Item Description: One of the secret rites of the Choir. Long ago, the Healing Church used phantasms to reach a lofty plane of darkness, but failed to make contact with the outer reaches of the cosmos. The rite failed to achieve its intended purpose, but instead created a small exploding star, now a powerful part of the Choir's arsenal. At times, failure is the mother of invention.
Story: The Choir of the Healing Church had long sought to commune with the outer reaches of the cosmos. However, their attempts failed and they created an exploding star. Now, this star is a powerful part of the Choir's arsenal.

Item Description: This greatsword belonged to Lord Gwyn's Knight Artorias who fell to the Abyss. Swallowed by the Dark with its master this sword is tainted by the Abyss and now its strength reflects its wielder's humanity
Story: Artorias was a great knight who fought against the Abyss. He was swallowed by the Dark and his greatsword became tainted with the Abyss. Now, the sword's power reflects the humanity of its wielder.

Item Description: Ring of the Pilgrims of Dark covenant . Increases the attack strength of hexes, but casting them reduces HP. What is dark? Perhaps we already know. We fear the dark, yet find solace in it. Those who join this covenant can see the hidden Dark Chasm.
Story: The Ring of the Pilgrims of Dark covenant was once worn by a powerful witch who sought to increase the power of her hexes, but at the cost of her own health. Now, any player who casts a hex while wearing the ring will suffer a reduction in HP. This ring is said to lead to the hidden Dark Chasm, a place where the shadows of the past converge. Those brave enough to venture into it may find untold secrets and power.

Item Description: Staff of the Academy of Raya Lucaria, embedded with a turquoise glintstone. Only a recognized sorcerer is permitted to wield this staff.
Story: The Staff of the Academy of Raya Lucaria is a powerful artifact that only a recognized sorcerer is permitted to wield. The staff is embedded with a turquoise glintstone, which gives it an extra edge when it comes to combat.

Item Description: Skull of a local from the violated fishing village. The inside of the skull was forcibly searched for eyes, as evidenced by innumerable scratches and indentations. No wonder the skull became stewed in curses. They who offer baneful chants. Weep with them, as one in trance
Story: A fishing village was violated and the locals were terrorized. One of the skulls from the village was stewed in curses and the inside was searched for eyes.

Item Description: A ring affixed with an open vessel. The vessel insatiably absorbs souls in place of its wearer, who is left unaware even of their collection. All things are rooted in souls, but what drives our thirst for them? Abstinence from this elixir may be the truest homage to an enduring self
Story: The ring is a cursed item that has been passed down through generations of a family. The wearer of the ring is unaware that they are absorbing the souls of others. The ring is said to have originated from a dark and twisted ritual. The wearer of the ring is left unaware of their collection of souls and all things are rooted in souls. However, the true power of the ring comes from the elixir that it contains. If the wearer abstains from drinking the elixir, they may

Item Description: An aged bird feather. Return to last bonfire rested at. Can be used repeatedly. The child of the dragon, sequestered away from the world, imagined a world of boundless possibilities from the mere sight of a feather.
Story: A child of the dragon finds a feather and imagines all the possibilities it could bring.

Item Description: Ultra greatsword crafted from the soul of the smelter demon. It's blade is imbued with a great flame. Use the strong attack to unleash its latent power. When the old king acquired the power to grant life to heaps of iron he molded a great array of metallic automatons. The iron monstrosity itself was perhaps one of the king's puppets.
Story: The Ultra Greatsword is a powerful weapon that was crafted from the soul of a smelter demon. When used in combat, the sword's flame-imbued blade can unleash its full power. The Ultra Greatsword is also known to be a powerful weapon that can grant life to metallic automatons.

Item Description: Greatsword forged from a blue-white meteoric ore. The blade conceals gravity-manipulating magic. A weapon unique to the Alabaster Lords, a race of ancients with skin of stone who were said to have risen to life when a meteor struck long ago.
Story: The greatsword was forged from a blue-white meteoric ore. The blade concealed gravity-manipulating magic, making it a weapon unique to the Alabaster Lords, a race of ancients who were said to have risen to life when a meteor struck long ago. The sword was said to have been passed down from one Alabaster Lord to the next, and was said to be the most powerful weapon in the kingdom. One day, the sword was stolen by a rival

Item Description: Set with red glintstones said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery. Alberiches was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.
Story: The red glintstones were said to have been formed from the blood of sacrifices. Alberiches was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago. He was said to have used the stones to strengthen his thorn sorcery.

Item Description: Longbow featuring delicate silverwork. Wielded by Albinauric wolfback archers. This bow requires dexterity over strength to master.
Story: The Albinauric wolfback archers are a proud and skilled people. They use the longbow as their weapon of choice, and it takes a great deal of dexterity to use it effectively. This bow is especially difficult to use, as it requires more skill than strength.

Item Description: Made from the largely unaltered hide of a young Albinauric. Raises arcane, but reduces the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears. A far cry from godskin, this Albinauric hide mask is the product of malicious mockery.
Story: The Albinauric hide mask is a product of malicious mockery. It raises arcane, but reduces the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears. This makes it a far cry from the godskin masks worn by most Albinauric.

Item Description: Short staff with a blue glintstone embedded. Wielded by the albinaurics of old. The albinaurics harbor a secret; they cast sorcery with their innate arcaneness.
Story: The staff belonged to the albinaurics, a race of sorcerers who wielded its power with ease. The albinaurics were a secretive people, and few knew of their true abilities. The staff was a remnant of their ancient ways, and held a secret that could change the course of history.

Item Description: Hammer used by Aldian acolytes. Not used as a weapon, but as an instrument to dissect the bodies of the victims of their experimentation. They say that Lord Aldia was the King's elder brother and helped found Drangleic, but he later lost interest in the land's fortunes.
Story: The Hammer of Aldia is a sacred tool used by Aldian acolytes. It is not used as a weapon, but as an instrument to dissect the bodies of the victims of their experimentation. They say that Lord Aldia was the King's elder brother and helped found Drangleic, but he later lost interest in the land's fortunes.

Item Description: A malformed ring left by Aldrich, Saint of the Deep. Recovers HP from critical attacks. Aldrich, infamous for his appetite for flesh apparently had the desire to share with others his joy of imbibing the final shudders of life while luxuriating in his victim's screams.
Story: The ring was left behind by Aldrich, a saint of the deep who was known for his insatiable appetite for human flesh. The ring is said to recover HP from critical attacks, and those who wear it are said to become immune to fear.

Item Description: A malformed ring left by Aldrich, Saint of the Deep. Recovers FP from critical attacks. Aldrich, infamous for his appetite for flesh, apparently had the desire to share with others his joy of imbibing the final shudders of life while luxuriating in his victim's screams.
Story: The ring is a dark, twisted thing, its metal tarnished and worn. When it touches someone, it seems to suck away their life force, healing them from any critical wounds. However, the ring also has a dark side. If someone is attacked while wearing the ring, their life force is drained and they die.

Item Description: Helm set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be
Story: Gideon ofnir is a powerful wizard who has the ability to see into the future. One day, he sees a vision of Queen Marika's impending death. In response, he sets out to find a way to prevent it. He comes across a set of armor that grants him the power to hear and see everything around him. With this newfound knowledge, he is able to prevent the queen's death.

Item Description: A skull of unknown ownership. Smashing it releases traces of souls, which can attract nearby foes. Does not work on all enemies, but can prove useful in unexpected ways.
Story: The skull belonged to an unknown individual, and when it was smashed, a cloud of souls escaped. These souls were attracted to any nearby enemies, and could prove useful in unexpected ways.

Item Description: The accoutrements of the Alonne Knights, who served the Old Iron King, were created with an advanced crafting technique. They remain solid and handsomely crafted. The design is styled after the armor worn by an unusual knight who trained the Iron King's men in the sword. He was said to have deserted his liege after bearing witness to his descent into depravity
Story: The accoutrements of the Alonne Knights, who served the Old Iron King, were created with an advanced crafting technique. They remain solid and handsomely crafted, even after centuries of use. One day, a new knight arrives at the castle, bearing the armor and sword of the Alonne Knight. He claims to have deserted his liege after bearing witness to his descent into depravity. The new knight is an oddity, and his armor and sword are unlike any other in

Item Description: Unique bow equipped by Alonne Knights. Most of them were charlatans, but among the riff-raff was an unusual knight from the far east. He trained the Iron King's men in the sword, in obeisance to his new lord.
Story: The bow was a beautiful weapon, made of sturdy wood with a golden bowstring. It was a gift from the Alonne Knights to the Iron King, and it was the only thing that could bring down the dragon that guarded the entrance to the castle. The knight who gave it to the king was an unusual knight from the far east. He had traveled to the kingdom to learn the art of swordsmanship, in obedience to his new lord.

Item Description: Light but offer very high defense. Alva crossed many a land in search of a cure for Saint Serreta's sickness, but failed and relinquished his knighthood. Alva was once wracked with guilt and remorse, but rediscovered his purpose in life with the aid of the witch who once plotted against him
Story: Alva is a knight who has lost his way. He's traveled the world in search of a cure for Saint Serreta's sickness, but he's failed. One day, he meets a witch who tells him that he can find his purpose again if he relinquishes his knighthood. Alva decides to do this, and he becomes a wanderer.

Item Description: Protection of Alva, seeker of the spurned. This armor was trimmed to reduce weight. To this day, troubadours sing of tales of the Wandering knight Alva and his travels, and of his involvement with the saint and the witch. Needless to say, the songs traditionally end in tragedy.
Story: Alva was a wandering knight who was known for his bravery and his love of music. One day, he met a saint and a witch who were in a dispute. The saint wanted to protect the witch, but the witch wanted to be left alone. Alva sided with the witch, and as a result, he was killed. But his songs live on, and are still sung today.

Item Description: An annual herb with an amber color so deep, it gives the impression of luminescence. Restores a small number of uses. It is the mistaken belief of many that the flowers of this herb do not blossom. However, small white flowers do blossom during dusk when the moon is visible.
Story: The flowers of the herb with an amber color are so deep in color that it gives the impression of luminescence. The herb is said to restore a small number of uses, and the small white flowers blossom during dusk when the moon is visible.

Item Description: The arm of a small Amygdala Great One. Strictly speaking, the Amygdalan Arm is no trick weapon of any sort, but certain madmen wield them like clubs. Starts as a large, tough blunt weapon formed of bone, but when extended, the hand quivers as if it were still alive.
Story: The Amygdalan Arm is a powerful weapon that is said to be the arm of a small Amygdala Great One. When extended, the hand of the arm quivers as if it were still alive.

Item Description: Ring of the Dragon Remnants covenant. Slightly increases Estus Flask HP recovery. Possessing a dragon scale is proof of its owner's prowess. Strength should always be displayed boldly, and meted out justly. Members of the covenant who bear dragon scales can fight with one another. The survivor of the duel claims the dragon scale of the opponent.
Story: The Ring of the Dragon Remnants covenant is a group of people who have sworn to protect each other by bearing dragon scales. These scales are proof of their strength and prowess, and the survivor of a duel with another member of the covenant can claim the dragon scale of their opponent.

Item Description: The bronze breastplate of the demigod Old King Doran. There are Jewels inlaid in it
Story: The breastplate of the Old King Doran was a powerful artifact. It was made from bronze and was adorned with jewels. The jewels were inlaid in the breastplate in a specific pattern, and they were said to have magical properties.

Item Description: Sword precious to Anri, another Unkindled. The dullest type of blade found in the ruined land of Astora. Only, it was once the sword of an earnest noble figure, and its attacks are boosted by that elusive, essential property unique to humans: luck.
Story: The sword was once the property of a noble figure, and its attacks were boosted by luck. However, due to the ruinous state of the land, the sword eventually became dull and was found by Anri. She takes it upon herself to restore it to its former glory, and with the help of her friends, she succeeds.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. The twisted cross means metamorphosis. Rotated anti-clockwise, this rune boosts stamina. The discovery of blood made their dream of evolution a reality. Metamorphosis, and the excesses and deviation that followed, was only the beginning.
Story: Caryll left her rune-covered blood on the ground near a tree. When a passerby discovered it, they were inspired to follow their dreams of becoming a runesmith. The discovery of blood made their dream of evolution a reality.

Item Description: Small medicinal tablets that counteract poison. Used to treat ashen blood, the baffling sickness that ravaged Old Yharnam long ago. These tablets only provide short-term relief. The ashen blood ailment eventually triggered the spread of the beastly scourge.
Story: The small medicinal tablets that counteract poison are used to treat ashen blood, the baffling sickness that ravaged Old Yharnam long ago. These tablets only provide short-term relief, and the ashen blood ailment eventually triggered the spread of the beastly scourge.

Item Description: A dress from the ancient fallen land of Oolacile. Its ivory-colored silk features elaborate embroidery and is imbued with ancient magic power. One cannot expect any physical protection from this garment, as it was not meant to be worn in battle
Story: The dress is a relic from the ancient land of Oolacile. It is made of ivory-colored silk and features intricate embroidery. The dress is said to be imbued with ancient magic power, and as such, it provides no physical protection from harm. However, the dress is still a beautiful and unique piece of clothing that would be perfect for any special occasion.

Item Description: Dress sewn in a long-lost fashion. The elaborately embroidered, ivory-colored silk is imbued with ancient magic power. No protection is offered by this garment, as it was never intended for battle
Story: The dress is a beautiful work of art, but it is also cursed. Whoever wears it will be vulnerable to all sorts of harm. However, the dress is also coveted by many people for its unique and mysterious power.

Item Description: Spur of a giant ant which has been fashioned into a rapier. The blade drips with scarlet rot. Scarlet rot is an old legend, of which Maleigh Marais of the Shaded Castle was a private believer. And indeed, he eventually found his own personal goddess.
Story: Maleigh Marais was a powerful sorcerer who ruled over the Shaded Castle with an iron fist. He was known for his dark magic and his obsession with the goddess Scarlet Rot. One day, he discovered a giant ant which had been transformed into a rapier. The blade was covered in a layer of scarlet rot, and Maleigh Marais was fascinated by the legend of Scarlet Rot. He decided to make his own rapier covered in the same layer of rot, as a tribute

Item Description: .A dagger fitted with aquamarine crystal. Engraved with a prayer in the old tongue to ward off incident. Perhaps it was a parting gift given to one sent off on great travels.
Story: The dagger was finely crafted with aquamarine crystal embedded in the hilt. The inscription on the blade was in the old tongue, and it seemed to have been a gift meant to protect the bearer on their travels. The story behind the dagger was a mystery, but it was likely a farewell gift from someone who was leaving for a long journey.

Item Description: The largest crossbow, and suitably powerful for its size. The bow string is made of metal, requiring great strength to fire.
Story: The largest crossbow in the world is wielded by a giant. The bowstring is made of metal, requiring great strength to fire. The giant is able to shoot arrows so fast that they can pierce through anything.

Item Description: Material used in a Holy Chalice rite. The tiny smatterings of haze that are found in certain ritual materials. Sometimes required for special rites. The additional rite Sinister Bell makes the bell-ringing woman appear, and when she rings a sinister bell, hunters from other worlds will be beckoned as adversaries.
Story: The tiny smatterings of haze that are found in certain ritual materials are known as "materials of the veil." Sometimes required for special rites, these smatterings add an ethereal quality to the proceedings. The additional rite Sinister Bell makes the bell-ringing woman appear, and when she rings a sinister bell, hunters from other worlds will be beckoned as adversaries.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. This transcription of the Great Ones' inhuman voices ripples like a watery reflection. This rune means Lake, and those branded by it enjoy augmented defense. Great volumes of water serve as a bulwark guarding sleep, and an augur of the eldritch Truth. Overcome this hindrance, and seek what is yours.
Story: Caryll left this rune for those who seek to understand the Great Ones. The rune is said to represent Lake, and those who are branded by it enjoy augmented defense. The rune is also said to be an augur of the eldritch Truth, and can be used to overcome obstacles.

Item Description: A curved greatsword forged from the soul of the Flexile Sentry. There is something unsettling, and at the same time beautiful, about its long curved blade. The sentry crammed inmates of the overflowing Bastille onto a rickety ship, and cast them out to the open sea. The majority of them drowned or starved but a few hardy survivors made land to the south, and imparted their knowledge of sorcery to the people there.
Story: The Flexile Sentry was a giant, serpentine creature that guarded the entrance to the Bastille. It was said that the sentry could twist its body in any direction, and that its blade was made from the soul of the creature. After the Bastille was stormed and its inmates freed, some of the survivors decided to take the sword and use it to defend their new home.

Item Description: White crown worn by an Archdeacon of the Cathedral of the Deep. Presented solely to delegates of the gods. A sign of the Way of White's highest rank. Of the three Archdeacons of the Deep, one cast off his white crown and left the cathedral to stand by Aldrich. One stood over Aldrich's casket, with hope that he would return one day. One attended to Rosaria, Mother of Rebirth, whom he deemed a goddess
Story: The white crown worn by an Archdeacon of the Cathedral of the Deep is a sign of the highest rank within the Way of White. When one casts off the crown, they have left the cathedral and stand by Aldrich, the second in command. One Archdeacon, over Aldrich's casket, has hope that he will return one day. One Archdeacon, Rosaria, Mother of Rebirth, deemed a goddess, attends to her.

Item Description: Large staff bestowed upon Archdeacons of the Cathedral of the Deep. The Archdeacon McDonnell's trespass, the sin of channeling faith for sorcery, transformed what was once merely a symbol of ecclesiastic authority into a catalyst of sorceries.
Story: The Archdeacon McDonnell's trespass, the sin of channeling faith for sorcery, transformed what was once merely a symbol of ecclesiastic authority into a catalyst of sorceries. The staff, once a simple tool of the church, now served as a conduit for dark magic. The Archdeacon's fate now rests in the hands of the player, as they venture into the Cathedral of the Deep to put an end to the sorceries plaguing the city.

Item Description: Sacred chime used by members of the Archdrake Sect of Lindelt. A catalyst for miracles and hexes. The land of Lindelt is governed by stringent laws, and those who dare defy them are punished without mercy. It is often the sinful who seek piety, spurred only by a selfish desire for salvation.
Story: The sacred chime was used by the Archdrake Sect of Lindelt to perform miracles and hexes. The land of Lindelt was governed by stringent laws, and those who dared defy them were punished without mercy. It was often the sinful who sought piety, spurred only by a selfish desire for salvation. One day, a young woman named Elin found the sacred chime and used it to save her village from a terrible fate. The people of Lindelt were so grateful that they

Item Description: A mace normally issued to clerics of the Archdrake sect of Lindelt. The land of Lindelt is governed by stringent laws, and those who dare defy them are punished without mercy. It is often the sinful who seek piety, spurred only by a selfish desire for salvation.
Story: The mace is a holy relic of the Archdrake sect of Lindelt. It is said that the mace was once used by the sect's founder, a great dragon cleric, to smite his enemies. The mace is now wielded by the sect's most devout followers, who use it to enforce Lindelt's laws and punish those who break them.

Item Description: Robes worn by the Archdrake sect of Lindelt. Little is known about the Archdrake sect and its ancient rituals, and those who dare to indulge their curiosity have been known to simply vanish. The Archdrake sect are the keepers of Lindelt's histories, including the only record of its foundation, a tome they have good reason to keep hidden away
Story: The robes worn by the Archdrake sect are said to be imbued with mystical power. Whoever wears them is granted access to the secrets of the sect's ancient rituals, but those who dare to delve too deep often disappear without a trace.

Item Description: Staff of members of the Archdrake sect of Lindelt. A catalyst for sorceries and hexes. In Lindelt, known for its clerics and their miracles, sorcery is believed to be a profane practice. But as with anything, such beliefs are part faith and part front, and this staff was born of that hypocrisy.
Story: The staff of the Archdrake sect of Lindelt is a powerful catalyst for sorceries and hexes. It was created by the sect's members as a way to hide their practices from the rest of the city, but it soon became a symbol of their power. The staff is said to be able to unleash powerful spells and hexes, and it is coveted by many in Lindelt.

Item Description: Shoes worn by Arianna. woman of the night in the Cathedral Ward. Innocent and cute. in contrast with its owner.
Story: Arianna was a woman of the night in the Cathedral Ward. She was innocent and cute, in contrast with her owner, the Devil. One day, a young man named John came to the ward to visit the cathedral. Arianna was drawn to him, and she began to fall for him. However, the Devil was watching them, and he was furious. He decided to take revenge on Arianna by making her look like a slut.

Item Description: High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.
Story: The undead wander the land, their garb tattered and faded. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, they are the pitiful product of unending life.

Item Description: Mask worn by jailers of Irithyll Dungeon. Noblemen delighted in its plump features.
Story: The Mask worn by jailers of Irithyll Dungeon is a grotesque and grotesquely obese piece of clothing. It is made from a thick, plush material, and is adorned with a large, bulbous nose. The noblemen who enjoy visiting the dungeon find the Mask to be quite pleasing, as it accentuates their already impressive physiques.

Item Description: Armor of Artorias the Abysswalker, one of Gwyn's four knights. The death of the armor's owner can be surmised from the corrosive Dark of the Abyss, and the tattered azure-blue cape, once a symbol of pride and glory
Story: The armor of Artorias the Abysswalker was once a symbol of pride and glory. The death of the armor's owner can be surmised from the corrosive Dark of the Abyss, and the tattered azure-blue cape, once a symbol of pride and glory.

Item Description: Armor of kings of the desert land of Jugo. First worn by Aurous, the land's heroic founder. According to legend, the armor of Aurous is composed of a mysterious substance that cannot be seen by cowards. What do your eyes tell you?
Story: The armor of Aurous is said to be composed of a mysterious substance that cannot be seen by cowards. When worn by a brave warrior, it gives them the strength to face any challenge. One day, a young man named Aurous discovered this armor and decided to use it to fight for justice. He became known as the land's heroic founder and his armor became known as the Armor of Kings.

Item Description: Armor of the Forlorn, who wander the land of the Undead. Born of Aldia's obsession with the First Sin, the Forlorn lost both their corporeal form and a world to call their own. Now they drift into other worlds, ever in search of a home. But without self, one has neither beginning nor end, and so the Forlorn have only to wander
Story: The armor of the Forlorn is a cursed item that was created by Aldia as part of her obsession with the First Sin. The Forlorn were once human beings who lost their corporeal form and a world to call their own as a result of Aldia's obsession. Now, they wander the land of the Undead in search of a new home.

Item Description: Strange armor from the ancient land of Zena, birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall. The many medals are believed to symbolize glory
Story: The armor is strange, with many medals that are believed to symbolize glory. It is said that the armor was from the ancient land of Zena, birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall. The armor is old and worn, but it still has a lot of life left in it.

Item Description: Armor of Solaire of Astora, Knight of Sunlight. The large holy symbol of the Sun, while powerless, was painted by Solaire himself. Solaire's incredible prowess must have come from rigorous training alone, for his equipment exhibits no special traits
Story: The armor of Solaire of Astora, Knight of Sunlight, is a holy symbol of the Sun. It is said that Solaire's incredible prowess came from rigorous training alone, for his equipment exhibits no special traits. However, the large holy symbol of the Sun painted by Solaire himself is still a powerful weapon.

Item Description: Armor of Kirk, knight of Thorns and notorious member of the Darkwraiths. A dense patch of thorns grows from its surface. It is a fitting item for the murderous Kirk, for by simply wearing it and rolling, one can damage enemies
Story: Kirk had always been a ruthless fighter, and he had honed his skills to a razor's edge. He was known as the Knight of Thorns, and he was one of the most feared Darkwraiths in all of Hell. But even Kirk was not immune to injury. One day, while he was fighting in the pits of Hell, he was struck in the shoulder by a powerful enemy. The wound was deep, and the armor that he was wearing did nothing to stop the

Item Description: Tool used to etch titanite into armor for reinforcement. Rest at a bonfire to make armor reinforcement possible
Story: The etching tool was a simple, but necessary tool used by the blacksmiths of the kingdom to reinforce armor with titanite. The tool rested at a bonfire, allowing the blacksmiths to quickly etch reinforcement into the armor of their soldiers.

Item Description: Tool used to etch titanite into armor for reinforcement. Rest at a bonfire to make armor reinforcement possible
Story: The etching tool was a simple, but necessary tool used by the blacksmiths of the kingdom to reinforce armor with titanite. The tool rested at a bonfire, allowing the blacksmiths to quickly etch reinforcement into the armor of their soldiers.

Item Description: One of the curses that festered within the belly of the Greatwood, and a terrible weapon favored by Earl Arstor the Impaler. The spear is enwreathed in rotten, heavily poisonous meat. Defeating foes restores HP. Skill: Shield Splitter Take a large step forward and make a single focused thrust to puncture enemy shields and inflict damage.
Story: The Greatwood was a dark and foreboding forest that lay on the outskirts of the kingdom. It was said that the forest was cursed by an evil sorcerer, and that any who entered were doomed to die. One day, a group of brave knights ventured into the forest to investigate the rumors. They were quickly met with resistance, and soon found themselves surrounded by a horde of monsters. Just as they were about to be overwhelmed, one of the knights pulled out a wicked spear made from

Item Description: Knuckle ring worn by Rhoy the Explorer. Increases petrification resistance. Petrification is tantamount to death, and in that sense, this knuckle ring is a charm that may save your life.
Story: Rhoy the Explorer was a famed explorer who ventured into uncharted territory. One day, while exploring an ancient ruin, he came across a chamber filled with petrified creatures. The ring he was wearing amplified his petrification resistance, allowing him to survive and explore the ruin further.

Item Description: Gray crystalline ring crafted from shards. Increases FP restored by Ashen Estus Flask. Once a treasure brought before Lothric's Queen, she had it enshrined in the Cemetery of Untended Graves, so that one day an Unkindled might profit from its use.
Story: The Gray crystalline ring was crafted from shards of Ashen Estus Flask. It increased the FP restored by the Ashen Estus Flask.

Item Description: Attire of the retired hunter Djura. One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the workshop. A fine piece of hunter attire that provides stable defense to anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat. Painted with ash in a ceremony to ward off blood. Djura is known through his contact with the Powder Kegs, the heretics of the workshop. He is said to have been both uncommonly kind and dreadfully foolish. Djura felt defeated by the state of Old Yharnam, and renounced his hunter's vows.
Story: Djura, a retired hunter, wears a paint-covered outfit to ward off blood. He is known for his kindness to the Powder Kegs, a heretical sect of hunters.

Item Description: Attire of the retired hunter Djura. Painted with ash in a ceremony to ward off blood. Djura is known through his contact with the Powder Kegs, the heretics of the workshop. He is said to have been both uncommonly kind and dreadfully foolish. Djura felt defeated by the state of Old Yharnam, and renounced his hunter's vows.
Story: Djura retired from hunting many years ago, but he still keeps in touch with the workshop of Old Yharnam. One day, he received a letter from the Powder Kegs, a group of heretics who have been living in exile. They asked him to come and help them fight against the state, but Djura was too old and tired to do anything. He decided to go to Old Yharnam anyway, in a ceremony to ward off blood. When

Item Description: Straight sword wielded by ashen warriors. As brittle as it appears. The jagged edge of this tired and worn blade tears into the hides of foes.
Story: The straight sword is a weapon that is wielded by ashen warriors. It is brittle and looks worn, but the jagged edge of the blade is deadly.

Item Description: Soft leather Gloves worn by assassins who lurk in the shadows. The thick leather offers reasonable absorption without creating any undesired noise. A well-crafted piece of protection. Critical spots are reinforced with metal.
Story: The gloves were made for assassins who lurk in the shadows. They were thick leather, offering reasonable absorption without creating any undesired noise. The gloves were also well-crafted, with critical spots reinforced with metal.

Item Description: This greatsword, bestowed only upon elite knights, is a relic of the ruined land of Astora. Designed for a focus on thrust attacks, this sword is hard and sharp, but not unusually heavy. Skill: Charge Hold sword at waist and charge at foe. Use strong attack while charging to extend the length of the charge.
Story: The greatsword, bestowed only upon elite knights, is a relic of the ruined land of Astora. The knights of Astora were known for their prowess in wielding the greatsword, and this sword was designed with their needs in mind. The greatsword is hard and sharp, but not unusually heavy. When used skillfully, the greatsword can be used to extend the length of the charge, making it a powerful weapon.

Item Description: A well-crafted sword named after the ruined land. Astora, before its fall, was a land replete with royal blood, and this weapon is both a reminder and heirloom of that era.
Story: The sword is a heirloom of the royal family of Astora, before it fell to ruin. It is a reminder of a time when the land was prosperous and full of life. The sword is also powerful, and can be used to fight against those who would try to take away the land's riches.

Item Description: Key to the Astral Clocktower at the top of the Grand Cathedral. The caretaker of the tower's numerous patients, known to them only as Lady Maria, made her home behind the giant star-interpreting clock.
Story: The Astral Clocktower is a place of great mystery and power. It is said that the caretaker, Lady Maria, makes her home behind the clock, which is said to be able to interpret the stars. Lady Maria is known to be a kind and compassionate woman, who cares for the patients in the tower.

Item Description: Robe fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.
Story: The robe is made from supple cloth and is worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. However, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Item Description: Staff of the astrologers. A glintsone is embedded in the tip, enabling it to be used as a catalyst for sorceries. Sorceries must be memorized first at a site of lost grace, and a staff must be equipped to cast them
Story: The Staff of the Astrologers is a powerful tool that allows its user to cast powerful sorceries. The staff is made from a special type of metal that is able to store magical energy, and the glintsone embedded in the tip of the staff allows the user to cast their spells with ease. The staff must be equipped in order to use its power, and is usually kept at a site of lost grace in order to prevent it from being used by anyone other than the rightful

Item Description: Astrologists believe that magical powers can be obtained at moments of special heavenly alignment. Even the collective wisdom of the Melfian Magic Academy cannot pull magic out of the sky, but the ideas of the astrologists led to the creation of new and very useful magic devices
Story: The astrologists had long believed that magical powers could be obtained at moments of special heavenly alignment. So, they created devices to harness these powers. These devices were used by the astrologists to perform various tasks, from casting spells to summoning spirits.

Item Description: Remnant of the eldritch Truth encountered at Byrgenwerth. Use phantasms, the invertebrates known to be the augurs of the Great Ones, to partially summon abandoned Ebrietas. The initial encounter marked the start of an inquiry into the cosmos from within the old labyrinth, and led to the establishment of the Choir.
Story: A group of explorers stumble upon an ancient labyrinth filled with eldritch secrets. Inside they find a strange creature known as Ebrietas, who seems to be the manifestation of some sort of cosmic force. The group is able to partially summon her using phantasms, and from that moment on they begin to explore the labyrinth and its secrets in earnest.

Item Description: Repeating crossbow cherished by the weapon craftsman Eidas. Its elaborate design makes it closer to a work of art than a weapon. Intricate mechanism makes heavy damage possible through triple-shot firing of bolts. but in fact each bolt inflicts less damage
Story: The Repeating Crossbow was a finely crafted weapon that was closer to art than a weapon. The intricate mechanism made it possible to fire three bolts at once, making it a powerful weapon. However, each bolt only inflicted a fraction of the damage that it could have.

Item Description: It is said that Avolina was fond of spiders and creepy crawlies. Born outside of marriage, Avolina shamed her house, and was locked away with only her books and this ragged old doll to keep her company.
Story: Avolina is a lonely girl who is shunned by her family because she was born outside of marriage. She is content to spend her days reading and playing with her doll, until one day a spider comes to visit her. The spider tells Avolina that she is beautiful and deserves to be loved. Avolina is touched by the spider's words and decides to start living life to the fullest. She becomes more outgoing and starts dating boys, and eventually has a child of her own. Av

Item Description: Weapon of Godfrey, Elden Lord. It was broken in a battle fought as leader of the Tarnished during the Long March. This weapon is symbolic of Godfrey's vow to conduct himself as a lord, later becoming an emblem of the golden lineage. In the days of the past, a crown was warranted with strength.
Story: The Weapon of Godfrey is a legendary relic that once belonged to Elden Lord Godfrey. It was broken in a battle fought as leader of the Tarnished during the Long March. The weapon is symbolic of Godfrey's vow to conduct himself as a lord, later becoming an emblem of the golden lineage. In the days of the past, a crown was warranted with strength.

Item Description: Greataxe wielded by Godrick the Grafted. This golden battleaxe is emblazoned with the figure of a beast, representing the strength of Godfrey, First Elden Lord and patriarch of the golden lineage. I command thee kneel! For I am the lord of all that is golden!
Story: Godrick the Grafted was a powerful and respected god-king in the land of Elden. He wielded a greataxe that was engraved with the figure of a beast, representing the strength of Godfrey, First Elden Lord and patriarch of the golden lineage. One day, a rival god-king challenged Godrick to a battle and won. As a result, Godrick was exiled from his home and forced to wander the land, seeking refuge with any other golden-blooded creatures he

Item Description: Staff of Azal, sage of Forossa. Rather roughly crafted, but imbued with the magic of Azal. Greatly intensifies spells, but also drastically reduces spell usage. This staff, unfit for the inexperienced, is evidence of sage Azal's prowess.
Story: The Staff of Azal is a powerful artifact that amplifies spells and reduces their usage by a significant amount. It was created by the sage Azal, and is only meant for the most experienced mages. Despite its flaws, the staff is still an incredibly powerful tool.

Item Description: Staff of the primeval glintstone sorcerer Azur. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone may wield it. Reduces casting time of all sorceries, but consumes additional FP.
Story: The Staff of the Primeval Glintstone Sorcerer Azur is a powerful artifact that reduces the casting time of all spells, but it consumes additional FP. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone can wield it, and even then, it is a dangerous weapon to possess.

Item Description: Manchettes corroded by blue-green glintstones. Worn by Azur, primeval current sorcerer. Azur had reached a near-inorganic state.
Story: Azur, the primeval current sorcerer, wore machettes that corroded from blue-green glintstones. These weapons were worn in order to channel and control the power of the current.

Item Description: Key to the balcony on the first floor of the Research Hall. Lady Maria of the Astral Clocktower gave this to the patient, Adeline. Maria had hoped Adeline would find comfort in the faint breeze that carried the scent of flowers from the outside, but Adeline couldn't fathom her intentions.
Story: Lady Maria of the Astral Clocktower gifted a key to the balcony on the first floor of the Research Hall to patient Adeline. Maria hoped that the faint breeze that carried the scent of flowers from the outside would provide comfort to Adeline, but Adeline could not understand why the flowers would be comforting.

Item Description: Shield of the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. Tweaked for improved stability. Balder was the home of Knight King Rendal but the kingdom was reduced to ruins after a widespread outbreak of Undead
Story: The shield of the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder is a finely crafted piece of metalwork. It is designed to be stable and provide protection from attacks. The shield is also tweaked for improved stability. This makes it ideal for use by knights of the kingdom.

Item Description: The knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder wielded these rock-solid long swords which are excellent for thrust attacks. Balder was the home of Knight King Rendal, but the kingdom was reduced to ruins after a widespread outbreak of Undead
Story: The knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder wielded these rock-solid long swords which are excellent for thrust attacks. Balder was the home of Knight King Rendal, but the kingdom was reduced to ruins after a widespread outbreak of Undead. Rendal and his knights fought valiantly against the Undead, but eventually they were overwhelmed. Now, centuries later, the swords of Rendal and his knights still stand as a warning to any would-be invaders.

Item Description: Armor of bandits of the Forossan outskirts. The territory of Forossa became lawless after the kingdom fell to war. Citizens became bandits, and scattered to other lands
Story: The armor of the bandits of the Forossan outskirts is a symbol of their power and defiance. It is made from the finest materials and is decorated with intricate designs. The armor is coveted by many, but it is also a source of fear for those who know of its power.

Item Description: An axe of bandits of the Forossan outskirts Very sturdily built for the armament of a bandit. When Forossa fell to war, its citizens were left landless, and entirely to their own devices. Many were reduced to thievery, while Forossan knights scattered to other lands as sellswords. An axe of bandits of the Forossan outskirts Very sturdily built for the armament of a bandit. When Forossa fell to war, its citizens were left landless, and entirely to their own devices. Many were reduced to thievery, while Forossan knights scattered to other lands as sellswords.
Story: The axe was once wielded by a band of brigands who roamed the outskirts of Forossa, preying on the weak and taking what they wanted. Now, it rests in a museum, a reminder of the violence and chaos that once plagued the land. One day, it may be taken out of its glass case and used once more to terrorize the innocent.

Item Description: A greataxe of bandits of the Forossan outskirts. Very sturdily built for the armament of a bandit. When Forossa fell to war, its citizens were left landless, and entirely to their own devices. Many were reduced to thievery, while Forossan knights scattered to other lands as sellswords.
Story: The greataxe of the bandits of the Forossan outskirts is a sturdy weapon built for the armament of a bandit. When Forossa fell to war, its citizens were left landless, and entirely to their own devices. Many were reduced to thievery, while Forossan knights scattered to other lands as sellswords.

Item Description: Mask of black cloth that covers the mouth. Favored by bandits for hiding their faces, it also provides some protection against poison.
Story: The Mask of Black Cloth is a favored item of bandits for hiding their faces. It also provides some protection against poison. In the story, the Mask is worn by a young girl who is fleeing from her home after her parents were killed. She is pursued by the bandits, but manages to escape by wearing the Mask.

Item Description: A wide single-edged shortsword. Primarily a slicing weapon, but its blade is crafted to cause bleeding, making it a favorite of lowly thieves and bandits.
Story: The single-edged shortsword is a favorite weapon of lowly thieves and bandits. It is a slashing weapon that is designed to cause bleeding. This makes it a deadly weapon for those who rely on stealth and surprise to take down their prey.

Item Description: Curved sword with a light, crescent-shaped blade. Used by the bandits who ran rampant in the wake of the Shattering. Most of the blade is now darkened and covered in rust, but with enough dexterity this weapon may still stand up to some use.
Story: The curved sword with a light, crescent-shaped blade is known to have been used by the bandits who ran rampant in the wake of the Shattering. Most of the blade is now darkened and covered in rust, but with enough dexterity this weapon may still stand up to some use.

Item Description: A knife with a slightly broad single edge. Its tip is shaped to leave a wound that won't easily close. Designed for unsavory work, and beloved by those of unsavory ilk.
Story: The knife was designed for those who do unsavory work. It's sharp tip makes it perfect for slicing through tough skin or muscle. The knife is also beloved by those who are unsavory themselves.

Item Description: This wide single-edged shortsword is the favorite of lowly thieves and bandits. Primarily a slicing weapon, but highly effective when used for critical hits, such as after parrying or from behind.
Story: The shortsword is the favorite weapon of lowly thieves and bandits. It is primarily a slicing weapon, but can be highly effective when used for critical hits.

Item Description: Ring of Raime the traitor. Reduces stamina loss when blocking with a shield. Raime was an agile swordsman who served King Vendrick, but after resigning from his post, he reconsidered his way of life and was born again as a stalwart warrior.
Story: Raime the traitor was a skilled swordsman who served King Vendrick faithfully, but after resigning from his post, he reconsidered his way of life and was reborn as a stalwart warrior. One day, Raime found a strange ring while scavenging in the ruins of an old castle. The ring granted him the ability to reduce stamina loss when blocking with a shield, which proved to be invaluable in his new career as a defender of the kingdom.

Item Description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.
Story: The armor belonged to a knight who had been forced to abandon his home. He was a fierce warrior, and despite his territorial losses, he was still named a knight. One day, he met a woman who was also a knight. They fell in love and married. Together, they fought against their enemies and restored their home.

Item Description: A finely-crafted greatsword intricately engraved with an ancient motif. Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.
Story: The greatsword was a gift from the king to the most valiant knights who had been forced to leave their homes. These knights were often sent to the far reaches of the kingdom, where they had to start from scratch and fend for themselves. The sword was meant as a symbol of hope, and it gave its new owner the strength to persevere.

Item Description: A finely-crafted halberd intricately engraved with an ancient motif. Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.
Story: The halberd was a finely crafted weapon that was intricately engraved with an ancient motif. It was given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.

Item Description: A club forged from the soul of the Flexile Sentry.The spikes covering its length are as vile as the sentry itself. Long ago, the dungeons overflowed with the accursed, and the king commanded a contorted sentry to deliver those who had no cells to a faraway land, and to make certain they were never heard from again. The sentry crammed inmates of the overflowing Bastile onto a rickety ship, and cast them out to the open sea. The majority of them drowned or starved, but a few hardy survivors made land to the south, and imparted their knowledge of sorcery to the people there.
Story: The Flexile Sentry is a cursed creature that was created to guard the dungeons of the king. It is said that the spikes on its body are as vile as the sentry itself, and that it was tasked with delivering anyone who was condemned to the faraway land of the dungeons. However, the sentry was unable to contain the inmates of the Bastile, and so it cast them out to the open sea. A few of the inmates survived, and they taught the people of

Item Description: The choice weapon of the infamous Darkwraith Kirk also known as the Knight of Thorns for the gnarly spikes on his favorite weapon. This frightful sword deals only thrust attacks, and causes heavy bleeding.
Story: Kirk's choice weapon is a fearsome sword with jagged spikes along the blade. The spikes cause heavy bleeding when the sword is used, and it is said that Kirk himself is particularly skilled in using this weapon.

Item Description: Chalice used in old ceremony in which Lothric knights take their vows. It is only a formality now, but it remains as an empty practice. Place this basin at a statue of a beheading knight.
Story: The Chalice used in an ancient ceremony in which Lothric knights took their vows. It is only a formality now, but it remains as an empty practice. Place this basin at a statue of a beheading knight.

Item Description: Special material used in a Holy Chalice ritual. Remains of Loran infant infected by the scourge. A harbinger of curses and symbol of defilement. The additional rite Curse defiles dungeons in which hunters' HP is greatly eroded, but what better place to seek cursed blood gems but in the midst of defilement?
Story: The Lore Chalice was used in a Holy Chalice ritual to bless the drink. The Chalice was filled with the remains of Loran, an infant infected with the scourge. The Chalice was also used to add a curse to the dungeons in which hunters would hunt. The curse would greatly reduce the HP of any hunters who entered the dungeon, but it would also be a place where cursed blood gems could be found.

Item Description: A standard greatsword. Heavy Greatsword are designed to be wielded two-handed. Normally swung in large arcs and effective against multiple foes, be wary that such attacks leave the wielder wide open.
Story: The greatsword was a massive weapon, easily twice the size of any other sword that the young man had ever seen. The metal was dark and gleaming, and the blade was sharp and deadly looking. He could feel the weight of the sword in his hand, and the feel of the blade against his skin made him feel alive. He could feel the power of the sword coursing through him, and he knew that he could use it to protect himself and his friends.

Item Description: Flail which deals magic damage, having been imbued with power by the remembrance of Astel. Formed of the same many-colored star debris that comprised the form of the Naturalborn of the Void.
Story: The Flail which deals magic damage was imbued with power by the remembrance of Astel. The Flail was formed of the same many-colored star debris that comprised the form of the Naturalborn of the Void.

Item Description: Staff used by hollowed Drangleic sorcerers, A catalyst for sorceries and hexes. The bat affixed to its tip is a simple charm. It has no bearing on the staff´s powers, but the germs on the cadaver poison foes upon contact in strike attacks.
Story: The staff is a simple wooden staff with a bat charm on the end. It is used by hollowed Drangleic sorcerers to cast spells and hexes. The bat is simply a charm that has no effect on the staff's powers, but the germs on the cadaver poison foes upon contact in strike attacks.

Item Description: A thick, heavy blade attached to a handle. A versatile, standard weapon Capable of powerful attacks thanks to the weighty blade, these weapons are also regarded for their powerful charge attacks.
Story: The weapon known as a 'Charge Blade' is a powerful tool that can be used for both offensive and defensive purposes. The weight of the blade combined with its charge ability makes it a formidable weapon, perfect for taking down enemies in a single strike.

Item Description: Large iron great hammer designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum. Weighty enough to crush armor and its wearer alike.
Story: The large iron great hammer was designed for gladiatorial combat. It was used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum. The hammer was so heavy that it could crush armor and its wearer alike.

Item Description: Robe worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy scholar, tattered from being worn on the battlefield. Whenever war broke out and the academy sealed its gates, only Haima's scholars dared venture outside. Seclusion is no way to foster discovery; it is only a convenient form of escape.
Story: The Raya Lucaria Academy was a prestigious school for the study of magic. However, when war broke out and the academy sealed its gates, only Haima's scholars dared venture outside. Seclusion is no way to foster discovery; it is only a convenient form of escape. One day, a scholar by the name of Haima ventured outside the gates. She was wearing a robe that had seen much battle, and it was tattered from being worn on the battlefield. As

Item Description: Wood-carved mask of Eileen the Crow, Hunter of Hunters. The beak contains incense to mask scents of blood and beast. Hunters of Hunters dress as crows to suggest sky burial. The first Hunter of Hunters came from a foreign land, and gave the dead a virtuous native funeral ritual, rather than impose a blasphemous Yharnam burial service upon them, with the hope that former compatriots might be returned to the skies, and find rest in a hunter's dream.
Story: The first Hunter of Hunters, Eileen, came from a faraway land and brought a new funeral ritual to Yharnam. Her hope was that her compatriots might find peace in a hunter's dream.

Item Description: Large medicinal pellets, supposedly formed of coagulated beast blood. Banned by the Healing Church due to their unclear origin. Grants a spurt of beasthood. Ripping apart the flesh of one's enemies and being rained up by their splattering blood invigorates one's sense of beasthood, feeding strength and euphoric feeling alike.
Story: The Healing Church had long been wary of these pellets, believing them to be the product of dark magic. It was only recently that they had been able to confirm their suspicions, and now they were strictly forbidden. Even the most devout of healers were hesitant to use them, for fear of becoming like the beasts they were meant to cure. One day, a rogue healer decided to test the pellets' effects on himself. He ripped open the flesh of his enemies and was soon d

Item Description: Silver gauntlets engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.
Story: Bernahl the Recusant was a great champion, feared by all who knew him. He was known for his silver gauntlets, engraved with tiny beasts. One day, while he was out fighting on the battlefield, his maiden threw herself into the fire in front of him. Bernahl was so overcome with grief that he renounced his title and left the kingdom. He wandered the land, living off the land, until he met a group of nomads who took him in. Now, Bern

Item Description: Beastly weapon wielded by Irreverent Izzy. Crafted by chiseling the long bones of an undead darkbeast and fastening them to the weapon. The bones are still alive, and when unleashed, grant its wielder a spurt of beastly power. As flesh is flayed and blood is sprayed, the beast within awakens, and in time, the wielder of this weapon surges with both strength and feverish reverie.
Story: Izzy's beastly weapon was forged from the long bones of an undead darkbeast. The bones were still alive, and when unleashed, they granted Izzy a spurt of beastly power. As flesh was flayed and blood was sprayed, the beast within awoke, and in time, Izzy's wielder surged with both strength and feverish reverie.

Item Description: A trick weapon used by Old Hunters. This thick iron cleaver slices through the toughest of beast hides, and when transformed the blade splits into sections, allowing one to lash it in the fashion of a heavy whip. This crude weapon relies on brute force and is regrettably inelegant, suggesting that the hunts of the earliest hunters made for horrific affairs, painted in sanguine black and reds.
Story: The Old Hunters used a trick weapon called a Cleaver of the Beast. When transformed, the blade splits into sections, allowing one to lash it like a whip. This crude weapon is inelegant and relies on brute force, but it is still a powerful weapon.

Item Description: The bloodied hide of a horrible Cleric Beast, pulled over the back. Without the attacked beast hide this foreigner garb wouldn't raise anyone's eyebrows. Brador donned a compatriot's beastly scalp and hide while still moist with blood. Most of the blood stains on this hide were from that day
Story: Brador had just finished slaying a Cleric Beast and was about to strip the hide off when he saw a foreigner walking by. He decided to take the hide and disguise himself as a foreigner, just in case anyone was watching.

Item Description: One of the forbidden hunter tools made by Irreverent Izzy. Borrow the strength of the terrible undead darkbeasts, if only for a moment, to blast surrounding foes back with the force of a roaring beast. The indescribable sound is broadcast with the caster's own vocal cords, which begs the question, what terrible things lurk deep within the frames of men?
Story: The darkbeasts that Izzy created were meant to be used as hunting tools, but some people found the sound they made to be horrifying. The darkbeasts were never meant to be used for anything else, but some people found a way to use them for evil.

Item Description: One of the forbidden hunter tools made by Irreverent Izzy. Borrow the strength of the terrible undead darkbeasts, if only for a moment, to blast surrounding foes back with the force of a roaring beast. The indescribable sound is broadcast with the caster's own vocal cords, which begs the question, what terrible things lurk deep within the frames of men?
Story: The darkbeasts that Izzy created were meant to be used as hunting tools, but some people found their sound horrifying and decided to use them for evil purposes. Now, with the power of the darkbeasts behind them, the caster can blast their enemies back with the force of a roaring beast. This Lore item gives players the ability to unleash the power of the undead darkbeasts for a short period of time.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. A transcription of the roar of a labyrinth beast, the bearer of the Beast rune has accentuated transformation effects. Beast is one of the early Caryll Runes. as well as one of the first to be deemed forbidden. The discovery of blood entailed the discovery of undesirable beasts.
Story: The Beast rune is a mysterious symbol that has the power to enhance the abilities of those who carry it. When discovered, it was quickly deemed forbidden by the ruling council of Byrgenwerth, as it was believed to be connected to the discovery of bloodthirsty beasts. However, those who possess the Beast rune know that it has the power to unleash their inner beast, granting them enhanced abilities in the process.

Item Description: A torch which burns oil infused with a special incense. The aroma pacifies wild beasts. Torches such as these were used to keep unwelcome beasts away from treasure troves hidden in caves.
Story: A group of adventurers is exploring a cave when they come across a large hoard of treasure. The leader of the group decides to take a torch and light the incense inside to keep the beasts away. The smell of the incense calms the animals and they stay away from the treasure.

Item Description: After the repeated experiments in controlling the scourge of beasts, the gentle Embrace rune was discovered. When its implementation failed, the Embrace became a forbidden rune, but this knowledge became a foundation of the Healing Church. Those who swear this oath take on a ghastly form and enjoy accentuated transformation effects, especially while wielding a beast weapon.
Story: The Healing Church discovered the Embrace rune and used it to control beasts, but it failed. Now, those who swear the oath to the church take on a ghastly form and enjoy accentuated transformation effects, especially while wielding a beast weapon.

Item Description: Greathammer with a striking end modelled to resemble five beastly claws. The black nails protruding from golden fur are said to represent Serosh, Lord of Beasts, who went to become King Godfrey's Regent.
Story: The greathammer is a powerful weapon that is said to have been forged by Serosh, the Lord of Beasts. The black nails protruding from the golden fur on the end of the weapon are said to represent Serosh, who went to become King Godfrey's Regent.

Item Description: A trick weapon used by the old hunters. A second blade is found inside the curve of the main one. In its initial form, the saif can be wielded like a long curved sword, but when transformed, its blade is contracted, allowing for quick, repeated stabs. Although this trick weapon allows for adaptive combat, it was later replaced by saws and similar weapons that were more effective at disposing of beasts.
Story: The saif is a weapon that was used by the old hunters. When transformed, the saif's blade can be contracted, allowing for quick, repeated stabs. Although this weapon is adaptive, it was later replaced by saws and similar weapons that were more effective at disposing of beasts.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. This particular specimen has a pronounced effect, due to its extended state of dampness.Most waning blood gems provide rare special effects such as fire, bolt, or healing.
Story: The gem was once the lifeblood of a powerful dragon. Over time, the gem's power waned, and it was sealed away in a dark corner of the dragon's lair. Years later, a group of adventurers stumbled upon the gem and decided to take it for themselves. Unfortunately, the gem's power was too strong for them to control, and it quickly drained their health. In the end, the gem killed them all.

Item Description: Curved sword forged of dull iron wielded by the beastmen of Farum Azula. The blade is heavy but well-balanced. Comparatively easy to wield for the damage it delivers.
Story: The curved sword is a weapon that is forged from dull iron. It is heavy, but well-balanced, making it easy to wield for the damage it delivers. The beastmen of Farum Azula use this sword to fight against their enemies.

Item Description: Catalyst belonging to Beatrice, the rogue witch. Contrasts with Vinheim catalysts. This ancient catalyst shows signs of being used for age-old sorceries. It has passed the hands of many generations to get here.
Story: The Catalyst belonged to Beatrice, the rogue witch. It was a stark contrast to the Vinheim catalysts, which were new and shiny. This ancient catalyst showed signs of being used for age-old sorceries. It had passed the hands of many generations to get here.

Item Description: An old armor that is oddly comfortable. Belonged to a Bell Keeper. To this day, the forbidden love of Prince of Alken and the Princess of Venn manipulates these marionettes. Surely they never imagined that their dolls would outlast their own kingdoms
Story: The old armor belonged to a Bell Keeper. It was oddly comfortable, and it was likely that it had been worn by someone who loved their work. The forbidden love of Prince of Alken and the Princess of Venn had manipulated these marionettes for centuries, and they never imagined that their dolls would outlast their own kingdoms.

Item Description: Wooden bow used by bell keepers. Very light, and requiring hardly any strength. The bells symbolize forbidden love; the bell keepers, their faithful guardians, ever-ready to annihilate trespassers. They will stand watch for ever and ever, these determined, if ill-fated, marionettes.
Story: The wooden bow used by bell keepers is a very light weapon that requires hardly any strength to use. The bells symbolize forbidden love, and the bell keepers, their faithful guardians, are always ready to annihilate trespassers. They will stand watch for ever and ever, these determined marionettes.

Item Description: A special ring granted to only the most accomplished sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School. The ring is engraved with an everlasting dragon, and boosts the strength of sorceries.
Story: The ring is a coveted possession at Vinheim Dragon School, and is only given to the most accomplished sorcerers. The ring boosts the strength of sorceries, and is engraved with an everlasting dragon. The sorcerers who wear the ring are feared and respected by their peers. One day, the ring was stolen by a rival school. The sorcerers at Vinheim were determined to find the ring and bring it back to school. They enlisted the help of a dragon, who they believed

Item Description: A special ring given to those who are deemed fit to undertake the journey of discovery in Vinheim, home of sorcery. Greatly boosts sorceries. Apropos to the Dragon School, the seal depicts an everlasting dragon. A bellowing dragon symbolizes the true nature of the consumate sorcerer.
Story: The ring bestowed to those who are deemed fit to undertake the journey of discovery in Vinheim, home of sorcery. The ring greatly boosts sorceries, and is aptly suited to those who wish to pursue the Dragon School, for on the seal is depicted an everlasting dragon, a bellowing symbolizing the true nature of the consumate sorcerer.

Item Description: Armor of unknown origin. Belonged to Benhart of Jugo. Apparently Benhart found this while wandering land to land, but its origins are unknown. He wore it all the time, he adored it so, leaving a slight odor
Story: The armor belonged to Benhart of Jugo. He found it while wandering land to land, but its origins are unknown. He loved wearing it, and it left a slight odor. Some say the armor was imbued with magical properties, and that Benhart was able to use it to fight on even terms with even the most powerful foes.

Item Description: The katana of a berserker, by its name. The thick, shiny black blade cuts exquisitely. Its origins and owner are unknown, but at some point the blade became known by this name.
Story: The katana of a berserker is a powerful weapon that has been used by many warriors in the past. Its origins and owner are unknown, but it is known by its name - the katana of a berserker. This sword is known for its sharpness and its ability to cut through anything.

Item Description: Katana forged from the soul of Sir Alonne. The captivating, undulating design serves to enhance this weapon's mystical allure. Alonne came from the east, and soon became the Iron King's most trusted knight. When he departed, the Old Iron King bequeathed Sir Alonne's name to his iron warriors.
Story: The Katana forged from the soul of Sir Alonne is a beautiful weapon with a mystical allure. Sir Alonne came from the east and soon became the Iron King's most trusted knight. When he departed, the Old Iron King bequeathed Sir Alonne's name to his iron warriors. The captivating, undulating design on this weapon enhances its mystical allure.

Item Description: Gigantic hat worn by the great sorcerer Logan. It completely hid his face, which led to his nickname Big Hat. Famously antisocial, Logan used it to block out noise and people's stares so he could focus on his own thoughts, but it does not possess any special magic powers.
Story: Logan's hat is said to be the size of a small house and completely covers his face, making him known as the Big Hat. Legend has it that he never talks to anyone because he is too busy thinking, and because of this, he is one of the most mysterious and feared sorcerers in all of the land.

Item Description: This billed mask belongs to Yuria, the second eldest. These maidens of a Primordial Serpent were renowned as founders of the Sable Church, which offered salvation for Hollows.
Story: The mask belonged to Yuria, the second eldest daughter of the Sable Church's founders. Yuria was renowned for her piety and her ability to bring Hollows to salvation through her church. When she died, her mask was passed down to her youngest daughter, who kept it hidden away until she was ready to use it.

Item Description: Binoculars made of Brass. Use to peer at distant scenery. This advanced device was built by a famous craftsman of Astora. Its utility is singular, but its applications many. The value of these specs depends greatly on the imagination of their owner
Story: The binoculars were a prized possession for anyone who could afford them. They were made of brass and had a unique ability to see far away. The value of these specs depended greatly on the imagination of their owner. Some people used them to watch the sunset or the stars at night. Others used them to spy on people or track animals. The possibilities were endless.

Item Description: Binoculars made of Brass. Use to peer at distant scenery. This advanced device was built by a famous craftsman of Astora. Its utility is singular, but its applications many. The value of these specs depends greatly on the imagination of their owner
Story: The binoculars were a prized possession for anyone who could afford them. They were made of brass and had a unique ability to see far away. The value of these specs depended greatly on the imagination of their owner. Some people used them to watch the sunset or the stars at night. Others used them to spy on people or to see things that were out of reach. The possibilities were endless.

Item Description: A short katana wielded by the swordsman and distinguished guest of High Lord Wolnir. This shiny black blade is thick, but shorter than the typical katana. The swordsman was a master of a rare technique, traces of which can be observed in this weapon's strong attack. Skill: Hold Assume a holding stance to rapidly execute a lunging slash with a normal attack, or a deflecting parry with a strong attack.
Story: The swordsman was a skilled swordsman who had mastered a rare technique. This technique was seen in the sharpness of his black katana. He was a distinguished guest of High Lord Wolnir and was often seen in the company of other lords and ladies. One day, the swordsman was challenged to a duel by a rival lord. The swordsman accepted and fought with all his might. In the end, the swordsman emerged victorious, but his katana was damaged in the

Item Description: Longbow carved from black wood to resemble a blade. One of the most difficult bows to master. The blade-like body of the bow is light and cuts through the air. Though a longbow, it can be wielded similarly to a shortbow.
Story: The longbow is a difficult bow to master, but its light body and sharp blade-like design make it one of the deadliest bows in existence. Though it can be wielded similarly to a shortbow, the longbow's true power lies in its ability to cut through the air with ease.

Item Description: A black longbow named after a hero of old, known for the unusual stance from which it is fired. Has a longer range than standard bows, but successful usage requires a trained, dexterous hand. Skill: Triple-shot Swiftly nocks three arrows with finesse after drawing the bow, firing them simultaniously.
Story: The black longbow is a powerful weapon that requires a skilled hand to use. Legend has it that the bow was created by a hero known for his unusual stance from which he fired his arrows. By nocking three arrows simultaneously, the user can fire them quickly and with great accuracy.

Item Description: The preferred black bow of the heroic archer Pharis. Has a longer range than standard bows, but is more difficult to use. Without proper abilities, results will be underwhelming.
Story: Pharis had always been a gifted archer, but his favorite bow was the black bow. It had a longer range than a standard bow, but it was more difficult to use. He had to be able to draw the bow smoothly and with perfect form in order to get the most out of it. One day, Pharis met a wizard who taught him how to use the black bow to its fullest potential. With his new skills, Pharis was able to shoot arrows further

Item Description: Attire of Healing Church hunters. Most Healing Church hunters are elementary doctors who understand the importance of early prevention of the scourge, achieved by disposing of victims, and even potential victims, before signs of sickness manifest themselves. Their black attire is synonymous with fear, and that peculiar Yharnam madness. When a cancer is discovered, one must pinpoint its location, reach in, and wrench it from the host's bosom
Story: The Healing Church hunters wear black clothing to signify their fear and to show their affiliation with the Healing Church. They use their knowledge of Yharnam's disease to find and remove cancerous tumors from the bodies of those afflicted.

Item Description: Robe worn by pardoners serving Velka, the Goddess of Sin. The pardoners' attire is uniformly black in color and said to be imbued with Velka's mystical power, which provides resistance against all manner of magic
Story: The robe worn by pardoners serving Velka, the Goddess of Sin, is said to be imbued with her mystical power, which provides resistance against all manner of magic. This powerful garment has been worn by pardoners for centuries, and its dark color has become synonymous with the goddess' authority.

Item Description: Eerily shaped armor spoken of in legend, crafted with the scales of the Black Dragon. The Black Dragon was long considered a mere legend, but this proves its existence
Story: The Black Dragon armor is said to be crafted from the scales of the Black Dragon. Legend has it that this armor was created to protect those who wear it from harm. Those who possess this armor are considered to be among the most powerful warriors in the land.

Item Description: In legend, this oddly-shaped greataxe is said to be forged from the Black dragon's tail. As it is told, the Black dragon lost its tail to a brave warrior in a magnificent battle, and the tail was later used to forge several legendary weapons.
Story: The greataxe is said to have been forged from the Black dragon's tail. The dragon lost its tail in a battle, and the tail was later used to forge the greataxe. The weapon is said to be incredibly powerful and able to slice through anything.

Item Description: In legend, this oddly-shaped long sword is said to be forged from the black dragon's tail. As it is told, the black dragon lost its tail to a brave warrior in a magnificent battle, and the tail was later used to forge several legendary weapons.
Story: The black dragon's tail is said to be the strongest and most powerful weapon in the world. It is said that whoever wields the tail can conquer the world. A brave warrior named Jason fought and won the battle against the black dragon, and the weapon was forged from its tail. Jason used the sword to conquer the world and become a legendary hero.

Item Description: In legend, this oddly-shaped straight sword is said to be forged from the black dragon's tail. As it is told, the black dragon lost its tail to a brave warrior in a magnificent battle, and the tail was later used to forge several legendary weapons.
Story: The black dragon's tail is said to be the strongest and most powerful weapon in the world. It is said that whoever wields the tail can conquer the world.
