One day, a brave warrior fought and defeated the black dragon, and the weapon's tail was cut off. The warrior took the tail to a smithy and had it forged into a straight sword. From then on, the sword was known as the Black Dragon's Tail.

Item Description: In legend, this oddly-shaped war hammer is said to be forged from the black dragon's tail. As it is told, the black dragon lost its tail to a brave warrior in a magnificent battle, and the tail was later used to forge several legendary weapons.
Story: The black dragon's tail is said to be the perfect material for a war hammer. The weapon is incredibly powerful and can crush anything in its way. The only downside is that it's very difficult to find.

Item Description: Attire of the three mentors of the Sable Church of Londor. this pitch-black dress resembles a mourning dress with black leggings andgauntlets are hidden by the dress. These maidens of a Primordial Serpent were renowned as founders of the Sable Church, which offered salvation for Hollows. It is apparent that the women in black were highly skilled fencers, capable of founding the Sable Church between just the three of them.
Story: The three founders of the Sable Church were renowned as some of the most skilled fencers in all of Londor. When they founded the church, it was with the intent of offering salvation to Hollows, and it was clear that their skills with swords and blades were unmatched. Today, the dress worn by these women is still a source of awe and fear in Hollows, who know that these women are capable of anything.

Item Description: Mystical orb found on a Keeper's corpse. Invade the world of the murderer of a Fire Keeper, to defeat the perpetrator and reclaim the soul of the Fire Keeper. The Black Eye keeps constant watch on the city of the Gods, Anor Londo
Story: The orb was found on the body of a Keeper, killed by a murderer. The Black Eye knows that the murderer is a Fire Keeper, and they want to invade the world of the Gods to defeat him and reclaim the soul of the Fire Keeper.

Item Description: Mystical orb found on a Keeper's corpse. Invade the world of the murderer of a Fire Keeper, to defeat the perpetrator and reclaim the soul of the Fire Keeper. The Black Eye keeps constant watch on the city of the Gods, Anor Londo
Story: The orb was found on the body of a Keeper, killed by a murderer. The Black Eye knows that the murderer is a Fire Keeper, and they want to invade the world of the Gods to defeat him and reclaim the soul of the Fire Keeper.

Item Description: More powerful bisque urn filled with special black powder. Explodes, inflicting great fire damage. Fire damage, which differs from physical damage, is highly effective against creatures of flesh, beasts, and other foes that might naturally have cause to fear the flame.
Story: The bisque urn filled with black powder was coveted by all who saw it. It was said to be more powerful than any other bisque urn, and its explosive contents were feared by all. One day, a group of adventurers decided to take the urn for themselves. They were not prepared for the power it held. The urn exploded, inflicting great fire damage on the group. The fire burned them alive, and their screams echoed through the forest for days.

Item Description: A dagger affixed with a black crystal. Found deep inside the Gutter, in the Black Gulch. Heavier than a standard dagger, but with a fine crystal that gives it a smoother slice. Some of the more determined souls exiled to the Gutter sought to scale the walls of the forsaken place and walk the earth once again, but failed, and wasted away mired in misery and resentment.
Story: The dagger was found deep inside the Gutter, in the Black Gulch. It was heavier than a standard dagger, but with a fine crystal that gave it a smoother slice. Some of the more determined souls exiled to the Gutter sought to scale the walls of the forsaken place and walk the earth once again, but failed, and wasted away mired in misery and resentment. If found and wielded by the right person, the dagger could grant them the power to walk the earth once

Item Description: Attire of hunters known as the King's Black Hands. A black cape covers leather armor, shrouding the wearer in darkness. Black Hand was the title established to honor hunters who served successive generations of kings. To date, no more than three such individuals have borne this distinction
Story: The King's Black Hands are a group of hunters who have served the kings of the kingdom for generations. They are known for their dark cape and leather armor, which helps to conceal them in the darkness. The hunters are a prestigious group and are only allowed to join if they are able to prove themselves worthy.

Item Description: Robe worn by Hollowed Drangleic mages. Drangleic mages wore different garb depending on their sex. What function this served, however, is unknown, as with many old practices.
Story: A robe worn by Hollowed Drangleic mages. It is unknown what function it served, as with many old practices.

Item Description: Hood worn upon awakening to the nightmare of blood and beasts. Perhaps its wearer had to stay out of sight, and travel by cover of darkness. Without memory. who will ever know?
Story: The hood worn by the person who had the nightmare of blood and beasts is mysterious. They may have to stay out of sight, and travel by cover of darkness because they don't remember who they are.

Item Description: Iron helmet worn by hunters of the Unseen Village. Removing the hood reveals something reminiscent of a warrior of a previous age. This headwear is made of metal, a rarity for hunter garb, and has high defense, but only against physical attacks.
Story: The Iron Helmet is a rare piece of hunter gear, made of metal and designed to protect the head from physical attacks. The hood that is usually attached to the helmet is removed, revealing a warrior-like appearance that is reminiscent of a bygone era.

Item Description: Armor of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight known for his great strength. Built of a special black iron and providing strong defense, notably against fire, but so terrible heavy to be unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.
Story: Tarkus was known for his great strength and armor. He was able to use his armor to protect him from fire, but it was so heavy that it was difficult for anyone else to use. Tarkus was the only person who could use it effectively.

Item Description: Greatshield of the might knight Tarkus Built of special black iron and even heavier than Knight Berenike's tower shield. Especially resistant to fire attacks and effective for shield bashing.
Story: Tarkus was a might knight who fought in many battles, but he was never defeated. One day, he was fighting a dragon and was about to be killed. The dragon breathed fire on Tarkus, but his shield protected him. The heat from the fire melted the black iron of his shield, but it didn't break. Tarkus killed the dragon with his bare hands.

Item Description: Dagger once belonging to one of the assassins who murdered Godwyn the Golden on the Night of the Black Knives. A ritual performed on the oddly misshapen blade imbued it with the power of the stolen Rune of Death.
Story: The dagger once belonged to one of the assassins who murdered Godwyn the Golden on the Night of the Black Knives. A ritual performed on the oddly misshapen blade imbued it with the power of the stolen Rune of Death. Now, whenever someone dies by the blade's edge, the power of the rune courses through their body and kills them instantly.

Item Description: Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound. Traces of power yet remain in its concealing veil, which muffles the sound of footsteps. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.
Story: The Scale Armor of the Black Knife Assassins is a finely crafted piece of armor that was designed to make no sound when worn. This armor was forged with traces of power still remaining within it, which helps to muffle the sound of footsteps. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and it is rumored that they were Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

Item Description: Armor of the Black Knight who haunt Lordran. The knights followed Lord Gwyn when he departed to link the flame, but they were burned to ashes in newly kindled fire, wandering the world as disembodied spirits ever after
Story: The armor of the Black Knight who haunt Lordran is said to be the most fearsome armor in all of Lordran. It is said that the Black Knight himself is the armor, and that it is imbued with his dark power. Any who wear it are doomed to follow in the Black Knight's footsteps, becoming dark and twisted spirits forevermore.

Item Description: Armor of the Black Knights who roam the lands. The knights served the First Lord Gwyn, and followed him into the flame upon its linking. They became ash, but still wander the realms to this day.
Story: The armor of the Black Knights who roam the lands is said to have been forged from the linking flame itself. The knights followed the First Lord Gwyn into the flame, and became ash. However, their armor still walks the realms, serving as a reminder of the First Lord's might.

Item Description: Glaive of the black knights who wander the lands. Used to face chaos demons. The unique attack of this glaive greatly reduces enemy poise, reflecting the tremendous size of the enemies that the knights have fearlessly faced. Skill: Spin Sweep Sweep foes in a large spinning motion, and utilize momentum to transition into an overhanded strong attack.
Story: The glaive is a weapon used by the black knights who wander the lands. It is a large, heavy weapon that was specifically designed to face chaos demons. The weapon's unique attack greatly reduces the poise of enemies, reflecting the tremendous size of the enemies that the knights have fearlessly faced.

Item Description: Even after their flesh was charred by flame, they remained as strong as ever, and stood watch, challenging visitors to their land.
Story: The land of the fire giants was a harsh and unforgiving place. The giants were the only living creatures that could withstand the intense heat of their homeland. Even after their flesh was charred by flame, they remained as strong as ever, and stood watch, challenging visitors to their land.

Item Description: .Greatsword wielded by knights who served a lord of light in a long-forgotten age. Even after their flesh was charred by flame, they remained as strong as ever, and stood watch, challenging visitors to their land.
Story: The greatsword was wielded by knights who served a lord of light in a long-forgotten age. Even after their flesh was charred by flame, they remained as strong as ever, and stood watch, challenging visitors to their land. One day, a group of adventurers arrived at the land of the knights and challenged them to a fight. The knights fought with all their might, but eventually they were defeated. The greatsword remained in the hands of the knights, and it is still wielded

Item Description: Halberd of the black knights who wander Lordran. Used to face chaos demons. The large motion that puts the weight of the body into the attack reflects the great size of their adversaries long ago.
Story: The Halberd of the Black Knights is a legendary weapon that was used by the black knights who wandered Lordran. It was used to face chaos demons, who were much larger and more powerful than any other creatures in the game. The large motion that puts the weight of the body into the attack reflects the great size of their adversaries long ago.

Item Description: Shield of the Black Knights that wander Lordan. A flowing canal is chiseled deeply into its face. Long ago the black knights faced the chaos demons and were charred black but their shields became highly resistant to fire
Story: The Shield of the Black Knights that wander Lordan is a powerful artifact that was created by the black knights who fought against the chaos demons. The shield is made out of a special metal that is highly resistant to fire, which is why it is often used by the black knights.

Item Description: Greatsword of the Black Knights who wander Lordran. Used to face chaos demons. The Large motion that puts the weight of the body into the attack reflects the great size of their adversaries long ago.
Story: The greatsword of the black knights who wander Lordran. It was used to face chaos demons, and the large motion that puts the weight of the body into the attack reflects the great size of their adversaries long ago.

Item Description: Ultra greatsword wielded by knights who served a lord of light in a long forgotten age. Even after their flesh was charred by flame, they remained as strong as ever, and stood watch, challenging visitors to their land.
Story: The Ultra Greatsword is a legendary weapon that was once wielded by knights who served a lord of light in a long forgotten age. Even after their flesh was charred by flame, they remained as strong as ever, and stood watch, challenging visitors to their land. One day, a group of adventurers ventured into the land of the knights and were met with their fiery challenge. Despite their best efforts, the adventurers were eventually defeated and the Ultra Greatsword was taken from them.

Item Description: This armor is made of smooth black leather is extremely quiet, a good thing for those who hide in the shadows. The leather itself is thick, offering a decent level of protection
Story: The armor is made for those who want to stay hidden and undetected. It is made of black leather and is very quiet, making it perfect for those who want to sneak around.

Item Description: Armor dyed black. Allows the wearer to blend in with the dark. Often used by those with ill-intent. Meticulously crafted, and provides fair defense
Story: The armor was black, and it seemed to absorb the light that hit it. It was finely crafted, and it looked like it would provide good defense. However, the armor also had a sinister look to it, as if it was meant for someone with evil intentions.

Item Description: Black Robe Belonged to Straid of Olaphis. Straid was invited to the old kingdom of Olaphis for his wisdom, but its depth was such that people soon feared him, and in the end Straid was led into a dreadful trap. Straid spent several lifetimes as stone. During this hiatus, kingdoms rose and fell, until the land called Drangleic came to be.
Story: The black robe belonged to Straid of Olaphis, a sage who was invited to the old kingdom of Olaphis but was soon feared and trapped in a dreadful trap. During his hiatus, kingdoms rose and fell, until the land called Drangleic came to be.

Item Description: Manscorpion Tark's thrusting sword. The scorpion pincer guard contains poison, which is injected into foes pierced by the blade. Tark's past is a thing obscure. But then again, do any of us know who we are, let alone what we may have been?
Story: Tark's thrusting sword is a deadly weapon. The scorpion pincer guard contains poison, which is injected into foes pierced by the blade. Tark's past is a thing obscure. But then again, do any of us know who we are, let alone what we may have been?

Item Description: Cloak worn by the secret sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School. They secretly work with sound-based spells, and never reveal themselves
Story: The Cloak worn by the secret sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School is a special item. It is made of a special material that allows sound-based spells to be cast without being detected. This cloak is a vital part of the sorcerers' arsenal, and they never reveal themselves to anyone.

Item Description: Robe worn by Zullie the witch, seducer of Alva of Wayfarer. Boasts excellent magic defense. When Zullie the witch learned of Alva's dedication to Saint Serrate she used all manner of tricks and deceit to ruin him, but in the end she would spend her life with him, supporting his endeavors. Scholar of the First Sin added: The witch, as unloving as she was unloved, finally found illumination through her blighted existence.
Story: A robe worn by Zullie the witch, seducer of Alva of Wayfarer. Boasts excellent magic defense. When Zullie the witch learned of Alva's dedication to Saint Serrate she used all manner of tricks and deceit to ruin him, but in the end she would spend her life with him, supporting his endeavors. Scholar of the First Sin added: The witch, as unloving as she was unloved, finally found illumination through her blighted existence.

Item Description: Staff used by Leydia Witches. Imbued with a special magic, making it a catalyst for sorceries, miracles, and hexes. Leydia apostles are adept at magic, and wielded unique weapons, but were deemed blasphemous and slaughtered.
Story: The Staff of Leydia was once used by Leydia Witches. It was imbued with a special magic that made it a catalyst for sorceries, miracles, and hexes. The Leydia Apostles were adept at magic, and wielded unique weapons, but were deemed blasphemous and slaughtered. Now, the Staff of Leydia is yours to use. Use it to cast powerful spells and perform miracles. Be the catalyst for change and bring peace to the world.

Item Description: A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf Blaidd, who served as Ranni’s shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady. Relic of an assassin who assumed the guise of Ranni the Witch's loyal shadow. The likeness is striking.
Story: The mask was a faithful ally to Ranni the Witch. It was crafted after the head of a black wolf, Blaidd, who served as her loyal shadow. If it would have him turn upon his Lady, Blaidd would defy destiny itself.

Item Description: Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Blackflame Monks. The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.
Story: The Blackflame Monks were once devout guardians of the black flame, a sacred relic that burned with a divine power. However, they became corrupted by its power and turned against their brethren, forsaking their duty to protect the flame. Now, they wander the world, seeking to spread their dark influence and bring ruin to all who oppose them. These iron greaves are a symbol of their traitorous ways, and are sure to intimidate any foe.

Item Description: Soft eye blessed by a phantasm. They were discovered through Byrgenwerth's contact with the arcane, but in the end revealed nothing. Deep within the eye lies a vast stretch of dark sky that rumbles with an endless meteor storm. The slightest rub of the tiny orb, and the rock will tumble and soar.
Story: The soft eye is a cursed item that was discovered by Byrgenwerth through their contact with the arcane. The eye is filled with a vast stretch of dark sky that rumbles with an endless meteor storm. The slightest rub of the orb, and the rock will tumble and soar.

Item Description: Soft eye blessed by a phantasm. They were discovered through Byrgenwerth's contact with the arcane, but in the end revealed nothing. Deep within the eye lies a vast stretch of dark sky that rumbles with an endless meteor storm. The slightest rub of the tiny orb, and the rock will tumble and soar.
Story: The soft eye is a cursed item that was discovered through Byrgenwerth's contact with the arcane. The eye is said to contain a vast stretch of dark sky that rumbles with an endless meteor storm. The slightest rub of the orb, and the rock will tumble and soar.

Item Description: Wooden hammer of the giant blacksmith in Anor Londo who handles lightning weapons. The giant blacksmith forges with this wooden hammer as it would be hazardous to handle lightning weapons with metals
Story: The giant blacksmith in Anor Londo crafts some of the most powerful lightning weapons in all of Lordran. He is a master of the craft, and his wooden hammer is the perfect tool for handling these deadly weapons.

Item Description: Metal hammer of Andre of Astora blacksmith at the Old Church. Can be used as a strike weapon but better left in the hands of its talented owner
Story: Andre was a blacksmith at the Old Church, and his metal hammer was one of the most prized possessions in the church. It was a powerful tool, but Andre was better suited to using it as a strike weapon, not as a tool for everyday use.

Item Description: Blacksteel katana wielded by Alonne Knights.One of the sturdiest types of katana, preferred by masters of the quick-draw. In the heyday of his land, the Old Iron King fancied entertaining dubious and eccentric guests from faraway lands. Most of them were charlatans, but among the riff-raff was an unusual knight from the far east. He trained the Iron King's men in the sword, in obeisance to his new lord.
Story: The Blacksteel katana was wielded by Alonne Knights, who were masters of the quick-draw. The katana was one of the sturdiest types of katana, preferred by masters of the quick-draw. In the heyday of his land, the Old Iron King entertained dubious and eccentric guests from faraway lands. Most of them were charlatans, but among the riff-raff was an unusual knight from the far east. He trained the Iron King's men

Item Description: Dagger given to one who set out on a journey to fulfill her duty long ago. The power of its former owner, the kindling maiden, is still apparent. The one who walks alongside flame, Shall one day meet the road of Destined Death.
Story: The dagger was once wielded by the kindling maiden, a young woman who set out on a journey to fulfill her duty long ago. The power of her former owner is still apparent in the dagger, and it is said that the one who walks alongside flame shall one day meet the road of Destined Death.

Item Description: A special trick weapon passed down among hunters of hunters. One of the oldest weapons of the workshop. Splits into two when activated. The weapon's warped blades are forged with siderite, a rare mineral of the heavens. Most effective swift attacks,such as after a quick-stepping.
Story: The hunters of hunters carry a special weapon that splits into two blades when activated. The weapon is forged with siderite, a rare mineral of the heavens. The warped blades are most effective when used in quick attacks, such as after a quick-stepping.

Item Description: Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd The pelt serves as a cape, protecting from cold. Blaidd was the blade of Ranni, but the cold bothered him anyway.
Story: The armor of Blaidd is well-worn and covered in scars. It serves as a cape, protecting from the cold. Blaidd was the blade of Ranni, but the cold bothered him anyway. He was always searching for a way to stop the cold from bothering him, but he never found a solution. One day, he met a woman who told him about a place where he could find the answer to his problem. The place was a land of ice and snow,

Item Description: Sacred sword of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy. Remains of the countless heroes he has devoured writhe upon the surface of this blade. Now they share the same blood, bound together as family. Some HP is restored upon defeating an enemy.
Story: The Sacred Sword of Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy, is a legendary blade that is said to have been created from the remains of countless heroes Rykard has devoured. Now, the heroes who once fought against him are bound together as family, sharing the same blood on the blade. When Rykard is defeated, some of his HP is restored.

Item Description: An altered state of titanite. Use to make weapons lacerating, or to provide bleeding resistance to shields. Sorcerers at the Melfian Magic Academy once attempted to imbue titanite with various elements, but are said to have failed. Someone must have succeeded though; what else would explain this stone?
Story: The stone is said to have the power to alter the state of titanite, granting weapons lacerating properties or providing bleeding resistance to shields. Sorcerers at the Melfian Magic Academy once attempted to imbue titanite with various elements, but are said to have failed. Someone must have succeeded though; what else would explain this stone's strange properties?

Item Description: A jar of carnivorous plant secretions. Applies bleeding effect to Main-hand weapon. Bleeding foes' max HP is lowered.
Story: The jar of carnivorous plant secretions is a powerful tool that can help you take down your enemies. The bleeding effect will cause your enemies' maximum HP to be lowered, making it easier for you to take them down.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. commonly known as a charm kept by saints. Used in infusion to create blessed weapons. Special blessed weapons gradually restore HP and heavily damage reanimated foes.
Story: The gem was a common item kept by saints. It was used in infusion to create blessed weapons. The special blessed weapons gradually restored HP and heavily damaged reanimated foes.

Item Description: Attire of the Choir, high-ranking members of the Healing Church. Members of the Choir are both the highest-ranking clerics of the Healing Church, and scholars who continue the work that began at Byrgenwerth. The eye covering indicates their debt to the teachings of Master Willem, even though their paths diverged.
Story: The Choir is a group of high-ranking clerics of the Healing Church. They are scholars who continue the work that began at Byrgenwerth. The eye covering indicates their debt to the teachings of Master Willem, even though their paths diverged.

Item Description: The Vilebloods of Cainhurst, blood-lusting hunters, see these frightful things in coldblood. They often appear in the blood of echo fiends, that is to say, the blood of hunters. Queen Annalise partakes in these blood dreg offerings, so that she may one day bear the Child of Blood, the next Vileblood heir.
Story: The Vilebloods of Cainhurst are a group of bloodthirsty hunters who feast on the blood of echo fiends, or hunters who have killed echo fiends. Queen Annalise is a member of this group, and she hopes to one day become the next Vileblood heir.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Slurped by Irithyll slaves. Used in infusion to create lacerating weapons. Such weapons inflict lacerating damage. Most effective with sharp or spiked weapons.
Story: The gem was coveted by the Irithyll slaves, who would drink its contents in an attempt to increase their strength. The gem also had the ability to infuse weapons with lacerating damage, making them particularly deadly against foes with weak armor.

Item Description: A misplaced workshop tool from the Hunter's Dream. The hunter who retrieves this can fortify weapons by kneading blood gems into them. Blood gems add properties to weapons when used to fortify them, as blood defines an organism.
Story: The hunter who finds the misplaced workshop tool from the Hunter's Dream can use it to fortify their weapons with blood gems. The blood gems add properties to the weapons when used, such as increasing damage or adding a special effect.

Item Description: A misplaced workshop tool from the Hunter's Dream. The hunter who retrieves this can fortify weapons by kneading blood gems into them. Blood gems add properties to weapons when used to fortify them, as blood defines an organism.
Story: The hunter who finds this tool can use it to fortify their weapons with blood gems, adding unique properties to their weapons. The blood of creatures defines their power and can be used to enhance the effectiveness of a weapon.

Item Description: Blood taken from Adella, nun of the Healing Church. Restores an amount of HP, then continues to gradually restore HP for a short time. The Healing Church nuns are chosen for their merit as vessels for blood, and groomed as Blood Saints. The mere chance of being treated with their blood lends legitimacy to the Healing Church and communion.
Story: Adella had always been a devout nun of the Healing Church. She had been chosen for her merit as a vessel for blood, and groomed as a Blood Saint. When she was kidnapped by a group of bandits, she was terrified. But when they took her to a remote cabin, and cut her arm to take her blood, she felt a sense of peace. The bandits were amazed at the amount of HP her blood restored, and they began to treat her like a goddess. As

Item Description: Blood taken from Arianna, Cathedral Ward woman of pleasure. The sweet blood of Arianna restores HP, and temporarily speeds stamina recovery. A member of the old Healing Church would know that her blood is similar indeed, to precisely what was once forbidden.
Story: Arianna was a woman of pleasure in the Cathedral Ward. She was known for her sweet blood, which was said to restore HP and speed stamina recovery. One day, a member of the old Healing Church discovered that her blood was similar indeed, to the blood that was once forbidden. Using this knowledge, they were able to heal themselves and others with her blood.

Item Description: Blood of the soul that seeped from the hole within Slave Knight Gael. Used as pigment by his lady in Ariandel to depict a painted world. When Gael came upon the pygmy lords, he discovered that their blood had long ago dried, and so consumed the dark one's soul.
Story: Gael, a slave knight of the kingdom of Ariandel, discovered a group of pygmy lords living in the darkest corners of the kingdom. The pygmies were a small, primitive people, and their blood was the only thing that could create the vibrant colors needed to paint the kingdom's landscapes. Gael drank the blood of the pygmies, and in doing so, consumed their souls. Now, the pygmies haunt the kingdom, painting the landscapes with their dark blood

Item Description: A Caryll rune that transcribes inhuman sounds. Blood Rapture is the raw euphoria of the warmth of blood. Restores HP with visceral attacks, one of the darker hunter techniques. This rune resonates with servants of the Queen, carrier of the Child of Blood, who yearn for their Queen's blood with little hope of requitement. For them, they find solace in Blood Rapture, that serves as a surrogate for their desires.
Story: The Caryll rune Blood Rapture is a dark hunter technique that restores HP with visceral attacks. It resonates with servants of the Queen, who yearn for their Queen's blood with little hope of requitement. For them, Blood Rapture provides a surrogate for their desires.

Item Description: A Caryll rune that transcribes inhuman sounds. Blood Rapture is the raw euphoria of the warmth of blood. Restores HP with visceral attacks, one of the darker hunter techniques. This rune resonates with servants of the Queen, carrier of the Child of Blood, who yearn for their Queen's blood with little hope of requitement. For them, they find solace in Blood Rapture, that serves as a surrogate for their desires.
Story: The Caryll rune Blood Rapture is a dark hunter technique that restores HP with visceral attacks. It resonates with servants of the Queen, who yearn for their Queen's blood with little hope of requitement. For them, Blood Rapture provides a surrogate for their desires.

Item Description: A solid shard that forms in coldblood. After death, a substance in the blood hardens, and that which does not crystallize is called a blood stone. At the workshop, these bloodstones are embedded in weapons to fortify them.
Story: The workshop was always busy, but today it was especially so. The clanging of metal against metal, the shouts of the workers, and the occasional cry of pain all blended together into a cacophony that was almost overwhelming. One of the workers, a young woman with long, dark hair, was struggling to fix a sword that had been damaged in battle. She was using her own blood to try and fix the blade, but it was no use. The sword was too

Item Description: Special blood used in ministration. Restores HP. Once a patient has had their blood ministered, a unique but common treatment in Yharnam, successive infusions recall the first, and are all the more invigorating for it. No surprise that most Yharnamites are heavy users of blood.
Story: The blood of Yharnamites is special. It is used in ministration to restore HP. The blood of Yharnamites is also invigorating, as it recalls the first infusion. This makes it a popular treatment in Yharnam.

Item Description: One of the infamous bite rings commissioned by Sir Arstor of Carim. Despite the dreadful rumors surrounding its creation, this ring is an unmistakable asset, in its ability to help prevent bleeding.
Story: The bite ring was a strange and controversial piece of jewelry. It was said that it was created by Sir Arstor of Carim, one of the most infamous and feared necromancers of his day. The bite ring was supposed to help prevent bleeding, and many people believed that it was nothing more than a tool of the necromancer's trade. Despite its dubious origins, the bite ring was an invaluable tool. It saved many lives, and it became something of a symbol

Item Description: One of several bite rings, known for their peculiar design. Increases bleeding resistance. The similar, oddly disturbing design of these rings suggests a common source. Whoever the master craftsman was, he clearly knew his trade.
Story: The bite rings were strange, but the design was familiar. I had seen it before, but I couldn't place where. I was about to ask my friend when I realized that the design was on the bite rings of the vampires that were attacking us. I screamed and ran away, but it was too late. My friend was already bitten and dying.

Item Description: Large curved claws used by Bloodhound Knights. The curve allows the weapon to slip through an enemy's guard.
Story: The Bloodhound Knights are a fearsome order of knights who use large curved claws to slash through their enemies. The curved design allows the claws to slip through an enemy's guard, leaving them vulnerable to a quick and deadly attack.

Item Description: Metal armor with a jutting breastplate. Worn by the Bloodhound Knights. The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.
Story: The Bloodhound Knights are a group of warriors who are known for their unyielding tracking skills. They are a fearsome group, and are often hired by powerful lords to track down criminals or fugitives. The armor worn by the Bloodhound Knights is made from metal plates that jut out from their chests, giving them an imposing appearance. The knights are fiercely loyal to their masters, and will follow them into any battle.

Item Description: Bloodied Arm Bands. Brador donned a compatriot's beastly scalp and hide while still moist with blood. Most of the blood stains on this hide were from that day
Story: Brador had just fought in a brutal battle and was covered in blood. He found a bandage and put it on his arm to stop the bleeding. The bandage was from a comrade he had fought alongside, and some of the blood stains on it were from when Brador had killed the comrade.

Item Description: A blood-stained whip. A tool made for a purpose forbidden by the gods. Its effect is augmented by its pointed tip, but still only marginally effective against protective covering such as hard armor.
Story: The whip is a tool that was made for a purpose that was forbidden by the gods. The pointed tip of the whip makes it marginally effective against protective covering, but the whip's true power comes from its blood-stained handle. The handle is stained with the blood of those who have disobeyed the gods, and the whip's power is amplified by this.

Item Description: The demented hunter weapon brandished by Brador, the Healing Church assassin. The Bloodletter assumes its true and terrifying form after it draws upon blood from the inner reaches of one's body and soul. This is the only effective means of expelling tainted blood, or so Brador, isolated in his cell, continued to believe
Story: The Bloodletter is a weapon wielded by Brador, an assassin for the Healing Church. When it draws upon blood from the inner reaches of its victim's body and soul, the Bloodletter assumes its true and terrifying form. This is the only effective means of expelling tainted blood, according to Brador, who was imprisoned in a cell alone for years because of his beliefs.

Item Description: Katana of the old Mound-maker. The Mound-maker piled sacrifices upon the altar, but became the final offering himself, leaving this katana as a gift for his dear family. Skill: Bloodlust Stain blade with one’s own blood to temporarily grant uncanny sharpness. For one driven by bloodlust, nothing deserves to remain standing.
Story: The Mound-maker was a great warrior who sacrificed himself to build a great mound in honor of his family. After he died, he left this katana as a gift to his loved ones. When someone is driven by bloodlust, this katana gives them the sharpest edge possible.

Item Description: Red moss clump used as maggot repellent. Reduces bleeding build-up. Bleeding builds up when attacked by sharp blades or spikes, and once triggered causes severe damage. Use this moss clump before it reaches that point.
Story: The red moss clump was used as a maggot repellent. It reduced the bleeding build-up, and if it reached that point, the moss clump would help to stop the bleeding.

Item Description: The bloodshield spoken of in the lost legends. The red blood is slightly enchanted and boost various resistances
Story: The bloodshield is a legendary artifact said to be imbued with the power of the red dragon. Legend has it that whoever possesses the shield will be immune to all forms of damage, including magical attacks. The shield is said to be incredibly powerful, and its red blood is said to be slightly enchanted, granting the user various resistances.

Item Description: Material used in a Holy Chalice rite. An exquisite eyeball removed quickly after death, or perhaps even before. Used to unlock the seal of the old labyrinth hintertombs.
Story: The ancient labyrinth hintertombs were sealed off long ago, but someone has recently discovered a way to unlock the seal. They use an eyeball taken from a recently deceased person to do so.

Item Description: Mask formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood. Even the most ghastly cover is more inviting than the festering face beneath.
Story: A mask made from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood is more inviting than the festering face beneath. The mask is a symbol of hope and represents the possibility of a new beginning.

Item Description: Padded cloth armor with indelible bloodstains around the neck. Worn by headless foot soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.
Story: The armor is stained with blood, and it seems to have been worn by foot soldiers who have been decapitated. They stand guard around the mausoleum, endlessly vigilant.

Item Description: Dagger with a bloodstained blade. Afflicts targets with blood loss. As blood darkened the dagger through repeated slashing and stabbing, its blade only grew sharper and harder.
Story: The dagger was stained with the blood of its victims. It was a gruesome weapon, one that inflicted blood loss on its targets. It was said that the more blood the dagger stained, the sharper and harder its blade became.

Item Description: Ominous piercing sword with a winding blade. Carried by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood. Designed to bore into flesh, causing severe blood loss at the wound. The extracted blood trickles gracefully down the length of the blade.
Story: The sword is called the Bloodletter and is said to be the weapon of choice of the Lord of Blood. It is a fearsome weapon, designed to cause severe blood loss at the wound. The extracted blood trickles gracefully down the length of the blade, making it a deadly weapon.

Item Description: Material used in a Holy Chalice ritual. Pale vegetation that commonly grows on coldblood in a place long abandoned, that has bloomed into a bright red stygian flower.
Story: The Chalice of Blood was used in a Holy ritual to summon the god of death. The bright red flower that grew from the chalice was a sign that the ritual was successful.

Item Description: Potently medicinal moss clump with a flower. Reduces poison and toxin. Cures ailments. A toxin is a more vicious form of poison which quickly leads to death. Moss clumps without blooms are useless against toxin, and those who neglect to carry this flowered variety are simply courting an early demise.
Story: The Moss Clump was created by a wise druid to help those who are poisoned or afflicted with toxins. The moss clump is filled with powerful medicinal properties that help to reduce the effects of poison and toxin. The moss clump also helps to cure ailments, making it a valuable asset for anyone who needs it.

Item Description: Vest of a nomadic warrior. The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. Warriors must remain ever drifting.
Story: The vest belonged to a nomadic warrior. The blue color of its fabric symbolized brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. Warriors must remain ever drifting in order to avoid becoming stagnant.

Item Description: Dagger used by fume sorcerers when a battle draws too close for comfort. An ordinary-looking dagger laced with magic. Strengthens spells, but also increases vulnerability to them
Story: The dagger was used by fume sorcerers to increase their spellcasting abilities, but it also made them more vulnerable to spells.

Item Description: Dubious liquid medicine used in strange experiments conducted by high ministers of the Healing Church. A type of anesthetic that numbs the brain. Hunters, able to retain consciousness by force of will, make use of a secondary effect of the medicine, which dilutes their presence while standing still.
Story: The Dubious Liquid Medicine was used in strange experiments conducted by high ministers of the Healing Church. A type of anesthetic that numbs the brain. Hunters, able to retain consciousness by force of will, make use of a secondary effect of the medicine, which dilutes their presence while standing still. This allowed them to sneak up on their prey undetected.

Item Description: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Use of this hood, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.
Story: The young maidens of Dominula dance and play all day long during the festival. To show their dedication, they must wear a special blue hood. Anyone who violates this rule risks being scolded by the elders.

Item Description: Straight sword wielded by Leydia apostles. Imbued with a special magic that makes the Blue Flame both a sword and magic catalyst. Execute a strong attack to emit magic. The Leydia apostles, adept at magic, wielded unique weapons but were hunted down as traitors.
Story: The straight sword wielded by the Leydia apostles was imbued with a special magic that made the Blue Flame both a sword and magic catalyst. When used in conjunction with the apostles' strong attack, the sword's magic could be unleashed in a powerful blast. The apostles were hunted down as traitors, and their unique weapons were all lost to history.

Item Description: .Halberd of Targray, Knight of the Blue. A fitting weapon for a shepherd of lost souls Those who put faith in an absolute good also believe in the existence of true evil. But to others, the distinction between the two can be quite unclear.
Story: The Halberd of Targray was once wielded by a knight who fought for the good of all. But after years of service, the knight became lost in his own convictions, and began to hunt down evil wherever it may be found. Now, his halberd is a symbol of hope to those who believe in the power of good, and a warning to those who would dare to defy it.

Item Description: Ring of the Way of Blue covenant. Increases HP slightly. The Way of Blue is not a developed religion. It is a humble prayer that spread naturally amongst those seeking help. When apostles of Blue are invaded by dark spirits, they can receive assistance from masters of other worlds.
Story: The Ring of the Way of Blue covenant increases HP by a small amount. When apostles of Blue are invaded by dark spirits, they can receive assistance from masters of other worlds.

Item Description: Chainmail armor crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers. Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.
Story: The Chainmail armor worn by the Albinauric archers was crafted with blue silver, a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves. This armor provides protection from magic and frost, two elements that can be deadly to those who rely on them. The armor is sleek and elegant, and its blue silver color makes it stand out among the other armors worn by the soldiers.

Item Description: The rare gem called tearstone has the uncanny ability to sense imminent death. This blue tearstone from Catarina boosts the defence of its wearer when in danger
Story: The tearstone was a rare gem that had the uncanny ability to sense imminent death. It was found by a young girl named Catarina who used it to boost her defence when in danger.

Item Description: A ring set with a rare tearstone. Reacts when the wearer is in danger, temporarily increasing its wearer's physical defense. Caitha, goddess of tears, mourns those who have lost loved ones by shedding pure tears of blue. It is said that the stone set in this ring is one such tear
Story: When Caitha, goddess of tears, wears this ring, it amplifies her physical defense in times of danger. This ring is said to have been given to her by a grieving mother who wanted to protect her daughter.

Item Description: The Blade of this greatsword shines like the brilliant rays of the moon. In the oldest legends, rarely spoken of today, it is said that the sword was born of a great white being. Then, what explains this lifeless weapon? Perhaps there has been some mistake...
Story: The Blade of this greatsword shines like the brilliant rays of the moon. It is said that the sword was born of a great white being. However, what explains this lifeless weapon? Perhaps there has been some mistake...

Item Description: Dangling, upside-down rune etched in the mind of a hunter. This reminder allows one to envision the rune with clarity. Allows a hunter to awaken again without losing Blood Echoes, a trick that seems nearly too good to be true.
Story: The rune hangs from a thin gold chain around the hunter's neck, swinging gently back and forth with their movements. It's a simple reminder, but it's one that the hunter relies on heavily. The rune is a symbol of their power, and it's the only thing that keeps them from losing their Blood Echoes. The hunter has been hunting for weeks, and they're close to their target. They've been through countless forests and caves, and they're starting to lose Blood

Item Description: Spear whittled from the weapon wielded by Gransax. One of the legendary armaments. A great ancient dragon, Gransax once rained calamity upon the Royal Capital - the only time in historical record that Leyndell's walls have fallen. This marked the dawn of the war against dragons.
Story: The spear was wielded by Gransax, a legendary dragon that once caused havoc in the Royal Capital. The only time this has ever happened is when Gransax was attacking Leyndell. With this spear, the people of Leyndell can finally stand up to Gransax and win the war against dragons.

Item Description: Coarse paper that applies bolt to weapons when rubbed. Invented by Archibald, the infamous eccentric of the Healing Church workshop. Artificially recreates the blue sparks that are said to surround darkbeasts. Unlike the other strange weapons created by Archibald, this one was favored by many hunters, in particular those who had even once laid eyes on a darkbeast.
Story: The Archibald workshop was a place of mystery and intrigue. It was here that the eccentric Archibald created some of the strangest weapons known to man. One of these was the coarse paper that applied bolt to weapons when rubbed. This artificial recreation of the blue sparks that are said to surround darkbeasts was favored by many hunters, in particular those who had even once laid eyes on a darkbeast.

Item Description: An altered state of titanite. Use to imbue weapons with lightning, or to provide lightning resistance to shields. Sorcerers at the Melfian Magic Academy once attempted to imbue titanite with various elements, but are said to have failed. Someone must have succeeded though; what else would explain this stone?
Story: The stone is said to have been used by the sorcerers at the Melfian Magic Academy to imbue weapons with lightning, or to provide lightning resistance to shields. Recently, someone has apparently succeeded in doing so, and the stone has become sought-after by adventurers. Whether or not this is true, or if the stone is just a myth, is unknown. What is known, however, is that the stone has a mysterious power that intrigues many.

Item Description: Armor made of bone ash,worn by the oldest keepers. The keepers, who mind the slumbering Great Ones, gained eternal life, preserved in ashen form in a ceremony of flame that cremated body and soul Now, their frail armor is white and sinewy, a window into an arcane lost art.
Story: The armor worn by the oldest keepers is bone ash, a material that has been preserved through a ceremony of flame. The keepers, who mind the slumbering Great Ones, gained eternal life, preserved in ashen form. Now, their frail armor is white and sinewy, a window into an arcane lost art.

Item Description: The long, pointed hat is a symbol of the old keepers and is considered evidence of their companionship, forged in a certain sin.
Story: The hat is a symbol of the old keepers and is considered evidence of their companionship. The keepers were a group of sinfully powerful beings who forged the hat together. The hat is said to be evidence of their companionship and is a symbol of their power.

Item Description: A mask made of bone ash, worn by the oldest keepers. The keepers, who mind the slumbering Great Ones, gained eternal life, preserved in ashen form in a ceremony of flame that cremated body and soul. The long, pointed hat is a symbol of the old keepers and is considered evidence of their companionship, forged in a certain sin.
Story: The oldest keepers of the Great Ones were granted eternal life by cremating their body and soul in a ceremony of flame. They wear a pointed hat as a symbol of their companionship and are considered evidence of the Great Ones' presence.

Item Description: The Old Iron King led his best men on Undead hunts, but their memories were purged in rebirth
Story: The Old Iron King was a great king who led his people to victory against the undead. However, after his death, his best men forgot all about their past and went on to lead successful lives. One day, they were called back to serve their king once again, and they were able to do so with renewed vigor.

Item Description: .Bone that is bound to the fist. Used to enhance hand-to-hand combat. Salvaged from a malformed creature. Enables one to fight with inhuman strength, as if the very spirit of the bone's malicious owner had taken control.
Story: The Bone that is Bound to the Fist is a powerful artifact that enhances hand-to-hand combat. It was salvaged from a malformed creature and allows one to fight with inhuman strength, as if the very spirit of the bone's malicious owner had taken control.

Item Description: The very men who were ordered to hunt down the Undead were themselves hollowed, and founded a kingdom of bone
Story: The kingdom of bone was founded by the very men who were ordered to hunt down the Undead. These men were hollowed by the Undead and now they rule over a kingdom of bone. The kingdom is a dark and dangerous place where the Undead reign supreme. The men who founded the kingdom are now hunted by the other kingdoms for their dark magic and their ability to control the Undead.

Item Description: Additional medium that strengthens Quicksilver Bullets. According to the workshop, this is a special bone marrow ash collected from Hemwick Charnel Lane. Invaluable to hunters with weak bloodtinge who require the use of stronger firearms.
Story: The workshop owner explained that Hemwick Charnel Lane is a place where hunters go to collect special bone marrow ash. This ash is said to be invaluable to those with weak blood, as it helps them use stronger firearms.

Item Description: Scythe forged from the soul of the Covetous Demon. The curved spine of the Covetous Demon is hard as rock, and rather than slicing through flesh, this weapon seems to grind it apart. That thing that ended up as a monstrous fiend, what was it to begin with, and why did it never leave the queen? Perhaps it was entranced by some perversion of love.
Story: The covetous demon's soul was used to create a fearsome scythe. The weapon's curved spine is hard as rock, and it seems to grind through flesh as if it was nothing. Rumors say that the covetous demon was originally a beautiful creature that was entranced by some perversion of love. When it became a monstrous fiend, it ended up killing the queen and was never seen again.

Item Description: Staff crafted with animal bones. A catalyst for sorceries and hexes. Properly trained sorcerers receive their first staff from their master after reaching a certain level of accomplishment. Those without proper training must devise something of their own making.
Story: The staff was crafted from animal bones, a catalyst for sorceries and hexes. Properly trained sorcerers receive their first staff from their master after reaching a certain level of accomplishment. Those without proper training must devise something of their own making.

Item Description: Giant wooden wheel encircled by spikes. Half-melded to a strange skeleton Can be used as a great shield only for the great gaps. But at least the spikes turn into weapons with a good spin. Strange indeed!
Story: The giant wooden wheel encircled by spikes is a strange and powerful artifact. Originally created as a great shield, the half-melded skeleton can be used as a deadly weapon with a good spin. The spikes on the wheel turn into deadly weapons when spun, making it a powerful and dangerous weapon.

Item Description: Tossing this into a Bonfire strengthens nearby foes. Once the Bonfire Ascetic is devoured by the flames, its effects can never be reversed. Be prepared before using this perilous ember. Fire exhibits a connection to the curse, and when the flames grow stronger, so does the curse.
Story: The Bonfire Ascetic is a dangerous item that can be used to strengthen nearby foes. Once it is consumed by the flames, its effects can never be reversed. Be careful before using this dangerous ember.

Item Description: The goddess of Sin, Velka, oversees this list of the guilty, who have disrespected the Gods or their covenants, and shall one day face the wrath of the Blades of the Darkmoon
Story: Velka's list of the guilty is a secret to all but the most trusted of her followers. These are the people who have disrespected the Gods or their covenants, and will one day face the wrath of the Blades of the Darkmoon.

Item Description: The goddess of Sin, Velka, oversees this list of the guilty, who have disrespected the Gods or their covenants, and shall one day face the wrath of the Blades of the Darkmoon
Story: Velka's list of the guilty is a secret to all but the most trusted of her followers. These are the people who have disrespected the Gods or their covenants, and will one day face the wrath of the Blades of the Darkmoon.

Item Description: A peculiar bottomless wooden box. Its origins are unknown. Some deride it as a symbol of unbridled avarice.Any number of items can be deposited into the box, and items can be managed while resting at a bonfire
Story: The villagers of a small, isolated village were always quick to point out the negative aspects of anyone who dared to venture too far from the safety of the village. One day, a stranger arrived in the village, and soon after, a strange wooden box began to be seen in the village square. The villagers began to gossip about the box, calling it a symbol of greed and avarice. One day, a villager decided to take the risk and deposit an item into the box.

Item Description: A peculiar bottomless wooden box. Its origins are unknown. Some deride it as a symbol of unbridled avarice.Any number of items can be deposited into the box, and items can be managed while resting at a bonfire
Story: The villagers of a small, isolated village were always quick to point out the negative aspects of anyone who dared to venture too far from the safety of the village. One day, a stranger arrived in the village, and soon after, a strange wooden box began to be seen in the village square. The villagers began to gossip about the box, calling it a symbol of greed and avarice. One day, a villager decided to take the risk and deposit an item into the box.

Item Description: An axe with an unusual design. Found in the Undead Purgatory. The chains and spikes wrapped around the axe cause bleeding, but weaken the axe's effectiveness when slashing. Accessories that are added to a weapon for the sole purpose of tormenting foes can often detract from the weapon's natural effectiveness.
Story: The axe was found in the Undead Purgatory, a place where the dead go after they die. The chains and spikes wrapped around the axe cause bleeding, but weaken the axe's effectiveness when slashing. However, the axe is still a deadly weapon.

Item Description: A bow created from the soul of Nashandra split into miniscule fragments, and spread across the land. Light and Dark are two sides of the same coin, much like the soul and the curse. The beings who presented themselves to those in search of kinghood were drawn to their awesome strength.
Story: The bow was created from the soul of Nashandra, a powerful demoness. The fragments of the bow spread across the land, and two groups of beings emerged: those who sought to become king, and those who sought to use the bow's power for evil.

Item Description: Knuckle ring worn by Rhoy the Explorer. Slows equipment degradation. Expensive, flashy gear will not always make life easier for you. Sometimes, you just need your tried-and-true equipment to last the long haul.
Story: Rhoy the Explorer was a famed explorer who traveled the world, seeking new knowledge. He was always careful with his gear, and wore a knuckle ring to protect his equipment from degradation. The ring slowed the degradation of his equipment, making it last longer.

Item Description: The scalp of a horrid Cleric Beast, indicating that hunter Brador, a Healing Church assassin, had killed a compatriot. Afterward, he wore his ally's own scalp, and hid himself away, deep below in a cell. The Church provided him with a single, soundless bell of death to ensure their secrets would be kept.
Story: Brador had killed a Cleric Beast, and wore its scalp as a trophy. He hid away, deep below in a cell, and used a single, soundless bell of death provided by the Church to ensure their secrets would be kept.

Item Description: A sacred braille tome from Carim, filled with advanced miracles. Give to a storyteller to learn advanced Carim miracles. In the Way of White, there is a tradition of placing great faith in the words of the blind, and braille tomes are not unusual.
Story: A braille tome from Carim, filled with advanced miracles. When given to a storyteller, they can learn advanced Carim miracles.

Item Description: Braille Divine Tome of Lothric
Story: The Braille Divine Tome of Lothric is a tome that is said to be the key to unlocking the mysteries of the Dark Souls universe. It is said to be written in Braille, and is said to be the only way to read it.

Item Description: Armor of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo. After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received this armor, which hides her hideous form and helps her hunt the guilty
Story: The Darkmoon Knightess is a fearsome Undead who has taken on the role of Fire Keeper of Anor Londo. After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received this armor, which hides her hideous form and helps her hunt the guilty.

Item Description: Armor of a knight once known as the Darkmoon. It is said that this brass armor hides something hideous within. Something about its silhouette suggests femininity.
Story: The armor of the knight known as the Darkmoon is said to hide something hideous within. It is said that the brass armor's silhouette suggests femininity, and that whoever wears it will be cursed.

Item Description: Battered iron armor from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar. The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty and typically indicate a sentence of death. They also cause this armor to deal damage when performing dodge rolls. Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.
Story: Elemer was a murderer who roamed the land, killing anyone who crossed his path. He was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter, because of the iron briars that grew on his armor. These briars were a sign of his guilt, as they indicated that he had committed a crime punishable by death. Whenever Elemer was attacked, the iron briars would cause his armor to deal damage to his attackers.

Item Description: Weapon made from an ordinary stone brick. Wielded by a laborer who lead a rebellion, and later become a champion himself. Even among other bludgeons of its size, this weapon is especially weighty. The strength of a giant is required to wield it.
Story: The weapon was once wielded by a laborer who led a rebellion against their oppressive government. After the rebellion was successful, the laborer became a champion himself and used the weapon to protect the people he had fought for. Even after years of being retired, the weapon retains its power and is still used by those who need it the most.

Item Description: Armor from a foreign land. Probably belonged to a brigand who met his match. In foreign lands, undead were banished to send a message to populace, and when the message was not heard, they banished the living, too.
Story: The armor is from a foreign land, most likely a place where brigands roam. When the armor was used to defeat a brigand, the brigand's fate was sealed. Now, the armor is a warning to any would-be criminals in that land. The living must be careful, for if they do not heed the warning, they may soon join the undead in exile.

Item Description: Mountains surround Drangleic on three sides. Most travelers who try to cross them end up hapless prey to the countless brigands lurking there. This armor may appear shoddy, but is in fact a very functional piece of work, its materials meticulously crafted together.
Story: The armor is made from the finest materials and is very functional. It was made by a craftsman who was very meticulous in their work. The brigands that live in Drangleic are always looking for new prey, so this armor is a very safe choice for anyone who wants to travel there.

Item Description: These paired daggers are the preferred weapons of the brigands of a distant land. When two-handed, the wielder holds a blade in each hand, allowing for divergent attacks that include left-handed moves.
Story: The brigands of a distant land rely on these paired daggers to take down their enemies. When two-handed, the daggers allow for divergent attacks that include left-handed moves. The brigands are known for their quick and deadly strikes, and these daggers are their favorite weapon.

Item Description: A tiny bug that produces light. Brightbugs are said to comfort the dead, and are found in the marshlands leading to the Undead Crypt. By ingesting a brightbug just before death, the moment at which they glow most brightly, one attains great power for a short time. Often utilized as a last-resort for adventurers who have lost their way. Has no effect in other worlds or for phantoms.
Story: The brightbug is a small, glowing bug that is said to comfort the dead. It is found in the marshlands leading to the Undead Crypt, and is often used as a last resort by adventurers who have lost their way. Although it has no effect on other worlds or for phantoms, it is said to be very helpful in guiding the deceased to the afterlife.

Item Description: The wide blade of this straight sword emphasizes slicing and has no thrust attack. The horizontal sweeping motion makes this sword effective against multiple enemies.
Story: The sword is called the 'Vengeance'. It is said that the sword was forged from the fangs of a dragon that was slain by a hero. The hero used the dragon's teeth to create the sword, and its sharpness is said to be unmatched.

Item Description: A straight sword with a broken blade. A weapon with no exceptional qualities. Only a mad Hollow would choose to fight with this.
Story: The straight sword with a broken blade lay abandoned on the battlefield, its once sharp edge now dull and broken. It was only fitting that this weapon be used by a mad Hollow, as it had no other exceptional qualities.

Item Description: Half of the blade of this straight sword is broken off. Only the completely Hollowed would even consider using this as a weapon.
Story: The sword is cursed and no one would dare to use it. A group of adventurers comes across the sword and decides to take it on as a challenge. They spend weeks trying to fix the sword but it's just too cursed. One day, while they're working on it, the sword breaks in half. The half with the broken off blade falls to the ground and the other half still intact remains in the hand of the adventurer.

Item Description: A broken straight sword. Handled as a dagger due to its length. This inexpensive sword is terribly worn, but nevertheless a favorite amongst thieves.
Story: The broken straight sword is a favorite amongst thieves due to its length. It is terribly worn, but nevertheless a favorite amongst those who seek to rob and plunder.

Item Description: A rotting wooden amulet with an unrecognizable figure engraved into it.
Story: The amulet is old and worn, with a figure engraved into it that is unrecognizable. The amulet is stained with dried blood, and the smell of rot fills the air around it. The amulet is cursed, and whoever wears it will slowly lose their mind.

Item Description: Very small round metal shield. Parry attacks with large center protrusion. Small shields are always less stable but landing critical hits after parry is easier. This shield is specialized for parrying.
Story: The small shield was designed to be used as a parry shield. It was made with a large center protrusion that made it easier to land critical hits after parry.

Item Description: Green flower-shaped weed with small white blooms. Large temporary boost to stamina recovery speed. Flowers of the Green Blossom are ethereal, blossoming only on the surface of chilled, but not frozen, water.
Story: The Green Blossom weed is a rare and magical flower that grants a temporary boost to stamina recovery speed. The flowers only grow on water that is chilled but not frozen.

Item Description: Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise. Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid
Story: The Great Horned Tragoth's helm was a prized possession for any knight looking to bolster their poise. The gold bull-goat motif on the helm was a sign of the Tragoth's esteem and was said to provide protection from all manner of danger. Countless Tarnished have relied on the Great Horned One's aid to survive in the Lands Between, and would be lost without his protection.

Item Description: Garb of the Madaras twins, denizens of the Forbidden Woods, likely belonging to the older of the two. Both the twins became hunters, and brought back and dissected their beast prey, in order to support the villagers in their forbidden research.
Story: The Garb of the Madaras twins is a ceremonial garment worn by the older of the two Madaras twins. The twins became hunters, and brought back and dissected their beast prey, in order to support the villagers in their forbidden research.

Item Description: Mask of the Madaras twins, denizens of the Forbidden Woods, likely belonging to the older of the two. The twins grew up in silent kinship with a poisonous snake. Eventually they learned human ways, and became hunters. When they discovered vermin even in their beloved snake, the younger brother is said to have murdered the older.
Story: The Mask of the Madaras twins is a fearsome artifact, likely belonging to the older of the two. The twins grew up in silent kinship with a poisonous snake. Eventually they learned human ways, and became hunters. When they discovered vermin even in their beloved snake, the younger brother is said to have murdered the older. The mask is said to have the power to transform the wearer into a snake, and the twins used it to hunt down their prey.

Item Description: An oddly large butcher's knife.Not your standard weapon, but certainly deadly enough to be utilized as one. Absorbs the HP of foes. who in their right mind would create such a thing? Perhaps it is best not to dwell on how it was likely used in the past.
Story: The butcher's knife was once used as a deadly weapon. It absorbed the HP of foes, leaving them vulnerable to further damage. It is unknown who created the knife, but it is best not to think about how it was likely used in the past.

Item Description: Huge carving knife made to cleanly butcher the human body. Signature weapon of the Ogress Anastasia, known to have eaten countless Tarnished while disguised as a Finger Maiden. Restores a very small amount of HP when it squarely strikes an enemy.
Story: The Ogress Anastasia was known for her gruesome appetite, and her signature weapon was a huge carving knife made to cleanly butcher the human body. Whenever she fought, she would disguise herself as a Finger Maiden, and her enemies would underestimate her because of it. However, when she struck them with her true form, her knife would restore a very small amount of HP to her enemies.

Item Description: Medium metal shield. Decorated by an ancient blue Caduceus. A standard widely-used shield
Story: The Caduceus is a symbol of healing and protection. It is said that the god Hermes created it from the wings of a butterfly. The shield is decorated with a blue Caduceus, a symbol of strength and protection.

Item Description: Round wooden shield crafted in Lordran. Decorated by an ancient blue Caduceus. The giant trees in Lordran are distant offspring of the great stone archtrees. This shield inherits their properites and the wood greatly reduces magic damage.
Story: The Caduceus is a symbol of healing and protection. It is said that the god Hermes created it from the wings of a dragon that had been slain by Apollo. The Caduceus has been used by many different cultures as a symbol of strength, wisdom, and healing. In the game, the Caduceus is a powerful shield that reduces magic damage.

Item Description: The weapon augments one's bare hands with thick, studded leather. The Caestus has a short reach, but quick cool down. Amount of damage inflicted is dependent on its wearer's strength.
Story: The Caestus is a powerful weapon that augments the user's bare hands with thick, studded leather. The weapon has a short reach, but has a quick cool down. The amount of damage inflicted is dependent on the user's strength.

Item Description: Silver armor worn by the royal guards who protect Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle. This paper-thin silver armor is said to deflect blood of ill-intent, and is what allows the royal guards to capture prey for their beloved Queen, so that one day, she may bear a Child of Blood.
Story: The armor is said to deflect blood of ill-intent, and is what allows the royal guards to capture prey for their beloved Queen. One day, a young girl wearing the armor will become the next Queen of the Vilebloods.

Item Description: Badge of the royal guards of Cainhurst, loyal guardians of the Vileblood Queen Annalise. The Vilebloods are hunters of blood, and hunt prey as they search for blood dregs. The hunter who joins them is faced with a decision: to merely borrow their strength, or to become one of them, heart and soul.
Story: The badge of the royal guards of Cainhurst is a symbol of their loyalty to the Vileblood Queen Annalise. It is said that the Vilebloods are hunters of blood, and that they hunt prey as they search for blood dregs. It is also said that the hunter who joins them is faced with a choice: to merely borrow their strength, or to become one of them, heart and soul.

Item Description: Silver helmet worn by the royal guards who protect Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle. This paper-thin silver armor is said to deflect blood of ill-intent, and is what allows the royal guards to capture prey for their beloved Queen, so that one day, she may bear a Child of Blood.
Story: The Silver Helmet is a sacred relic of the Vilebloods, and is worn by the royal guards who protect Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle. This paper-thin silver armor is said to deflect blood of ill-intent, and is what allows the royal guards to capture prey for their beloved Queen, so that one day, she may bear a Child of Blood.

Item Description: An old blood-stained summons, inviting an honored guest to the forsaken Castle Cainhurst. Rather bafflingly, it is addressed to you. Do not hesitate; the stagecoach leaves from Hemwick crossing.
Story: You had always thought Hemwick Crossing was a quaint little town, until you received a summons from the forsaken Castle Cainhurst. The stagecoach leaves from there, so you decide to go. When you arrive, you find that the castle is in shambles. However, you are able to find an old blood-stained summons and decide to go to the castle. When you get there, you find that the castle is haunted by the ghosts of the previous guests. You are

Item Description: An old blood-stained summons, inviting an honored guest to the forsaken Castle Cainhurst. Rather bafflingly, it is addressed to you. Do not hesitate; the stagecoach leaves from Hemwick crossing.
Story: You had always thought Hemwick Crossing was a quaint little town, until you received a summons from the forsaken Castle Cainhurst. The stagecoach leaves from there, so you can't ignore it. You have no idea what could be waiting for you, but you're not going to let anything stop you from finding out.

Item Description: Sacred chime blessed by Caitha, goddess of tears. Hex-dedicated catalyst. Cannot be used to cast miracles. Caitha, the goddess of tears, is known as a compassionate being that is with us in times of tragedy, but some believe that she is a demoness that guides us toward misfortune.
Story: The sacred chime was blessed by Caitha, goddess of tears. It was hex-dedicated to help catalyze miracles, but the chime could not be used to cast them. Some believed that Caitha was a demoness that guided people toward misfortune, but others believed that she was a compassionate goddess that was with us in times of tragedy.

Item Description: A ring enchanted by the orange eye of Kalameet, the bringer of calamity. Doubles damage received by its wearer. A useless ring befitting of no finger. Best left unknown, or at least well hidden.
Story: The ring was cursed by Kalameet, the bringer of calamity. The ring doubled the damage received by the wearer, making it useless for anyone but the most reckless of adventurers. However, the ring was best left unknown, or at least well hidden, as it was not meant for anyone's finger.

Item Description: A ring made from the orange eye of a calamitous dragon. Receive double damage. This ring has no useful powers, and is merely a symbol of dragon worship, a thing quietly passed down amongst its most fervent adherents, some of whom become convinced the task has been bestowed upon them as a sacred duty.
Story: The ring is passed down from one dragon worshipper to the next, each believing that they are the one destined to wear it and protect the others from harm. However, the ring has no real power and is only a symbol of the dragon worshippers' beliefs. One day, a young dragon worshipper named Sarah finds the ring and is convinced that it is meant for her. She becomes obsessed with wearing it and protecting her friends, even going so far as to try and kill her own

Item Description: Beloved sword of an aged knight whose last quest was long behind him, repurposed into a walking stick. The tip is rather worn. Though bent of back and without the brawn required even to raise the sword aloft, still he wished to meet his end with weapon in hand.
Story: The old knight had fought in many battles and killed many enemies, but his last quest was long behind him. He had retired from the battlefield and taken up a life of peace, but he could not rest until he had fulfilled his duty. One day, he found a broken sword in a ditch and decided to fix it up. He spent many hours polishing the blade and sharpening the tip, and when he was finished, he proudly carried the sword around with him. He was happy

Item Description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. Canvas talismans are austere items carried by heralds. Equip a talisman or a sacred chime to cast miracles. Miracles must be attuned at a bonfire before use.
Story: The Medium is a sacred item that is used to cast miracles. The talisman is carried by heralds and is used to cast miracles that must be attuned at a bonfire before use.

Item Description: Staff embedded with a blue glintstone. One of two types of Carian staff. Gifted to enchanted knights, it enhances Glintblade sorceries.
Story: The staff was a beautiful blue, and it had a faint blue glint to it. It was one of the two types of Carian staffs, the other being a green staff. The staff was gifted to enchanted knights, and it enhanced Glintblade sorceries.

Item Description: Staff embedded with a blue glintstone. One of two types of Carian staff. Given to sorcerers that they might enact the role of knight. Enhances Carian sword sorceries.
Story: The staff was embedded with a blue glintstone, one of the two types of Carian staff. It enhanced Carian sword sorceries. The sorcerers that received it were given the role of knights, and were tasked with enacting the role of protector.

Item Description: Armor of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.
