Story: The armor of the enchanted knights is a relic of a bygone era. Once they served the Carian royal family with distinction, but with the family's decline, the knights fell into disarray. Some claim that the armor is cursed, while others say that the enchantments within it are still potent. Whichever is true, the armor is a powerful symbol of the past and a reminder of what could have been.

Item Description: Straight sword embedded with a blue glintstone. Weapon of knights sworn to Carian royalty. These knights' swords could serve as catalysts, letting them wield sorcerous battle skills. Despite numbering fewer than twenty, this power made them a match for even the champions of gold in battle.
Story: The straight sword was embedded with a blue glintstone. It was a weapon of knights sworn to Carian royalty. The knights' swords could serve as catalysts, letting them wield sorcerous battle skills. Despite numbering fewer than twenty, this power made them a match for even the champions of gold in battle.

Item Description: Magic scepter of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. The glintstone is known as a Carian Blue, enhancing full moon sorceries. Only those of the highest intelligence may wield this, the finest of all glintstone staves.
Story: The Magic Scepter of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon is a powerful artifact that only the most intelligent beings can use. It is said that the glintstone within it enhances full moon sorcery to an incredible degree. Only those with the utmost intelligence can hope to wield this powerful weapon.

Item Description: Unusual helm bestowed upon knights of Carim.
Story: The Carim knights were known for their fierce fighting skills and their unique helms. This particular helm was said to give the wearer incredible strength and protection.

Item Description: Ring worn by warriors of the sand kingdom, Carthus. Boosts rolling invincibility, at the cost of defense. The sword technique of Carthus allows for fluid movement with a curved sword. Masters of the technique are said to dazzle their opponents by moving as weightlessly as a grain of sand. They live for their High Lord Wolnir, conqueror of most kingdoms known to their people.
Story: The Carthus warriors wear a ring that boosts their rolling invincibility, but at the cost of defense. This ring is a symbol of their power and their dedication to their High Lord Wolnir.

Item Description: Large curved sword wielded by swordsmen of Carthus. The lightest of the curved Greatsword. Crafted to cause bleeding.
Story: The Carthus swordsmen are known for their large curved swords. This sword is the lightest of the curved Greatswords, and is crafted to cause bleeding. It is said that the lightest of the curved Greatswords can slice through even the strongest of armor.

Item Description: .Curved sword of Carthus swordsmen. This weapon's thick, heavy blade is crafted to cause bleeding, and requires ample strength and dexterity to wield effectively, suggesting that the swordsmen of Carthus were amongst the mightiest.
Story: The Curved Sword of Carthus is a fearsome weapon that is known for its ability to cause bleeding. It is said that the swordsmen of Carthus were amongst the strongest and most skilled warriors in all of the land.

Item Description: Ring worn by the warriors of the sand kingdom, Carthus. Slightly boosts dexterity and obscures the wearer while rolling. The sword technique of Carthus allows for fluid movement with a curved sword. Masters of the technique are said to dazzle their opponents by moving as weightlessly as a grain of sand. They live for their High Lord Wolnir, conqueror of most kingdoms known to their people.
Story: The Carthus warriors are known for their fluid swordplay and their rings are said to boost dexterity and obscure the wearer while rolling. One day, a young Carthus warrior named Rokh took his ring to the arena to test its abilities. He quickly became a master of the sword technique and dazzled all who saw him. He lived for the High Lord Wolnir, the conqueror of most kingdoms known to his people.

Item Description: A pyromancy tome from Carthus containing pyromancies crafted for battle. Give to the old pyromancer to learn advanced pyromancies of the Great Swamp. Carthus pyromancies developed in isolation from other forms, explaining their divergent evolution.
Story: The old pyromancer in Carthus was always looking for ways to improve his pyromancy skills. He found a tome from the Great Swamp that contained advanced pyromancies that he could learn. The old pyromancer was excited to learn these new pyromancies and gave the tome to himself.

Item Description: Highly viscous scarlet plant secretions. Temporarily applies bleeding effect to Main-hand weapon. Associated with the warriors of Carthus, whose blades take on the scarlet hues of both this sanguine substance and the spatters of their victim's blood.
Story: The warriors of Carthus are known for their use of scarlet plant secretions on their blades in order to give them a bleeding effect. This substance is also said to be associated with the warriors, as their blades take on the scarlet hues of both this sanguine substance and the spatters of their victim's blood.

Item Description: Strangely curved sword crafted to cause bleeding, wielded by Carthus swordsmen. Shaped to sneak around the defenses of shields, this sword requires ample dexterity to wield effectively.
Story: The Carthus swordsmen are a proud and fierce group. They are known for their curved swords, which are designed to cause bleeding. These swords are incredibly difficult to use, requiring great dexterity.

Item Description: Ring granted to those bound by the Forest Hunter covenant. Answer Alvina's summoning. The white cat Alvina speaks a human tongue and has lived since the early Age of Fire. Alvina was a trusted friend of Knight Artorias and the Great Wolf Sif.
Story: Alvina is a white cat who was friends with Artorias and Sif. When the Great Wolf was killed, Alvina was heartbroken. She was able to speak human language and so she was able to summon Artorias when she needed help.

Item Description: Distinctively shaped armor worn by the Knights of Catarina. Outside of Catarina, it is often ridiculed for their onion-like shape, infuriating the proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for parrying
Story: The armor worn by the Knights of Catarina is distinctly shaped and often ridiculed for their onion-like shape. However, the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for parrying. The knights are proud of their armor and are often infuriated when outsiders mock it, but the armor is still a vital part of their defense.

Item Description: This armor appears rather absurd, but its multi-faced construction is in fact quite practical as it effectively deflects physical attacks. The old tales speak of brave Catarina knight wearing this armor as they rushed courageously into battle
Story: The armor is actually quite practical, as it deflects physical attacks. However, the old tales speak of a brave Catarina knight who wore this armor into battle. They say that the armor protected them from harm and helped them to rush courageously into battle.

Item Description: Massive iron armor worn by knights serving the Cathedral of the Deep. Repulsive creatures of the deep are sure to attract the foolish, but the cathedral knights are prepared to meet such intruders head on with their more than ample might.
Story: The armor is so large and heavy that it takes two people to carry it. It is so large that it covers the entire body and is so heavy that it is impossible for anyone to move without help. The armor is so large and heavy that it is impossible for anyone to move without help. The armor is so large and heavy that it is impossible for anyone to move without help.

Item Description: Ultra greatsword wielded by the knights of the Cathedral of the Deep. Highly destructive if intolerably heavy. Its blade is flattened for use as a strike weapon, but the point at the end allows for thrustin
Story: The Cathedral of the Deep was a place of worship for the dark gods. The knights who guarded the cathedral were some of the most skilled and deadly warriors in the land. One day, a new god was born and the cathedral was attacked. The knights fought bravely, but they were outnumbered and outmatched. In the end, the new god destroyed the cathedral and the knights with it.

Item Description: Cleaver decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village. Crafted from human bone. Grants trace amounts of runes upon landing attacks.
Story: The Cleaver is a ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village. Crafted from human bone, it grants trace amounts of runes upon landing attacks.

Item Description: Rake decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village. Crafted from human bone. Grants trace amounts of runes upon landing attacks.
Story: The windmill village celebrates the annual Dominula festival with a series of dances and ceremonies. One of the ceremonial tools used during the festivities is the rake, which is decorated with colorful fabrics. When used in combat, the rake grants the user a small amount of runes upon landing an attack.

Item Description: Sickle decorated with flowers and many-coloured fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula. Its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard. Crafted from human bone. Grants trace amounts of runes on landing attacks.
Story: The sickle is a ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula. It is said that its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard, granting the user a chance to land a deadly strike.

Item Description: Large bludgeon ecorated with flowers and many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village. The striking end is a skull too large in size to be human. Grants trace amounts of runes on landing attacks.
Story: The large bludgeon is a ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village. The striking end is a skull too large in size to be human. Grants trace amounts of runes on landing attacks.

Item Description: A celestial dial that functions with the giant astral clock in the Grand Cathedral. When the dial is held up towards the Astral Clock, the clock will come to life and reveal a secret to its curious interloper
Story: The celestial dial is a mystical artifact that was used to activate the giant astral clock in the Grand Cathedral. When held up towards the clock, the user would be able to see a secret message that was only meant for them.

Item Description: A celestial dial that functions with the giant astral clock in the Grand Cathedral. When the dial is held up towards the Astral Clock, the clock will come to life and reveal a secret to its curious interloper
Story: The celestial dial is a mystical artifact that was used to activate the giant astral clock in the Grand Cathedral. When held up towards the clock, the user would be able to see a secret message that was only meant for them.

Item Description: Chainmail armor of thin interlinking rings of steel. It is common throughout the human world since it can be easily produced, is not too heavy, and offers good defense. Knights may favor flashy armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, anything is fine as long as it keeps them alive. One of the more common kinds of protective gear
Story: The chainmail armor is common throughout the human world. It is not too heavy and offers good defense. Knights may favor flashy armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, anything is fine as long as it keeps them alive. One day, a warrior finds a suit of chainmail that is unlike any other. The armor is thin interlinking rings of steel, and it is very flashy. The warrior decides to wear the armor, and it gives him an advantage on the battlefield.

Item Description: Chainmail armor of thin interlinking rings of steel. Popular due to its ease of crafting, respectable damage absorption, and light weight. Knights may favor imposing armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, that which keeps them alive is armor enough.
Story: The chainmail armor was popular for a reason. It was easy to craft, respectable in terms of damage absorption, and light weight. It was perfect for warriors on the battlefield.

Item Description: Armor made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.
Story: The armor was made of woven chain, and was standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, it offered dependable protection. The armor was heavy, but it was worth it to be safe.

Item Description: Padded cloth armor with a chainmail shawl draped over the shoulders. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.
Story: The chainmail shawl was a symbol of rank and privilege. It was given to foot soldiers who had proven themselves in battle. The padded cloth armor was a necessary precaution against injury.

Item Description: A spiked iron tube attached by a chain wielded by Mad Pumpkin Heads. Especially large for a flail, wielding it requires more strength than it does dexterity.
Story: The Mad Pumpkin Heads are a tribe of pumpkin headed people that live in the dark, spooky forests near the edge of the world. They are a fierce and warlike people, and their flail is their most prized possession. It is especially large and spiked, and requires more strength than dexterity to wield.

Item Description: Pauldron reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.
Story: The pauldron is a sign of bravery and strength in the badlands. It is reserved for the bravest warriors and is a reminder to them that they have slain countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain, the brave warriors of the badlands shun any excess adornment.

Item Description: Trident of the Six-eyed Channelers sorcerers who serve Seath the Scaleless in collecting human specimens. Thrusted in circular motions in a unique martial arts dance that stirs nearby allies into a bloodthirsty frenzy.
Story: The Trident of the Six-eyed Channelers is a mystical artifact wielded by sorcerers who serve Seath the Scaleless. The weapon is a circular trident that is used in a unique martial arts dance that stirs nearby allies into a bloodthirsty frenzy.

Item Description: A curved sword born from the soul of Quelaag, daughter of the Witch of Izalith, who was transformed into a chaos demon. This blade inherits only the chaotic nature of Quelaag, and has a unique speckled design. Blade wielder erodes along with opponents.
Story: Quelaag's curved sword is said to be the product of her daughter's soul, and as such, it is imbued with the chaotic nature of the Witch of Izalith. This sword is said to be able to corrode and destroy anything it touches, as the wielder themselves will eventually decay.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Relics of land scorched by the Chaos Flame. Used in infusion to create chaos weapons. Chaos weapons inflict fire damage, and scale with intelligence and faith. Handled only by blacksmiths knowledgeable in ancient.
Story: The gem is a relic of a land that was scorched by the Chaos Flame. It is used in infusion to create chaos weapons. Chaos weapons inflict fire damage, and scale with intelligence and faith. Only blacksmiths who are knowledgeable in ancient can handle these weapons.

Item Description: Rapier of darkness and chaos. Navlaan claims to have sealed himself away to prevent tragedy, but could a sorcery truly possess a will of its own? Truth can be elusive, and the tales surrounding him are questionable. Only, it is clear a strange power possess this sword. Nebulous, inky and serene, the Dark hold an allure matched only by the fear it strikes in men's hearts. Could it be nature, holding a mirror to mankind?
Story: A rapier forged from the darkest of metals, with a will of its own. It is said that the Navlaan, a sorcerer of great power, sealed himself away to prevent tragedy. However, it is clear that a strange power now resides within the rapier. Whether it is nature, holding a mirror to mankind, or something else entirely, the Dark hold an allure that is hard to resist.

Item Description: Robe worn by a chaos sorcerer. The man claims to have sealed himself away, but who's ever heard of sentient magic? It is no doubt difficult to judge the veracity of the man's words, but this hood certainly seems to possess an unusual power. He calls himself Navlaan, now.
Story: A robe worn by a chaos sorcerer. The man claims to have sealed himself away, but who's ever heard of sentient magic? The robe seems to have an unusual power, and the man who wears it claims to have sealed himself away.

Item Description: Black charcoal-like pine resin. Applies fire to Main-hand weapon. Affected weapon inflicts fire damage for a short time. Particularly effective against corporeal creatures and Undead who have an instinctual fear of fire.
Story: The black charcoal-like resin was a powerful tool that could ignite the flames of a weapon, causing fire damage to enemies. It was especially effective against corporeal creatures and Undead who had an instinctual fear of fire.

Item Description: Lance forged from the soul of the Executioner's Chariot. Its cross-shaped blade causes bleeding. The perverse design of this spear mirrors the chariot from which it came, a merciless creation that endlessly tortured the Undead.
Story: Lance forged from the soul of the Executioner's Chariot. It's blade causes bleeding, and its design is reminiscent of the chariot from which it came, a merciless creation that endlessly tortured the Undead.

Item Description: One of the staple articles of hunter attire, fashioned at the workshop. A product of the scourge of the beast that once plagued Old Yharnam and culminated in the town's fiery cleansing. The cape's dampness makes it highly resistant to fire. Wearers of this attire hunted down Victims of the scourge who survived the raging flames and stench of singed blood.
Story: The cape is a staple article of hunter attire, fashioned at the workshop. It is made of a material that is highly resistant to fire, and was worn by hunters who hunted down Victims of the scourge who survived the raging flames and stench of singed blood.

Item Description: A charred greatsword of the Knights of Loyce, its blade burned black by the flame. These Knights of Loyce lacked all sense of self, and were driven only by the urge to expunge any who might disturb the flame, even former compatriots
Story: The Knights of Loyce were a group of knights who were driven by the urge to expunge any who might disturb the flame of their god. They were known for their fanaticism and their blackened swords.

Item Description: Black leather long coat hat worn by Marvellous Chester, a man of mystery lost in the past. This exquisitely sewn aristocratic suit allows its wearer to move in silence, lending well to stealth
Story: Chester was a man of mystery, and his coat was a symbol of his power and status. He would often move in silence, and his coat allowed him to move stealthily.

Item Description: Foreign-made weapon wielded by the royal guards who protect Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle. When the intricate, rippled engraving that spans the Chikage's blade is imbrued with blood, the sword sings in scarlet hues. However, the rite eats away at the wielder's very essence.
Story: The Chikage is a foreign-made weapon that is wielded by the royal guards who protect Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle. When the intricate, rippled engraving that spans the Chikage's blade is imbrued with blood, the sword sings in scarlet hues. However, the rite eats away at the wielder's very essence.

Item Description: One of the bite rings native to Carim. Increases frost resistance. This ring would never grace Friede's hand, for the painting and its frost became her home.
Story: Friede is a painter who has found refuge in the cold, painting the frozen landscapes of Carim. One day, a bite ring arrives in her mail, with a note from a friend in the city. The ring promises to increase her frost resistance, so she can continue to paint. Friede puts on the ring and finds that it not only works as advertised, but also gives her an icy power that she can use to freeze her enemies. She revels in her newfound strength and uses it

Item Description: Sacred chime forged from the soul of Nadalia, Bride of Ash. Nothing appears sacred about the frightful design of this chime, but it does have the benefit of raising one's faith. The oozing, frozen iron forming the bell seems to anticipate a scream.
Story: The Sacred Chime was forged from the soul of Nadalia, Bride of Ash. Nadalia was a beautiful and pious woman who was tragically killed by a dragon. Her soul was taken and used to create the Sacred Chime. The chime has the ability to raise one's faith, as the design of the bell seems to anticipate a scream.

Item Description: Blacksteel katana wielded by Alonne Knights.One of the sturdiest types of katana, preferred by masters of the quick-draw. In the heyday of his land, the Old Iron King fancied entertaining dubious and eccentric guests from faraway lands. Most of them were charlatans, but among the riff-raff was an unusual knight from the far east. He trained the Iron King's men in the sword, in obeisance to his new lord.
Story: The Blacksteel katana was wielded by Alonne Knights, who were masters of the quick-draw. The katana was one of the sturdiest types of katana, preferred by masters of the quick-draw. In the heyday of his land, the Old Iron King entertained dubious and eccentric guests from faraway lands. Most of them were charlatans, but among the riff-raff was an unusual knight from the far east. He trained the Iron King's men

Item Description: The ring is named for its decorative green blossom, but its luster is long since faded. Raises stamina recovery speed.
Story: The ring is a beautiful ring with a green blossom on it. It is said that the ring's luster is long since faded, but it still has the ability to speed up stamina recovery.

Item Description: This old ring is named for its decorative green blossom, but its luster is long since faded. Raises stamina recovery speed.
Story: The ring is old and worn, but the green blossom on its band is still brightly visible. It is said that whoever wears this ring will have their stamina recovered much faster than usual.

Item Description: Special hunter tool of the Choir, high-ranking members of the church. Fashioned after a bell that projects an arcane sound across planes of existence The sound of this smaller, silver version of the bell does not cross planes, but grants vigor and healing to all cooperators.
Story: The Choir's special hunter tool is a silver bell that projects an arcane sound across planes of existence. This smaller, silver bell does not cross planes, but grants vigor and healing to all cooperators.

Item Description: Special hunter tool of the Choir, high-ranking members of the church. Fashioned after a bell that projects an arcane sound across planes of existence The sound of this smaller, silver version of the bell does not cross planes, but grants vigor and healing to all cooperators.
Story: The Choir's special hunter tool is a silver bell that projects an arcane sound across planes of existence. This small, silver bell grants vigor and healing to all cooperators.

Item Description: Attire of the Choir, high-ranking members of the Healing Church. Members of the Choir are both the highest-ranking clerics of the Healing Church, and scholars who continue the work that began at Byrgenwerth. Together with the left behind Great One, they look to the skies, in search of astral signs, that may lead them to the rediscovery of true greatness.
Story: The Choir is a group of clerics who are tasked with looking for signs from the heavens that may lead to the rediscovery of greatness. They are high-ranking members of the Healing Church and are also scholars who continue the work that began at Byrgenwerth.

Item Description: This special throwing blade has a flat tip, and is wielded by guardians of the Church of Filianore. Consume FP to project illusory blades which seek their targets. Guardians of the Church, of whom few remain, watch over Princess Filianore's eternal slumber along with the Spears of the Church.
Story: The throwing blade is a special weapon used by the guardians of the Church of Filianore. When used, the blade projects illusory blades which seek out their targets. Few remain of the guardians, and they watch over Princess Filianore's eternal slumber.

Item Description: One of the old trick weapons of the Healing Church, a hunting weapon formed from one of the giant picks that appear in old beast tales. The Church Pick initially serves as a large sword, but when transformed functions as an extended war pick. In spite of its origins, it is a highly practical weapon.
Story: The Healing Church had a long and bloody history. They were the only ones who could heal the sick and wounded. But they were also the only ones who could kill the monsters that threatened the people. So the Church created a weapon that could do both. The Church Pick was a giant sword that could transform into an extended war pick. It was a highly practical weapon that could kill any monster.

Item Description: Short sword given to high ranking clergymen of Farum Azula. Raises potency of bestial incantations. The design celebrates a beast's five fingers, symbolic of the intelligence once granted upon their kind.
Story: The high ranking clergymen of Farum Azula were given a short sword that raised the potency of bestial incantations. The design on the sword celebrates a beast's five fingers, symbolic of the intelligence once granted upon their kind.

Item Description: One of the weapons originating from the Two Fingers. A formless sequence of ciphers comprise its blade, and as such no shield can repel it. Deals holy damage. The furtive inscription appears to hang in the air; the language of light spoken by the Two Fingers.
Story: The Two Fingers is a legendary weapon that originated from the world of the gods. It is a formless sequence of ciphers that deals holy damage. No shield can repel it.

Item Description: A Caryll rune that transcribes inhuman sounds. The Clawmark is an impulse to seek the warmth of blood like a beast. It strengthens visceral attacks, one of the darker hunter techniques. Although the difference is subtle, Runesmith Caryll describes the Beast as a horrific and unwelcome instinct deep within the hearts of men, while Clawmark is an alluring invitation to accept this very nature.
Story: The Caryll rune that transcribes inhuman sounds is a dark and dangerous tool that can be used to strengthen visceral attacks. The Clawmark rune is an alluring invitation to accept this very nature, strengthening the instinct to seek blood like a beast. These two runes are opposites in terms of their effects, but they both have the potential to be very dangerous if used incorrectly.

Item Description: A sacred seal given by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman. A rare trinket which allows incantations to be scaled with strength. The claw mark represents Gurranq's wrath. Enhances bestial incantations learned from Gurranq.
Story: The Claw of Gurranq was a sacred seal given to a Clergyman by the Beast Gurranq. The Claw allowed incantations to be scaled with strength, and the claw mark represented Gurranq's wrath.

Item Description: A weapon formed by three sharped claws. Attacks cause bleeding, and the wounds inflicted are not easily mended. Preferred weapon of the spooks of an Eastern land.
Story: The claws of the weapon are sharp and deadly. They cause bleeding when they hit their target, and the wounds inflicted are not easily mended. This is the preferred weapon of the spooks of an Eastern land, who use it to inflict fear and terror in their enemies.

Item Description: Harpoon with a tip made from a sharpened meteorite shard. Wielded by the claymen who infest dynastic remains. The blade emits a faint light and deals magic damage.
Story: The Harpoon is a unique weapon that was created by the Claymen who infest dynastic remains. The blade emits a faint light and deals magic damage.

Item Description: .A very large greatsword. Very heavy, and designed for use with both hands. Allows for broad attacks that are effective against multiple foes. Requires great strength and experience to handle effectively.
Story: The greatsword was once wielded by a great hero who fought tirelessly against evil. Now, the sword is yours to use and protect the innocent. It is a powerful weapon, but it requires great strength and experience to use it effectively. With this sword by your side, you can take on any foe.

Item Description: Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.
Story: The Armor of the Cleanrot Knights is celebrated for its undefeated campaign in the Shattering. These knights swore to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

Item Description: Piercing sword of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Mainly used as a backup weapon, in combination with a long- handled armament.
Story: The Piercing Sword of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia was a backup weapon, in combination with a long-handled armament. It was mainly used as a last resort, as its sharpness was not as effective as other weapons. However, it was still a formidable weapon, and was known for its ability to pierce through armour.

Item Description: Spear of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella. The winged golden blade deals holy damage. The diminutive shield is blessed with an incantation that wards off rot.
Story: The Spear of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella. is a finely crafted golden weapon that deals holy damage. The diminutive shield is blessed with an incantation that wards off rot.

Item Description: The steel greatshield used by Knight Artorias who succumbed to the Abyss. Artorias deeply scarred by the Abyss used this to form a barrier to protect his compatriot Sif. Although this drained the shield its magic defense remains high
Story: The steel greatshield used by Knight Artorias who succumbed to the Abyss. Artorias deeply scarred by the Abyss used this to form a barrier to protect his compatriot Sif. Although this drained the shield its magic defense remains high.

Item Description: A ring that belonged to Fiorenza, the only truly moneyed merchant in Volgen. Shortens spell casting time. Fiorenza used his riches to buy up trinkets of luxury and rare collectibles, but was ruined after years of excessive debauchery.
Story: Fiorenza's ring was said to have shortened spell casting time by a significant margin. This allowed him to cast spells more quickly and with less effort, but it also led to his ruin.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. This transcription of the Great Ones' inhuman voices depicts downreaching currents. This rune means Deep Sea, and grants augmented resistance. Great volumes of water serve as a bulwark guarding sleep, and an augur of the eldritch Truth. Overcome this hindrance, and seek what is yours
Story: Caryll left this rune for those who seek to understand the Great Ones and their secrets. The rune is said to grant resistance to water currents, and protect those who sleep. Those who can decipher the rune's meaning may find answers to the mysteries of the Great Ones.

Item Description: Armor worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle. It is rather substantial in size and weight, making its wearer look even bigger than he actually is
Story: The armor worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White is renowned for its unyielding quality in battle. It is a rather substantial piece of armor, making the wearer look even bigger than he actually is. The armor is made from the finest materials and is very difficult to break, even for the most powerful of enemies.

Item Description: Garb worn by a cleric turned undead. Unmistakable vibrant blue robes. It is said that the blue-robed travelers were entrusted with a duty. They bore large covers on their backs to ensure that they would not become seedbeds for spreading darkness.
Story: The cleric's robes were once vibrant and alive with color. Now, they are a sickly blue, stained with dried blood and rot. The cloth is heavy and it hangs off of the undead's frame like a shroud. The cleric's eyes are cold and empty, and there is a hunger in their gaze that makes the other travelers shudder.

Item Description: Candle stick used as both sword and catalyst. Used for worship by the Deacons of the Deep. The deacons, under the guidance of Archdeacon McDonnell, became both Clergymen and sorcerers.
Story: The candle stick was once used as both a sword and a catalyst for worship by the Deacons of the Deep. Now, it is a sacred relic used by Clergymen and Sorcerers alike.

Item Description: Most clerics receive this as their first sacred chime. A catalyst for miracles and hexes. To use miracles, equip a sacred chime and attune a miracle at a bonfire. The strength of most miracles is affected by the caster's faith.
Story: The sacred chime is a key component in the cleric's arsenal. It is a catalyst for miracles and hexes, and can be used to attune a miracle at a bonfire. The strength of most miracles is affected by the caster's faith.

Item Description: Horrific weapon made of a hardened skeletal arm. Wielded by Ensha of the Royal Remains. Fitted by placing one's hands into the fists' grips until they dig in. O clinging creature. A king relinquishes not the hand.
Story: The Ensha of the Royal Remains was known for her horrific weapon, a hardened skeletal arm that she wielded with ease. Rumors circulated that she had fitted the weapon herself, using her hands to grip the fists until they dug in. No one knew for sure, but it was said that a clinging creature would never be able to wrest the arm from her grasp.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. The twisted cross means metamorphosis. Rotated clockwise, this rune boosts HP. The discovery of blood made their dream of evolution a reality. Metamorphosis, and the excesses and deviation that followed, were only the beginning.
Story: Caryll left her rune-covered secret symbol behind in Byrgenwerth, a place where she spent her days crafting runes that could change people into beasts. When she bled out after making a particularly potent rune, her friends realized that her dream of human evolution was only the beginning. With Caryll's blood, they could finally achieve their own monstrous form.

Item Description: This ancient ring, engraved with a large green flower, is of unknown origin. Hastens the regeneration of stamina.
Story: The ring is said to have originated from a faraway land, and is said to have the ability to hasten the regeneration of stamina. It is unknown how true this claim is, but regardless, the ring is coveted by many due to its purported healing properties.

Item Description: A simple wooden club. This simple bladeless strike weapon is effective against most foes is easily handled and can break the guard of a shield.However a single miss makes one wide open so timing and proximities are crucial
Story: The simple wooden club is a common weapon found in many fantasy stories. It is easy to handle and can break the guard of a shield, making it an effective weapon against most foes. However, a single miss can leave the user wide open, so timing and proximities are crucial.

Item Description: Hidden sword once granted to the Tarnished of the Roundtable by the Two Fingers. A formless cipher comprises its blade, which deals holy damage no shield can repel. Champions would gather at the Roundtable Hold in days long past, when the Two Fingers were masters of oration, their flesh yet full of vigor.
Story: The Hidden Sword is a legendary weapon that was once granted to the Tarnished of the Roundtable. The sword is made up of a formless cipher and is said to deal holy damage that no shield can resist. The sword was once used by champions at the Roundtable Hold in days long past, when the Two Fingers were masters of oration.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. Blood gems are especially rare blood stones that grow on coldblood. Blood gems are kneaded into weapons using workshop tools, but only when of matching shape. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks.
Story: The blood gem was a rare and powerful blood stone that grew on coldblood. It was said that only when of matching shape could a blood gem be kneaded into a weapon, and that most radial blood gems had effects that related to physical attacks.

Item Description: Droplet of coldblood containing Blood Echoes. Use to gain Blood Echoes. Hunters sustained by the dream gain strength from Blood Echoes. They imbibe the blood with thoughts of reverence, indeed gratitude, for their victims.
Story: The hunters of the night were always on the lookout for Blood Echoes. These droplets of coldblood contained the essences of the slain, and by drinking them hunters could gain strength and power. The blood was imbibed with thoughts of reverence and gratitude for the victims, and this in turn gave the hunters a sense of invincibility and purpose.

Item Description: Material used in a Holy Chalice ritual. Pale vegetation that commonly grows on coldblood in a place long abandoned, said to mature slowly in close proximity to death, and eventually bloom.
Story: The chalice was made of pale vegetation that grew on coldblood. It was said to mature slowly in close proximity to death, and eventually bloom. The chalice was used in a Holy Chalice ritual.

Item Description: Material used in a Holy Chalice ritual. Pale vegetation that commonly grows on coldblood in a place long ago abandoned.
Story: The Chalice of Blood is a ceremonial item used in Holy Chalice rituals. It is made of pale vegetation that commonly grows on coldblood in a place long ago abandoned. The Chalice is said to have the power to heal wounds and bring peace to the soul.

Item Description: A beaten red battle standard is furled around this time-worn halberd. Even after his lord was fled, Commander O'Neil continued to brandish this flag in the devastation of the rot-eaten field of battle, the sole veteran who remembers this battle with pride.
Story: Commander O'Neil, a veteran of a forgotten battle, continues to brandish his flag even after his lord was fled. He is the only living witness to the battle, and he holds onto his memories with pride.

Item Description: A spotted fruit. Temporarily boosts poison resist. This common fruit has no taste, but when facing a true test of mettle, its benefits could make the difference between life and death.
Story: The spotted fruit was a common fruit that had no taste, but when facing a true test of mettle, its benefits could make the difference between life and death. One day, a young man was about to take on a difficult challenge when he found a spotted fruit and ate it. The fruit gave him a temporary boost in poison resist, which allowed him to complete the challenge.

Item Description: Garb with a thick embroidered cape attached. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.
Story: The cape was made of a thick, embroidered fabric, and it was attached to a long, flowing dress. The dress had a hem that came down to just below the knee, and it was decorated with intricate, flowing designs. The board that was attached to the neck of the dress depicted a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This was a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increased faith.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. Several runes relate to blood, including Communion, which raises the maximum number of blood vials one may carry. This rune represents the Healing Church and its ministers. Blood ministration is, of course, the pursuit of communion.
Story: Caryll left this rune to remind her followers of the importance of blood ministration.

Item Description: A bow crafted from various materials. Inflicts more damage than ordinary bows, but has a shorter range, making it unfit for sniping.
Story: The bow was made from a variety of different materials, each with their own unique properties. The bow's damage was greater than an ordinary bow, but its range was shorter, making it unsuitable for sniping.

Item Description: Black hood for blending in with the darkness. Worn by church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.
Story: The black hood was a necessary tool for the church confessors. It helped them blend in with the darkness, and it was worn by those who were loyal to the teachings of the Two Fingers. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, sent out confessors to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors were loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Item Description: Attire of traveling conjurators. Conjurators were the predecessors to pyromancers, and spent their lives roaming the lands. No wonder their attire was designed to protect them from fire, poison, and other threats of nature.
Story: Conjurators were the predecessors to pyromancers, and spent their lives roaming the lands. No wonder their attire was designed to protect them from fire, poison, and other threats of nature. One day, a conjurator named Garen was out exploring a new land. He came across a group of bandits who were attacking a village. Garen used his magic to create a firestorm that destroyed the bandits and saved the village.

Item Description: Mask worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor, in the image of a foreign queen. Increase dexterity. Long ago, when Rykard first set eyes on Tanith, she was working as a dancer in a foreign land. Soon, he made her his consort. She was the only human to remain by his side when he became the serpent of blasphemy. In that moment, Tanith was truly charmed by him.
Story: Tanith is a Lady of the Volcano Manor, and wears a mask in the image of a foreign queen. She is skilled in dexterity, and long ago, when Rykard first set eyes on her, she was working as a dancer in a foreign land. Soon, he made her his consort. She was the only human to remain by his side when he became the serpent of blasphemy. In that moment, Tanith was truly charmed by him.

Item Description: Once upon a time a troupe of foreign constables chased a beast all the way to Yahrnam, and this is what they wore. The constables became victims of the beast, except for one survivor, who in turn devoured the creature whole, all by himself. The fable is a favorite among Yahrnamites, who are partial to any stories of pompous, intolerant foreigners, who suffer for their ignorance. It makes the blood taste that much sweeter.
Story: The constables were chasing a beast all the way to Yahrnam. They were all devoured by the beast, except for one survivor. The survivor ate the beast whole, and it made his blood taste that much sweeter.

Item Description: Coin made of copper. Its face shows an image of Old Man McLoyf, god of medicine and drink. Even coins of great value in the world of men have little value in Lordran, where the accepted currency is souls. Those who dream of returning to the outside world are fond of carrying these around
Story: In Lordran, the currency is souls. Coins of any value are rare and valuable, as there is no equivalent in the world of men. One day, a coin made of copper was found in Lordran. The face on the coin showed the image of Old Man McLoyf, the god of medicine and drink. The coin had no value in Lordran, where the accepted currency was souls, but to those who dreamed of returning to the outside world, it was a prized possession

Item Description: Coin made of copper. Its face shows an image of Old Man McLoyf, god of medicine and drink. Even coins of great value in the world of men have little value in Lordran, where the accepted currency is souls. Those who dream of returning to the outside world are fond of carrying these around
Story: In Lordran, the currency is souls. Coins of any value are rare and valuable, as there is no equivalent in the world of men. One day, a coin made of copper was found in Lordran. The face on the coin showed the image of Old Man McLoyf, the god of medicine and drink. Even though it had little value in Lordran, those who dreamed of returning to the outside world found it comforting to carry around.

Item Description: Attire of pyromancers of the Great Swamp, particularly favored by old sages. . Attire of Cornyx, pyromancer of the Great Swamp. In the Great Swamp, it was customary to adorn oneself with articles of nature. He favored the use of raven feathers. Ravens are said to have once been Firelink messengers, guiding the undead to the land of ancient gods. The bronze ornamentation serves to ward off evil spirits. The long skirt emulates those worn by witches, who were the forebearers of pyromancy.
Story: Cornyx is a pyromancer of the Great Swamp, and he favors the use of nature-themed clothing. He wears a long skirt that resembles the clothing worn by witches, and he wears bronze ornamentation to ward off evil spirits.

Item Description: Urn filled with secretions of giant corrosive ants. Powerful acid inflicts damage on equipment. Giant anthills created by corrosive ants line the horizon of the desert land of Jugo Ant larvae are considered a delicacy, but he who enters an anthill uninvited will have their flesh melted to the bone.
Story: The Jugo desert is home to giant anthills created by corrosive ants. The ants are powerful and their acid can inflict damage on equipment. Anyone who ventures into an anthill uninvited will have their flesh melted to the bone.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. Several runes contain a nuance of Blood, including the rune of Corruption, associated with the oath of the corrupt. Pledgers to this oath are Cainhurst Vilebloods, hunters of blood who find dregs for their Queen in coldblood, particularly in that of hunters. Yet the corrupt are heretics in the eyes of the Church, and thus subject to the wrath of the Executioners
Story: The runes on the staff were old and worn, but the symbol they bore was new and strange. It was a rune of Corruption, one of the most feared symbols in all of Bloodborne. The runes were carved into the wood in a way that made it seem as if they were drinking in the blood of the world. The staff belonged to Caryll, the runesmith of Byrgenwerth. Caryll had been killed by the hunters of Cainhurst, the vile

Item Description: Dagger of the unwanted, those guided by heretical storytellers. A rather large dagger with a powerful attack, but this transparent attempt to intimidate foes reveals much about its owner's fears.
Story: The dagger was once wielded by someone who was not happy with their life. They were filled with anger and resentment, and they lashed out at anyone and everything. The dagger was their way of punishing the world for not being fair to them. Unfortunately, the dagger's power also attracted the unwanted attention of those who wanted to use it for their own gain. Now, the dagger is cursed and it only brings harm to those who try to use it.

Item Description: Badge of a member of the Choir, elites of the Healing Church. The eye signifies the very cosmos. The Choir stumbled upon an epiphany, very suddenly and quite by accident. Here we stand, feet planted in the earth, but might the cosmos be very near us, only just above our heads?
Story: The Choir was a group of elites within the Healing Church. They were responsible for healing the injured and sick, and they had an epiphany that the cosmos was very near them. They decided to stand on their feet and look up, and they saw the stars.

Item Description: Armor worn by court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital. The tall, dark headpiece and formal gold stitching suggests they may have also been oracles. There are many sorcerers who claim to heirship to the great sage Big Hat Logan, and the Profaned Capital houses on of two leading schools.
Story: The armor worn by the court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital is a tall, dark headpiece and formal gold stitching that suggests they may have also been oracles. The armor is a sign of their power and status in the city, and many sorcerers claim to be heirs to the great sage Big Hat Logan. The Profaned Capital houses one of the leading schools of sorcery, and the court sorcerers are the protectors of the city.

Item Description: Catalyst used by the court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital. Very powerful when wielded by an exceptionally intelligent sorcerer. The court sorcerers laid claim to the legacy of the renowned Big Hat Logan, going so far as to emulate him with copies of the staff he used.
Story: The court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital prized the Catalyst very highly. It was said that when wielded by an exceptionally intelligent sorcerer, the Catalyst could be incredibly powerful. Unfortunately, the Catalyst was also very rare, and as such, it was often passed down from one sorcerer to another.

Item Description: This ring symbolizes Knight Artorias's covenant with the beasts of the Abyss. Its wearer, like Artorias himself can traverse the Abyss.
Story: The ring is a sign of Artorias's covenant with the beasts of the Abyss. It allows its wearer to traverse the Abyss, just as Artorias himself could.

Item Description: The serpent is an imperfect dragon and symbol of the Undead. Its habit of devouring prey even larger than itself has led to an association of gluttony. This gold ring, engraved with the serpent, boosts its wearer's item discovery, so that more items can be amassed.
Story: The serpent is an imperfect dragon and symbol of the Undead. It is said that this gold ring, engraved with the serpent, boosts its wearer's item discovery, so that more items can be amassed. This ring is said to be cursed, as it has led to the wearer's downfall in the past.

Item Description: A gold ring depicting the snake, both the servant and manifestation of the god of desire, Zinder Greed is traditionally viewed as a vice, but only a coward sees every chance as something to fear
Story: The ring is cursed, and anyone who wears it will be consumed by their own desires. But a brave man can use the ring to their advantage, by using it to seduce their enemies and gain their trust. Once they have their enemy's trust, they can strike at them at any time, using the ring to take their enemies by surprise.

Item Description: The serpent is an imperfect dragon and symbol of the Undead. Its habit of devouring prey even larger than itself has led to an association of gluttony. This silver ring, engraved with the serpent, rewards its wearer with additional souls for each kill.
Story: The serpent is an imperfect dragon and symbol of the Undead. It is said that the serpent can devour prey even larger than itself, and as such, it has come to be associated with gluttony. This silver ring, engraved with the serpent, will reward its wearer with additional souls for each kill.

Item Description: A silver ring depicting the snake, both the servant and manifestation of the god of greed, Zandroe. Greed is traditionally viewed as a vice, but only a fool lets that ruin a good opportunity.
Story: The ring had been in the family for generations, passed down from mother to daughter. It was a heirloom, a symbol of wealth and power. But no one knew its true power. One day, a young woman found the ring in a pawnshop. She was desperate for money, and the ring seemed like the perfect way to get it. She wore it constantly, flaunting her wealth to anyone who would listen. But the ring had a darker side.

Item Description: Round wooden shield. Cracked and nearly broken. Wood shields are lighter than metal shields but this one has lower physical damage reduction stability partly due to cracking.
Story: The shield was cracked and nearly broken, but it was still a powerful defense. It had a lower physical damage reduction stability partly due to the cracks, but it was still a formidable shield.

Item Description: An old smithing hammer. Looks like a typical hammer, but is in fact incredibly sturdy. Some say it was the hammer used long ago by a famed blacksmith of yore.
Story: The old smithing hammer is said to have been used by a famed blacksmith of yore. Legend has it that this hammer was incredibly sturdy, and was even used to break swords. Whoever possesses this hammer will be able to break any sword with ease.

Item Description: Candlestand used in worship of Birac, the most hallowed Monk Prelate of the Giants' Flame. Concerned over the lazy arrogance with which the monks treated the Flame, Birac severed his own head as a lesson to the others, intending it be used as a candlestand. His faith yet smolders from within the cranial vessel.
Story: A prelate of the Giants' Flame, Birac severed his own head as a lesson to the others. His faith still burns within the skull, providing light to those who worship him.

Item Description: A typical steel chainmail. Belonged to Creighton the Wanderer. Its design resembles that of the knight order of the eastern land of Mirrah, but with some odd differences that catch the eye. Perhaps it is a finely-crafted imitation
Story: Creighton the Wanderer was a wandering swordsman who had traversed the eastern land of Mirrah. He had seen and experienced much, and his chainmail was a testament to his travels. It was unlike any chainmail that he had seen before, with its design resembling that of the knight order of the eastern land of Mirrah. However, there were some odd differences that caught his eye, such as the lack of a crossguard on the sword arm and the placement of the shoulder

Item Description: Black crossbow featuring a long stock. Used for sniping, it has a very long range. Weapon of Crepus, who served the Two Fingers from the shadows of the Roundtable as the head confessor.
Story: Crepus was a priest of the Two Fingers, a shadowy figure who served as the head confessor for the Roundtable. He was known for his long-range black crossbow, which had a deadly accuracy.

Item Description: Well-used old bronze battle axe with a long hilt and a crescent-shaped blade. One of the blessed weapons of the Way of White. The Crescent Axe is bequeathed to cleric warriors who have proven their faith.
Story: The Crescent Axe is a holy weapon that is bequeathed to cleric warriors who have proven their faith. It is said that the Crescent Axe was one of the blessed weapons of the Way of White. The weapon is said to have the power to cut through any obstacle.

Item Description: A bronze greataxe with a crescent shaped blade. Its long handle gives the weapon great reach. One senses that this axe was once imbued with a sacred power, but only traces of it remain. Perhaps those who blessed this axe are no longer with us.
Story: The greataxe is a powerful weapon that once held great power. However, the sacred power that once flowed through it is now only a faint memory. Whoever once wielded this axe must have been very powerful, as the weapon's mere presence still instills fear in those who see it.

Item Description: Greataxe with a large, arcing blade and long handle. The Crescent Moon of its name is said to have been spurred by nostalgia. Specializes in sweeping through foes by making use of its long handle.
Story: The greataxe with the crescent moon name is said to have been spurred by nostalgia. It is a powerful weapon that specializes in sweeping through foes with its long handle.

Item Description: Ringfinger Leonhard's weapon of choice, a type of shotel imbued with the power of the moon. Leonhard set out on a journey of rebirth, but decided instead to serve the goddess as a knight, and inherited this weapon. Skill: Crescent Blade Assume a broad stance and fire off crescent moon blades.
Story: Leonhard was a skilled swordsman, but he always felt a bit out of place. He was born with a ring finger that was a little bit different than the other fingers. He didn't know what it was, but he knew it made him different. He was teased and bullied as a child, but he never gave up on his dream of becoming a knight. One day, he found himself inheriting a shotel that had been imbued with the power of the moon. With

Item Description: A sickle with a crescent-shaped blade. This sickle, enchanted by magic, is not intended as a weapon, but rather a ceremonial instrument.
Story: The sickle is a ceremonial instrument that is not meant to be used as a weapon. It is enchanted by magic, and its crescent-shaped blade is meant to symbolize the moon. The sickle is said to have been created by a goddess who wanted to create a more peaceful world.

Item Description: Ring of the Brotherhood of Blood Covenant. This is nothing special. Perhaps, in the end, an oath is but a window into the ambitions of the oath taker. If you have taken this oath, then you know what you want. To be soaked in the blood of your kind.
Story: The Ring of the Brotherhood of Blood Covenant is a simple, unremarkable ring. It is made of metal, and is circular in shape. The ring is engraved with a symbol, a red circle with a black cross inside of it. The ring is worn on the middle finger of the right hand. The ring is special to those who have taken the oath of the Brotherhood of Blood Covenant. The oath takers believe that by wearing the ring, they will be soaked in the blood

Item Description: Ring of the Rat King covenant. Join this covenant and wear this ring to lure trespassers of the Rat King's territory into your world. If you receive this ring, rejoice in the opportunity to demonstrate your allegiance to an eminently noble being.
Story: The Ring of the Rat King covenant is a pact between players and the Rat King. By joining the covenant, players receive the ring which allows them to lure trespassers into their world. If a player receives the ring, it is an opportunity to show their allegiance to the Rat King, a noble being.

Item Description: Shield of a nameless knight likely a high-ranking knight of Astora. One of the enchanted blue shields. The Crest Shield greatly reduces magic damage
Story: The Shield of a nameless knight likely belonged to a high-ranking knight of Astora. The shield was one of the enchanted blue shields, and it greatly reduced magic damage.

Item Description: Robe of the sorcerers who flooded New Londo to seal away the Dark wraiths, and the Four Kings who descended into Dark. The Sealers were once known as healers, and the bright crimson was a symbol of that
Story: Now, the robe is stained with the blood of the innocent, and the power it once held is long gone.

Item Description: Crimson water of unknown origin. Greatly restores HP and spell uses. Those who have experienced the powerful effect of this dimly lucent red water care not that its very origins are completely unknown.
Story: A group of adventurers set out to find the source of the crimson water, believing that its power could help them recover from injuries or even cure diseases. Upon arriving at the source, they discovered that the water was coming from a fissure in the earth that led to a dark and mysterious underworld. The water was so powerful that even those who drank it quickly found their spell use and health restored. However, the water's origins were still a mystery, and the adventurers never found out what

Item Description: Weapon consisting of a three-pronged blade affixed to a long pole. The long central blade closely resembles a katana. A weapon of the Land of Reeds, known for its ability to be wielded as a spear while still being capable of performing slashing attacks.
Story: The weapon known as the Reedswand is a unique piece of weaponry. It is a three-pronged blade that is affixed to a long pole. The long central blade closely resembles a katana, but the weapon can also be wielded as a spear. The Reedswand is known for its ability to be wielded as a spear while still being capable of performing slashing attacks. This makes it a powerful weapon that is well-suited for combat in the Land of

Item Description: Badge of a hunter of hunters, who hunts those who have become addled with blood. The badge of the Hunter of Hunters is quietly passed down from generation to generation, usually to an outsider from the hinterlands. To be entrusted with this cursed badge, one must be strong, resilient to the seduction of blood, and gracious when taking a comrade's life.
Story: The Hunter of Hunters badge is passed down from generation to generation, usually to an outsider from the hinterlands. The badge is bestowed upon someone who is strong, resilient to the seduction of blood, and gracious when taking a comrade's life.

Item Description: Thrusting sword wielded by Corvian Knights, and a special paired weapon. When twin-handed, brandish four thin-edge blades in the left hand. In their infatuation with Sister Friede, the Corvian Knights swore to protect the painting from fire, and to this end, took to the execution of their own brethren. Skill: Quill Dart Simultaneously throw temporarily substantial illusions of the four thin-edged blades wielded in the left hand.
Story: The twin-handed sword is a special paired weapon that is wielded by Corvian Knights. When paired together, the swords form four thin-edge blades. The swords are used to protect the painting from fire, and to this end, the Corvian Knights take to the execution of their own brethren. The twin-handed sword is also skillful in the art of illusion, creating temporary substantial illusions of the four thin-edged blades.

Item Description: Talons used by Corvian Knights. Inflicts five perpendicular slashes, causing heavy bleeding. In their infatuation with Sister Friede, the Corvian Knights swore to protect the painting from fire and to this end, too to the execution of their own brethren. Skill: Raptor Flurry Spread right and left talons like a broad set of wings and launch into a tornado of consecutive attacks.
Story: The Corvian Knights were a proud and noble order of knights who served the Sister Friede painting. They were devoted to protecting her from harm and executed any who dared to threaten her. However, their own infatuation with Sister Friede led to them becoming corrupted and bloodthirsty. They used their talons to inflict five perpendicular slashes on their opponents, causing heavy bleeding.

Item Description: Attire worn by Eileen the Crow, Hunter of Hunters, known in particular for her crowfeather cape. Hunters of Hunters dress as crows to suggest sky burial. The first Hunter of Hunters came from a foreign land, and gave the dead a virtuous native funeral ritual, rather than impose a blasphemous Yharnam burial service upon them, with the hope that former compatriots might be returned to the skies, and find rest in a hunter's dream.
Story: Eileen the Crow, Hunter of Hunters, known in particular for her crowfeather cape, wore this attire when she first arrived in Yharnam, to represent her sky burial tradition. She hoped that her former compatriots might find peace in a hunter's dream.

Item Description: Special magic crown bestowed upon Dusk, Princess of Oolacile, upon her birth. Its wearer is blessed by all manner of magic. This raises the power and effect of the wearer's magic, but damage suffered by magic attack also rises
Story: Dusk wore the crown with pride, knowing that it granted her an advantage over her peers. However, the crown also amplified the damage she took from magic attacks, and she soon found herself struggling to stay alive. One day, she was attacked by a powerful mage, and the crown's magic proved to be too much for her to handle. The mage destroyed the crown, and Dusk was left with serious injuries that took her years to recover from.

Item Description: One of the precious secrets of Cainhurst. The old king's crown is said to reveal illusions, and expose a mirage that hides a secret. And so Logarius donned the crown of his own volition, determined to prevent a single soul from stumbling upon the vile secret. What visions did he see, sitting serenely upon his new throne?
Story: Logarius had always been a curious man, so when he was crowned king, he decided to take advantage of the crown's power. He sat upon his new throne and allowed his mind to wander, curious to see what visions would come to him. He soon found himself in a dark place, surrounded by corpses and blood. In the distance, he could see a light, and he knew that he had to reach it. He fought through the corpses and reached the light, only to find

Item Description: Crown of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo. This crown of the gods demands faith immeasurable of its wearer, but it is imbued with Darkmoon power that enhances all magic. The image of the sun manifests Gwyndolin's deep adoration of the sun
Story: The Crown of the Dark Sun is a powerful artifact that requires immense faith to be worn by its wearer. This crown is infused with Darkmoon power, which enhances all magic. The image of the sun is said to represent Gwyndolin's deep adoration of the sun.

Item Description: Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Worn by the knight Ordovis and his men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.
Story: Ordovis and his fellow knights served Godfrey faithfully, until the day he was betrayed and killed. Now, his armor holds the power to strengthen the Crucible of Life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. This armor also grants the wearer the ability to cast Crucible of Life incantations, which can strengthen aspects of the Erdtree.

Item Description: A cross spear hung with a malformed corpse. Once, a mad king was born to the pygmy royalty and Shira, knight of Filianore, put him to rest. But Shira's cross spear, unable to kill the undying king, only pinned itself to him. Shira delivered them together to the darkroom, where she stayed and held them close.
Story: Shira is a pygmy who is the last of her kind. She is a knight of Filianore, and the last of her kind. One day, a mad king was born to the pygmy royalty and Shira put him to rest with her cross spear. But the cross spear couldn't kill the king, only pinned him to the ground. Shira stayed with him and held him close in the darkroom.

Item Description: A crushed eye orb with an unfocused gaze. The crush eye writhes unsteadily, in search of dishonorable miscreants. Where are the fiends, where are they....
Story: The eye orb is a remnant of a once powerful being that was destroyed. Now, it seeks out anyone who has done wrong, no matter who they are. It will punish them with its unyielding gaze.

Item Description: A sacred chime, once the possession of Gertrude, the Heavenly Daughter, and defiled by the scholars of the Grand Archives. The power of crystals granted the scholars a degree of success. In this case, their work enabled this chime to be suitable for casting both miracles and sorceries.
Story: The Grand Archives were always a place of mystery and intrigue. The scholars who worked there were constantly seeking to unlock the secrets of the world. One day, they discovered a crystal that had the power to cast miracles and sorceries. They quickly took possession of the chime, believing that they had finally found the key to unlocking all of the archives' secrets. However, they were wrong. The chime was actually the sacred chime of Gertrude, the Heavenly Daughter.

Item Description: Ember required for weapon ascension. Crystal ember created by Seath the Scaleless. Handled only by the giant God's blacksmiths
Story: The crystal ember was a sacred item that was only created by the giant God's blacksmiths. It was used to ascend a weapon to a higher level of power. The only people who were allowed to handle the ember were the giant God's blacksmiths.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Introduced to Lothric by the Crystal Sages. Used in infusion to create crystal weapons. Crystal weapons inflict magic damage, and scale effectively with intelligence.
Story: The gem of infused titanite is a rare find, introduced to Lothric by the Crystal Sages. Used in infusion to create crystal weapons, these weapons inflict magic damage and scale effectively with intelligence.

Item Description: A fully crystallized straight sword. How such a weapon was created is entirely unknown. The crystallization boosts its attack but makes the blade brittle. The sword cannot be used for long as it cannot be repaired
Story: The straight sword was created by a unknown artisan. The crystallization of the metal made the sword more powerful, but also made it brittle. The sword could only be used for a short time before it needed to be repaired.

Item Description: A knife made by sharpening hard crystal. Signature weapon of glintstone miners. Used as a tool to extract glintstone from broken rock, and as such a faint magic enwreathes the blade.
Story: The knife was made by the miners of Glintstone. It was their signature weapon, used to extract glintstone from broken rock. The faint magic that enwreathed the blade made it a valuable tool.

Item Description: Weapon born from the mystical creature of the Darkroot Garden the Moonlight Butterfly. Imbued with a powerful crystal power like the butterfly created by Seath the Scaleless. Can emit crystal light rings.
Story: The Moonlight Butterfly Sword was created from the mystical creature of the Darkroot Garden, the Moonlight Butterfly. The sword was imbued with a powerful crystal power like the butterfly created by Seath the Scaleless. The sword could emit crystal light rings.

Item Description: Thrusting Sword with tiny crystals scattered across its blade, used by the Crystal Sages for self-defence. The crystals boost the magic damage inflicted by the sword, and the item discovery of its wielder, fruit of the lifetime of research conducted by the sages. Skill: Stance. From stance, use normal attack to back step and execute a surprise attack, or a strong attack for consecutive thrusting.
Story: The Thrusting Sword was created by the Crystal Sages as a means of self-defence. The crystals that make up the sword boost the magic damage inflicted by the weapon, as well as the discovery of its wielder. In addition, the stance that the sword can be used in grants the user the ability to execute a surprise attack or a strong attack consecutively.

Item Description: Secret crystal scroll of the Grand Archives of Lothric. Give to a sorcerer to learn crystal sorceries. These sorceries are the work of the paledrake, Seath the Scaleless, whom Logan is said to have met, a branch of sorcery that has been carried on by the Crystal Sages.
Story: Logan is a sorcerer who has learned crystal sorcery from the paledrake, Seath the Scaleless. He gives this scroll to a sorcerer to learn crystal sorceries. These sorceries are the work of the paledrake, Seath the Scaleless, whom Logan is said to have met.

Item Description: A fully crystallized straight shield. How such a weapon was created is entirely unknown. The crystallization boosts its defense but makes the shield brittle. The shield cannot be used for long as it cannot be repaired
Story: The shield was created by a powerful wizard who had a deep understanding of crystals. He used his knowledge to create a powerful shield that was also incredibly brittle. The shield could only last for a short amount of time before it shattered.

Item Description: Spear fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence. The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to safeguard their crystals unto the end. One theory posits that they yearn for the return of their creator who will carve for them new brethren.
Story: The Crystalians are a race of alien beings that live on a planet made entirely of crystals. They are a mysterious and powerful race that are known for their powerful magic and their ability to create crystal weapons. One theory suggests that the Crystalians were created by their creator, who left them to fend for themselves. Another theory suggests that the Crystalians yearn for the return of their creator, who will create new Crystalians in his image. Regardless of the true story, the Crystalians are

Item Description: Staff fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enhances Crystalian sorceris. The Crystalian's faint cognition is know as the wisdom of stone. This staff can only be weilded by those of intellect high enough to grasp such wisdom.
Story: The staff was crafted from pure crystal and it enhanced the Crystalian's sorceris. The Crystalian's faint cognition was known as the wisdom of stone and only those of high intellect could grasp such wisdom.

Item Description: A fully crystallized straight sword. How such a weapon was created is entirely unknown. The crystallization boosts its attack, but makes the blade brittle. The sword cannot be used for long, as it cannot be repaired
Story: The straight sword is a powerful weapon that is crystallized. This makes the sword more powerful, but also makes it brittle. The sword cannot be used for long, as it cannot be repaired.

Item Description: Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence. The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to safeguard their crystals unto the end. One theory posits that they yearn for the return of their creator who will carve for them new brethren.
Story: The Crystalians are a race of alien beings that live on a planet made entirely of crystals. They are a peaceful people who use their magic to protect their crystals. One day, their creator returned and created new Crystalians.

Item Description: Armor worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized. The crystal provides powerful defense, but it cannot be used for long because it is easily broken and cannot be repaired
Story: The armor worn by the Hollowed knight was partially crystallized. The crystal provided powerful defense, but it couldn't be used for long because it was easily broken and couldn't be repaired.

Item Description: Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights. Its left breast is emblazoned with a peering cuckoo, whence came their name. Perhaps the bird's shrewd gaze is an expression of their refusal to be mere servants of the academy.
Story: Raya Lucaria Academy knights are known for their unique armor, which features a cuckoo on the left breast. The bird is said to represent their refusal to be mere servants of the academy, and its shrewd gaze is said to be an expression of its intelligence.

Item Description: Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. The surcoat depicts twinned cuckoos peering into a flourishing mass of glintstone. To a glintstone sorcerer, the body is a transient thing. The Cuckoo alone knows its insignificance, yet watches over it all the same.
Story: Raya Lucaria Academy was founded on the belief that all students should have access to the best education possible. To that end, the academy provides its students with the best armor and weapons available. The surcoat worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers is a perfect example of this philosophy. The surcoat depicts twinned cuckoos peering into a flourishing mass of glintstone, a symbol of the academy's dedication to providing its students with the best possible education.

Item Description: One of several bite rings, known for their peculiar design. Increases curse resistance. The similar, oddly disturbing design of these rings suggests a common source. Whoever the master craftsman was, he clearly knew his trade.
Story: The bite rings were strange, but the design was familiar. I had seen it before, but I couldn't place where. I was about to ask my friend when I realized that the design was from a set of rings that my family had. My great-grandfather had worn one of the rings, and it had passed down to my father. I had never seen the other two, but I knew they existed. I was excited to find out more about the design and the history of

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. The sticky spots are indicative of a curse, but this gem's malicious effects are perfect for bolstering certain types of weapons. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. The sticky spots and indicative of a curse, but this gem's malicious effects are perfect for bolstering certain types of weapons. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks
Story: A cursed blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. The sticky spots are indicative of a curse, but this gem's malicious effects are perfect for bolstering certain types of weapons. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. The sticky spots are indicative of a curse, but this gem's malicious effects are perfect for bolstering certain types of weapons. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks
Story: The gem was once a beautiful, shining ruby. But something dark and sinister happened to it- the ruby turned into a mass of writhing, bleeding red spots. Now, any weapon that comes into contact with the gem becomes fortified and imbued with various properties, but the gem's curse is also perfect for enhancing certain types of attacks. Enemies beware- this gem is sure to cause bloodshed!

Item Description: Hard, curved club, shaped like a crescent moon. Wielded instead of a curved sword by Albinaurics lacking dexterity. The only point of similarity between the two is the shape.
Story: The Albinaurics were a race of creatures that lacked the dexterity to wield swords effectively. So, they created a club instead. The club was curved and resembled a crescent moon, giving it a unique look. The Albinaurics used the club as their primary weapon, and it was very effective.
