Item Description: A curved greatsword forged from the soul of the Ancient Dragon. In the Age of the Ancients, the world was unformed, shrouded by fog. A land of grey crags, archtrees, and everlasting dragons.
Story: The greatsword was forged from the soul of the ancient dragon, and it is said that the blade is imbued with the power of the dragon itself. The sword is said to be able to slay any foe with ease.

Item Description: Large curved club of hard wood, shaped like a crescent moon. Wielded by Albinaurics lacking the dexterity demanded by a curved sword, and who prefer the added weight and destructive force.
Story: The Albinaurics are a race of giants who lack the dexterity demanded by a curved sword, and who prefer the added weight and destructive force of a large curved club. One day, a Albinaurics warrior named Albinauric the Great found a magical club that granted her the ability to wield it with deadly precision.

Item Description: A great curved sword with an Ominous blade. One of the forbidden weapons sealed away by the Ivory King. Formed by Rock, Tree, and the remnants of a most peculiar soul. It is said the farther the wielder travels, the deadlier the blade becomes.
Story: The sword is said to be formed by the Rock, Tree, and the remnants of a most peculiar soul. It is said that the farther the wielder travels, the deadlier the blade becomes.

Item Description: A twinblade imported from a foreign land. The razor-sharp blades cause bleeding, but as a result, are easily worn and dulled. When wielded by a master, this dual-tipped blade is an unparalleled weapon that hardly allows a foe any opportunity to retaliate... More description
Story: The twinblade was a weapon that was imported from a foreign land. It was a razor-sharp blade that caused bleeding, but as a result, it was easily worn and dulled. When wielded by a master, this dual-tipped blade was an unparalleled weapon that hardly allowed a foe any opportunity to retaliate.

Item Description: This standard small dagger has only a modest attack but can be jabbed in rapid succession, and is effective in critical hits such as after a parry or when stabbing in the back. With both slash and thrust attacks this dagger is useful in various situations
Story: The small dagger is a common weapon that is not very powerful, but can be jabbed quickly multiple times to cause critical damage. It is useful for parrying or stabbing in the back, and can be used in various situations.

Item Description: Armor worn by the Dancer of the Boreal Valley. The mirage-like aurora veil is said to be an article of the old gods, permitted only for direct descendants of the old royal family. The black eyes of the Pontiff eventually transformed the Dancer into a beastly creature, her gauntlets fusing with her own hide.
Story: The armor worn by the Dancer of the Boreal Valley is said to be an article of the old gods, permitted only for direct descendants of the old royal family. The Pontiff eventually transformed the Dancer into a beastly creature, her gauntlets fusing with her own hide.

Item Description: Paired enchanted swords that Pontiff Sulyvahn bestowed upon the Dancer of the Boreal Valley. These blades, symbollic of the Dancer's vows, are enchanted with dark magic in the right hand, and fire in the left, mirroring the Pontiff. Skill: Dancer's Grace Unleash the fury of both blades in a dancing spin motion and use strong attack to continue the performance until stamina is exhausted.
Story: The Dancer of the Boreal Valley was given two enchanted swords by Pontiff Sulyvahn. The swords are enchanted with dark magic in the right hand, and fire in the left, mirroring the Pontiff's vows. When the Dancer performs with the swords, they unleash the fury of both blades in a dancing spin motion. The Dancer can use strong attack to continue the performance until stamina is exhausted.

Item Description: Armor of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark. Their armor transformed, and remains a symbol of the Dark servants and their diabolical art of Lifedrain.
Story: The armor of the Darkwraiths is a symbol of their dark past. Once proud knights of New Londo, they descended into darkness and became Dark servants. Their armor changed, becoming a symbol of their dark art of Lifedrain.

Item Description: Arrows imbued with dark flame. Tipped with Dark Pine Resin. Weapons fortified with dark are effective against those who fear the dark, such as clerics and magical creatures. Useful in the short term for those who have learned no magic, or whose magic is exhausted
Story: The dark arrows were tipped with dark pine resin, and were weapons that were effective against those who feared the dark, such as clerics and magical creatures. They were also useful in the short term for those who had learned no magic, or whose magic was exhausted.

Item Description: Ring depicting a hand grasping a purple stone. Increases dark attack, but compromises damage absorption. An old fable in Londor claims that the lure of the clutch ring reaches out to the crestfallen, who might otherwise be overcome by despair.
Story: A ring with a purple stone that increases dark attack, but compromises damage absorption. The ring is said to be the lure of the clutch ring, which reaches out to the crestfallen and helps them overcome their despair.

Item Description: Ember required for weapon ascension. The church long hid the forbidden black ember, and no living blacksmith knows of it
Story: The blacksmiths of the kingdom have been searching for a black ember for years. Finally, they find one in the ruins of an old church. Using the black ember, they are able to forge a new weapon that can ascend a warrior to a higher level.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Born of disembodied humanity. Used in infusion to create dark weapons. Dark weapons inflict dark damage, and scale with intelligence and faith.
Story: The gem of infused titanite is a powerful artifact that was created from the remains of human beings. It is used to create dark weapons, which inflict dark damage and scale with the intelligence and faith of their users.

Item Description: The Darkwraiths, incited by Kaathe, use the power of the dark soul to absorb humanity, an art shared by this weapon, which also acts as a special shield. The ancients, particularly, could sap the humanity of even a replete saint in the blink of an eye
Story: The Darkwraiths are a group of demons that use the power of the dark soul to absorb human souls. This weapon was used by ancient beings to protect themselves from being drained of their humanity.

Item Description: Mask of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark. Some say the skeletal mask of an ancient Darkwraith is partially fused with the flesh of its face
Story: The Mask of the Darkwraiths is a cursed artifact that once belonged to a group of knights known as the New Londo. The knights were once honorable warriors, but they descended into darkness after they were cursed by a Darkwraith. Some say the skeletal mask of an ancient Darkwraith is partially fused with the flesh of its face, and that the mask's evil power still lingers. Anyone who wears the mask risks becoming possessed by the Darkwraith's curse, and will

Item Description: Piece Name) of the Darkwraiths, relics of a small country that fell to the dark long ago. Looks as if it may crumble to dust at any moment. The Darkwraiths were the oldest of the Red Eye Invaders, and rumored to have served a Primordial Serpent.
Story: The Darkwraiths are a relic from a small country that fell to the dark long ago. They look as if they may crumble to dust at any moment, and the Darkwraiths were the oldest of the Red Eye Invaders. Some say that they served a Primordial Serpent.

Item Description: A Moon Greatsword, bestowed by a Carian queen upon her spouse to honor long-standing tradition. One of the legendary armaments. Ranni's sigil is a full moon, cold and leaden, and this sword is but a beam of its light.
Story: Ranni's Moon Greatsword is a legendary weapon that was bestowed upon Ranni's spouse by a Carian queen in honor of their long-standing tradition of honoring each other with gifts. The sword is made of cold, leaden metal and is imbued with the light of the moon, making it one of the deadliest weapons in existence.

Item Description: A ring bestow upon students of a certain standard at the Melfian Magic Academy. It's lightning quartz increases lightning defense. Pyromancer Glocken crafted so many of these replicas that they became widespread, such that his fellow magicians harshly scolded him for undermining lessons gained from harsh training.
Story: The Glocken Ring was a magical artifact that granted its wearer increased lightning defense. Pyromancer Glocken created many of these rings, which caused other magicians to harshly scold him for undermining his training.

Item Description: A black gaping hole in the flesh that resembles the brand of an Undead. The darkness of humanity seeps from this bottomless pitch-back hole, the gap filled by the accumulation of the curse. This Dark Sigil will never heal, but there is a tale told of a Fire Keeper who returned from the Abyss, and brought great comfort to a bearer of the curse.
Story: The Dark Sigil is a cursed item that has been passed down through the generations of cursed individuals. It is said that a Fire Keeper who returned from the Abyss brought great comfort to those who bore the Dark Sigil.

Item Description: Dark silver armor from Vinland. The dark silver is known to be the oldest metal in the land, and is said to exorcise malice. Its heaviness slightly impedes stamina regeneration.
Story: The armor is said to have been forged in Vinland, the land of the Vikings. The dark silver is known to be the oldest metal in the land, and is said to exorcise malice. It is said that wearing this armor makes the wearer more resistant to attacks, as it slows down their stamina regeneration.

Item Description: A dark silver dagger used by the Lord's Blade Ciaran, of Gwyn's Four Knights. The victim is first distracted by dazzling streaks of the Gold Tracer, then stung by the vicious poison of this dagger.
Story: The Lord's Blade Ciaran was known for his deadly accuracy with his silver dagger. On one fateful day, he used it to take down a powerful opponent. Unfortunately, the opponent was also wielding a gold tracer, which caused the victim to be distracted and then stung by the poison.

Item Description: Pitch-black straight sword of the Darkwraith, survivor of the land swallowed by darkness. The Darkwraiths were the first red orb invaders, and originators of a unique sword technique inspired by their thick, broad blades.
Story: The Darkwraith's sword is pitch black, and is said to be the only sword that has survived the land swallowed by darkness. The Darkwraith's sword is a unique and powerful weapon, and is said to be the only sword that can defeat the red orb invaders.

Item Description: Troches with an inexplicably pungent odor. Temporarily boosts dark defense. Verbal histories often mention Saint Elizabeth; her uniquely concocted medicines and potions are still widely used today.
Story: The Troches were a strange looking item with an inexplicably pungent odor. They temporarily boosted dark defense. The verbal histories often mentioned Saint Elizabeth; her uniquely concocted medicines and potions were still widely used today.

Item Description: This special ring crafted in an Eastern land is made of gold, but with a wood grain crest on its surface. Agents of subterfuge in this faraway land are particularly fond of the dark gold wood grain, which greatly alters its wearer's rolling action.
Story: The ring is said to be made in an Eastern land, and is said to be made of gold, but with a wood grain crest on its surface. The agents of subterfuge in this faraway land are particularly fond of the dark gold wood grain, which greatly alters its wearer's rolling action.

Item Description: Katana of Grave Warden Agdayne. Has a crystal-clear blade and a strong attack that slices through enemy shields. This katana was originally wielded by the one who gave us first death, and still exists imperfectly between planes.
Story: The Katana of Grave Warden Agdayne is a powerful weapon that was originally wielded by the one who gave us first death. It still exists imperfectly between planes, and its crystal-clear blade makes it a deadly weapon against enemy shields.

Item Description: Ring granted to those bound by the Darkmoon Blade covenant. Answer Dark Sun Gwyndolin's summoning. Gwyndolin, all too aware of his repulsive, frail appearance, created the illusion of a sister Gwynevere, who helps him guard over Anor Londo. An unmasking of these deities would be tantamount to blasphemy.
Story: The Ring of the Darkmoon Blade is a powerful artifact granted to those who swear allegiance to Gwyndolin, the Dark Sun. Gwyndolin, all too aware of his repulsive, frail appearance, created the illusion of a sister Gwynevere, who helps him guard over Anor Londo. An unmasking of these deities would be tantamount to blasphemy. If you are able to find and defeat Gwyndolin, the Dark Sun, the Ring will be

Item Description: Bow born from the soul of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, Darkmoon deity who watches over the abandoned city of the Gods, Anor Londo. This golden bow is imbued with powerful magic and is most impressive with Moonlight Arrows.
Story: The bow was once the weapon of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, the deity who watched over the abandoned city of the Gods, Anor Londo. The bow is imbued with powerful magic and is most impressive with Moonlight Arrows. The bow is said to have been born from the soul of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, and it is said that the bow can shoot arrows that are so powerful they can cleave through even the strongest of armor.

Item Description: Longbow of Darkmoon Gwyndolin, who was gradually devoured by Aldrich.This golden bow is imbued with powerful magic and is most impressive with Moonlight Arrows. Skill: Darkmoon Arrow Infuse a readied arrow with Darkmoon essence, granting it magic damage and the ability to pierce shields.
Story: The bow of Darkmoon Gwyndolin was once a magnificent weapon. However, over time, the dark lord Aldrich began to consume the god-like being, gradually taking away its life force. In desperation, Gwyndolin called upon the power of the moon, infusing its arrows with its own dark essence. This made the arrows even more powerful, able to pierce through shields and deal magical damage.

Item Description: Ring of the moon deity Gwyndolin, youngest son of Gwyn, the First Lord. Adds many slots for attunement. Gwyndolin, also known as the Dark Sun, commands the Darkmoon Knights, and bestows this ring upon the best of them.
Story: The Ring of the Moon Deity Gwyndolin is a powerful ring that grants its wearer many slots for attunement. Gwyndolin, also known as the Dark Sun, is the youngest son of Gwyn, the First Lord. He commands the Darkmoon Knights, and bestows this ring upon the best of them.

Item Description: This ring is granted to adherents of Gwyndolin, Darkmoon deity and last born of Gwyn, Lord of Sunlight. Grants additional magic attunement slots. The Dark Sun Gwyndolin is the only remaining deity in Anor Londo. His followers are few, but their tasks are of vital importance.
Story: The ring is a sign of allegiance to the Darkmoon deity Gwyndolin. It grants the wearer an additional magic attunement slot, making it more powerful than most other rings. Gwyndolin is the last of the deities, and his followers are few, but their tasks are of vital importance.

Item Description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. Granted to Darkmoon Blade knights, adherents to the Covenant of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin. This talisman demands dutiful faith from its owner, but has very high miracle adjustment
Story: The Darkmoon Blade knights were the most devout followers of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, and as such were granted this miraculous medium. It required great faith from the user, but the talisman's miracle adjustment made it one of the most powerful tools in their arsenal.

Item Description: An altered state of titanite. Use to imbue weapons with darkness, or to provide darkness reduction to shields. Sorcerers at the Melfian Magic Academy once attempted to imbue titanite with various elements, but are said to have failed. Someone must have succeeded though; what else would explain this stone?
Story: The stone is said to have been used by sorcerers at the Melfian Magic Academy to imbue weapons with darkness. However, it is unknown what happened to the stone after they failed. Someone must have succeeded though, as this is the only explanation for this strange stone.

Item Description: The Darksign signifies an accursed Undead. Those branded with it are reborn after death, but will one day lose their mind and go hollow. Death triggers the Darksign, which returns its bearer to the last bonfire rested at, but at the cost of all humanity and souls.
Story: The Darksign is a sign of accursed Undead. When a person is branded with the Darksign, they are reborn after death. However, this comes with a cost. The Darksign returns the bearer to the last bonfire they rested at, but at the cost of all humanity and souls. This means that the bearer can never truly die, and will always be haunted by their past.

Item Description: The Darksign signifies an accursed Undead. Those branded with it are reborn after death, but will one day lose their mind and go hollow. Death triggers the Darksign, which returns its bearer to the last bonfire rested at, but at the cost of all humanity and souls.
Story: The Darksign is a sign of accursed Undead. When a person is branded with the Darksign, they are reborn after death. However, this comes with a cost. The Darksign returns the bearer to the last bonfire they rested at, but at the cost of all humanity and souls. This means that the bearer can never truly die, and will always be haunted by their past.

Item Description: An accursed mark. The Darksign induces death, returning the player to the last bonfire rested at, at the cost of all souls held. Do what you must to gather the pieces, scraping them into some semblance of a whole, before the will to do so fades.
Story: The Darksign is a mark that induces death, returning the player to the last bonfire rested at. The player must gather the pieces of the Darksign before the will to do so fades.

Item Description: The sword of the knights of the Four Kings of New Londo. Its blade is wide and thick and it is wielded in an unusual manner. When the Four Kings were seduced by evil, their knights became Darkwraiths, servants of the Dark who wielded these darkswords.
Story: The sword of the knights of the Four Kings of New Londo. It was wielded in an unusual manner, and when the Four Kings were seduced by evil, their knights became Darkwraiths, servants of the Dark.

Item Description: Robe and Skirt worn by deacons of the Cathedral of the Deep, worn on the inside of the deep red robe. In time, those dedicated to sealing away the horrors of the Deep succumbed to their very power. It seems that neither tending to the flame, nor the faith, could save them.
Story: The deacons of the Cathedral of the Deep wore robes of deep red, inside of which were hidden the robes worn by the priests of the cathedral. These robes were meant to seal away the horrors of the Deep, but eventually those dedicated to sealing away the horrors of the Deep succumbed to their very power.

Item Description: Ritual spear used by priests of old who were permitted to come among the Deathbirds. The priests became guardians of the birds through the rite of Death, which also serves as an oath sworn to their distant resurrection.
Story: The ritual spear was used by priests of old who were permitted to come among the Deathbirds. These priests became guardians of the birds through the rite of Death, which also serves as an oath sworn to their distant resurrection.

Item Description: Barbed rod carried by Deathbirds. The birds are graveyard fire keepers; it is said they rake out the ashen remains of the dead from their kilns.
Story: The barbed rod is a ceremonial tool carried by the deathbirds. It is said that the birds rake out the ashen remains of the dead from their kilns. This rod is used to punish those who have wronged the deathbirds.

Item Description: Old Hunter Garb decorated with brass trinkets At the time, some hunters believed that certain metals would ward off beast blood. On a night of the hunt, it is no wonder that people would resort to superstition.
Story: The old hunter's garb was adorned with brass trinkets, and it was said that by wearing them, the hunter would be protected from the beasts during the hunt. On that fateful night, the hunter was successful in bringing down a large animal, but as he was about to take its head off, he was attacked from behind. The brass trinkets must have worked as intended, as the beast's blood was repelled by the metal.

Item Description: A braille divine tome of the Deep, belonging to the deacons of the cathedral. Intended to teach divine protection to the deacons of the deep, but later, dark tales were added to its pages, such that it is now considered a thing profane.
Story: The deacons of the cathedral were always looking for ways to protect their people from harm. So, when they found a braille divine tome that could teach them divine protection, they were excited. However, over time, the tome began to be filled with dark tales. Now, the deacons believe that the divine protection the tome promised is nothing more than a curse.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Found in the dregs of the Cathedral of the deep. Used in infusion to deep weapons. Deep weapons inflict dark damage, but lose scaling effects. There is a darkness that lies beyond human ken.
Story: The gem was found deep within the Cathedral of the Deep. It was used in infusion to create deep weapons, which inflicted dark damage but lost some of their scaling effects. The darkness that lies beyond human understanding was what inspired the creation of these weapons.

Item Description: A ring bestowed upon the Deacons of the Cathedral of the Deep. Allows attunement of additional spells. In the Cathedral slumber things most terrible, and as such, the deacons require a grand narrative, to ensure they do not falter in their duty. A philosophy, to ward away the madness beckoned by the grotesqueries at hand.
Story: The ring bestowed upon the Deacons of the Cathedral of the Deep allows them to attune to additional spells. The deacons were once content with their meager allotment of magic, but now they find themselves in need of more. The ring allows them to access spells that are not normally available to them. This allows them to bolster their defenses and to cast spells that would otherwise be too dangerous for them to use.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. This transcription of the Great Ones' inhuman voices depicts downreaching currents. This rune means Deep Sea and grants augmented resistance. Great volumes of water serve as a bulwark guarding sleep, and an augur of the eldritch Truth. Overcome this hindrance, and seek what is yours.
Story: Caryll left this rune to those who seek knowledge of the Great Ones. The rune represents the deep sea and the resistance it provides against the currents of the eldritch Truth. By transcribing the voices of the Great Ones, Caryll hoped to overcome the hindrance of sleep and find what is rightfully theirs.

Item Description: Greatsword wielded by the Throne Defender. Unleash its true power to enwreath in magic. The Defender has stood by the throne for ages. Will his wait be worth the while?
Story: The greatsword is wielded by the Throne Defender, a figure who has defended the throne for many years. The sword is said to have the power to enwrap in magic, and the Defender is waiting to unleash its full potential. His wait may be worth it, as the throne may soon be in danger.

Item Description: A special hunter tool crafted by the old Oto Workshop. These molotovs wedge into the ground when thrown, and explode on a timed delay. A shame that such a complex gadget must be sacrificed with each use of this inefficient hunter tool. Nevertheless, delayed molotovs are cherished by the minority of hunters who prefer the tricksier kill. This creation is one of the earliest- known roots of the Powder Kegs.
Story: The old Oto Workshop crafted this Molotov hunter tool in an effort to create an efficient hunting tool. Unfortunately, each Molotov must be used in conjunction with the hunter tool, sacrificing its efficiency. However, Molotov hunters who prefer the more tricky kills cherish this creation, as it is one of the earliest roots of the Powder Kegs.

Item Description: A special hunter tool crafted by the old Oto Workshop. These molotovs wedge into the ground when thrown behind one's back, and explode on a timed delay. A shame that such a complex gadget must be sacrificed with each use of this inefficient hunter tool. Nevertheless, delayed molotovs are cherished by the minority of hunters who prefer the tricksier kill. This creation is one of the earliest-known roots of the Powder Kegs.
Story: The old Oto Workshop crafted this Molotov Hunter Tool in an effort to create a more efficient hunting tool. Unfortunately, each Molotov Hunter Tool must be sacrificed in order to use it. This creation is a precursor to the Powder Kegs, which are still used by a minority of hunters today.

Item Description: A soft string-like ring tied around the finger. Makes it easier for invaders to find your world. Who would create such a ring, and why? Perhaps the answer is better left unknown.
Story: The ring was a simple design, a thin, soft string of metal wrapped around the finger. It was easy to miss, unless you were specifically looking for it. It was a simple design, but it had a purpose. The ring was created to help invaders find Earth. The creators of the ring knew that if they could make it easy for invaders to find our world, it would be much harder for us to defend ourselves. The ring was a warning to all of humanity,

Item Description: Glintstone staff styled as a scepter. A gift once given to the demi-humans to foster peace, it can be wielded even by those of low intelligence. Sneered at by fools in the academy.
Story: The Glintstone staff was once given to the demi-humans as a way to foster peace. It was scoffed at by many in the academy, but it can be wielded by even the lowest of intelligence. One day, a young student decided to take it up as a challenge and use it to achieve greatness.

Item Description: The lesser Capra demons use these Greatsword in pairs. The blade is cast iron and hooked. The sword is imbued with no particular magic but for those who have the strength its great weight will smash foes mercilessly
Story: The lesser Capra demons use these Greatswords in pairs. The blade is cast iron and hooked. The sword is imbued with no particular magic but for those who have the strength, its great weight will smash foes mercilessly.

Item Description: A demonic fist that burns with fiery essence. Its wielder can release this power through use of its Skill. When two-handed, fists are equipped in each hand. Skill: Flame Whirlwind Spin through opponents with abandon, flaming fists outstretched. Using a strong attack while spinning utilizes your momentum to slam the ground with both fists.
Story: The demonic fist was created by a powerful demon as a weapon of destruction. The fist is made of pure fire, and when used by its wielder, the fire can be released through the use of their skill. When two-handed, the fists are equipped in each hand, allowing for a powerful spin that can devastate opponents.

Item Description: Great hammer made of unknown materials. Perhaps it is stone, or even wood. The origins of its name are unclear. Its tremendous weight suggests that it was never intended for humans. Perhaps it was an offering to the demons that appear in legend.
Story: The great hammer is a powerful tool, made from an unknown material. It is said to have been made to appease the demons that haunt the night. Despite its imposing size, the hammer was never meant for human use. It is said that the hammer was once an offering to the dark beings, and that its weight is a testament to its power.

Item Description: Carved from the bones of fellow demons. Wielded by the lesser Taurus demons. This axe is imbued with no special power but can merrily beat foes to a pulp providing you have the strength to wield it.
Story: The Taurus demons are a race of demons that are weaker than the other demons. They carve axes from the bones of their fellow demons in order to try and make themselves stronger. The axe in question is imbued with no special power, but is just as effective at beating foes to a pulp as any other axe.

Item Description: This chaotic thing, the last flame kindled by a demon prince, is shaped like the claw marks of a demon. It is both a fiery bladed weapon, and pyromancy flame.
Story: The last flame, a chaotic thing that is both a fiery bladed weapon and pyromancy flame. It is shaped like the claw marks of a demon.

Item Description: Carved from the bones of fellow demons. Wielded by the slim lesser Batwing demons. The weapon of these chaos demons wandering Anor Londo are different from those of other chaos demons and are imbued with lightning
Story: The lesser Batwing demons are a race of demons that roam the dark depths of Anor Londo. They are known for their unique weapon, a bone-carved staff that is imbued with lightning. This weapon is said to be different from the other weapons of the lesser Batwing demons, and is said to be more powerful.

Item Description: Robe worn by depraved perfumers. The embroidery on the apron is itself a curse upon the Erdtree. These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.
Story: A cursed apron embroidered with heresy-inspiring symbols is what has earned the Erdtree perfumers their infamous reputation. These perfumers steep their own spices in order to alter their bodies and minds, and as they sink further into their own depravity, their apron becomes a symbol of their own damnation.

Item Description: Sorceress Clothes from the distant land of Jugo. Appears to be a plain, thin fabric, but is permeated with powerful magic. Desert Sorceresses have enchanting looks, and they use them to catch people off guard. Oddly enough, even those who are perceptive enough to realize the ploy fall prey to their seductions with alarming regularity.
Story: The sorceress clothes are from a faraway land called Jugo. They are a plain fabric, but are infused with powerful magic. Desert sorceresses have enchanting looks, and they use them to catch people off guard. Oddly enough, even those who are perceptive enough to realize the ploy fall prey to their seductions with alarming regularity.

Item Description: Common soldier's armor. It's insignia is worn beyond recognition. This musty, rusted hunk of metal befits one reduced to thievery.
Story: The common soldier's armor is a rusty hunk of metal that is worn beyond recognition. It is fitting for one reduced to thievery, as the insignia is worn beyond recognition.

Item Description: Greatarrows with intricately crafted tips. Designed to destroy equipment with impact. Bravery does not necessarily entail going head-on with a foe, especially if they have better armor than you. Use these arrows, and grind them down from afar.
Story: The greatarrows were designed by a master craftsman with the intent of destroying enemy equipment with impact. Though they are not meant for head-on combat, they can be used to take down enemies from a distance with ease.

Item Description: Scepter in the shape of a serpent devouring the world. This weapon will one day become the very symbol of the Lord of Blasphemy. One of the legendary armaments. A vision of the future briefly seen by Rykard in his final moments before being devoured by the great serpent.
Story: The Scepter in the shape of a serpent devouring the world is a legendary armament. A vision of the future briefly seen by Rykard in his final moments before being devoured by the great serpent. The scepter is said to be one of the legendary armaments, and it is said that one day it will become the very symbol of the Lord of Blasphemy.

Item Description: An oddly deformed iron ring. Increases the dexterity of its wearer. The Old Iron King ruled over a great age of iron. The King's power allowed him to mold iron freely, as if he held sway over the forces of life and creation.
Story: The ring was old and battered, but it still shone brightly. It seemed to amplify the dexterity of whoever wore it, making their movements more nimble and precise. The Old Iron King had worn it for centuries, and it had helped him to build an empire of iron. Now, the ring was all that remained of his great kingdom.

Item Description: Staff of a sorcerer-miner who extracts glintstone from crystal tunnels. The staff itself is a tool used to mine, and the ferrule is also embedded with a glintstone. Boosts the power of Stonedigger sorceries
Story: The staff of a sorcerer-miner who extracts glintstone from crystal tunnels. The staff itself is a tool used to mine, and the ferrule is also embedded with a glintstone. The staff gives the user a boost to the power of Stonedigger sorceries.

Item Description: Worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine. It is thought to have once been the white robe of a maiden, but smoke and ashes from bonfires darkened it over the years
Story: The white robe of a maiden was once pristine and beautiful, but years of exposure to the flames of bonfires has stained it black. Now, it is the robe of the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine, and is thought to have once belonged to a young girl who died in the flames of a burning building.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. This particular specimen has a pronounced effect, due to its extended state of dampness. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks.
Story: The gem was found in a dried up riverbed. It was covered in moss and algae, and the light shining through the gem created a eerie glow. The gem was heavy, and when picked up it felt warm and heavy in the hand.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. Blood gems are especially rare blood stones that grow on cold blood. Blood gems are kneaded into weapons using workshop tools, but only when of matching shape. Most waning blood gems provide rare special effects such as fire, bolt, or healing.
Story: The blood gem was a rare and powerful item. It was said to fortify weapons and add various properties. Blood gems were especially rare blood stones that grew on cold blood. Blood gems were kneaded into weapons using workshop tools, but only when of matching shape. Most waning blood gems provided rare special effects such as fire, bolt, or healing.

Item Description: A rare sacred chime of unknown origin. Can be used as a shield. This chime, likely brought here by a visiting saint, slightly augments the effects of miracles. Use strong attack to emit miracles and hexes. Effect: use miracles and hexes (strong attack)
Story: The chime was a sacred artifact that had been brought to the kingdom by a visiting saint. It had a slight effect on the effects of miracles, and could be used to emit miracles and hexes. The king had always been fascinated by the chime, and decided to use it to increase the power of his kingdom.

Item Description: A protective ring set with gemstones of four different colors. Increases the wearer's resistance to magic, lightning, fire and dark. The artistry required to attune the varying powers of four different stones within one ring could only be described as transcendental. There is only one sorcerer who could have done this; a man from the lost land of Olaphis
Story: The ring was created by a sorcerer from the lost land of Olaphis. He was able to attune the gemstones to increase the wearer's resistance to magic, lightning, fire, and dark. The ring is said to be able to protect its wearer from any magical attack.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. This transcription of the Great Ones' inhuman voices ripples like a watery reflection. This rune means Lake, and those branded by it enjoy augmented defense. Great volumes of water serve as a bulwark guarding sleep, and an augur of the eldritch Truth. Overcome this hindrance, and seek what is yours.
Story: Caryll left this rune for those who seek to understand the Great Ones. The rune is said to represent Lake, and those who are branded by it enjoy augmented defense. The rune is also said to be an augur of the eldritch Truth, and can be used to overcome obstacles.

Item Description: Holy water from Goddess Gwynevere. Fully restore HP and undo irregularities. The Goddess of Sunlight Gwynevere daughter of the great Lord of Sunlight Gwyn is cherished by all as the symbol of bounty and fertility.
Story: The Holy water from Goddess Gwynevere was said to be fully restore HP and undo irregularities. A few drops of this blessed water was enough to heal any injury and restore balance to any situation. Many people sought out this water for its miraculous properties, and the Goddess was always happy to grant a few drops to those in need.

Item Description: Holy water endowed with a divine blessing. Cures status effects and fully restores HP. Water blessed by an ancient goddess. Her name is long forgotten, and the Magic Academy of Melfia denies even her existence. In any age, there are those who refuse to see reason. It is their meddling that distorts the truth.
Story: In the faraway kingdom of Melfia, there is a Magic Academy that is said to be the best in the land. However, the Academy denies the existence of a goddess known as the White Maiden. One day, a student named Edward discovered a vial of holy water that had been blessed by the White Maiden. Edward's discovery caused a stir at the Academy, and the students began to debate the merits of the White Maiden's blessing. Edward's discovery also restored the health of

Item Description: Ember required for weapon ascension. Divine embers are property of the church, and intended for divine blacksmiths
Story: The divine embers were coveted by all blacksmiths, for they were the key to weapon ascension. However, the church held a monopoly on these embers, and only those who were sanctioned by the church could obtain them. One day, a young blacksmith named Ember decided to break the church's rule and obtain divine embers on his own. Unfortunately, he was caught and sentenced to life in a prison cell. However, Ember refused to give up on his dream, and

Item Description: A fragment of the matching ritual spears once held by the knights of Princess Filianore. These Divine Spears of gold were placed in the trusted hands of exalted Spears. When Spears of the Church face unduly treacherous foes, this allows them to draw upon former majesty, and summon a row of upward-thrusting ritual spears.
Story: The spears once wielded by the knights of Princess Filianore are now in the hands of the Spears of the Church. When they face an enemy that is too treacherous, they can draw upon their former majesty and summon a row of spears that thrust upward. This allows them to overcome their opponents easily.

Item Description: Discarded doll clothing, likely a spare for dress-up. A deep love for the doll can be surmised by the fine craftsmanship of this article, and the care with which it was kept. It borderlines on mania, and exudes a slight warmth.
Story: The doll clothing was discarded because the owner had outgrown it. They had loved the doll so much that they couldn't bear to part with it, even though it was no longer of use. The clothing was of high quality, and showed the care that had been taken in its creation. It was as if the doll itself still inhabited the clothing, and the owner could feel its warmth.

Item Description: A discarded doll hat, likely a spare for dress-up. A deep love for the doll can be sumised by the fine craftsmanship of this article, and the care with which it was kept. It borderlines on mania, and exudes a slight warmth.
Story: The doll hat had been abandoned on the side of the road. It was a beautiful hat, made with fine craftsmanship and care. It was a little bit mania, and it exuded a slight warmth. The doll had been loved very much, and its owner had taken great care of it.

Item Description: Discarded doll skirt, likely a spare for dress-up. A deep love for the doll can be sumised by the fine craftsmanship of this article, and the care with which it was kept. It borderlines on mania, and exudes a slight warmth.
Story: The doll skirt was discarded because it was a spare for a dress-up doll. The doll's deep love for itself can be seen in the fine craftsmanship and the care that was taken with it. It borders on mania, and exudes a slight warmth.

Item Description: Mask worn by a Dragon Acolyte sorcerer. The man claims to have sealed himself away, but who's ever heard of sentient magic? It is no doubt difficult to judge the veracity of the man's words, but this mask certainly seems to possess an unusual power.
Story: A sorcerer wearing a mask that seems to have the power to seal oneself away.

Item Description: A weapon from the soul of the Iron Golem, guardian of Sen's Fortress who repelled countless heroes who sought Anor Londo. The Gods fused the power of the soul with the great bones of the dragons, forming an appropriate core for the giant golem
Story: The Iron Golem was a giant golem that guarded Sen's Fortress. It was said that the Gods fused the power of the soul of the dragons with the great bones of the golem, forming an appropriate core for the giant golem. The Iron Golem was a powerful guardian, repelling countless heroes who sought to enter Anor Londo.

Item Description: A blessed charm. Cures poison and greatly restores HP. A rare, ancient charm that is said to be endowed with the power of dragons. It is not clear whether it is a man-made creation, or of some other nature.
Story: The amulet is a beautiful, ancient charm with the power to cure poison and restore health. It is unknown where it came from, or who created it, but it is said to be the work of dragons. Whoever possesses this amulet is sure to be safe from harm.

Item Description: A sacred chime shaped as a dragon. A catalyst for miracles and hexes. This chime sat long in the Dark Chasm, but still one senses a sublime purity. Only those with the deepest faith can wield this chime, but they will be rewarded with greatly amplified spells.
Story: The Dark Chasm is a deep and dark place, and it's home to a sacred chime that can amplify the power of miracles and hexes. Only those with the deepest faith can touch it, and they will be rewarded with greatly amplified spells. However, the chime is also a source of great danger, as anyone who tries to wield it will be drawn into the Dark Chasm and never seen again.

Item Description: Formless drakeblood seal with a dragon communion crest. Enhances Dragon Communion incantations. The sacrificial devouring of the heart gives power. Indeed, Dragon Communion is too primal in nature for the term incantation to be appropriate. This seal scales incantations with one's arcane attribute.
Story: The Formless drakeblood seal with a dragon communion crest enhances Dragon Communion incantations. Indeed, Dragon Communion is too primal in nature for the term incantation to be appropriate. This seal scales incantations with one's arcane attribute, granting them power beyond what is possible with traditional methods.

Item Description: Shield of a nameless knight likely a high-ranked knight of Astora. One of the enchanted blue shields. The dragon crest shield greatly reduces fire damage.
Story: The Shield of a nameless knight likely belonged to a high-ranked knight of Astora. The shield was one of the enchanted blue shields, and it greatly reduced fire damage.

Item Description: An art of the transcendent apostles who pray to the ancient dragons. To be alive is to be vulnerable, and the fiery Gods are no exception. The apostles seek another plane of existence, which transcends life
Story: The art of the transcendent apostles is a beautiful and powerful work. It is a testament to the power of prayer and the faith of the saints. The apostles believe that by praying to the ancient dragons, they can find a new plane of existence that is beyond life. This art is a symbol of their faith and their hope.

Item Description: An art of the transcendent apostles who pray to the ancient dragons. To be alive is to be vulnerable, and the fiery Gods are no exception. The apostles seek another plane of existence, which transcends life
Story: The art of the transcendent apostles is a beautiful and powerful work. It is a testament to the power of prayer and the faith of the saints. The apostles believe that by praying to the ancient dragons, they can find a new plane of existence that is beyond life. This art is a symbol of their faith and their hope.

Item Description: Weapon said to have been whittled from the claw of a great, ancient dragon, wielded by grotesque Tree Sentinels who yet serve the Erdtree. The claw is enwreathed with lightning, and tears through the dragons' feeble descendants with ease.
Story: The weapon is a greatsword that was whittled from the claw of a great, ancient dragon. The Tree Sentinels who wield it are grotesque, but they still serve the Erdtree.

Item Description: This sword one of the rare dragon weapons came from the tail of the stone dragon of Ash Lake descendant of the ancient dragons. Its great mystical power will be unleashed when wielded with two hands
Story: The sword was said to have come from the tail of the stone dragon of Ash Lake, a descendant of the ancient dragons. The sword's great mystical power would be unleashed when wielded with two hands.

Item Description: Halberd shaped like a dragon, enwreathed with both ice and lightning. Alas, the Dragonkin Soldiers never attained immortality, and perished as decrepit, pale imitations of their skyborn kin.
Story: The Halberd is a legendary weapon that is said to have been forged from the scales of a dragon. The weapon is encrusted with both ice and lightning, and is said to be able to kill any dragon. Unfortunately, the Dragonkin Soldiers never attained immortality, and perished as decrepit, pale imitations of their skyborn kin.

Item Description: Stone imbued with the power of dragons. Rite of apostles of the ancient dragons. Gain head of dragon. Emit dragon breath. The dragon apostles seek ascendence of life itself, attainable by transformation into an ancient dragon.This rite is only one step, but it cannot be reversed until death
Story: The stone was imbued with the power of dragons. It was a rite of apostles of the ancient dragons. The apostles sought to gain ascendence of life itself, by transforming into an ancient dragon. The stone could not be reversed until death.

Item Description: Stone imbued with the power of dragons. Rite of apostles of the ancient dragons. Gain head of dragon. Emit dragon breath. The dragon apostles seek ascendence of life itself, attainable by transformation into an ancient dragon.This rite is only one step, but it cannot be reversed until death
Story: The stone was imbued with the power of dragons. It was a rite of apostles of the ancient dragons. The apostles sought to gain ascendence of life itself, by transforming into an ancient dragon. The stone could not be reversed until death.

Item Description: A stone containing the strength of dragons. Transforms the head into that of a fire-breathing dragon, an effect that will remain until death. The zealots who sought everlasting life are said to have conducted rites to imbue stones with the strength of dragons, but there are no records confirming their success.
Story: The stone is said to have the power to transform the head of whoever possesses it into that of a fire-breathing dragon. The effect of the stone will remain until the person dies, so it is coveted by zealots who seek to gain an advantage in battle.

Item Description: This axe one of the rare dragon weapons is formed by the tail of the Gaping Dragon a distant deformed descendant of the everlasting dragons. The axe is imbued with a mystical power to be released when held with both hands
Story: The Gaping Dragon's tail is said to be the source of a powerful axe that can be used only by those with both hands. The axe is said to have a mystical power that can be unleashed when held in both hands.

Item Description: Piercing Gravel Stone sword containing primeval lightning. A portion of the Dragonlord's power, gained from a remembrance. This weapon commands great power over the paltry, mortal dragons of today.
Story: The Piercing Gravel Stone sword is a powerful weapon that was once wielded by the Dragonlord. This sword contains a portion of the Dragonlord's power, gained from a remembrance. This weapon commands great power over the paltry, mortal dragons of today.

Item Description: A dragon signet ring. Grants its bearer the protection of dragons. Increases HP, stamina, and maximum load, but is easily broken. Raulmond, knight of Drangleic, served the king by guarding the fort until his own demise, and was said to have cherished this ring throughout his life of service.
Story: Raulmond was a knight of Drangleic who served the king faithfully. He was said to have cherished his dragon signet ring, which granted him the protection of dragons. The ring increased his HP, stamina, and maximum load, but was easily broken. One day, Raulmond was killed in battle by a dragon. His ring fell off of his finger and was lost forever.

Item Description: A scale from the body of an ancient dragon. Offer to the dragon to bring your own flesh closer to that of the eternal ancient dragon. Touching an ancient dragon scale gives one a glimpse into the abyss. Believers in the dragon will rise above this petty corporeal existence.
Story: A scale from the body of an ancient dragon. It is said that if you touch this scale, you will be granted a glimpse into the abyss. Those who believe in the dragon will use this to rise above their petty corporeal existence.

Item Description: Created from an everlasting dragon tooth. Legendary great hammer of Havel the Rock. The dragon tooth will never break as it is harder than stone and it grants its wielder resistance to magic and flame
Story: Havel the Rock was a mighty warrior who fought against the evil forces of the world. One day, he was challenged to a duel by the most powerful wizard of his time. The wizard tried to use his magic to break Havel's hammer, but it was immune to the wizard's spells. In the end, Havel was victorious and claimed the wizard's magic as his own. From then on, his hammer was unbreakable and granted him resistance to magic and flame.

Item Description: Stone imbued with the power of the dragons. Rite of apostles of the ancient dragons. Gain torso of dragon. Roar like a dragon.The dragon apostles seek transcendence of life itself, attainable by transformation into an ancient dragon. This rite is only one step, but it cannot be reversed until death
Story: The stone was imbued with the power of the dragons. It was a rite of passage for the apostles of the ancient dragons. The dragon apostles sought to transcend life itself, and by becoming an ancient dragon, they could achieve this. However, the stone could not be reversed until death.

Item Description: Stone imbued with the power of the dragons. Rite of apostles of the ancient dragons. Gain torso of dragon. Roar like a dragon.The dragon apostles seek transcendence of life itself, attainable by transformation into an ancient dragon. This rite is only one step, but it cannot be reversed until death
Story: The stone was imbued with the power of the dragons. It was a rite of passage for the apostles of the ancient dragons. The dragon apostles sought to transcend life itself, and by becoming an ancient dragon, they could achieve this. However, the stone could not be reversed until death.

Item Description: Armor worn by the dragonriders, King Vendricks royal guard. According to legend, the dragonriders astride not horses, but wyrms. Aspiring dragonriders who had not the mettle to handle their training were torn apart by their wyrms, and those who survived emerged with deific strength.
Story: The armor worn by the dragonriders is said to have been forged from the scales of a dragon. Legend has it that the dragonriders astride not horses, but wyrms. Aspiring dragonriders who had not the mettle to handle their training were torn apart by their wyrms, and those who survived emerged with deific strength.

Item Description: Bow wielded by Dragonrider, King Vendrick's royal guard. Merely drawing this bow requires inhuman strength, but each shot has deadly potential. Demands great skill of its wielder, and thus served to test the worthiness of those who aspired to join Dragonriders.
Story: The bow was wielded by the king's royal guard, and it required inhuman strength to draw it. Each shot had deadly potential, and it was used to test the worthiness of those who aspired to join the dragonriders. Anyone who could wield the bow with skill was considered worthy, and it served as a symbol of the king's power.

Item Description: Longbow of the Dragonriders, who served the Old King of Want. The Dragonriders were the Old King's royal guard, and great strength was demanded of them. Merely drawing this bow calls for inhuman strength. The worthy few who can master this bow, however, use it to devastating effect. Skill: Puncture Pull the arrow even further back for a more powerful shot that can also pierce shields.
Story: The Dragonriders were a proud and noble group of warriors who served the Old King of Want. They were the king's royal guard, and were required to be incredibly strong in order to draw and use their longbow. Few were able to master this weapon, but when they did, they were able to use it with devastating effect.

Item Description: .Twinblade of the Dragonriders, King Vendrick's royal guard. Twinblades are wielded with an unusual technique. This one strikes hard but is very heavy. Demands great skill of its wielder, and thus served to test the worthiness of those who aspired to join the Dragonriders.
Story: The Twinblade of the Dragonriders is a royal guard weapon that is wielded with an unusual technique. The user strikes hard but is very heavy, making it a demanding weapon to use. The Twinblade is used to test the worthiness of those who aspired to join the Dragonriders. Those who are able to wield the Twinblade with skill and finesse are considered worthy candidates and are given the opportunity to join the prestigious guard.

Item Description: Halberd of the Dragonriders, King Vendrick's royal guard. A highly versatile weapon that can slash, sweep, and thrust when wielded nimbly, and is also imbued with magic. Demands great skill of its wielder, and thus served to test the worthiness of those who aspire to join the Dragonriders.
Story: The Halberd of the Dragonriders is a royal guard weapon that is highly versatile and can slash, sweep, and thrust. It is also imbued with magic, which makes it a demanding weapon to use. Those who aspire to join the Dragonriders must prove their worthiness by mastering this weapon.

Item Description: Armor of a nameless king who was ally to the ancient dragons. The golden crown, buried amidst long strands of bristling ash, is said to closely resemble that of the First Lord. Dragon scales are razor-sharp and cannot be burned
Story: The armor of the nameless king was allied with the ancient dragons. The golden crown, buried amidst long strands of bristling ash, is said to closely resemble that of the First Lord. The armor is made of dragon scales that are razor-sharp and cannot be burned.

Item Description: A weapon made by sharpening a Gravel Stone scale, thought to be the source of ancient dragon immortality, into an unclouded blade. Alas, the Dragonkin Soldiers never attained immortality, and perished as decrepit, pale imitations of their skyborn kin.
Story: The Gravel Stone scale weapon was said to be the source of ancient dragon immortality. However, the Dragonkin Soldiers never managed to obtain this power and eventually perished as pale imitations of their skyborn kin.

Item Description: Ring of Oceiros, former king of Lothric. Reduces damage from backstabs. In his later years, Oceiros became fascinated with dragons. After going mad, he was more commonly known as the Consumed King. Many assassins were dispatched to his domain, but none returned. The Consumed King ascribed his resilience to the divine protection of the dragon scale.
Story: The Ring of Oceiros is a legendary ring that once belonged to the former king of Lothric, Oceiros. The ring is said to have the power to reduce damage from backstabs. One day, Oceiros went mad after becoming fascinated with dragons, and many assassins were dispatched to kill him. However, none of them returned. It is believed that the ring's protection was due to the fact that Oceiros was once married to a

Item Description: Golden Armor associated with Dragonslayer Ornstein, from the age of gods, and imbued with the strength of lightning. In the dragonless age, this knight, who long guarded the ruined cathedral, left the land in search of the nameless king.
Story: In the age of gods, a knight named Ornstein guarded the ruined cathedral. One day, he left the land in search of the nameless king. Now, in the dragonless age, he travels the world in search of a new challenge. One day, he met a young girl who claimed to be the nameless king's daughter. She offered to help him find the king, and together, they set out on a journey to find him.

Item Description: Giant dragon-hunting arrows, resembling iron spears. Used by Hawkeye Gough and his Dragonslayers, they puncture human flesh easily. Dragonslayer Arrows can only be used with the Dragonslayer Greatbow, and vice-versa.
Story: The Dragonslayer Arrows were created by Hawkeye Gough and his Dragonslayers. They are similar to iron spears, but are made specifically for hunting dragons. The arrows can easily pierce through the flesh of a dragon, and can only be used with the Dragonslayer Greatbow.

Item Description: A ranseur forged from the soul of the Old Dragonslayer. The spear of the knight known as the Dragonslayer was imbued with the power of lightning, and shattered the stone scales of dragons.
Story: The Dragonslayer was a legendary knight who fought against dragons. After slaying many dragons, the Dragonslayer's spear was imbued with the power of lightning. This spear shattered the stone scales of dragons, and made them vulnerable to attack.

Item Description: Large spear-like arrows created by the giant blacksmith of the gods. Can only be used with greatbows. These large arrows were said to have been used by dragon hunters during the age of the gods. Easily pierces human flesh.
Story: The large arrows were said to have been used by dragon hunters during the age of the gods. They were easily able to pierce through human flesh, making them a powerful weapon.

Item Description: Melted iron greataxe that once formed part of the Dragonslayer Armour. Thickly imbued with the power of lightning. Use skill to draw upon the techniques used to slay the archdragons. Skill: Falling Bolt Hold axe high in the air to gather fierce lightning, and smash ground to whip the bolts to the ground.
Story: The Dragonslayer Armour was a legendary set of armor that was said to have been forged from the scales of a dragon. The armor was so powerful that it was said to be able to draw upon the power of lightning to strike down enemies. The armor was so legendary that it was said to have been worn by the legendary hero, the Dragonslayer. The armor was so powerful that it was said to have been able to fall apart if it was ever damaged. However, the armor was so

Item Description: Greatbow used by the Dragonslayers during the age of gods. Far greater in size than any normal bow, and far more devastating. The bow must be anchored in the ground to be fired, a time consuming operation that leaves the operator vulnerable. Only specialized great arrows can be fired from the bow. Skill: Puncturing Arrow Masterfully fires off a great arrow that pierces through all enemies in its path, inflicting damage.
Story: The greatbow was used by the Dragonslayers during the age of gods. It was far greater in size than any normal bow and far more devastating. The bow must be anchored in the ground to be fired, a time consuming operation that left the operator vulnerable. Only specialized great arrows could be fired from the bow. The skill required to use the greatbow was so great that only the most skilled archers could use it. The greatbow was so powerful that it could pierce through

Item Description: Cross spear associated with Ornstein the Dragonslayer. A weapon of the gods imbued with the strength of lightning. Two-handed thrust utilizes the support of the cross and requires great might, but can pierce deep into the flesh of dragons, and send mere men flying. Skill: Lightning Charge Charge with spear at waist to enwreathe with lightning, then release bolts with final thrust.
Story: Ornstein the Dragonslayer wielded a cross spear that was imbued with the power of lightning. He used it to slay dragons with ease, but his greatest skill was in using the spear's charge to enwrap them in lightning, then releasing the bolts with his final thrust.

Item Description: Large spear-like arrows enveloped in lightning created by the giant blacksmith of the gods. Can only be used with greatbows. Lightning has been a weapon of dragonslayers ever since the time of Gwyn, the First Lord.
Story: The giant blacksmith of the gods created these arrows, only usable with greatbows. They are imbued with the power of lightning, and are the perfect weapon for slaying dragons.

Item Description: Cross spear born from the soul of Ornstein a Dragonslayer guarding Anor Londo cathedral. Inflicts lightning damage; effective against dragons. Two-handed thrust relies on cross and buries deep within a dragon's hide and sends human foes flying.
Story: The Cross Spear was forged from the soul of Ornstein, a Dragonslayer who guarded Anor Londo Cathedral. The Cross Spear is imbued with the power of lightning, and is effective against dragons. The Cross Spear is a two-handed thrust that relies on the cross formation to inflict damage deep within a dragon's hide. This weapon sends human foes flying.

Item Description: A dragon hunting weapon from the age of the gods. The earliest form of the cross spear, serving as both a sword and a spear. Its owner was the Nameless King, a deific hunter of dragons. The swordspear is imbued with lightning, of which he was the heir. Skill: Falling Bolt Hold swordspear high in the air to summon fierce lightning that descends upon distant foes.
Story: The Nameless King was a legendary dragon hunter who wielded a swordspear that was imbued with powerful lightning. He was the heir to the power of the gods, and his skill with the weapon was unmatched. One day, he met a dragon that was far too powerful for him to defeat. In desperation, he summoned the lightning from his swordspear and used it to destroy the dragon. Since then, the swordspear has been known as the Falling Bolt.

Item Description: Axe favored by Creighton the Wanderer, infamous deserter of the Knights of Mirrah. Called Dragonslayer's Axe for the lightning that pulsates within its blade, but Creighton used it to slay men.
Story: Creighton the Wanderer was a notorious deserter from the Knights of Mirrah. He was known for his axe, which was said to be blessed by a dragon. One day, Creighton met a woman named Elin who showed him the way to freedom. He left the knights behind and traveled the world, using his axe to slay any who would stand in his way.

Item Description: The beloved black axe of the gallant Shieldless Lothian, formerly of Forossa. No warrior matched the ferocity of unbeatable Lothian, but he abruptly retired from the battlefield and was never heard from again. Some say that he grew tired of the frailty of human foes, and set off to slay the legendary dragon.
Story: The Shieldless Lothian was a legendary warrior who retired from the battlefield. Some say that he set off to slay the legendary dragon.

Item Description: Black iron armor worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partake of communion. The cape is crafted with dragon wing membrane. Altered: From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe.
Story: The drake knights were once the most feared warriors in all of the land. They were the ones who hunted down and killed dragons, and they wore the armor and cape that showed the spoils of their kills. But one day, the drake knights disappeared. No one knows what happened to them, but some say that they turned into dragons themselves.

Item Description: This sword one of the rare dragon weapons is formed by a drake's tail. Drakes are seen as undeveloped imitators of the dragons but they are likely their distant kin. The sword is imbued with a mystical power, to be released when held with both hands
Story: The sword is a powerful weapon that was created by a drake's tail. The sword is imbued with a mystical power that can be released when it is held with both hands. The sword is said to be able to slay any dragon that it comes across.

Item Description: Armor of the Drakeblood Knights, worshippers of the blood of dragons. The red cloth is said to symbolize their yearning for blood. Dragon worship has captured the hearts and minds of warriors across the lands for many ages. Perhaps such warriors are attracted to doctrines of few words.
Story: The armor of the Drakeblood Knights is said to be made from the finest red cloth, signifying their desire for blood. The armor is said to be the perfect fit for those who worship dragons, as it is said to be incredibly strong and protective.

Item Description: Greatsword wielded by the Drakeblood Knights, led by the honorable Sir Yorgh. The insignia chiseled upon its hilt symbolizes dragon's blood. To the Drakeblood Knights, fresh dragon blood was sacrosanct. They believed that by obtaining it, they could achieve a true understanding of life, transcending their own banal existence.
Story: The Drakeblood Knights were a prestigious order of knights who swore allegiance to Sir Yorgh and his dragon blood. They believed that by obtaining dragon blood, they could achieve a true understanding of life, transcending their own banal existence. One day, Sir Yorgh's greatsword was stolen by a rival knight. In order to get it back, the Drakeblood Knights set out on a perilous journey to find the thief and recover the sword.

Item Description: Giant onyx helmet. Something dark indeed eats away at the drakekeepers, eternal guardians of the shrine
Story: The drakekeepers were always a proud and noble group, sworn to protect the shrine from any and all threats. But something dark was eating away at them, slowly but surely. They could feel their strength waning, their resolve weakening. They knew they had to find a way to stop the threat before it was too late.

Item Description: An extremely sturdy pitch-black great hammer. Colossal warriors staunchly watch over the shrine, ready to defend its resident, or allow one worthy enough to be granted audience.
Story: The great hammer is the most powerful weapon in the shrine. It is said that only the bravest and strongest warriors are allowed to wield it, and that they are sworn to protect the shrine's resident, whoever that may be. Any who dare to challenge the hammer's guardians will be met with a crushing defeat.

Item Description: Colossal warriors staunchly watch over the shrine, ready to defend its resident, or allow one worthy enough to be granted audience.
Story: The Colossal Warriors were created by a powerful wizard to protect the shrine of a powerful god. Anyone who wished to see the god must pass through the Colossal Warriors first.

Item Description: an extremely sturdy pitch-black straight sword. Colossal warriors staunchly watch over the shrine, ready to defend its resident, or allow one worthy enough to be granted audience.
Story: The sword was forged from the blackest iron, and was so sturdy that it could cut through anything. It was guarded by a legion of colossal warriors, who would protect the shrine's resident at all costs. Any warrior who was worthy enough could be granted audience with the sword's owner, and they would be able to learn its secrets.

Item Description: An extremely sturdy pitch-black greatsword. Colossal warriors staunchly watch over the shrine, ready to defend its resident, or allow one worth enough to be granted audience.
Story: The greatsword was forged from the blackest iron and was so large it could only be wielded by the most powerful warriors. It was said that the warriors guarding the shrine were so strong and fearless that they would stop at nothing to protect their deity.

Item Description: An extremely sturdy pitch-black war hammer. Colossal warriors staunchly watch over the shrine, ready to defend its resident, or allow one worthy enough to be granted audience.
Story: The war hammer was created by the gods themselves to be wielded by the most powerful warriors. It is said that only those who are worthy can pick it up and use it to defend the shrine. Whoever wields the war hammer is unrivaled in strength and power.

Item Description: A sword decorated with drake wings. Use strong attack to unleash its latent power. The blade of this sword is split into two, and is best swung in smashing motions rather than slices. Drakes are likely descendants of the ancient dragons, and although their strength pales in comparison to the what is described in legend, to mere humans they are still mighty beasts
Story: The sword is a powerful weapon that was once decorated with the wings of a dragon. The wings give the sword a latent power that can be unleashed with a strong attack. The sword is best used in smashing motions, as the wings make the sword much more powerful. The wings of the dragon are likely descendants of the ancient dragons, and although their strength pales in comparison to what is described in legend, to mere humans they are still mighty beasts.

Item Description: Armour of the Drang Knights, proclaimed descendents of the land known for the legend of the Linking of the Fire. Fine protection that is both light and strong, having been reinforced with rare geisteel. The Drang knights were once feared sellswords, until treason meant descending into the abyss, and they were seperated forever
Story: The Armour of the Drang Knights is a finely crafted piece of protection that is both light and strong. It was reinforced with rare geisteel, making it a formidable weapon against any foe. The Drang Knights were once feared sellswords, until treason meant descending into the abyss. They were seperated forever, and their armour is now coveted by those who seek to protect themselves from harm.

Item Description: Paired hammers of the Drang Knights, descendants from the land known for the legend of the Linking of the Fire. When the Drang Knights disbanded, they scattered across the lands as sellswords. They quickly became known for shieldless, aggressive tactics that struck fear in the hearts of men. Skill: Spin Bash Bash foes with a large spinning motion, and utilize momentum to transition into an overhanded strong attack smash.
Story: The Drang Knights were a group of warriors who were known for their aggressive fighting style. They were descendants of the people who lived in the land known for the legend of the Linking of the Fire. When the Drang Knights disbanded, they scattered across the lands as sellswords. They quickly became known for their shieldless, aggressive tactics that struck fear in the hearts of men. One day, a young Drang Knight named Link found himself in the company of a group of other

Item Description: Paired spears of the Drang Knights, proclaimed descendants from the land known for the legend of the Linking of the Fire. When the Drang Knights disbanded, they scattered across the lands as sellswords. They quickly became known for shieldless, aggressive tactics that struck fear in the hearts of men.
Story: The Drang Knights were a group of warriors who were said to be descendants of the land of Drang. They were known for their shieldless fighting style, which was said to be very effective. After the Drang Knights disbanded, many of them became mercenaries. They quickly became feared by many, because of their aggressive and fearless tactics.

Item Description: Greatsword of Drummond, Royal Army Captain. An old and unadorned sword,perhaps, but the pride and joy of this venerable captain. An heirloom passed from grandfather to father, and then from father to son. Drummond, and those before him, used this sword to repel those who would threaten their great land.
Story: The Greatsword of Drummond was passed down through the generations of Royal Army Captain Drummond. It was an old and unadorned sword, perhaps, but the pride and joy of this venerable captain. Drummond and those before him used this sword to repel those who would threaten their great land. One day, Drummond was called to fight in a great battle against an enemy that he had never faced before. He knew that he could not win without his Greatsword, so he

Item Description: It's blood red color and odor of rotting flesh doesn't suggest it, but this rare mushroom is invaluable for its medicinal properties. Savvy hunters only carry it for a short time, as it is said a terrible beast is attracted to it.
Story: The mushroom is coveted by hunters for its medicinal properties, but they know to be careful as it is said that a terrible beast is attracted to the scent of the mushroom.

Item Description: Dried finger with multiple knuckles. Shriveled but still warm. With this many knuckles, surely it cannot belong to anything human
Story: The finger is dried and brittle, but it still feels warm to the touch. It's clear that this finger has been in some sort of intense heat, and the multiple knuckles tell a story of a powerful hand. The finger is most likely from a human, but it's impossible to say for sure. What could have happened to this finger to make it so shriveled and damaged?

Item Description: Dried finger with multiple knuckles. Shriveled but still warm. With this many knuckles, surely it cannot belong to anything human
Story: The finger is dried and brittle, but it still feels warm to the touch. It's clear that this finger has been in some sort of intense heat, and the multiple knuckles tell a story of a powerful hand. The finger is most likely from a human, but it's impossible to say for sure. What could have happened to this finger to make it so shriveled and damaged?

Item Description: Root of a perennial herb native to the south. Restores HP for an extended duration. Info: Wild animals abhor the pungent odor of this root, but clerics on pilgrimage are keenly aware of the value of its powerful medicinal effects.
Story: A group of pilgrims journeying through the south come across a patch of this herb. One of the clerics takes a sniff of the root and is immediately repelled by the pungent odor. However, the power of the root's medicinal effects is too great to ignore, so they gather some of the root and take it with them on their journey. The root's powerful healing properties are a life-saver for the pilgrims, and they are grateful for it.

Item Description: A traditional Drangleic helmet. Belonged to Captain Drummond. In his day, King Vendrick was fair and just, and expected the same of his liegemen. This helm was proof of King Vendrick's trust, an honor, until his transfiguration. Drummond's ancestors have served Drangleic for generations, principally as defenders of the great fort, but Captain Drummond is the last in this proud line
Story: The Drummond family has served Drangleic for generations, and Captain Drummond is the last in the line. When Vendrick turns into a dragon, Drummond is the only one who can stop him. He takes the helm of the Drangleic helmet and sets out to stop Vendrick.

Item Description: Tool used in duels of judgement. Nulls effects of special area effects for a short time. Allfather Lloyd's knights lived in fear of his duels of judgement, in which verdicts were carried out by his Sword of Law.
Story: The Sword of Law was a powerful tool used in duels of judgement. It nullified the effects of special area effects for a short time. Allfather Lloyd's knights lived in fear of his duels of judgement, in which verdicts were carried out by his Sword of Law.

Item Description: Greataxe designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum. A weapon reserved for duelist champions, the charge attack is particularly ferocious.
Story: The greataxe was designed for gladiatorial combat. It was used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum. The charge attack is particularly ferocious, and can easily cleave through armor.

Item Description: A large excrement. Still rather warm. Throw at enemy to cause rapid onset of poison, but you too will be subjected to the same bane. Most warriors are loath to come near a thing like this, much less carry it around, but therein lies the advantage.
Story: You find yourself in the middle of a battlefield, the stench of death and feces overwhelming. You see an enemy warrior, and you know you can take him down with a well-placed throw of your feces. But before you can make your move, you feel a sudden onset of poison in your system. You know you're going to die, but you also know that your enemies will soon follow.

Item Description: Dried fecal waste material, moist on the inside. Throw at enemy to inflict toxin build-up, but also ups your own toxicity. Though the stench makes it difficult to carry on one's person, inflicting toxins on an enemy yields high damage over time. Perhaps some Undead have fond memories of waste. Or, perhaps not.
Story: The protagonist is a mercenary who is hired to assassinate a high-ranking official. As they approach their target, they notice a foul smell coming from the official's residence. They decide to take the opportunity to inflict toxins on the official, knowing that the toxins will slowly kill them over time. In the end, the protagonist kills the official and escapes with their life.

Item Description: This magic crown-shaped ring was granted to princess Dusk of Oolacile upon her birth. The ringstone allows its wearer to cast additional sorceries, but at the cost of one-half of HP.
Story: Dusk was born with a magic crown-shaped ring that granted her the ability to cast additional sorceries, but at the cost of one-half of her HP. As she grew older, Dusk discovered that the ring also drained her energy, slowly killing her. She desperately sought a way to remove the ring, but no one could help her.
