One day, she met a mysterious old woman who told her of a way to break the ring's curse. Dusk had to find the

Item Description: Leaf-colored crown ring bestowed upon the princess of Oolacile, ancient land of golden sorceries. Reduces consumption of FP, but also lowers HP. Oolacile is synonymous for its lost sorceries of which the xanthous sorcerers are dedicated scholars. This crown ring is a rare artifact of great magic heritage.
Story: The Leaf-colored Crown Ring bestowed upon the princess of Oolacile, ancient land of golden sorceries. This ring is a rare artifact of great magic heritage, and it reduces the consumption of FP by the wearer, but it also lowers the wearer's HP. The xanthous sorcerers of Oolacile are dedicated scholars of lost sorceries, and this ring is a remnant of their ancient magic.

Item Description: Greatshield with an eagle design. Lightest and easiest greatshield to handle. Greatshields are very stable and deflect attacks. But one cannot parry and instead bashes with the shield
Story: The greatshield with the eagle design is the lightest and easiest greatshield to handle. It is very stable and deflects attacks, but one cannot parry and instead bashes with the shield. This makes it perfect for those who want to stay safe while attacking.

Item Description: This large twin-bladed axe forged with bronze is a ceremonial weapon normally used in sacred rites. Millwood is a land of primitive earth worship where chieftain knights served as high priests.
Story: The twin-bladed axe is a ceremonial weapon that is normally used in sacred rites. It is made of bronze, and is owned by a chieftain knight who is a high priest in Millwood, a land of primitive earth worship. The chieftain knight uses the axe to perform ceremonies and sacrifices to the earth god.

Item Description: This special ring crafted in an Eastern land is made of gold, but with a wood grain crest on its surface. The ring slows the loss of weapon durability and is particularly useful to bearers of delicate swords crafted in the East.
Story: The ring is said to have been crafted in an Eastern land, and is said to be made of gold but with a wood grain crest on its surface. The ring is said to slow the loss of weapon durability, and is particularly useful to bearers of delicate swords crafted in the East.

Item Description: A wooden kite shaped shield. It is decorated with the ancient symbol of a double-headed eagle painted yellow. Wooden shields are lighter than metal shields but with lower physical damage reduction and reduced shield stability.
Story: The shield belonged to a long-dead king who ruled over a forgotten kingdom. Legend has it that the king was so skilled with the shield that he could deflect any attack. Even after death, the shield continued to protect its owner from harm.

Item Description: offers excellent defense, particulary versus slashing attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East. A distinctive armor made in an Eastern land. Exquisitely crafted, this armor offers excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East
Story: The armor was made in a land far to the east, and is specifically designed to offer excellent defense against slashing attacks. It is exquisitely crafted, and is a favorite of warriors in that region.

Item Description: Distinctive armor made in an Eastern land. The exquisite craftmanship and artistic design made these prized pieces in the collection of any nobleman. Offers excellent damage absorption, particularly from slashing attacks from katanas, which are commonly encountered threats in battles fought in the East.
Story: The armor was made in the East, a land known for its skilled craftsmen and beautiful art. The armor was specifically designed to protect the wearer from the slashing attacks of katanas, which are commonly used in battles in that region. The armor's excellent damage absorption makes it a valuable asset in any battle.

Item Description: A pointy, ragged hood. Worn by the knight Jerren. The hood hides an aged, bearded mask. Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.
Story: Jerren's hood is a sign of his allegiance to General Radahn. The old knight has a beard, but his face is hidden behind a mask, a reminder of the oath they made to one another. Jerren is a loyal servant of his commander, and he will do anything to protect him.

Item Description: Storied sword and treasure of Castle Sol that depicts an eclipsed sun drained of color. One of the legendary armaments. In Sol, the sight of an eclipse inspires a dreadful awe, preventing an onlooker from averting his gaze.
Story: The Storied Sword and Treasure of Castle Sol is a legendary armament that depicts an eclipsed sun. The sword is said to have been wielded by a hero who fought against the dark forces that threatened the kingdom. The treasure includes a necklace made of precious gems that once belonged to the queen.

Item Description: Frightful occult shield. Defends against divine weapons and lightning. In an ill-fated plot to destroy the very gods the followers of the occult once attempted to steal the power of Gravelord Nito the first of the dead.
Story: The occult shield was created by the followers of the occult in an attempt to steal the power of Gravelord Nito, the first of the dead. The shield was meant to protect against divine weapons and lightning, but in an ill-fated plot, they attempted to steal the power of Nito himself. The consequences of this attempt were disastrous, and the shield now defends against any divine weapons or lightning.

Item Description: Bitter sour chestnut. Removes parasitic egg from body. The egg-bearers have chosen to serve the Flame of Chaos and the eggs symbolize this selfless choice. Naturally these chestnuts are forbidden but are allowed under special circumstances
Story: A chestnut that removes parasitic eggs from the body is coveted by those who serve the Flame of Chaos. These chestnuts are only allowed under specific circumstances, but when they are available they are highly prized.

Item Description: Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.
Story: The Crown of Godfrey was the first Elden Lord's crown. It was said that when Godfrey was the lord of the battlefield, he led the War against the Giants. He faced the Storm Lord, alone, and then, it was said, his eyes faded to a dull blue. After that, he was known as the Crown of Godfrey.

Item Description: Pyromancy flame drawing upon the latent power of Quelana of Izalith, mother of pyromancy. For the pyromancer, a flame is a precious thing indeed, to be nurtured, often for an entire lifetime. When the flame is shared, it creates an eternal bond between the parties.
Story: The first time I saw her, she was a tiny, flickering flame in a metal pot. I was just a boy, and my father had taken me to see the great pyromancers of Izalith. I was fascinated by their flames, their power. I wanted to be just like them. So when I saw the little flame in the pot, I was drawn to it. I reached out to it, and when my hand touched it, the flame grew larger and

Item Description: A strange weapon found among malformed inhabitants of the Profaned Capital. The Profaned Flame was triggered by the curse of these women, relatives of a certain oracle, but despite their culpability, they went on living, without any cares. Skill: Feast Bell Hold up axe and wave to emit a solemn chime to temporarily make weapons lacerating, and to restore HP for each hit.
Story: The Feast Bell was found among the malformed inhabitants of the Profaned Capital. It was triggered by the curse of these women, relatives of a certain oracle, but despite their culpability, they went on living, without any cares. The Feast Bell is a strange weapon that emits a solemn chime to temporarily make weapons lacerating, and to restore HP for each hit.

Item Description: Twinned naginata forged in the Land of Reeds. Chosen weapon of Eleonora, Violet Bloody Finger. Her mastery of the sword was such that her onslaught was likened to a whirlwind, but now her legacy is stained by accursed blood. Unique Skill: Bloodblade Dance Leap at foe to perform a flurry of tornado-like attacks. Follow up with an additional input to perform an attack that ends in an evasive maneuver.
Story: The naginata was forged in the Land of Reeds, and was chosen as the weapon of Eleonora, Violet Bloody Finger. Her mastery of the sword was such that her onslaught was likened to a whirlwind, but now her legacy is stained by accursed blood. Her unique skill is Bloodblade Dance, which allows her to leap at her foe to perform a flurry of tornado-like attacks. Follow up with an additional input to perform an attack that ends in an evasive maneuver

Item Description: Curved sword forged from the Soul of Alsanna. Formed by two curious blades, this sword can restore an ally's HP with a hit from its strong attack. The enigmatic Alsanna quietly found a place at the Ivory King's side, and when his strength was fully drained, he conferred this sword inscribed with the name of the land, to her.
Story: The Curved Sword was forged from the soul of Alsanna, a mysterious woman who found her place at the side of the Ivory King. When his strength was fully drained, he bestowed this sword onto her, inscribed with the name of the land. The sword can restore an ally's HP with a strong attack.

Item Description: Armor of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite knight of Astora, based on the fire-warding heraldic symbol on its blue surcoat. Although he was loath to give up on his Undead mission, he perished at the Undead Asylum, and went Hollow
Story: The nameless knight's armor had been imbued with powerful fire-warding magic by the heraldic symbol on its blue surcoat. When the knight perished at the Undead Asylum, his armor became imbued with the same fire-warding magic, and was able to protect whoever wore it from the undead.

Item Description: Armor made of bradden steel. Provides sturdy defense, making it an old-time favorite of elite knights. Bradden steel is used widely in Drangleic. This fine alloy is made from ores mined in the southern kingdom
Story: The armor was made of bradden steel, a sturdy metal that was favored by elite knights. The armor provided sturdy defense, making it an old-time favorite of those who fought in Drangleic. The metal was made from ores mined in the southern kingdom of Drangleic.

Item Description: Specially treated dried mushroom. Creates a euphoric sensation when ingested, and restores a large amount of HP over time. Saint Elizabeth devoted her life to helping the needy by concocting medicine and potions. It's thought her great virtue was matched only by her sublime beauty, but who can say now?.
Story: Saint Elizabeth was a kind and compassionate woman who devoted her life to helping the needy. One day, a traveler came to her village asking for help. He claimed to have a magical mushroom that could create a euphoric sensation when ingested and restore a large amount of HP over time. Saint Elizabeth was hesitant to help, but she knew that she could not turn away someone in need. She decided to try the mushroom and was amazed by the results. Now, she spends her days helping the needy

Item Description: Large medicinal mushroom of Elizabeth keeper of the sanctuary. Eating this mushroom invigorates the flesh and greatly restores HP for a limited duration. Its dramatic effect can make the difference between a warrior's life and death
Story: The large medicinal mushroom was found by Elizabeth, the keeper of the sanctuary. She was excited to find it, as it would invigorate the flesh and greatly restore HP for a limited duration. The dramatic effect of this mushroom could make the difference between a warrior's life and death.

Item Description: Armor of Lautrec the Embraced, representing the goddess Fina's love. During his solitude, he forsook everything, for he believed in the goddess's love for him. The goddess's arms wrap around it, as if to embrace the wearer
Story: Lautrec the Embraced is a famed painter who has dedicated his life to his art. One day, he falls into a deep depression after he realizes that he has lost the love of his life, Fina. One night, he has a dream in which the goddess Fina comes to him and tells him that she still loves him. In response, Lautrec embraces her in a passionate embrace, symbolizing his newfound faith in the goddess's love.

Item Description: Empty invertebrate shell that is said to be a familiar of a Great One. The Healing Church has discovered a great variety of invertebrates, or phantasms, as they are called. Shells with slime still harbour arcane power, and can be rubbed on weapons to imbue them with their strength.
Story: The Healing Church had been searching for a way to restore the kingdom's power. They had been using all sorts of arcane rituals and tools, but nothing seemed to be working. Then, one of their priests found an empty invertebrate shell. He rubbed it on his weapon and it suddenly became infused with power. The kingdom was saved and the priest was hailed as a hero.

Item Description: Empty invertebrate shell that is said to be a familiar of a Great One. The Healing Church has discovered a great variety of invertebrates, or phantasms, as they are called. Shells with slime still harbour arcane power, and can be rubbed on weapons to imbue them with their strength.
Story: The Healing Church had been collecting invertebrate shells for years, believing that they held great power. One day, they discovered a particularly large and powerful invertebrate shell and decided to test its power. They rubbed the shell on a weapon, and the weapon became infused with its power.

Item Description: Ember required for weapon ascension.This enchanted ember, a form of sorcery, is a vestige of the lost land of Oolacile
Story: The ember is a key to ascending to a higher level of weapon mastery. It is said to be a remnant of the lost land of Oolacile, and as such is imbued with powerful sorcery. Whoever possesses the ember will be able to wield powerful weapons with ease.

Item Description: An enlarged head of a patient of the Cathedral, with a cavity that just happens to fit a human head, although one would be mad to try it on. But if you do, listen carefully, for the sticky sound. Drip, drop. As water, seeping up from the depths, slowly, steadily.
Story: The Cathedral is a place of worship for all things holy. It is a place of peace and tranquility, a place where people come to pray and reflect. But there is one place in the Cathedral that is not as it seems. The head of a patient, enlarged by the Cathedral's magic, is kept in a glass case in the Cathedral's basement. The head is always clean and shiny, but a small, dark cavity has been growing in the center of the head.

Item Description: Fanned golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt. Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.
Story: The golden horn of the Oracle Envoys is a profoundly weighty artifact that is said to be incapable of being sounded by a mere human. It is unknown when or if the horn should be sounded, but its powerful blows are sure to be felt.

Item Description: Golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt. Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.
Story: The Golden Horn of the Oracle Envoys is a profoundly weighty artifact that is said to be able to make a powerful impact. It is unknown if the horn can be sounded by a mere human, or if it is still too early for its call to be heard. Regardless, the horn is an important part of the Oracle Envoys' history and mythology.

Item Description: Long golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt. Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.
Story: The Oracle Envoys are a set of incredibly powerful golden horns that are said to be able to call forth the gods. However, the horns are said to be too powerful for a mere human to use, so they are kept locked away by the Oracle Envoys. One day, a young man named Luke discovers the horns and decides to use them to call forth the gods. However, before he can do so, he is interrupted by the Oracle Envoys. They explain that

Item Description: An erdsteel dagger with a grass crest engraved upon its blade. Carried by the Erdtree royalty for self-defense in times of peace. Though forged to a high standard, the weapon is difficult to wield. Attack power also scales with faith.
Story: The grass crest on the dagger is a symbol of the Erdtree royalty. It is said that the crest was carved into the blade by the first Erdtree king, in order to ensure that his own weapon would be the most powerful in times of peace. However, the weapon's power is not just based on its design - the more faith a person has in using it, the more powerful their attacks will be.

Item Description: Longbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Arrow. Scales all arrow damage with faith, revealing its true worth when used with holy-infused arrows.
Story: The longbow featured Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Arrow. The scales all arrow damage with faith, revealing its true worth when used with holy-infused arrows.

Item Description: Greatbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Great Arrow. Scales all arrow damage with faith, revealing its true worth when used with holy-infused arrows.
Story: The Erdtree Greatbow was a legendary weapon created by the elves in conjunction with the Golden Great Arrow. The Erdtree Greatbow was said to have scales that increased the damage dealt by arrows with faith imbued within them. Only the most powerful of elves could use this weapon with true effectiveness, and even then, it was not without risk.

Item Description: A formless sacred seal decorated with an Erdtree crest, once the focus of religion in the Lands Between. Even though the Elden Ring is shattered, and the Erdtree has dulled from its former radiance, earnest faith continues to hold the answers.
Story: The Erdtree was a sacred tree in the Lands Between. It was once the focus of religion, but now it's faded and people no longer believe in it. However, some people still believe in it and they keep the seal that was once around the tree.

Item Description: worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. The surcoat bears a majestic likeness of the Erdtree. Its golden backing is an honor bestowed on no other soldiers.
Story: The Erdtree surcoat is a prestigious garment worn by soldiers sworn to protect the royal capital of Leyndell. The golden backing of this surcoat is an honor bestowed only on the bravest and most skilled soldiers in the kingdom.

Item Description: Commonplace robe made of thick cloth. Worn by the Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm, one of the first Tarnished to visit Roundtable Hold. A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.
Story: Wilhelm was a powerful sorcerer who sought to learn more about the primeval current. He made contact with it, but was then taken prisoner by Vargram.

Item Description: Thrusting sword of Chancellor Wellager. Forged with rare geisteel. A masterpiece of the great blacksmith Llewellyn that he brought along as a gift when he left Mirrah for Drangleic.
Story: Chancellor Wellager's thrusting sword is a masterpiece of blacksmithing. It is made of rare geisteel, and is said to be the sharpest sword in all of Drangleic.

Item Description: The largest of the thrusting swords. Can pierce an armored knight in one thrust. The blade is also sharp, allowing slicing as well.
Story: The largest sword in the kingdom was the thrusting sword. It was said that if it was used correctly, it could pierce an armored knight in one thrust. The blade was also sharp, allowing for slicing as well.

Item Description: The Undead treasure these dull green flasks. Fill with Estus at Bonfire. Fills HP. The Estus Flasks are linked to the Fire Keepers. The Dark Tales also make reference: An emerald flask from the Keeper's soul. She lives to protect the flame and dies to protect it further
Story: The Undead treasure these Estus Flasks. They are linked to the Fire Keepers and can be used to refill HP at Bonfires. In Dark Souls, the Estus Flasks are also mentioned in relation to the Dark Keepers. These flasks are said to come from the Keeper's soul, and they serve as a reminder of her death in order to protect the flame.

Item Description: The shard of an Estus Flask. Shards are deeply soaked in Estus. Graft the shard to an Estus Flask to increase flask uses. Over the ages, countless souls rested their bones as they drank from the original flask. And now this shard remains, serving as a vestige of their hopes and dreams.
Story: The shard of an Estus Flask is a remnant of a bygone era. It is soaked in the blood of the dead, and its power is drawn from the hopes and dreams of those who have passed. By grafting the shard to an Estus Flask, the user can increase the number of uses of the flask.

Item Description: A green ring crafted from shards. Increases HP restored by Estus Flask. This ring was entrusted to a certain Fire Keeper, but in the end she never met her champion, and the ensuing tragic farce became a favorite tale of the masses.
Story: The ring is a gift from a Fire Keeper to her champion, but the champion never arrives. The Fire Keeper eventually dies, but her story is still told and her ring is still treasured.

Item Description: An extremely rare rapid-firing crossbow. Fire three successive bolts. Inflict heavy damage by making all three shots count. Fiorenza, the richest merchant in all of Volgen recreated this lost weapon after reading of it in an old book.
Story: Fiorenza had always been fascinated by old books, and when she found an old tome on crossbows she knew she had to have it. She read about the weapon's history and how it was incredibly powerful. She decided to recreate it and sell it to the highest bidder. Anyone who could shoot three bolts in a row quickly and accurately would be able to inflict serious damage. Fiorenza set up a display in her shop and waited for someone to challenge her.

Item Description: Robe of an evangelist sent from the cathedral. These teachers, all women, came to enlighten inhabitants of the Undead Settlement and sent carriers on the path of sacrifice.
Story: The robe worn by the evangelist is a sign of hope and salvation. The teachers who sent her were women who believed in the power of redemption and wanted to bring light to the dark souls of the undead settlement. They believed that by sacrificing themselves, they could help to save others.

Item Description: Steel armor of Horace the Hushed, who took a liking to its cold, bulky insides. The original owner was said to be a corrupt executioner, who was killed and stripped of his armor. Horace is one of only two children to escape Aldrich's clutches.
Story: Horace the Hushed was a corrupt executioner who took a liking to the cold, bulky insides of his steel armor. One day, he was killed and stripped of his armor. Horace is one of only two children to escape Aldrich's clutches. He now uses his armor to protect the innocent people of his home town from the wickedness of the world.

Item Description: Attire worn by the band of executioners commanded by the martyr Logarius. Later became the basis for all Church attire, with its heavy draping of Holy Shawl. As the great Logarius once said, Acts of goodness are not always wise, and acts of evil are not always foolish, but regardless, we shall always strive to be good.
Story: The executioners of the martyr Logarius wore heavy, draping robes made of holy cloth. These robes became the basis for all Church attire, with its heavy draping of Holy Shawl.

Item Description: Black Helmet/Armor/Gauntlets/Leggings worn by the executioner of the Undead Purgatory. The spikes are designed to evoke fear. The executioner mercilessly put down countless Undead, but how could he know that it was never his own will, but that of the chariot horse?
Story: The black armor and gauntlets of the executioner of the Undead Purgatory are designed to evoke fear in the hearts of the undead. The spikes on the armor and gauntlets are meant to cause pain and anguish, as the executioner mercilessly put down countless Undead. However, the true reason for the spikes may never be known - they may just be a result of the horse's will.

Item Description: One of the secret treasures hidden in Cainhurst. The gloves of an executioner from a faraway land. Passed from executioner father to executioner son, these gloves can be used to summon wrathful spirits of the past by smearing them with blood. It is said that the nobles found immeasurable delight in the dances of these vengeful specters.
Story: The gloves of an executioner are said to be able to summon wrathful spirits of the past. When worn, they can be smeared with blood to invoke their power. The nobles of Cainhurst found great delight in the dances of these specters.

Item Description: One of the secret treasures hidden in Cainhurst. The gloves of an executioner from a faraway land. Passed from executioner father to executioner son, these gloves can be used to summon wrathful spirits of the past by smearing them with blood. It is said that the nobles found immeasurable delight in the dances of these vengeful specters.
Story: The gloves of an executioner are a coveted treasure in Cainhurst. Passed down from father to son, these gloves can be used to summon wrathful spirits of the past by smearing them with blood. It is said that the nobles found immeasurable delight in the dances of these vengeful specters.

Item Description: Bulky cleaver welded to a long haft. Said to have been used to dispatch the remnants of defeated armies, felling them like timber. Perhaps that is the reason it excels at critical hits.
Story: The bulky cleaver is said to have been used to dispatch the remnants of defeated armies, felling them like timber. It is said to have been welded to a long haft, giving it an advantage when it comes to critical hits.

Item Description: Greatsword of a debauched executioner used for beheadings. This sword retains a keen memory of its executioner's duty, and absorbs HP from each fallen foe.
Story: The greatsword of a debauched executioner is a fearsome weapon that retains a keen memory of its previous user's duty. Whenever it kills a foe, the sword absorbs their HP, making it an incredibly powerful tool for taking down even the most powerful enemies.

Item Description: Damaged iron gauntlets. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.
Story: The iron gauntlets are a relic from the penal colonies. They are battered and worn, but still hold the power to protect. The wearer of these gauntlets is a soldier who has been sent to the harshest of environments. They are a reminder of the strength and courage that can be found in the most difficult of circumstances.

Item Description: Bloodstained greatsword wielded by one of the Watchdogs of Farron, who preside over the slumber of fallen warriors. The blade is a reminder of the exile's past misdeeds. Inhuman strength is required to wield this heaviest of curved Greatsword. Skill: Spin Slash Slice into foes with a large spinning motion, and continue spinning to transition into a strong attack.
Story: The Bloodstained greatsword is a heavy curved sword that is wielded by one of the Watchdogs of Farron, who preside over the slumber of fallen warriors. The sword is a reminder of the exile's past misdeeds, and the strength required to wield it is inhuman. The sword's skill is in its spin slash, which can slice into foes with a large spinning motion, and continue spinning to transition into a strong attack.

Item Description: Mask of the watchdogs of Farron's Keep. After the Legion's Watchers became Lords of Cinder, the wolf blood dried up, and Farron was consumed by a festering wood. Within the wood, an emaciated old wolf commands watchdogs to defend the sanctity of sleeping warriors. Both the exiles were surely watchdogs themselves, for Farron has always been a land of itinerants.
Story: The Mask of the Watchdogs of Farron's Keep is a relic of the Watchers, a group of wolf-blooded warriors who were consumed by a festering wood after the Legion's victory over the kingdom of Farron. The old wolf who commands the watchdogs within the wood is likely an exile himself, for Farron has always been a land of travelers.

Item Description: Bolts that explode on impact. Deals area fire damage in the immediate vicinity. Due to the risk of detonation, the amount of bolts the user can carry is greatly limited. These are, after all, prototypes created by the weapon craftsman Edmond. You get what you pay for.
Story: Edmond was a weapon craftsman who specialized in creating bolts that would explode on impact, dealing area fire damage. Unfortunately, due to the risk of detonation, he was only able to create a limited number of these bolts. As a result, they are highly prized by those who can afford them, and are often used in battle as a last resort.

Item Description: Lure phantoms from other worlds. The dreadful Eyes of Death spread disaster across neighboring worlds. Phantoms lured to the world may end up as victims, allowing the Eyes of Death to multiply, and leading to further proliferation of bane.
Story: The Eyes of Death are a terrible force that plague neighboring worlds. Phantoms from other worlds are drawn to the world, and may end up as victims. If enough Phantoms are killed, the Eyes of Death will multiply and cause even more destruction. A group of adventurers must find a way to stop the Eyes of Death before they can spread further.

Item Description: Lure phantoms from other worlds. The dreadful Eyes of Death spread disaster across neighboring worlds. Phantoms lured to the world may end up as victims, allowing the Eyes of Death to multiply, and leading to further proliferation of bane.
Story: The Eyes of Death are a terrible force that plague neighboring worlds. Phantoms from other worlds are drawn to the world, and may end up as victims. If enough Phantoms are killed, the Eyes of Death will multiply and cause even more destruction. A group of adventurers must find a way to stop the Eyes of Death before they can spread further.

Item Description: An eye pendant which unlocks the surgery altar. There are two cathedrals in the Hunter's Dream. One lies past the River of Blood, and another contains the private research hall of the Healing Church. Only chosen members of the Healing Church, or their lamentable patients can enter the research hall, using this eye.
Story: The eye pendant is a key to the surgery altar. It is said that the cathedrals in the Hunter's Dream - one past the River of Blood, and another containing the private research hall of the Healing Church - are connected. Only chosen members of the Healing Church, or their lamentable patients, can enter the research hall using this key.

Item Description: An eye pendant which unlocks the surgery altar. There are two cathedrals in the Hunter's Dream. One lies past the River of Blood, and another contains the private research hall of the Healing Church. Only chosen members of the Healing Church, or their lamentable patients can enter the research hall, using this eye.
Story: The Healing Church has long been known for its miraculous healing abilities. But some believe that the church's secrets go even deeper than that. Some say that the Healing Church has access to an altar that allows them to perform surgery on humans without any harm. If this is true, then the church must keep this altar a secret, for only those who are chosen can access it. One day, a member of the Healing Church lost an eye in a fight. When he went to the Healing Church

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. A transcription of Eye, as spoken by left-behind Great Ones. Allows one to make additional discoveries. Eyes symbolize the truth Master Willem sought in his research. Disillusioned by the limits of human intellect, Master Willem looked to beings from higher planes for guidance, and sought to line his brain with eyes in order to elevate his thoughts.
Story: Caryll's Runes: A transcription of Eye, as spoken by left-behind Great Ones. Allows one to make additional discoveries. Eyes symbolize the truth Master Willem sought in his research. Disillusioned by the limits of human intellect, Master Willem looked to beings from higher planes for guidance, and sought to line his brain with eyes in order to elevate his thoughts.

Item Description: A pair of dark eyes. Said to be the eyes of the first Fire Keeper, and the light that was lost by all Fire Keepers to come. It reveals to the sightless Fire Keepers things that they should never see.
Story: The eyes of the first Fire Keeper are said to be the eyes of the devil himself. They reveal to the sightless Fire Keepers things that they should never see, including the location of the Fire Keeper's lost light. Whoever possesses the eyes is able to control the Fire Keepers and use their power for their own gain.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. This transcription of the Great Ones' inhuman voices ripples like a watery reflection. This rune means Lake, and those branded by it enjoy augmented defense. Great volumes of water serve as a bulwark guarding sleep, and an augur of the eldritch Truth. Overcome this hindrance, and seek what is yours.
Story: Caryll left this rune for those who seek to understand the Great Ones. The rune is said to represent Lake, and those who are branded by it enjoy augmented defense. The rune is also said to be an augur of the eldritch Truth, and can be used to overcome obstacles.

Item Description: An altered state of titanite. Use to imbue weapons with magic, or to provide magic reduction to shields. Sorcerers at the Melfian Magic Academy once attempted to imbue titanite with various elements, but are said to have failed. Someone must have succeeded though; what else would explain this stone?
Story: The stone is said to have been used by the Melfian Magic Academy to imbue weapons with magic. However, the sorcerers were never able to complete the task. Now, someone has found a way to do it, and the stone is being used to provide magic reduction to shields.

Item Description: A giant dragon tooth used as a great hammer. As solid as a boulder, this tooth is said to be taken from a dragon, but the truth of this claim is unclear. What is certain is that is bears some mystical power, and its wielder gains resistance to magic and fire.
Story: The giant dragon tooth used as a great hammer is said to be taken from a dragon, but the truth of this claim is unclear. What is certain is that this tooth is solid as a boulder and bears some mystical power. The wielder of this tooth gains resistance to magic and fire.

Item Description: Small, curved sword. Each hit inflicts little damage, but fluid chain attacks are deadly. The falchion's sharp slashing attacks are effective against cloth and flesh, but not against metal armor or tough scales.
Story: The falchion is a small, curved sword that inflicts little damage with each hit, but its chain attacks are deadly against cloth and flesh. However, its sharp slashing attacks are ineffective against metal armor or tough scales.

Item Description: Gloves worn by the Volgen Falconers. Domestic Volgen soldiers are infamously timid, so it is no wonder that this fierce band of mercenary falconers was hired to compensate. In practice they serve as bodyguards for the affluent elite, and they serve well, such that nobody dares scrutinize their backgrounds.
Story: The gloves worn by the Volgen Falconers are a fearsome sight. They are domestic Volgen soldiers, infamously timid, so it is no wonder that this fierce band of mercenary falconers was hired to compensate. In practice, they serve as bodyguards for the affluent elite, and they serve well, such that nobody dares scrutinize their backgrounds.

Item Description: Armor of an order of fallen knights who disbanded and fled but met untimely deaths. The drab, tattered cloth conceals tough, black metal which provides dependable protection from fire. It is just possible to make out the majestic gold engravings on its surface.
Story: The armor belonged to a group of knights who had disbanded after a battle. They were killed in a fire, and their armor was left behind. Now, centuries later, someone finds the armor and decides to wear it. The armor is incredibly protective, and it even has gold engravings on it. The person feels like a king or queen when they wear the armor, and they feel like they can take on anything.

Item Description: Part of a Falling star Beast's jaw, hard and shining black, fashioned into a weapon. With its sharp point, this colossal weapon can skewer foes.
Story: The Falling Star Beast's jaw was a fearsome weapon, its point sharp and deadly. It was said that with this weapon, the Falling Star Beast could easily skewer its enemies.

Item Description: Three bludgeoning copper heads attached to a handle by chains. Signature weapon of Necromancer Garris, the heretical sage. The heads were made to resemble those of his wife and two children.
Story: The Necromancer Garris used these copper heads as his signature weapon. He would swing them around like a club, striking his enemies with deadly force. The heads were made to resemble those of his wife and two children, in order to remind him of the people he loved.

Item Description: Armor blessed by the war god Faraam. armor is designed in the style of the Lion Knights, a once-mighty order from Forossa. Although the Lion Knights wore heavy armor, they were feared for their nimble two-handed swordplay. But their legacy was cut short with the fall of Forossa.
Story: The armor is blessed by the war god Faraam and is designed in the style of the Lion Knights, a once-mighty order from Forossa. Although the Lion Knights wore heavy armor, they were feared for their nimble two-handed swordplay. But their legacy was cut short with the fall of Forossa.

Item Description: This set pf Gauntlets after a god of war. The armor of the Forossa Lion Knights was preserved even after the destruction of their homeland, and is mentioned in numerous legends, alongside the names of those who are said to have gone beyond death.
Story: The Forossa Lion Knights were a proud and noble order of warriors who fought for their homeland of Forossa. After their homeland was destroyed, the Lion Knights were said to have traveled to the afterlife, where they were granted powerful armor by a god of war. These gauntlets are a remnant of that legend, and are coveted by warriors everywhere.

Item Description: Greatsword of the Abyss watchers which is atypically paired with a dagger. The dagger is utilized as a wedge in the left hand while the greatsword is held in the right, a unique technique that was synonymous with the Undead Legion. Confounds foes the manner of wolves hunting prey. Skill: Parry Deflect an attack when timed properly and follow up with a critical hit, executed with the dagger.
Story: The greatsword of the Abyss watchers is a legendary weapon that is atypically paired with a dagger. The dagger is utilized as a wedge in the left hand while the greatsword is held in the right, a unique technique that was synonymous with the Undead Legion. The greatsword is said to confound foes the manner of wolves hunting prey. If timed properly, the user can deflect an attack with the dagger and follow up with a critical hit, executed with the greatsword.

Item Description: Red feather arrows of the Lord's hunters. Their long range makes them effective for sniping.
Story: The Lord's hunters are a group of elite archers who use red feather arrows to take down their prey from a great distance. These arrows are incredibly accurate, making them perfect for taking down targets that are out of reach for most other weapons.

Item Description: Robe of black cloth that covers the entire body. Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home. The fabric itself is soft as silk and thin enough that those embraced can feel every pulse; every bit of her warmth.
Story: Fia had always been a curious girl. She loved to explore and learn as much as she could. So when she was exiled from her home, she was determined to find out everything she could about the world. She spent her days wandering the forests and the plains, and her nights studying under the best teachers she could find. One night, Fia happened upon a group of travelers who were on their way to a faraway land. They were dressed in strange robes, and

Item Description: Shoes worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers. The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.
Story: The shoes worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers are coveted by many. They are said to be the shoes worn by the maidens who served the Two Fingers long ago. The maidens who serve the Two Fingers share their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers. The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Item Description: A sacred seal bestowed by a Finger Maiden which serves as a catalyst for casting sacred incantations. Incantations must be memorized first at a site of grace, and a sacred seal must be equipped to cast them.
Story: The sacred seal bestowed by a Finger Maiden is a catalyst for casting sacred incantations. The seal is equipped to be used at a site of grace, and the user must memorize the incantations before using them.

Item Description: Iron armor singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?
Story: Vyke was a knight of the Roundtable Hold and was one of the closest to the throne of the Elden Lord. One day, he traveled far below the capital and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. It is unknown what caused him to go mad, but it is clear that his choice was not for his maiden.

Item Description: Arrows fired with flaming tips. Inflicts fire damage.
Story: The arrows were fired from the bow of a fiery-tempered warrior. The fiery tips caused fire damage as they flew through the air.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Found in rare cases inside demons. Fire weapons inflict fire damage, but lose scaling effects
Story: The gem was found inside a demon. It was said that this gem was infused with titanite, a rare material that could only be found inside demons. When fired from a fire weapon, the gem would inflict fire damage, but the scaling effects would be lost.

Item Description: Greatarrows imbued with fire. Tipped with Charcoal Pine Resin. Weapons fortified with fire are effective against against foes vulnerable to fire, such as Undead or beasts.* If your require magic but have learned none yourself, these will serve you well.
Story: The greatarrows were tipped with charcoal pine resin, and were imbued with fire. They were weapons that were effective against foes vulnerable to fire, such as Undead or beasts. If you were in need of magic but had not learned it yourself, these greatarrows would be a great help.

Item Description: Robe, Manchettes and Skirt worn by the guardian of the shrine. The Fire Keepers were robbed of light, to better serve as vessels for souls. Only those who cherish the writhing, searing darkness were given the keeper's black attire.
Story: The robe, manchettes and skirt worn by the guardian of the shrine were once a source of light, but now they are used to imprison those who cherish the darkness. The robe is made of a material that is both tough and flexible, making it perfect for defending oneself. The manchettes and skirt are made of a different material that is both fireproof and resistant to water.

Item Description: Soul of a long-lost Fire Keeper. Each Fire Keeper is a corporeal manifestation of her bonfire and a draw for the humanity which is offered to her. Her soul is gnawed by infinite humanity and can boost the power of the precious Estus Flask. Reinforced Estus Flasks capture denser Estus allowing for increased restoration of HP
Story: The Soul of a long-lost Fire Keeper is a powerful artifact that can boost the power of Estus Flasks. The Fire Keepers were the spiritual guardians of the bonfires that were used to restore the health of humanity. Their souls were consumed by the endless need for human sacrifice, and their spirits became corrupted by the power of the Estus Flask.

Item Description: Soul of a Fire Keeper who is said to have returned from the Abyss. This Fire Keeper preserves the bonfire, and serves its champion. She is said to have soothed and accepted the dark sigil, which has tainted her soul. And yet, her soul will one day embed itself in the bosom another Fire Keeper.
Story: The Soul of a Fire Keeper who is said to have returned from the Abyss. She preserves the bonfire, and serves its champion. She is said to have soothed and accepted the dark sigil, which has tainted her soul. And yet, her soul will one day embed itself in the bosom another Fire Keeper.

Item Description: Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth. Attire of the Fire Monks. The grotesque face sculpted on the chest is said to depict the corrupt ancient god of the flame. Taboos transform into lasting obsessions by virtue of the fear that they inspire.
Story: The Fire Monks are a religious order that follow the worship of a flame-wielding god. The grotesque face sculpted on their armor is said to depict the corrupt ancient god of the flame. The Fire Monks are feared and despised by most, but their Taboos transform into lasting obsessions by virtue of the fear that they inspire.

Item Description: Coarse paper that applies fire to weapons when rubbed. A hunter tool found in the Healing Church workshop. Since the tragedy that struck Old Yharnam, fire has become a staple in beast hunts, and is thought to cleanse impurity. Certain types of beasts have an abnormal fear of flame.
Story: The hunter tool was found in the Healing Church workshop. It is made of coarse paper that can be rubbed to create fire. The fire is thought to cleanse impurity, and is especially useful in beast hunts. Certain beasts have a fear of fire, making this tool a valuable asset in hunting them.

Item Description: Helm engraved with a sacred countenance and housing a cauldron. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks. It is said the cauldron perched atop the head was originally furnished with embers, and would surge into flames when the wearer's faith reached its zenith. The fire of this cauldron has since died out, however.
Story: The Helm of the Fire Prelates is a sacred artifact that once housed a cauldron filled with embers. The cauldron would flare up with fire when the wearer's faith reached its zenith, symbolizing their power and authority as leaders of the Fire Monks. However, the fire of the cauldron has since died out, leaving the Helm as a relic of the past.

Item Description: A tiny waning flame. Used to strengthen a pyromancy flame. A pyromancy flame serves as the catalyst for pyromancies, and scales the strength of each spell according to its level. Fire is a common object of worship, It can never be grasped, and its mystery stokes human imagination.
Story: A tiny waning flame is used to strengthen a pyromancy flame. The flame scales the strength of each spell according to its level.

Item Description: Gloves of witches who bore the Profaned Flame, now harrowed spirits of Irithyll. The witches who lead the Pontiff's Knights were originally ordained as holy knights. It was not long however, before their hearts were swallowed by the Profaned Flame
Story: The gloves were once the hands of witches who bore the Profaned Flame, a sacred relic that burned with the power to purify evil. Now, the gloves are haunted by the spirits of the witches who bore the flame, and they are used by the Pontiff's Knights to harrow the spirits of Irithyll.

Item Description: Bisque urn filled with black powder. Explodes, inflicting fire damage. Though this urn is a crude and commonplace weapon, it owes its continued usage to its simplicity and effectiveness in a variety of situations.
Story: A Bisque urn filled with black powder. Though it is a crude and commonplace weapon, the bisque urn owes its continued usage to its simplicity and effectiveness in a variety of situations. One day, a group of adventurers were travelling through the forest when they came across a group of bandits. The urn was hidden amongst the bandit's belongings, and when they lit the powder inside, it exploded, inflicting fire damage on the bandits.

Item Description: An altered state of titanite. Use to imbue weapons with fire, or to provide fire reduction to shields. Sorcerers at the Melfian Magic Academy once attempted to imbue titanite with various elements, but are said to have failed. Someone must have succeeded though; what else would explain this stone?
Story: The stone is said to have the power to imbue weapons with fire, or to provide fire reduction to shields. It is said that sorcerers at the Melfian Magic Academy once attempted to imbue titanite with various elements, but failed. Someone must have succeeded though, as the stone exists now.

Item Description: Armor of the Soul of Cinder, a deific manifestation of the Lords of Cinder, who linked the First Flame. It resembles a knight's armor, but bears hideous burns and contortions..A mishappen crown can be seen upon its Helm. The Armor taking the shape of a deathly ribcage. It exists as a symbol of the great Lords and the noble act of linking the fire, though it is no more than an empty husk.
Story: The Armor of the Soul of Cinder is a divine manifestation of the Lords of Cinder. It is a knight's armor, but it bears hideous burns and contortions. A mishappen crown can be seen upon its Helm. The Armor taking the shape of a deathly ribcage. It exists as a symbol of the great Lords and the noble act of linking the fire, though it is no more than an empty husk.

Item Description: The Lords of Cinder linked the First Flame, and this Greatsword was wielded by their deific manifestation. This coiled sword, found thrust in the bonfire, existed long before the throneless lords themselves. Skill: Ember The fading flame momentarily illuminates and launches itself forward.
Story: The Lords of Cinder were the first to link the First Flame, and this Greatsword was wielded by their deific manifestation. The Greatsword was found thrust in the bonfire, existing long before the throneless lords themselves. The Greatsword's flame fades momentarily, but it illuminates and launches itself forward, incinerating anything in its path.

Item Description: Badge crafted by the Oto Workshop, precursor to the workshop of the heretical Powder Kegs. The Powder Kegs were driven by singular ideas, and crafted strange weapons of great intricancy. It is clear that the philosophy of the Powder Kegs was already established at this time.
Story: The Badge crafted by the Oto Workshop was a precursor to the workshop of the heretical Powder Kegs. The philosophy of the Powder Kegs was driven by singular ideas, and their weapons of great intricacy were a testament to that. It is clear that the Powder Kegs were a force to be reckoned with, and their work is a testament to that.

Item Description: Weapon consisting of a bludgeoning head attached to a handle by chain. The iron ball is spiked and induces blood loss. Blows from this weapon cannot be parried. The charge attack whirls the iron ball around for increased force before striking.
Story: The weapon is called the Bloody Cleaver. It is a fearsome weapon, consisting of a bludgeoning head attached to a handle by chain. The iron ball is spiked and induces blood loss. Blows from this weapon cannot be parried. The charge attack whirls the iron ball around for increased force before striking. The Bloody Cleaver is said to have been created by a mad wizard who was obsessed with bloodshed. He created the weapon in order to inflict maximum damage on

Item Description: This greatsword with an undulating blade is the choice weapon of the slithering serpent men of Sen's Fortress. This weapon is designed to flay the skin and causes heavy bleeding.
Story: The greatsword with an undulating blade is the choice weapon of the slithering serpent men of Sen's Fortress. The weapon is designed to flay the skin and causes heavy bleeding. The serpent men use this sword to slaughter their enemies, leaving them bleeding and vulnerable.

Item Description: A greatsword with an undulating blade. The unique shape is designed to pare the flesh, and is highly effective at causing bleeding. Flamberge literally means flame blade, but it also seems to bear a certain creature's likeness.
Story: The Flamberge is a unique sword with a blade that curves and undulates like a flame. It is said to be designed specifically to pare the flesh, and is incredibly effective at causing bleeding. Some say that the blade is shaped like the head of a creature known as a Flamberge, and that it bears the likeness of a fearsome beast.

Item Description: Bottle filled with dried red butterflies. Stimulation of these rare butterflies creates a small flame, allowing torches to be lit on the go. These butterflies exude secretions which ignite upon exposure to air, protecting them from natural predators. Known and loved as handy fire-lighters, but feared as the catalysts of disastrous fires when found in swarms.
Story: The bottle of dried butterflies is a rare find. The butterflies inside create a small flame when stimulated, allowing torches to be lit on the go. However, this fire-lighter is feared by many because when in swarms, these butterflies can create disastrous fires.

Item Description: A ring bestowed upon students of a certain standard of the Melfian Magic Academy. It's fire-based quartz increases fire defense. There are rumors that Pyromancer Glocken has made a hefty profit selling these replicas.
Story: The ring bestowed upon students of the Melfian Magic Academy is a fire-based quartz that increases fire defense. Pyromancer Glocken, a well-known and successful seller of replicas of the ring, is said to have made a hefty profit from them.

Item Description: Stoneplates, the symbol of a true knight, grant the strength to face various hardships. The red stoneplate symbolizes fire, and boosts defence against flame.
Story: The stoneplates were a symbol of a true knight. They granted the strength to face various hardships, and the red stoneplate symbolized fire.

Item Description: Legends speak of a master of the sword garbed in blue, and his curved blade that was patterned after flowing water. Strong attack unleashes a series of strikes akin to a dance, offering a glimpse into the legend. Skill: Spinning Slash Skill favored by dexterous warriors. Slash foes as your body spins. Additional input allows for a follow-up attack.
Story: The blue-clad swordsman is known throughout the land for his skill with the blade. His spinning slash is feared by all who encounter him, for it is an attack that unleashes a series of powerful strikes that seem to flow together like a dance. Those who are skilled enough to use this attack can take down even the most formidable foes.

Item Description: Ring of Flynn, the infamous thief. Utilizes the strength of the wind, such that lower equip load proportionally increases physical attack. Flynn was known as a tiny fighter who packed a mighty punch. Even the most skilled warriors in the land failed to capture him.
Story: The Ring of Flynn was a legendary artifact that utilized the power of the wind. It was said that anyone who wore the ring could increase their physical attack by a significant amount. Flynn was known as a tiny thief who was incredibly powerful. Even the most skilled warriors in the land could not capture him.

Item Description: Light spear wielded by the Farron Followers. Balanced to allow for throwing. The Followers attack in groups, surrounding foes, shielding themselves, and thrusting their spears at their foes. On a final command, they hurl their spears at their fallen foe, to give the retired warrior an honorable send-off.
Story: The Farron Followers are a religious order of knights that follow the god Farron. They are known for their balanced spears and their ability to surround and attack their foes. On the final command, they hurl their spears at their fallen foe, giving them an honorable send-off.

Item Description: Great curved sword wielded by Farron Followers. Its great weight enables heavy-handed chain attacks. The Followers brandish their swords to hunt warriors taken by the Abyss. Their technique is honed to face men, implying those yet to lose their human aspect are their likeliest prey. Skill: Prying Wedge A chain attack that wedges below foes and swings upward, breaking their guard. Strong attack can be used to follow up the onslaught with a fatal blow.
Story: The great curved sword wielded by Farron followers is a fearsome weapon. Its great weight enables heavy-handed chain attacks. The Followers brandish their swords to hunt warriors taken by the Abyss. Their technique is honed to face men, implying those yet to lose their human aspect are their likeliest prey. Skill: Prying Wedge allows the user to chain an attack below foes and swing upward, breaking their guard. Strong attack can be used to follow up the onslaught with a fatal

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and add various properties. This particular specimen has a pronounced effect, due to its extended state of dampness. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks.
Story: The gem was found in a swamp, and the dampness had caused it to grow more powerful. The gem enhanced the strength and accuracy of weapons, as well as giving them various other properties.

Item Description: Metal Graves that have already been mended countless times. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.
Story: The metal graves are a common sight in the battlefield. They are wide and long, and are issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army. The graves are often mended countless times, as the foot soldiers are constantly stepping on them.

Item Description: .Inexpensive straight sword. Standard issue for Drangleic foot soldiers. No masterpiece, this weapon won't be used to fend off any truly threatening foe.
Story: The Drangleic foot soldiers are always equipped with the cheapest straight swords they can find. This one is no different, it's just a standard issue weapon that won't be used to fend off any truly threatening foe. However, this sword has a special ability. Whenever someone is about to die, the sword will start to glow and they will be saved.

Item Description: Padded cloth armor with more than a few stains. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.
Story: The armor is old and worn, but it still provides some protection from the elements. The cloth is stained and matted with dried blood, dirt, and other debris. It smells of sweat and metal, and it's clear that it's been used often.

Item Description: Clothing worn upon awakening to the nightmare of blood and beasts. Not typical clothing for Yharnam, perhaps it is of foreign origin. It is said, after all, the traveler came to Yharnam from afar. Without memory, who will ever know?
Story: The traveler awakens in a nightmare, covered in blood and beasts. He doesn't know where he is, or who he is, but he knows he needs to get out. He starts to search for a way out, when he notices a strange piece of clothing lying on the ground. He picks it up, and it feels strange and unfamiliar. He doesn't know what it is, but he knows he needs it. He starts to run, and the clothing helps him stay warm in

Item Description: Oddly shaped greatsword wielded by imps. The gently undulating forked blade is known as an imp's tongue and causes blood loss.
Story: The odd-shaped greatsword is known as an imp's tongue. It is a gentle undulating forked blade that causes blood loss. The sword is wielded by imps who use it to attack their prey.

Item Description: Peculiar hatchet wielded by imps. The gently undulating forked blade is known as an imp's tongue and causes blood loss.
Story: The peculiar hatchet is known as an imp's tongue because it causes blood loss with each swing. The hatchet is coveted by the imps for its deadly capabilities.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. The Great One Oedon, lacking form, exists only in voice, and is symbolized by this rune. Those who memorize it enjoy a larger supply of Quicksilver Bullets. Human or no, the oozing blood is a medium of the highest grade, and the essence of the formless Great One. Both Oedon, and his inadvertent worshippers, surreptitiously seek the precious blood.
Story: Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth, left this rune as a secret symbol of her faith in the Great One Oedon. The rune is said to give its user a larger supply of Quicksilver Bullets, and the blood of the formless Great One is said to be of the highest quality. The worshippers of Oedon surreptitiously seek the blood, believing it to be a source of power.

Item Description: Four-pronged Plow wielded by the wooden scarecrows serfs of the forest Sanctuary. The scarecrow serfs would not normally use these four-pronged plows as weapons but their sharpness makes them very deadly
Story: The four-pronged plow wielded by the wooden scarecrows serfs of the forest Sanctuary is a deadly weapon. The scarecrow serfs would not normally use these plows as weapons, but their sharpness makes them very deadly.

Item Description: This four-pronged plow is shaped like a fist, and is a worker's tool in the Undead Settlement. Not originally intended for battle, but serves as a deadly weapon owing to its sharp points.
Story: The Undead Settlement is a place where the undead live and work. The plow is a worker's tool, but it can also be used as a deadly weapon.

Item Description: A Fragrant tree branch with a faint sweet smell. Restore the life of things turned to stone. Extended inhalation of the branch's scent can lead to coughing and nausea.
Story: The branch had been lying on the ground for weeks, forgotten. The dirt had been kicked up and the leaves were wilted, but there was still a faint sweet smell coming from the branch. A small rabbit sniffed it cautiously, then ran away in fear. A nearby bird took flight, cawing in alarm. The branch was cursed.

Item Description: A dragon weapon symbolizing Darkeater Midir. The once-exquisite blade is now stained black, and frayed at the hilt. Without its sheath, it will soon crumble into nothing. Skill: Hold Assume a holding stance in which a normal attack sends a shockwave along the earth, and a strong attack commences a series of slashes.
Story: The once-exquisite blade is now stained black, and frayed at the hilt. It is a symbol of Darkeater Midir, the god of darkness and death. Without its sheath, it will soon crumble into nothing.

Item Description: A rich droplet of coldblood containing Blood Echoes. Use to gain frenzied Blood Echoes. This manifestation of madness comes from a mind teetering on the very brink, but has a sane mind ever produced anything of true significance?
Story: The Blood Echoes droplet was discovered by a mad scientist in a dark corner of his laboratory. The scientist was trying to create a new form of Blood Echoes, but he was unsuccessful. The droplet was filled with madness and frenzied Blood Echoes.

Item Description: Formless sacred seal bestowed by the maiden of the Three Fingers. Enhances incantations of the frenzied flame. This seal is the mark of the Lord of Frenzied Flame. Scales incantations using strength, dexterity, intelligence, and faith all together.
Story: The Formless Sacred Seal bestowed by the maiden of the Three Fingers enhances incantations of the frenzied flame. This seal is the mark of the Lord of Frenzied Flame and Scales incantations using strength, dexterity, intelligence, and faith all together.

Item Description: A great scythe wielded by Sister Elfriede, with a curved blade thinly coated by Painted World frost that easily breaks the guard of shields. In the painting, the scythe is a symbol of a long-lost home, possibly explaining Elfriede's preference for it.
Story: Elfriede had always loved the scythe. It was a symbol of a long-lost home, possibly explaining Elfriede's preference for it. She often dreamed of a place where the sky was a deep blue, the sun shone all the time, and the snow was a beautiful, icy white. One day, she found herself in the Painted World, and the scythe became her new home. She fought tirelessly to protect her new home, and eventually became a

Item Description: A razor-thin piercing blade of ice. Forged by Ijii, the carian Royal Blackmith. Can inflict frost upon enemies, and launch its blade with a strong attack. The blade immediately regenerates.
Story: The Ijii Royal Blacksmith crafted a razor-thin piercing blade of ice. This deadly weapon can inflict frost upon enemies, and launch its blade with a strong attack. The blade immediately regenerates.

Item Description: One-of-a-kind enchanted crossbow of exquisitely detailed craftsmanship. Made to celebrate the matrimonial union, and reconciliation, between the houses of the Erdtree and the Full Moon, Leyndell and Raya Lucaria. The two rings dance when reloading the weapon. Reveals true worth when used with holy- infused bolts.
Story: Leyndell and Raya Lucaria were two of the most powerful houses in the land. They had been feuding for years, and it was clear that their marriage was going to be the end of it. They decided to put an end to the fighting by making an enchanted crossbow that would reveal the true worth of the bolts used with it. When the two rings danced when the weapon was reloaded, it was clear that the crossbow was working.

Item Description: A large sickle with a round blade The thin blade, fortified with bradden steel, slices with a fine smoothness. Hooks into flesh, then rips it apart to cause bleeding.
Story: The sickle is a finely crafted weapon that is designed to inflict maximum damage on its target. The thin blade is fortified with bradden steel, which makes it incredibly sharp and resistant to damage. The hooks on the blade are designed to catch onto flesh and tear it apart, causing bleeding. This sickle is perfect for inflicting pain and bloodshed in the battlefield.

Item Description: Straight sword forged from the soul of the fume knight, and imbued with the Dark of Nadalia. The exile swordsman Raime had the ability to expunge the black fog, but chose instead to live alongside it, in the company of the child of Dark that haunts this sword.
Story: The Straight Sword forged from the soul of the fume knight, and imbued with the Dark of Nadalia. The exile swordsman Raime had the ability to expunge the black fog, but chose instead to live alongside it, in the company of the child of Dark that haunts this sword.

Item Description: This twisted sword, the heaviest of all ultra Greatsword, resembles black slate. This weapon, said to belong to a traitor from long ago, was so heavy that it found no owner, and became a forgotten relic of history. Skill: Stomp Use one's weight to lunge forward with a low stance and increased poise, and follow with a crushing strong attack.
Story: The ultra Greatsword is a relic from ancient times, and is said to have belonged to a traitor. It is so heavy that it has never been used, and has become a forgotten relic. However, some skilled warriors have found ways to use it, and it is a fearsome weapon. When used, the user will take a low stance and lunge forward, followed by a strong attack.

Item Description: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower warriors. The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.
Story: The ancestral followers were a proud and fierce people. They wore raiment made from a bristly pelt, and they kept their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds to sprout from their very flesh. They were certain that their souls would be reborn as new trees, and they waited eagerly for this to happen.

Item Description: Greatsword of Slave Knight Gael, the only weapon that he kept with him from beginning to end. Originally an executioner's sword made for decapitation, this blade is heavily chipped and stained with the blood of countless battles. Skill: Blade of Peril A precarious technique unique to undead Gael. Leap in any direction, slamming the greatsword to the ground, then follow with normal attack for a large spinning slash, or strong attack to back-step and jump foward in an overhead slam.
Story: Gael, a slave knight, was always prepared for battle. He carried only one weapon with him, a greatsword that had seen many battles. One day, he was betrayed and killed by his own comrades. In his last moments, Gael used his skill with the blade of peril to take out all of his enemies.

Item Description: A two-pronged spear that imitates a weapon mentioned in an ancient text. Gargoyles are said to guard castles and forts from ill fortune, and they have appeared in many forms in all the great lands throughout history. Some of them are so meticulously crafted that they look as if they might come to life.
Story: The two-pronged spear is a magical artifact that was mentioned in an ancient text. The gargoyles that are said to guard castles and forts from ill fortune are known to have appeared in many forms throughout history, but some of them are so meticulously crafted that they look as if they might come to life.

Item Description: Stone torch hammer wielded by gargoyles of the Profaned Capital. The Profaned Flame, which never goes out, imbues this weapon with a fire attack.
Story: The gargoyles of the Profaned Capital are known for their stone torches, each of which is wielded by a mighty warrior. This hammer is imbued with the power of the Profaned Flame, and its fiery attack makes it a fearsome weapon.

Item Description: Stone torch spear wielded by gargoyles of the Profaned Capital. The Profaned Flame, which never goes out, imbues this weapon with a fire attack. Skill: Kindled Charge Hold spear at waist and charge at foe, using the momentum to transition to a fiery strong attack.
Story: The gargoyles of the Profaned Capital are known for their stone torches, which never go out. This spear is imbued with the Profaned Flame, a fire attack that burns through enemies.

Item Description: Sliced tail of the gargoyle guarding the Bell of Awakening in the Undead Church or patrolling in Anor Londo. Can be used as a bronze battle axe. Bends dramatically during large attacks owing to its nature as a tail
Story: The gargoyle guarding the Bell of Awakening in the Undead Church or patrolling in Anor Londo is known for its powerful swings and its flexible tail. However, the tail can also bend dramatically during large attacks, owing to its nature as a tail.

Item Description: Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyles, mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage. Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.
Story: Valiant Gargoyles are a race of winged creatures that dwell in the dark corners of the world. They are devoted to Maliketh, the Black Blade, and use their bronze greataxes to deal holy damage to their enemies. This weapon is mended with blackened corpse wax, signifying its importance to the Gargoyles.

Item Description: Bronze halberd wielded by Valiant Gargoyles, mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage. Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.
Story: Valiant Gargoyles are a race of winged creatures that serve Maliketh, the Black Blade. They are known for their fierce fighting skills and their use of bronze halberds which deal holy damage. This weapon is especially mended with blackened corpse wax, signifying its importance to the Gargoyles.

Item Description: Bronze greatsword wielded by Valiant Gargoyles mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage. Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.
Story: Valiant Gargoyles are a race of winged creatures that serve Maliketh, the Black Blade. They are known for their great swords, which are often mended with blackened corpse wax. This sword is said to deal holy damage, a mark of those who serve Maliketh faithfully.

Item Description: Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyles. Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.
Story: Valiant Gargoyles are a proud and fierce race of bronze-skinned creatures that dwell in the dark and dangerous depths of the earth. For generations, they have defended their home against all who would challenge them. One day, a greataxe that belonged to one of their own was stolen. The Gargoyles set out to find the thief and bring them to justice. They tracked the weapon to a dark and abandoned temple, where they found the thief hiding. The Gargoyles fought

Item Description: Bronze greatsword wielded by Valiant Gargoyles. Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.
Story: Valiant Gargoyles is a proud and noble clan of bronze greatswords that reside in the dark and foreboding depths of the underworld. For generations, they have defended the realm from all who would dare trespass, and their blades are feared by all. One day, a young gargoyle named Valiant was tasked with retrieving a powerful artifact from the depths of the underworld. However, as he reached for the artifact, he lost his grip and the sword fell into the darkness. For

Item Description: Halberd of the gargoyle guarding the Bell of Awakening in the Undead Church. Perfectly standard bronze halberd without any special power.
Story: The gargoyle guarding the Bell of Awakening in the Undead Church was always vigilant, but it never expected anyone to try and steal its prized possession. When the thief crept up behind it, the gargoyle was completely unprepared for the attack. The halberd fell from its grip and clattered to the ground, leaving the gargoyle defenseless.

Item Description: Bronze shield of the gargoyle guarding the Bell of Awakening in the Undead Church. The gargoyle's skin is tough by itself and perhaps its shield may have been a prop for it is a rare example of a metal shield that does not reduce physical damage 100%.
Story: The Bell of Awakening is a sacred relic that is said to grant eternal life to anyone who rings it. The Undead Church has a gargoyle guarding the bell, and its skin is so tough that it doesn't reduce physical damage by 100%. One day, a brave adventurer decided to take on the gargoyle and fight it head on. He was able to defeat it, but the shield it was wearing saved its life. The shield is now a rare and powerful artifact, and anyone who finds

Item Description: Bronze twinblade wielded by Valiant Gargoyles. Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.
Story: Valiant Gargoyles are a proud and fierce race of bronze-skinned creatures with wings. They are often seen defending their homes and allies from harm. One day, a group of Valiant Gargoyles were attacked by a horde of monsters. In the midst of the chaos, one of the Gargoyles' bronze twinblades fell to the ground. Without hesitation, one of the Gargoyles picked up the blade and fought on, using the weapon to devastating effect. After the

Item Description: Hunter attire worn by Father Gascoigne. Similar to hunter garb created at the workshop, only these are tainted by a pungent beastly stench that eats away at Gascoigne. Father is a title used for clerics in a foreign land, and there is no such rank in the Healing Church.
Story: Father Gascoigne, a cleric of the Healing Church, travels to a foreign land to spread the word of the church. While there, he acquires a set of hunter attire that has been tainted by a pungent beastly stench. The clothing is so repulsive that no one will ever want to be near Father Gascoigne, let alone wear his clothing. However, the stench only seems to bother Father Gascoigne himself.

Item Description: Hunter attire worn by Father Gascoigne. The dingy scarf is a Holy Shawl and symbol of the Healing Church, from which Gascoigne would eventually part ways. Father is a title used for clerics in a foreign land, and there is no such rank in the Healing Church.
Story: Father Gascoigne is a priest of the Healing Church, a religious order that worships the goddess Hecate. One day, he decides to break away from the church and start his own sect. He takes on the name Father Gascoigne and wears a dingy scarf that he claims is a Holy Shawl from the Healing Church. He travels to a foreign land and starts preaching his new beliefs to the people. However, the church back home finds out and sends agents to stop him.

Item Description: Guantlets of the pitiable Embraced Knight. Depicts the affection of goddess Fina. Adrift on sea of isolation, only his faith in the love of his goddess remained true, and so the knight forsook all else. The face of the guantlets are crafted to depict the goddess's embrace, quite ignoring the fact that her love is in fact as fickle as the weather
Story: The Embraced Knight wore guantlets crafted by the goddess Fina in an attempt to remind himself of her love. The guantlets depicted the goddess's embrace, even though the knight knew that her love was as fickle as the weather. Despite the guantlets' lack of success, the knight continued to believe in the goddess's love and was able to find solace in it.

Item Description: Strange gauntlets from the ancient land of Zena, birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall. They gold bracelets symbolize a vanquisher
Story: Domhnall sells these gauntlets to adventurers as a sign of victory. The wearer can use the gauntlets to cast the spell 'vanquish' once per day.
