Item Description: Guantlets of Kirk, the notorious knight of Thorns. A dense patch of thorns grows from its surface. A fitting item for the murderous Kirk, for even the simple act of rolling can damage enemies when wearing this attire.
Story: Kirk is a notorious knight of Thorns, known for his brutal and bloody tactics. He wears a set of guantlets made of thorns, as a way of protecting himself from harm. The thorns are dense and difficult to roll through, making it difficult for enemies to hit Kirk.

Item Description: Hunter attire of Gehrman, the first hunter. Created before the workshop existed by making adjustments to everyday clothing, and later became the basis for all hunter's garb. The hunter's emphasis on engaging beasts with speed, and therefore of selecting lightweight attire, no doubt traces back to Gehrman's own combat style.
Story: The first hunter, Gehrman, created his attire before the workshop even existed. He made adjustments to everyday clothing, and it became the basis for all hunter's garb. Gehrman's combat style was based on speed, so he chose clothing that was lightweight and fast-moving. This may have been a result of his own style, or it may have been what was necessary to engage beasts quickly and efficiently.

Item Description: Hunter attire of Gehrman, the first hunter. Created before the workshop existed by making adjustments to everyday clothing, and later became the basis for all hunter's garb. The hunter's emphasis on engaging beasts with speed, and therefore of selecting lightweight attire, no doubt traces back to Gehrman's own combat style.
Story: The first hunter, Gehrman, created his attire before the workshop even existed. He made adjustments to everyday clothing, and it became the basis for all hunter's garb. He emphasized speed in his combat style, and this is probably why his attire is so lightweight.

Item Description: Staff with a forked tip, embedded with red glintstones. Enhances lava sorceries. The Man-Serpents of Mt. Gelmir draw from faith in addition to intelligence to enhance the potency of their sorcery.
Story: The Man-Serpents of Mt. Gelmir are a fearsome group of sorcerers who use their faith in addition to their intelligence to enhance their spells. They live on the slopes of Mt. Gelmir, a volcano that is said to be the home of the serpents themselves. The Man-Serpents are a powerful force, and their sorcery is feared by all.

Item Description: Armor worn by knights once royal to Praector Rykard. It bears an emblem that none wear any longer, standing as it does for a lord that fell from loft ambition into gluttonous depravity. As the lord lost his dignity, so too did these knights lose their master.
Story: The armor worn by knights once royal to Praector Rykard. Once proud and bearing an emblem that none wear any longer, the armor now stands as a symbol of shame for a lord that fell from loft ambition into gluttonous depravity. As the lord lost his dignity, so too did these knights lose their master.

Item Description: Great iron wheel lined with flesh-flaying blades. Device of torture used by Inquisitor Ghiza. As the wheel spins it causes severe pain and blood loss. The design was adopted for use as the iconic weapon wielded by Iron Virgins.
Story: The Iron Virgins are a religious order of female warriors who use the great iron wheel as their signature weapon. The device is said to cause severe pain and blood loss, making it a perfect tool of torture.

Item Description: The ghosts of New Londo clutch this wickedly sharp dagger with their bony hands and make mincemeat of the living. One of the cursed weapons which can inflict damage upon ghosts.
Story: The ghosts of New Londo haunt the city, seeking revenge on the living. One day, a cursed dagger was found in the city and the ghosts were quick to take it up. With its sharp blade, the dagger quickly made mincemeat of the living.

Item Description: Metal torch that burns with cold ghostflame. Tool of the Fallen Hawks who prowl the underground rivers. When the band's last embers were used up in their long search, they began to burn the bones of their fellows, acquiring the cold ghostflame, but sealing their fate as dwellers of the underground for all eternity.
Story: The Fallen Hawks were a band of warriors who fought in the great war against the dragons. When the war ended and the dragons were defeated, the Fallen Hawks were left with nothing but their swords and their search for revenge. They found their way to the underground rivers, where they discovered the ghostflame. With this powerful fire, they could burn the bones of their enemies and seal their fates as dwellers of the underground for all eternity.

Item Description: Armor of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo. Made from ancient brass, it also offers protection versus non-physical attacks, but due to its giant size, it is extremely heavy for humans, and impedes stamina recovery.
Story: The armor of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo is a relic from an age long past. It was made from brass, and offered protection against non-physical attacks. However, because of its size, it was extremely heavy for humans, and impeded stamina recovery.

Item Description: Greatshield made of bronze and marcasite. Used by the giant sentinels of Anor Londo. Marcasite or white iron is effective against non-physical damage but as the shield is designed for the giant sentineles its weight is unbearable.
Story: The greatshield of bronze and marcasite is a relic from the ancient days of Anor Londo. The giant sentinels who guarded the city were equipped with these shields, made to be both powerful and weighty. The marcasite or white iron in the shield is effective against non-physical damage, but as the shield is designed for giants, its weight is unbearable.

Item Description: Greataxe forged from the Last Giant's soul. This weapon resembles a primitive stone tool, but is quite powerful owing to its immense size. King Vendrick disappeared as the war with the Giants reached its ferocious peak, leaving his castle. Some swear that upon hearing the news, the Queen's face remained as still as her portrait.
Story: The greataxe was forged from the last giant's soul. It is a primitive looking stone tool, but is quite powerful due to its immense size. The king disappeared as the war with the giants reached its ferocious peak, leaving his castle. Some swear that upon hearing the news, the queen's face remained as still as her portrait.

Item Description: . Club of the Giants that besieged Drangleic. Nothing more than a boulder bound to a tree, but a very powerful, if primitive weapon. A human would require great strength to wield this Giant-sized Club King Vendrick, in adherence to Queen Nashandra's counsel, led his armies north in an effort to subjugate the Giants, and claim their powerful souls for his own.
Story: Vendrick, the King of Drangleic, led an army of Giants against the humans in an effort to claim their souls. He was defeated and killed by a human wielding a Giant-sized Club.

Item Description: A hammer made from a boulder, used in the War against the Giants. One of the heftiest weapons in the entire Lands Between. After the giants were quelled, and man turned against man in violence, this weapon was all but forgotten. Man has grown feeble in comparison to his forebears.
Story: The hammer was forged from a large boulder during the war against the giants. It was one of the heaviest weapons available, and was used to great effect against the giants. After the war was over, man grew tired of fighting and forgot about this powerful weapon. Today, it is all but forgotten, and man is no match for the giants.

Item Description: Large halberd made of old brass used by the giant sentinels of Anor Londo. Brass contains traces of lightning but as the halberd is designed for the giant sentinels its weight is unbearable
Story: The giant sentinels of Anor Londo were created to protect the city from any threats. These massive halberds were made of brass, which was infused with traces of lightning to make it even more powerful. However, even with its weight, the halberd is too heavy for any mortal to wield.

Item Description: Hefty whip woven from the flame-red hair of a Fire Giant. Every giant is red of hair, and Radagon was said to have despised his own red locks. Perhaps that was a curse of their kind.
Story: The Hefty Whip is a powerful weapon made from the hair of a Fire Giant. Legend has it that Radagon despised his own red locks, and so the whip was said to be a cursed item. Whoever wields it will be unstoppable.

Item Description: Sacred seal depicting the one eyed god of the Fire Giants, adorned with braids of red hair. Sacred seal wielded by Fire Monks and Prelates, this catalyst enhances Giants' Flame incantations.
Story: The sacred seal depicting the one eyed god of the Fire Giants is a powerful catalyst that enhances Giants' Flame incantations. The Fire Monks and Prelates who wield it are some of the most powerful magic users in the land, and their flames are feared by all.

Item Description: Flanged cap made from gilded iron. Issued to foot soldiers protecting the royal capital of Leyndell.
Story: The Flanged Cap was a prestigious piece of headwear that was given to foot soldiers who were stationed in the royal capital of Leyndell. The foot soldiers were responsible for protecting the royal family and their property, so the Flanged Cap was a symbol of their importance.

Item Description: This halberd with a large blade was a scythe refitted for battle. Designed for slicing, and inflicts slash damage.
Story: The halberd was once a simple scythe, but was refitted with a large blade for battle. The large blade inflicts slash damage, making it perfect for cutting through enemies.

Item Description: Ritual blade once presented to Leyndell by the Academy of Raya Lucaria to celebrate their newfound peace. Though the weapon is embedded with precious glintstones and features Erdtree ornamentation, the undulating blade is symbolic of an ancient ritual.
Story: Leyndell had always been fascinated by the ritual blade. It was given to her by the Academy of Raya Lucaria as a sign of their newfound peace. Though the weapon was embedded with precious glintstones and featured Erdtree ornamentation, the undulating blade was symbolic of an ancient ritual. Leyndell was determined to learn more about it, and eventually she discovered that the ritual was used to summon a dragon. Now she uses the blade to fight for peace and justice

Item Description: Staff with a glintstone embedded at the tip. A catalyst for casting sorceries. Sorceries must be memorized first at a site of lost grace, and a staff must be equipped to cast them.
Story: The staff was a beautiful piece of craftsmanship. The glintstone at the tip was a beautiful addition, adding an extra bit of magic to the staff. The staff was perfect for casting sorceries. The staff was found by a group of adventurers while they were exploring a lost temple. The staff was perfect for the group's needs, as they were able to cast the group's favorite spells. The staff was a valuable addition to the group's arsenal, and they were

Item Description: Black iron armour worn by Yurt, the Silent Chief. A portion of the complete armor set which has an extremely high level of adhesion. The black iron robs the wearer of his or her body heat, causing them to shiver and breathe out cold air.
Story: Yurt, the Silent Chief, was a fearsome warrior who wore black iron armour that robbed him of his body heat. This made him shiver and breathe out cold air, which made him even more fearsome to his enemies.

Item Description: Armor worn by knights loyal to Godrick The Grafted. Its left breast is emblazoned with a two-headed war axe, an emblem of the golden lineage. The knights surely boasted of their strength in days long gone.
Story: The armor worn by Godrick's loyal knights is a powerful symbol of their lineage. The two-headed war axe on the left breast is a reminder of their strength and power.

Item Description: Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Worn by the Godskin Apostles. The apostles, once said to serve Destined Death, are wielders of the god-slaying black flame. But after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, the source of their power was sealed away.
Story: The robe worn by the god-slaying apostles is made from patches of smooth skin sewn together. The apostles were once said to serve Destined Death, but after their defeat by Maliketh, the Black Blade, their power was sealed away. Now, they wander the world, seeking to find a way to restore their power.

Item Description: Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.
Story: The Hood is a unique piece of clothing that is made from patches of smooth skin. It is made to be plump and soft, and is worn by the Godskin Nobles. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Unlike other apostles, who are usually covered in scars, the nobles are said to have smooth, unmarked skin. This is likely due to their ability to transform into Erdtrees, the primordial form of the tree.

Item Description: Unique twinblade wielded by Godskin Apostles characterized by its disturbing design. One end features a sickle for slicing attacks while the other boasts a winding spike for boring into flesh. Much skill is required to wield this weapon due to its asymmetric nature.
Story: The twinblade was wielded by the Godskin Apostles, a group of holy warriors who were characterized by their disturbing design. The one end of the weapon featured a sickle for slicing attacks, while the other boasted a winding spike for boring into flesh. Due to its asymmetric nature, great skill was required to wield this weapon.

Item Description: Elegant piercing sword with a celadon colored blade wielded by Godskin Nobles. The nobles possess skill with the sword unmatched by any lowborn. Despite its size, successive attacks from this weapon are swifter than the eye can follow.
Story: The elegant piercing sword with a celadon colored blade is wielded by the Godskin Nobles. This sword is unmatched by any lowborn, as successive attacks from this weapon are swifter than the eye can follow. The Godskin Nobles possess skill with this sword that is unmatched by any other.

Item Description: Sacred sword of the Gloam-Eyed Queen who controlled the Godskin Apostles before her defeat at the hands of Maliketh. The black flames wielded by the apostles are channeled from this sword.
Story: The Sacred Sword of the Gloam-Eyed Queen is a powerful weapon that was used by the apostles before their defeat at the hands of Maliketh. The black flames wielded by the apostles are channeled from this sword.

Item Description: Sacred seal of the Godskin Apostles, inlaid with obsidian. Said to represent the manipulation of black flame, this catalyst enhances godslayer incantations.
Story: The Sacred Seal of the Godskin Apostles is a powerful artifact that enhances godslayer incantations. It is said to represent the manipulation of black flame, and is said to be a catalyst that enhances the power of godslayer spells.

Item Description: The odd helmet worn by the band of Executioners commanded by the martyr Logarius. The conical gold helmet, symbol of the executioners, represents luminosity, ambition, and an unflagging resolve to face impurity, staring it down with stern golden spirit. As the great Logarius once said, Acts of goodness are not always wise, and acts of evil are not always foolish, but regardless, we shall always strive to be good.
Story: The helmet is said to have been worn by the executioners who served under the martyr Logarius. The helmet is said to represent the ambition and resolve of the executioners, and to stare down impurity with stern golden spirit.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks, and this golden radial blood gem, kept for generations within the Church, strengthens attacks against those afflicted intensely by beasthood. When clerics began transforming into unspeakable beasts, the Church needed something to retaliate with.
Story: The Church had a blood gem that strengthened attacks against those afflicted with beasthood. When clerics began transforming into unspeakable beasts, the Church needed something to retaliate with.

Item Description: Coin made of gold, with Allfather Lloyd and his white halo shown on its face. Even coins of great value in the world of men have little value in Lordran, where the accepted currency is souls. Those who dream of returning to the outside world are fond of carrying these around.
Story: When you were a child, your parents would take you to the bank to deposit your allowance. You would marvel at the coins, their gold shining in the light. You would dream of one day being able to take that gold and travel the world. Now, as an adult, you still carry that dream with you. You never thought you would be able to do it, but you've been saving your coins for years. You're finally able to purchase a ticket to the outside world.

Item Description: Coin made of gold, with Allfather Lloyd and his white halo shown on its face. Even coins of great value in the world of men have little value in Lordran, where the accepted currency is souls. Those who dream of returning to the outside world are fond of carrying these around.
Story: When you were a child, your parents would take you to the bank to deposit your allowance. You would marvel at the coins, their gold shining in the light. You would dream of one day being able to take that gold and travel the world. Now, as an adult, you still carry that dream with you. You never thought you would be able to do it, but you've been saving your coins for years. You're finally able to purchase a ticket to the outside world.

Item Description: Pendant of Vicar Amelia. Use to change into a Blood Gem, which fortifies weapons. This pendant, passed down among the vicars who head the Healing Church, is a reminder of the cautionary adage. To reveal the adage, touch the altar skull.
Story: The Healing Church is a religious order that focuses on healing and restoring balance to the world. The pendant is a reminder to the vicars of the cautionary adage, which states that to reveal the adage, one must touch the altar skull. This pendant is passed down among the vicars who head the Healing Church, and it is a reminder of the order's focus on healing and restoring balance to the world.

Item Description: Rare pine resin which emits golden sparks. Applies lightning to Main-hand weapon. Affected weapon inflicts rare lightning damage making it effective against targets which are resilient to both magic and fire. Very effective against dragon family foes
Story: The rare pine resin emits golden sparks that apply lightning to a weapon. This makes it effective against targets which are resistant to both magic and fire. The resin is especially effective against dragon family foes.

Item Description: A rare pine resin with a golden glint. Applies lightning to Main-hand weapon. The affected weapon inflicts lightning damage for a short time. Particularly effective against foes who are resistant to magic and fire.
Story: The golden pine resin was a rare find, and its properties were coveted by many. When applied to a weapon, it granted the user the ability to inflict lightning damage on their opponents. This was particularly effective against foes who were resistant to magic and fire.

Item Description: Rare pine resin which emits golden sparks. Chunks of it are even rarer. Temporarily applies lightning to Main-hand weapon. Its origins are unknown although some have speculated that it may in fact be a type of fungal resin.
Story: A golden sparkles emanates from a chunk of rare pine resin. Suddenly, the weapon in your hand becomes charged with electricity, shocking any nearby enemies. The origins of this mysterious resin are unknown, but some believe it may be a type of fungal material. Whether or not this is true is up for debate, but what is certain is that this rare substance can give you a temporary advantage in combat.

Item Description: Curved sword used by the Lord's Blade Ciaran, one of Gwyn's Four Knights. Ciaran brandishes her sword in a mesmerizing dance, etching the darkness with dire streaks of gold.
Story: The Lord's Blade Ciaran is a curved sword used by one of Gwyn's Four Knights. Ciaran is a skilled dancer with her sword, etching the darkness with dire streaks of gold. She is a powerful ally to have on your side, and her sword is a deadly weapon.

Item Description: Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos. She wore this gold-hemmed black cloak before even the Age of Fire, and it offers strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.
Story: Quelana's cloak is said to have been worn by the witch who first discovered pyromancy, and it has been said to offer strong resistance against fire, poison, and other perils.

Item Description: A sword made to commemorate the death of Godwyn the Golden, first of the demigods to die. Infused with the humble prayer of a young boy; O brother, lord brother, please die a true death.
Story: The sword was made to commemorate the death of Godwyn the Golden, the first of the demigods to die. The boy who made the prayer infused it with his own humility and hope. Now, every time someone wields the sword, they are reminded of the sacrifice of the young man who made it.

Item Description: Weighty halberd forged of gold. Wielded by the Order of Tree Sentinels, heavily equipped knights. Deals holy damage. A masterfully crafted weapon that lives up to its heft, but is difficult for one mere human strength to wield.
Story: The Order of Tree Sentinels is a group of heavily armored knights who use halberds as their primary weapon. The halberd is a powerful tool that deals holy damage, making it perfect for combating evil.

Item Description: Greatsword made of light, modeled after the Elden Ring itself. Forged by King Consort Radagon to proudly symbolize the tenets of the Golden Order. One of the legendary armaments. Telltale signs betray that this was once the greatsword bequeathed to him by his first wife, Rennala.
Story: The greatsword was once the prized possession of the king consort of Elden Ring. It was forged from light, and was modeled after the Elden Ring itself. The sword was one of the legendary armaments, and one of the few that could truly be called magical. However, the sword's true power was revealed when it was used to slay the dragon that was terrorizing the kingdom. Telltale signs betray that this was once the greatsword bequeathed to him by

Item Description: A formless sacred seal depicting the ceremonial observation of Order. Enhances Golden Fundamentalist incantations. Fundamentalism is scholarship in all but name. Scales incantation using both intelligence and faith.
Story: The Order Sacred Seal was created to help enhance Golden Fundamentalist incantations. It uses both intelligence and faith to scale incantation, allowing practitioners to use their strongest spells with the least amount of effort.

Item Description: A ritual spear presented to Darkmoon Knights before Sulyvahn claimed the title of Pontiff. Can also be used as a staff. Sorceries cast using this weapon channel the wielder's faith.
Story: The Darkmoon Knights were a religious order that served the god Sulyvahn. One day, the Pontiff claimed the title of Darkmoon Knight and began to make changes to the order. He removed the religious elements from the order and made it a military force. The members of the Darkmoon Knights were not happy with this change, and many left to join other religious orders. However, a few remained loyal to the Pontiff and continued to serve him. One of these remaining members

Item Description: A golden scroll chronicling the vast research of the xanthous scholars. Give to a sorcerer to learn the arts of Oolacile. In the lost land of Oolacile, the sorceries orchestrated light, and were said to shine in golden hues.
Story: A golden scroll chronicling the vast research of the xanthous scholars. When given to a sorcerer, they will be able to learn the arts of Oolacile. In the lost land of Oolacile, the sorceries orchestrated light, and were said to shine in golden hues.

Item Description: Worn rags that just barely cover the body. Lord Goldmask felt no draw to the vain excess of clothing; what use is finery to one who seeks greater brilliance?
Story: Lord Goldmask is a powerful and mysterious figure who has forsaken the trappings of society in order to pursue knowledge and enlightenment. He is often seen wearing rags, which barely cover his body, in order to show his lack of interest in worldly things. One day, he comes across a group of people who are wearing extravagant clothing and jewels, and he is struck by how pointless all of that is. He decides to follow their example and live simply, without any attachments. This makes him a

Item Description: Body of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo. Without its core, it is a mere hunk of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but its immense weight hinders stamina recovery
Story: The Iron Golem was once a mighty guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress. However, without its core, it is just a hunk of iron. However, because of its immense weight, it hinders stamina recovery.

Item Description: An axe born from the soul of the Iron Golem guardian of Sen's Fortress who repelled countless heroes who sought Anor Londo. Its powerful one-handed attack imitates the Golem's blade of wind but the heavy iron blade makes it quite unwieldy
Story: The axe was forged from the soul of the Iron Golem guardian of Sen's Fortress. The axe is powerful and can imitate the blade of wind, but it is quite unwieldy. The axe was used by many heroes who sought to enter Anor Londo, but they were all repelled by the axe's powerful one-handed attack.

Item Description: Greatbow of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Weapon of the Guardian Golem. Extremely heavy, this greatbow requires enormous strength just to draw, suggesting it was not designed for human use.
Story: The greatbow of black stone was crafted by a civilization that now lay in ruins. The weapon was meant for use by the Guardian Golem, a powerful creature that once protected the civilization. The greatbow is extremely heavy, requiring immense strength just to draw it. This suggests that the greatbow was not designed for human use.

Item Description: A great halberd of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Wielded by the Guardian Golem.
Story: The Guardian Golem was created to protect the last remaining city of the civilization that created it. The city was destroyed, and the Guardian Golem was the only thing left to protect the ruins. The Golem is a powerful weapon, and it's always ready to fight.

Item Description: The hunters known as the King's Black Hands wielded paired weapons. These belonged to Gotthard, who fled the castle. Gotthard rose quickly through the knighthood, no surprise to those who have witnessed his swordsmanship.
Story: Gotthard is a skilled hunter and swordsman who fled his home after a disagreement with his father. He joins a group of hunters known as the King's Black Hands and quickly rises through the ranks. One day, he is called to meet the king, who offers him a new position as the captain of the royal guard. However, Gotthard is reluctant to leave his friends and the hunt. He instead chooses to flee the kingdom with his new found friends.

Item Description: Armor of Hawkeye Gough, one of Gwyn's Four Knights. Armor donned by Gough since his days as a dragonslayer. The medallion, bequeathed by the Lord Himself, and the dragon bone pauldrons are symbols of the highest honors
Story: Gough was a renowned swordsman and dragon slayer. He was given the armor of Hawkeye Gough by the Lord himself, as a symbol of the highest honors. The medallion, bequeathed by the Lord Himself, and the dragon bone pauldrons are symbols of the highest honors.

Item Description: Great arrow used by Hawkeye Gough, one of Lord Gwyn's Four Knights, for dragon slaying. Requires Greatbow. Gough personally crafts each stone tip, and wraps the shaft tightly with tree bark.
Story: The great arrow used by Hawkeye Gough, one of Lord Gwyn's Four Knights, for dragon slaying. The arrow is made with carefully crafted stone tips and is tightly wrapped in tree bark. Gough personally crafts each arrow, ensuring that each one is unique.

Item Description: Greatbow used by Hawkeye Gough, of Lord Gwyn's Four Knights, for dragon slaying. This bow is larger than even those used by the famed Dragonslayers. Only their leader, Gough, had the strength to handle it.
Story: The greatbow used by Hawkeye Gough was larger than any other bow used by the famed Dragonslayers. Only Gough, the leader of the Four Knights, had the strength to handle it. Gough was known for his prowess in slaying dragons, and this bow was his weapon of choice.

Item Description: The Ring of the assassin Gower, who has killed a half-dozen kings, and several distinguished clergymen. Reduces damage taken from behind. For an assassin. whose own life is always at stake, the greatest liability is one's exposed back.
Story: The Ring of the assassin Gower was a gift from his latest victim, the king. Gower had killed the king in cold blood, and the king's advisors had given him the ring as a way of thanking him. The ring was said to reduce damage taken from behind, and Gower had always been careful to stay out of sight. But one day, Gower was cornered by his enemies. He tried to take the ring off, but it was too tight. He was

Item Description: The storied sword of Castle Morne. A revenger's weapon, it is burdened with oceans of anger and regret. One of the legendary armaments. A lone surviving champion from a country now vanished was so determined to continue fighting that he claimed the swords of an entire clan of warriors.
Story: The storied sword of Castle Morne. A revenger's weapon, it is burdened with oceans of anger and regret. One of the legendary armaments. A lone surviving champion from a country now vanished was so determined to continue fighting that he claimed the swords of an entire clan of warriors.

Item Description: The embodiment of the power that still remained in the dragon's head that was granted to Godrick's left arm. The wielder's arm will take the form of a small dragon, sprouting sharp dragon fangs at the fist. This weapon cannot be two-handed.
Story: Godrick's left arm was granted the power of a dragon's head, and as a result, his arm took on the form of a small dragon. This dragon had sharp dragon fangs at the fist, and as a result, it was impossible to wield it two-handed.

Item Description: A Lance fashioned from rare geisteel, Designed for high-.ranking Drangleic Knights, hence the design ''Geisteel equipment is of the finest make, but geisteel is so rare that very few of these weapons were actually used in combat.'''
Story: The Lance is a rare geisteel weapon designed for use by high ranking Drangleic Knights. The weapon is incredibly powerful, but due to the rarity of geisteel, few were actually used in combat.

Item Description: A legendary weapon of the Way of White granted to an Undead paladin long ago. This mass of iron can only be lifted by those with inhuman strength but it is blessed and very effective against agents of Dark
Story: The undead paladin known as the White Knight had been fighting against the forces of evil for many years when he was given a legendary weapon. The weapon was a mass of iron that could only be lifted by those with inhuman strength. The White Knight was very grateful for the weapon and used it to fight against the agents of Dark.

Item Description: Old medium metal shield of unknown origin. The grass crest is lightly imbued with magic which slightly speeds stamina recovery
Story: The shield was found in a field, its grass crest lightly imbued with magic which slightly sped stamina recovery. The shield was given to the protagonist by an old man who claimed it was from a faraway land. The protagonist was able to use the shield to help them win many battles.

Item Description: Greatscythe comprised of a large blade affixed to a crooked stick. Weapon wielded by the aged grave keepers who tend the forgotten graveyards throughout the Lands Between. This weapon is said to have served as a charm against evil spirits in times of old.
Story: The greatscythe is a powerful weapon that is said to have been used by grave keepers to protect the people of the Lands Between from evil spirits. It is said that the weapon is especially effective against these spirits because of its crooked stick form.

Item Description: A pyromancy tome of the grave warden, from the Carthus catacombs. Give to the pyromancer master to learn black flame sorceries. High Lord Wolnir of Carthus succumbed to the Abyss, but the pyromancer later became a grave warden, and discovered the black flame.
Story: The Carthus catacombs are a dark and dangerous place, and the High Lord Wolnir was no exception. He succumbed to the Abyss and left his pyromancy tome to the grave warden who would later become his successor. The black flame that is contained within the tome is a powerful sorcery that the pyromancer uses to burn the corpses of the dead.

Item Description: Rotting, tattered skirt, robe, hood and wrap. Attire of grave wardens at the Cathedral of the Deep. Grave wardens were tasked with disposing of the ever rising corpses that plagued the cathedral. Their clothes are utterly putrid, drenched in the blood and mucilage of their undertaking.
Story: The grave wardens of the Cathedral of the Deep wear garments that are soiled and stained with the blood and viscera of the corpses that they are tasked with disposing of. These wardens are a grim and solemn group, always ready to deal with the ever-rising corpses.

Item Description: Worn by a Grave Warden sorcerer. The man claims to have sealed himself away, but who's ever heard of sentient magic? It is no doubt difficult to judge the veracity of the man's words, but this hood certainly seems to possess an unusual power. He calls himself Navlaan, now.
Story: The hood worn by the grave warden sorcerer Navlaan is said to possess an unusual power. The man claims to have sealed himself away, but who's ever heard of sentient magic? It is no doubt difficult to judge the veracity of the man's words, but this hood certainly seems to possess an unusual ability.

Item Description: Mask of Dores, graveguard of the Forbidden Woods. His pale countenance mimics the labyrinth watchers. Willem kept two loyal servants back at Byrgenwerth. When they were sent into the labyrinth. they encountered the eldritch Truth. and went mad. One became the password gatekeeper, while Dores became a graveguard of the forest. Both remained loyal, even in madness.
Story: The Mask of Dores is a relic of Byrgenwerth, a cursed place where the eldritch Truth lies hidden. When two of Willem's servants were sent into the labyrinth to find it, they went mad and became the gatekeeper and graveguard of the forest, respectively. Dores remains loyal to Willem even in his madness, and watches over the Forbidden Woods to this day.

Item Description: Robe of Dores, graveguard of the Forbidden Woods. His pale countenance mimics the labyrinth watchers. Willem kept two loyal servants back at Byrgenwerth. When they were sent into the labyrinth. they encountered the eldritch Truth. and went mad. One became the password gatekeeper, while Dores became a graveguard of the forest. Both remained loyal, even in madness.
Story: Willem, a young man, ventured into the Forbidden Woods to find his missing father. He was accompanied by his two loyal servants, who were sent into the labyrinth by Willem's father. After encountering the eldritch Truth, they both went mad and one became the gatekeeper and Dores became a graveguard of the forest. Both servants remained loyal even in madness.

Item Description: Defensive wear encircled by bronze snakes. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes. The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.
Story: The defensive wear encircled by bronze snakes is a relic from the days when gladiators were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes, but the snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

Item Description: Sacred seal made from Gravel Stone thought to be an ancient dragon scale. Enhances Dragon Cult incantations of the Royal Capital. The worship of the ancient dragons does not conflict with belief in the Erdtree. After all, this seal, and lightning itself, are both imbued with gold.
Story: The Sacred Seal made from Gravel Stone is said to be an ancient dragon scale. It is said to enhance the Dragon Cult incantations of the Royal Capital. The worship of the ancient dragons does not conflict with belief in the Erdtree. After all, this seal, and lightning itself, are both imbued with gold.

Item Description: Sword wielded only by servants of Gravelord Nito, the first of the dead. Crafted from the bones of the fallen. The miasma of death exudes from the sword, a veritable toxin to any living being.
Story: The sword is known as the Bone Sword, and it is said that it was created from the bones of the fallen. The miasma of death that radiates from the sword is said to be a deadly toxin to any living being. It is said that only the servants of Gravelord Nito are able to wield the sword with impunity, and that it is a deadly weapon that can cut through even the strongest of defenses.

Item Description: Giant tree branch serves as a wooden club. Smashes enemies from upside the head. The leaping attack is a trademark of clubs and this giant club is no exception.
Story: The giant tree branch served as a sturdy wooden club. It was large enough to smash enemies from the upside the head with ease, and its leaping attack was a trademark of clubs. This giant club was no exception, and it was a fearsome weapon in the hands of a skilled fighter.

Item Description: An enormous club of hardwood. Wildly hammering foes with this striking weapon requires no dexterity; only brute force. While it may seem sacrilegious, this weapon is said to be a withered branch of the Erdtree. Imbued with holy power, this weapon will never snap.
Story: The Erdtree was a sacred tree to the elves. It was said that the branch that became the club was a withered branch of the tree. The club was said to be imbued with holy power and would never snap.

Item Description: Great scythe of the forlorn souls guided by heretical storytellers. The Mistress of the Painted World is said to wield a great scythe herself. Great scythes inflict profuse bleeding, such that the blood splatters on the wielder. Skill: Neck Swipe This attack aims for the scruff of a foe's neck, and when successful, functions as a head shot, inflicting heavy damage.
Story: The great scythe of the forlorn souls is said to be wielded by the Mistress of the Painted World. This fearsome weapon inflicts massive bleeding damage, making it perfect for slaying those who have wronged others.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of ByrgenwertThis transcription of the Great Ones' inhuman voices depicts downreaching currents. This rune means Deep Sea and grants augmented resistance. Great volumes of water serve as a bulwark guarding sleep, and an augur of the eldritch Truth. Overcome this hindrance, and seek what is yours.
Story: Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwert, left this transcription of the Great Ones' inhuman voices as a warning to those who would seek to understand the secrets of the eldritch Truth. The runes depict downreaching currents, signifying the dangers of delving too deep into the mysteries of the Great Ones. Those who overcome this obstacle will gain enhanced resistance to the sleep of the gods.

Item Description: Large rapier featuring a thin, sharp blade. Commonly used in life or death duels. Like its smaller counterparts, its made for thrusting attacks, and can be used while guarding with a shield.
Story: The large rapier is a finely crafted weapon that is commonly used in life or death duels. It is made for thrusting attacks and can be used while guarding with a shield.

Item Description: A curved Greatsword with a single-sided blade. Delivers slashing attacks with its sharp blade, but is ineffective against thick armor and hides covered in tough scales. Wielders of the weapon employ a unique style that enhances attacks with spinning motions.
Story: The single-sided blade of the curved Greatsword is sharp and delivers slashing attacks. However, the weapon is ineffective against thick armor and is covered in tough scales. The wielder of the Greatsword employs a unique style that enhances their attacks with spinning motions. This style allows them to slice through their enemies with ease.

Item Description: Headband decorated by a pair of great horns. Worn by ancestral follower warriors.
Story: The headband is adorned by a pair of great horns, signifying the wearer's allegiance to the ancestral follower warriors. The headband is worn by the descendants of the warrior caste, who use its power to protect themselves from harm.

Item Description: Large knife with a broad, curved blade. This weapon is designed to Spinning Slash and rend, inflicting blood loss upon the recipient.
Story: The large knife is a fearsome weapon, its broad, curved blade designed to inflict blood loss upon its target. It is said that this weapon is especially effective when used in conjunction with the Spinning Slash ability, allowing the user to quickly and easily tear through their opponents.

Item Description: Greatsword born from the soul of Gwyn Lord of Cinder. As bearer of the ultimate soul Gwyn wielded the bolts of the sun but before linking the fire divided that power amongst his children and set off with only this greatsword as his companion
Story: The greatsword was born from the soul of Gwyn Lord of Cinder. As bearer of the ultimate soul Gwyn wielded the bolts of the sun but before linking the fire divided that power amongst his children and set off with only this greatsword as his companion. The greatsword was forged from the very fires of the sun and was said to be unbreakable. Gwyn entrusted the greatsword to his eldest son, Darrow, to protect his people. Darrow passed the great

Item Description: Large mace wielded by the knights of the Cathedral of the Deep. The extremely heavy strike attacks of this weapon are devastating and will break weaker shields with a single blow. Wielding such a weapon will require inhuman strength. Skill: Perseverance Anchor weapon in earth to temporarily boost poise. Damage reduced while activated.
Story: The Cathedral of the Deep is a massive and ancient cathedral located deep within the earth. It is home to a large contingent of knights who protect the cathedral and its inhabitants from any who would harm them. One of the knights' main weapons is a large mace that is incredibly heavy and powerful. When used, it can break through even the strongest shields with a single strike. However, using this weapon requires immense strength and stamina, as it is very taxing on the user.

Item Description: Huge bludgeon with sharp protrusions. An enlarged version of its smaller cousin. Maintains all the advantages of smaller bludgeons, boasting few deficiencies while being very capable at breaking enemy guards and stances. A shrewd choice for simple slugging matches.
Story: The large bludgeon was a fearsome weapon. It was larger than its smaller cousin, and had sharp protrusions on the side. It was perfect for breaking guards and stances, and was a shrewd choice for simple slugging matches.

Item Description: Created by strapping a large blade to a hilt. A crude makeshift weapon with low durability. Primitive weapons can be more effective at evoking fear than more advanced efforts. Perhaps this is why the wielder chose this fearsome creation.
Story: The primitive weapon is a fearsome creation, evoking fear in its opponents. The wielder chose it for its effectiveness, and it seems to be working.

Item Description: This giant machete has a slash attack, and is a worker's tool in the Undead Settlement. This dismantling tool was not originally intended for use in battle. Skill: Sharpen Scrape the blade to sharpen and enable a cleaner cut.
Story: The Undead Settlement is a place where the dead walk among the living. This giant machete is a worker's tool, meant for use in the settlement's many factories and workshops. But this machete is not just any machete. It has a slash attack, and is a powerful weapon when used in battle.

Item Description: The blade of this huge, loathsome cleaver comprises a row of amputated Omen horns. Weapon of slaughter wielded by Omen killers. The hideous horns cause blood loss, adding vibrant colors to the ongoing mayhem.
Story: The blade of this huge cleaver is made up of a row of amputated Omen horns. The horns cause blood loss, adding vibrant colors to the ongoing mayhem. The cleaver is wielded by Omen killers, who use it to butcher their prey.

Item Description: Relic containing the Blood Echoes of a Great One. Use to gain cosmically nightmarish Blood Echoes. Like a true revelation, this uncanny relic defies understanding
Story: The relic was a small, dark box. It was old, and the wood was weathered and cracked. When opened, a foul smell filled the room. Inside the box was a small, tarnished silver mirror.

Item Description: Fragments of the lost wisdom of the Great Ones, beings that might be described as gods. Use to gain Insight. At Byrgenwerth Master Willem had an epiphany: We are thinking on the basest of planes. What we need, are more eyes.
Story: Willem, a Byrgenwerth Master, has a revelation that the way to gain insight into the Great Ones is to find more eyes. He begins to search for eyes among the people of the world, but they are all too blinded by their own desires. One day, he comes across a young girl who has the ability to see beyond the veil of reality. He takes her under his wing and teaches her the ways of the Great Ones.

Item Description: Weapon with a long curved blade. Converted from a wheat-harvesting tool. The magnificent sharp curved blade instills fear in opponents. Perhaps it is their survival instinct at work.
Story: The weapon is a curved wheat harvesting tool that has been converted into a deadly weapon. The curved blade instills fear in opponents, as it is likely their survival instinct at work. The weapon is so sharp that it can easily slice through flesh and bone.

Item Description: A great scythe used to harvest grain. Normally used as a farm tool, not a weapon. It feels almost as if there were powers in its giant blade, perhaps drawn from the fears of those hunted by this fearsome thing.
Story: The scythe was once used as a farm tool, but it has a dark history. It is said that the scythe is a weapon of fear, and that it can draw power from the fears of those who use it.

Item Description: Attacks with this large scythe, normally used for crop harvesting, are effective at breaking past shields. The magnificent sharp curved blade instills fear in opponents. Perhaps it is their survival instinct at work. Skill: Neck Swipe This attack aims for the scruff of a foe's neck, and when successful, functions as a head shot, inflicting heavy damage.
Story: The large scythe is a fearsome weapon that is normally used for crop harvesting. Its sharp curved blade instills fear in opponents, and when used correctly, can be a head shot that inflicts heavy damage.

Item Description: Huge bludgeon with three stars at the striking end. Though primarily a striking weapon, the stars' spikes cause blood loss. A blood-stained star is an ill omen, a fact not lost upon those against whom this weapon is brought to bear. Landing attacks slightly restores HP.
Story: The huge bludgeon with three stars at the striking end is a fearsome weapon. Its spikes cause blood loss, making it perfect for inflicting damage on enemies. Landing powerful attacks slightly restores the user's health.

Item Description: Huge bludgeon with three stars at the striking end. Though primarily a striking weapon, the stars' spikes cause blood loss. A blood-stained star is an ill omen, a fact not lost upon those against whom this weapon is brought to bear. Landing attacks slightly restores HP.
Story: The huge bludgeon with three stars at the striking end is a fearsome weapon. Its spikes cause blood loss, making it perfect for inflicting damage on enemies. Landing powerful attacks slightly restores the user's health.

Item Description: Pyromancy tome from the Great Swamp containing advanced pyromancies. Give to the old master pyromancer to learn advanced pyromancies of the Great Swamp. Spells of the Great Swamp are passed down from master to pupil. Without a master, there is no pupil, but without a pupil, there is also no master.
Story: The tome from the Great Swamp is a powerful artifact that contains advanced pyromancies. Giving it to the old master pyromancer will allow him to learn the spells of the Great Swamp and pass them down to a new generation of pyromancers. Without a master, there is no pupil, and without a pupil, there is no master. This story highlights the importance of a teacher and their students in the world of pyromancy.

Item Description: Ring said to be chiseled from the bone of a flame salamander by blighted Pyromancers living in the Great Swamp. Boosts pyromancies. It is believed that salamanders are the descendants of demons, born of the Chaos Flame, from which Pyromancy is also said to have originated.
Story: The Ring is said to have been carved from the bone of a flame salamander by blighted Pyromancers living in the Great Swamp. The Ring supposedly boosts pyromancies, and is believed to have originated from the Chaos Flame, which is said to be the origin of pyromancy.

Item Description: This giant wooden hammer is a worker's tool in the Undead Settlement. Intended to grind flesh and bone to prepare for burial, rather than use in battle.
Story: The Undead Settlement is a place where the dead are brought to be buried. The workers there use this giant wooden hammer to grind flesh and bone to prepare for burial. It's a tool meant for the living, not the dead.

Item Description: This greataxe is a veritable mass of iron. Its weight sends foes flying but makes it difficult to handle without inhuman strength. Any miss makes one very vulnerable as each swing requires the full force of the body
Story: The greataxe is a massive weapon that is difficult to handle without superhuman strength. Any miss makes the user very vulnerable, as each swing requires the full force of the body.

Item Description: Huge thick horn carved with tree ring-like markings adapted into a bludgeoning weapon. Wielded by ancestral follower warriors. The ancient horn is imbued with the power of ancestral spirits. A small amount of HP is restored upon defeating an enemy
Story: The ancient horn is a relic from a bygone era. It is said that the horn was created by the ancestors as a means of defending themselves. Whenever an enemy is defeated with the horn, a small amount of their health is restored.

Item Description: This lance features a long pole, and was originally intended to be used by knights for jousting. This weapon is primarily used in charging attacks, and would require tremendous strength and dexterity to be handled by a mere foot soldier. Skill: Charge Hold lance at waist and charge at foe. Use strong attack while charging to extend the length of the charge.
Story: The long, pole-like lance is a relic from a time when knights would joust for entertainment. It is now primarily used in charging attacks, as the user must have tremendous strength and dexterity to wield it. However, there is also a skill to using it effectively - by holding the lance at waist level and charging at the foe, the user can extend the length of the charge, making it more powerful.

Item Description: Shield born from the soul of the great grey wolf Sif guardian of the grave of the Abysswalker Knight Artorias. Boasts consistent defense and divine protection against various status effects.
Story: The shield was forged from the soul of the great grey wolf Sif, the guardian of the grave of the Abysswalker Knight Artorias. The shield is said to boast consistent defense and divine protection against various status effects.

Item Description: A coarse iron lump of an ultra greatsword. Mows down foes by utilizing its incredible weight. Though handling it likely requires the wielder to have surpassed the realm of the merely human, it is precisely for this reason the weapon is used to slaughter even inhuman foes.
Story: The ultra greatsword is a massive iron lump that is incredibly heavy. It is used to slaughter enemies who are beyond the realm of the merely human. Though it is difficult to handle, the ultra greatsword is perfect for slaying even inhuman foes.

Item Description: Sword born from the soul of the great grey wolf Sif guardian of the grave of the Abysswalker Knight Artorias. Sir Artorias hunted the Darkwraiths and his sword strikes harder against dark servants
Story: The sword, Sif, was born from the soul of the great grey wolf Sif, who was the guardian of the grave of the Abysswalker Knight Artorias. Sir Artorias hunted the Darkwraiths and his sword strikes harder against dark servants.

Item Description: Sword born from the souls of the great grey wolf Sif guardian of the grave of the Abysswalker Knight Artorias. The sword can damage ghosts as it was cursed when Artorias joined a covenant with the creatures of the Abyss
Story: The sword, Sif, was born from the souls of the great grey wolf Sif, who was a guardian of the grave of the Abysswalker Knight Artorias. The sword was cursed when Artorias joined a covenant with the creatures of the Abyss, but it was later purified by the goddess of the hunt, Ariamis.

Item Description: Greatsword of the Forlorn, who wander the land of the Undead. The King's elder brother Aldia sought to overcome the curse through means unalike his sibling's. The Forlorn were born of Aldia's sinful infatuation.
Story: The greatsword of the Forlorn was once wielded by the king's elder brother, Aldia. After he was cursed by a necromancer, Aldia sought to overcome the curse through means unalike his sibling's. The Forlorn were born of Aldia's sinful infatuation, and they wander the land of the Undead in search of revenge.

Item Description: Green weed shaped like a flower. Temporary boost to stamina recovery speed. This uniquely bitter biting herb is sometimes harvested in large quantities but normally it is an annual plant found near water
Story: The green weed was a beautiful flower-like plant that grew near water. It had a temporary boost to stamina recovery speed, and was sometimes harvested in large quantities. However, it was normally an annual plant that was found near water.

Item Description: Green weed shaped like a leafy flower. Temporarily boosts stamina recovery speed. At one point, this herb was avoided due to its uniquely bitter taste, but once its effects became known, it was harvested to near extinction by merchants. Now, only exceptionally rare, wild specimens of this plant are left.
Story: The green weed was once avoided due to its uniquely bitter taste. However, once its effects became known, it was harvested to near extinction by merchants. Now, only exceptionally rare, wild specimens of this plant are left.

Item Description: Attire of the retired hunter Djura. This worn wolf cap was his trademark. Djura is known through his contact with the Powder Kegs, the heretics of the workshop. He is said to have been both uncommonly kind and dreadfully foolish. Djura felt defeated by the state of Old Yharnam and renounced his hunter's vows.
Story: Djura's wolf cap is a well-known trademark of his. He is known for his interactions with the Powder Kegs, a heretical sect of hunters in Old Yharnam. He is said to have been both kind and foolish, and felt defeated by the state of the city. He renounced his hunter's vows and settled down in a small cottage in the woods outside of town.

Item Description: Curved sword boasting a large blade. This weapon is designed to make use of its weight in combination with its sharp cutting edge. A thoroughly reliable choice of weapon for those who can master its particulars.
Story: The curved sword is a finely crafted weapon that is designed to make use of its weight in combination with its sharp cutting edge. The weapon is a thoroughly reliable choice for those who can master its particulars. Those who can use the curved sword to its fullest potential are able to take down even the most formidable opponents with ease.

Item Description: Armor of the stone knights, guardians of the forest sanctuary. The stone knights are golems animated by magic, and their enchanted armor is oppressively heavy
Story: The armor of the stone knights is a heavy, oppressive force that guards the forest sanctuary. The knights were created by a powerful wizard long ago to protect the forest from harm. Over time, the armor has become a symbol of strength and protection for the people of the forest.

Item Description: Engraved golden bracers. Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtree. In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.
Story: The bracers are worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtree. They are said to have been created in accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, and it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

Item Description: Sliced tail of the Sanctuary Guardian. This flexible, spiked and highly poisonous tail would make a rather obnoxious weapon.
Story: The Sanctuary Guardian's tail is a deadly weapon that would make an effective addition to anyones arsenal. The flexible spikes and poisonous properties make it a deadly threat to any opponent.

Item Description: Ring of the Blue Sentinel covenant. Join this covenant and wear this ring to be automatically summoned to the worlds of blue apostles who have been invaded by dark spirits. The ring is engraved with the crest of the Way of Blue, symbolizing the dignified oath to protect each world's master from dark spirits.
Story: The Ring of the Blue Sentinel covenant is a magical ring that allows its wearer to be automatically summoned to the worlds of blue apostles who have been invaded by dark spirits. The ring is engraved with the crest of the Way of Blue, symbolizing the oath to protect each world's master from dark spirits.

Item Description: A Caryll rune discovered by the old hunter Ludwig along with the Holy Moonlight Sword. Boosts amount of life recovered by rallying. When Ludwig closed his eyes, he saw darkness, or perhaps nothingness, and that is where he discovered the tiny beings of light. Ludwig was certain that these playful dancing sprites offered guidance They could empty Ludwig of his fears at least in the midst of a hunt.
Story: Ludwig had been hunting for years, ever since his family was killed. He was a skilled hunter, but he was never able to bring his family back. One day, Ludwig found a Caryll rune while out hunting. When he touched it, he saw a vision of dancing sprites. The sprites told him that they could help him find his family again. Ludwig was skeptical at first, but he decided to give it a try. After using the rune, Ludwig was able to find

Item Description: Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown. The garb of those accused of lesser crimes, indicated by the collar of sharpened branches.
Story: The olive brown cloak was the garb of those accused of lesser crimes. It was a coarse, hooded cloak made of olive-colored fabric. The collar of sharpened branches indicated that the wearer was someone who was not to be messed with.

Item Description: Ancient armor of a set of cast iron armor, belonging to Champion Gundyr. Modeled after a former king. Gundyr, or the Belated Champion, was bested by an unknown warrior. He then became sheath to a coiled sword in the hopes that someday, the first flame would be linked once more.
Story: The armor belonged to Gundyr, a champion who was bested by an unknown warrior. He then became sheath to a coiled sword in the hopes that someday, the first flame would be linked once more. One day, a young girl found the armor and decided to take it home. She was inspired by Gundyr's story and decided to become a champion herself.

Item Description: Halberd of Gundyr the Champion, received when he was charged with his duty. This old cast-iron halberd has the power to break poise, and is said to never crumble, seeming to suggest that Gundyr was fated to eternal service from the beginning.
Story: Gundyr was a champion of the gods, and was given a halberd as a sign of his dedication. The halberd was said to never crumble, and it had the power to break poise. Gundyr was destined to serve the gods for eternity.

Item Description: Armor of the nomadic Gyrm. Excellent poise but heavy. The stocky Gyrm are kind-natured, but humans deemed them impure, and drove them underground
Story: The Armor of the nomadic Gyrm is excellent for its poise, but it is a bit heavy. The stocky Gyrm are kind-natured, but humans deemed them impure, and drove them underground. Now, they live in secret, and use their armor to protect themselves from the humans who would seek to harm them.

Item Description: An axe used by the nomadic Gyrm. At first glance this axe appears crude, but with further examination one sees the fine craftsmanship of Gyrm blacksmiths. Quite heavy for a human, but flung about with reckless abandon by the Gyrm.
Story: The nomadic Gyrm use this axe as their primary weapon. It is quite heavy for a human, but the Gyrm use it with reckless abandon. They believe that the axe is imbued with the power of the Gyrm, and that it can bring them victory in any battle.

Item Description: A great hammer used by the nomadic Gyrm. A makeshift weapon created from a blacksmith's anvil. As heavy as it appears. Crafted rather shoddily, but each hit landed is certain to inflict serious damage.
Story: The nomadic Gyrm travel the land, swinging this great hammer with all their might. It is a makeshift weapon, created from a blacksmith's anvil, but each hit landed is certain to inflict serious damage.

Item Description: A greataxe used by the nomadic Gyrm. At first glance this greataxe appears crude, but with further examination one sees the fine craftsmanship of Gyrm blacksmiths. Quite heavy for a human, but swung about with reckless abandon by the Gyrm.
Story: The greataxe was forged by the nomadic Gyrm, a race of fierce warriors who traveled the land in search of adventure. The Gyrm blacksmiths were renowned for their craftsmanship, and the greataxe was no exception. It was quite heavy for a human, but swung about with reckless abandon by the Gyrm. They believed in using the best tools for the job, and the greataxe was perfect for battle.

Item Description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence and strength to the detriment of FP. Scholars of the Haima Conspectus sought the power to quell conflict, and to this end studied the sorceries of cannon fire and the gavel.
Story: The glintstone crown bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars was said to increase intelligence and strength to the detriment of FP. Scholars of the Haima Conspectus sought the power to quell conflict, and to this end studied the sorceries of cannon fire and the gavel.

Item Description: Long-hilted weapon mixing spear and axe is difficult to handle requiring both strength and dexterity. The Halberd has two elementary attacks: Spear-like thrusting and large sweeping swings. However one false swing and the wielder is left wide open
Story: The Halberd is a difficult weapon to use, requiring both strength and dexterity. The first attack is a spear-like thrusting motion, while the second is a large sweeping swing. However, one false swing and the wielder is left wide open.

Item Description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
Story: The Haligtree are a sacred tree to the people of the forest. For centuries, soldiers have sworn their allegiance to the tree by wearing these gauntlets. The gauntlets are stained with the blood of enemies, and the rust has slowly taken over. The gauntlets are a symbol of strength and honor to the soldiers who wear them.

Item Description: Armor worn by knights sworn the Haligtree. Its left breast is emblazoned with the crest of the Haligtree. Though watered with Miquella's own blood since it was a sapling, the Haligtree ultimately failed to grow into an Erdtree.
Story: The armor worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree was once stained with Miquella's own blood. The tree failed to grow into an Erdtree, but the armor still bears the crest of the Haligtree.

Item Description: Helm worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree. Graced by a crown of unalloyed gold. Increases faith.
Story: The Helm of the Haligtree was a sacred relic worn by knights sworn to the tree. It increased their faith and granted them protection from harm.

Item Description: War scythe of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella. This was the weapon of commanders in Malenia's army, and the half-halo blade deals holy damage.
Story: The War Scythe of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella. This was the weapon of commanders in Malenia's army, and the half-halo blade deals holy damage. The Cleanrot Knights were a group of holy warriors who fought alongside Malenia, the Blade of Miquella. They were a fearsome force, and their scythes were deadly weapons.

Item Description: Hammer comprised of a large stone affixed to a metal handle. Originally a blacksmith's tool. The art of smithing is said to have originated among the giants. This weapon's striking attacks boast ample weight behind them.
Story: The hammer is a large, heavy tool used by blacksmiths. It is said that the art of smithing originated among the giants, and this weapon's striking attacks boast ample weight behind them.

Item Description: Metal hammer of Vamos a skeleton blacksmith deep within the Catacombs who rarely speaks. Can be used as a strike weapon but better left in the hands of its talented owner
Story: The metal hammer of Vamos was passed down from father to son for generations within the Catacombs. The blacksmith rarely spoke, preferring to let his hammer do the talking. But when the hammer was needed, it was deadly accurate and could fell even the strongest of foes.

Item Description: Small hand axe. Appears identical to a lumberjack's tool but has an ideal weight and strength and is easy to handle. One wrong swing leaves the wielder wide open so timing and proximity to the enemy must be judged carefully
Story: The small hand axe is a finely crafted tool that is perfect for a lumberjack. It has the weight and strength that is needed to handle the heavy logs, but is also easy to handle. The wrong swing can leave the wielder open, so timing and proximity to the enemy must be carefully judged.

Item Description: Small portable lantern. This hunting accessory provides light while leaving both hands free to hold weapons. The torch, however, provides a stronger source of light.
Story: The small portable lantern was a handy hunting accessory. It provided light while leaving both hands free to hold weapons. The torch, however, provided a much stronger source of light.

Item Description: Blade built into Malenia's prosthetic arm. Through consecration it is resistant to rot. Malenia's war prosthesis symbolized her victories. Some claim to have seen wings when the weapon was raised aloft; wings of fierce determination that have never known defeat.
Story: The Blade built into Malenia's prosthetic arm is a powerful weapon that is resistant to rot. Malenia's war prosthesis symbolized her victories, and some claim to have seen wings when the weapon was raised aloft. The wings of fierce determination that have never known defeat.

Item Description: Dagger used by handmaids of the Profaned Capital. Each successful attack replenishes a slight amount of FP. It is said that these women took pleasure in wounding others.
Story: The Dagger was used by the handmaids of the Profaned Capital. Each successful attack replenished a small amount of FP. It was said that these women took great pleasure in wounding others.

Item Description: He who chooses this as a weapon either faces extenuating circumstances or has an odd sense of humor. If you care for your life, leave this one in the kitchen.
Story: The kitchen is a dangerous place. It's hot, cramped, and filled with sharp objects. But if you're looking for a weapon, the kitchen is the place to go. This knife is sharp, but it's also dull. It's not meant for fighting, but for cutting vegetables.

Item Description: Giant gold-decorated curved sword wielded by warriors of the Harald Legion, who sought the dark soul. The swords sank into the dark with the legion, where their blades were severely corroded. Skill: Sever Hold the giant blade with both hands and slash repeatedly at foe's feet
Story: The Harald Legion was a mighty force in the world, wielding swords of gold and wielding the power of the dark soul. However, their blades eventually corroded and they were lost to the world. Now, their swords can be found only in the darkest of places, where their skill and power can still be wielded.

Item Description: Armor made of thick leather. Very common type of protective gear, they provide a sound level of defense.
Story: The armor was made of thick leather and was very common type of protective gear. It provided a sound level of defense and was very sturdy.

Item Description: A commonplace piece of armor. No embellishments. Very solid
Story: The armor was unremarkable, just a common piece of armor. It was very solid, and there were no embellishments. However, the armor had a special power. Whenever someone wearing the armor was in danger, they would be protected by a shield of invincibility.

Item Description: Bow fashioned from a minstrel's harp. Sonorous tones still resound when firing arrows. Troubadours sing tales of champions, both in the honorable service of the Erdtree, and the one who spurns honor for blasphemy.
Story: The bow was crafted from a minstrel's harp. The sonorous tones still resounded when firing arrows. The troubadours sang tales of champions, both in the honorable service of the Erdtree, and the one who spurns honor for blasphemy.

Item Description: The large sickle-shaped body, used for severing corpses, is a worker’s tool in the Undead Settlement. The sharp edge is on the inside of the weapon, itself designed for cutting and pulling, thus allowing for good damage against shielded foes.
Story: The large sickle-shaped body, used for severing corpses, is a worker’s tool in the Undead Settlement. The sharp edge is on the inside of the weapon, itself designed for cutting and pulling, thus allowing for good damage against shielded foes.

Item Description: Certain Church hunters obfuscate their identities and slip into the nooks and crannies of the city. This is the garb that allows these harrowed individuals to go unnoticed. These hunters are keen to early signs of the scourge, serving as a first line of defense against its outbreak. Or perhaps, when the time is ripe, they find signs of the scourge where there are none. It just goes to show, the corner beggar is not always who he seems.
Story: The Church hunters are a group of individuals who use disguises to slip into the city unnoticed in order to find signs of the scourge. They are the first line of defense against the outbreak and are also skilled at finding signs of the scourge where there are none.

Item Description: Armor worn by Havel the Rock's warriors. Carved from solid rock, its tremendous weight is matched only by the defense it provides. Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face them were inevitably beaten to a pulp
Story: Havel the Rock's armor was a sight to behold. It was carved from solid rock, and its tremendous weight was matched only by the defense it provided. Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

Item Description: A helm and armor as if hewn from a giant boulder. Offers stupendous defense, but weighs a ton. The origin of the name Havel is not clear. Some say it was the warrior who wore the armor, but others say it was the name of a great kingdom ruined in a barbaric war.
Story: The Havel armor was once the pride of a great kingdom. But it was destroyed in a barbaric war. Now, only the most courageous and determined warriors can hope to wear it. It is a stupendous defense, but it weighs a ton. Anyone who tries to wear it risks being crushed under its weight.

Item Description: Gauntlets as if hewn from a giant boulder. Highly protective, but excessively heavy. The warriors who followed Havel the Rock never flinched, nor retreated from battle, crushing any foe that stood in their way.
Story: Havel the Rock was a mighty warrior who led his people to victory against all odds. He was known for his massive gauntlets, which were so heavy they made him unable to use his other arm. However, this didn't stop him from crushing any foe that stood in his way.

Item Description: Greatshield of the legendary Havel the Rock. Cut straight from a great slab of stone. This greatshield is imbued with the magic of Havel proves a strong defense and is incredibly heavy. A true divine heirloom on par with the Dragon tooth
Story: Havel the Rock was a legendary hero who fought against the evil forces of the dragonkin. He was known for his great shield, which was said to be made from a slab of solid rock. The shield was so powerful that it could block even the most powerful attacks.

Item Description: This ring was named after Havel the Rock, Lord Gwyn's old battlefield compatriot. Havel's men wore the ring to express faith in their leader and to carry a heavier load
Story: The ring was given to a soldier by his commander as a sign of faith in his abilities. The soldier wore the ring with pride, knowing that it was a symbol of his comrades' support.

Item Description: A ring for warriors keen on heavy acoutrements. Increases maximum equip load. This ring was named after Havel the Rock, the battlefield compatriot of Gwyn, the First Lord. The art of war has been a constant since ages past, and those who would follow in Havel's footsteps are no fewer now than in his own day.
Story: Havel the Rock was a great warrior and friend to Gwyn, the First Lord. He was known for his heavy armor and weapons, and he helped Gwyn win many battles. After Gwyn's death, Havel continued to fight for the kingdom, always looking for new ways to improve his skills. One day, he found a ring that increased his maximum equip load. This made him even more powerful on the battlefield, and he was able to help the kingdom win many more battles

Item Description: One of the special rings granted to the four knights of Gwyn. The Hawk Ring belonged to Hawkeye Gough, who led the Greatarchers. Boosts bow range, so that arrows fly like they were shot by Gough's great bow, which took down high-flying dragons.
Story: The Hawk Ring was a special ring granted to the four knights of Gwyn. Hawkeye Gough, who led the Greatarchers, was the ring's owner. The ring boosted bow range, so that arrows flew like they were shot by Gough's great bow, which took down high-flying dragons.

Item Description: A ring graced with the engraving of the hawk. Extends the range of arrows. Blue eyed Durgo, the nomadic bowman, had many valiant victories in battle, half owing to the boon of this ring.
Story: The ring bestowed power to the user's arrows, allowing them to shoot further than usual. Durgo, a skilled bowman, relied on this ring to help him win battles.

Item Description: Blood-stained swordgrass of Hawkwood, deserter of the Undead Legion. Traditionally, the Undead Legion of Farron sends the gravest of messages using swordgrass. Come to the mausoleum in Farron. Only one can take the path of ancient dragons.
Story: The Blood-stained swordgrass of Hawkwood is a rare and powerful plant that only grows in the mausoleum of Farron. It is said that the only person who can take the path of ancient dragons is the one who finds and takes the swordgrass.

Item Description: Small metal shield. A standard widely-used shield. This shield is easy to use and is one of the smallest shields that offers 100% physical damage reduction.
Story: The small metal shield is a common shield that offers 100% physical damage reduction. It is easy to use and is one of the smallest shields that offers this protection.

Item Description: Large bolt. Used mainly with the Heavy Crossbow. These weighty bolts inflict high damage, but have reduced range.
Story: The large bolt is a heavy crossbow bolt that inflicts high damage, but has a reduced range. It is most commonly used with the Heavy Crossbow.

Item Description: Boots made of thick leather. The boots of the pyromancers are incredibly tough, on account of the rugged grasslands and treacherous swamps they must traverse. Their soles are nearly impenetrable
Story: The boots of the pyromancers are incredibly tough, on account of the rugged grasslands and treacherous swamps they must traverse. The boots are also incredibly comfortable, thanks to the thick leather. The boots are perfect for walking through the grasslands and the swamps, as their soles are nearly impenetrable.

Item Description: Powerful large crossbow. While bows require both hands, a crossbow is held in one, but arming each bolt takes time.
Story: The large crossbow was a powerful weapon that required only one hand to use. The arming of each bolt took time, but it was a deadly weapon when used correctly.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Famously used to forge Farron greatswords. Used in infusion to create heavy weapons. A warrior can appreciate a heavy weapon, for they scale effectively with strength.
Story: The gem of infused titanite is a legendary item used to forge Farron greatswords. It is also used in infusion to create heavy weapons, which are ideal for warriors who want to scale effectively with strength.

Item Description: A lance originating in Heide. A special alloy makes it very durable. The tip of the lance has been extended. The composition of the alloy of these lances remains a mystery, but in Drangleic the attempt to imitate it resulted in the similar bradden steel.
