Lances are normally wielded by mounted knights and it takes considerable training to handle one on the ground.
Story: The lance that originated in Heide was a special alloy that made it very durable. The tip of the lance had been extended, making it easier to wield on the ground. The composition of the alloy of these lances remains a mystery, but in Drangleic the attempt to imitate it resulted in the similar bradden steel. Lances are normally wielded by mounted knights, and it takes considerable training to handle one on the ground.

Item Description: Chainmail worn by Heide Knights. Whether Heide refers to a kingdom or was just a name for the land is not clear, for no records date back far enough to tell. All that is known is that the Way of Blue has its origins in Heide, and that Heide was later subsumed by the sea.
Story: The Heide Knights wore chainmail armor that was said to be imbued with the power of the Way of Blue. The armor was said to have originated from Heide, a kingdom that was later subsumed by the sea. The armor was said to be powerful and able to protect its wearer from harm.

Item Description: Straight sword originating in Heide, A special alloy makes it very durable. The composition of the alloy of these swords remains a mystery, but in Drangleic the attempt to imitate it resulted in the similar bradden steel.
Story: The straight sword originating from Heide is a special alloy made with a unique composition that makes it very durable. The attempt to imitate it resulted in the similar bradden steel. In Drangleic, the straight sword is a powerful weapon that can easily cleave through enemies.

Item Description: A lance originating in Heide. A special alloy makes it very durable. The composition of the alloy of these lances remains a mystery, but in Drangleic the attempt to imitate it resulted in the similar bradden steel. Lances are normally wielded by mounted knights, and it takes considerable training to handle one on the ground.
Story: The lance that originated in Heide was a special alloy that made it very durable. The attempt to imitate it resulted in the similar bradden steel. Lances are normally wielded by mounted knights, and it takes considerable training to handle one on the ground.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. The Heir sees sentimentality in the warmth of blood, acknowledging this as one of the darker hunter techniques. More Blood Echoes gained from visceral attacks. Perhaps the Heir is a hunter who bears the echoing will of those before him.
Story: Caryll's runesmithing skills are renowned, and she often leaves behind secret symbols that hint at her work. One such symbol is the Blood Echo, a warm glow that emanates from visceral attacks. Some believe that the Blood Echo is a sign of the Heir's dark hunter techniques, acknowledging the darkness within them.

Item Description: An undated halberd. Wielded by a warrior from a time so ancient that there exists no record of his endeavors. Has extremely low durability. Sometimes, just as a thing falls to pieces, it unleashes its last flash of great power...
Story: The halberd was once wielded by a warrior from a time so ancient that there exists no record of his endeavors. One day, the weapon fell to pieces and its last flash of great power was unleashed. Now, anyone who wields the halberd can draw upon its power.

Item Description: Greatsword patterned after the black steeple of the Helphen, the lampwood which guides the dead of the spirit world. The lamplight is similar to grace in appearance, only it is said that it can only be seen by those who met their death in battle.
Story: The Helphen, a black steeple that guides the dead of the spirit world, is the inspiration for a greatsword. The blade is patterned after the lamplight, and its appearance is said to be similar to grace. Only those who have died in battle can see it, and its light is said to be like a beacon of hope in the dark.

Item Description: Hunter's hat worn by Henryk, the old hunter. The taciturn old hunter Henryk was once partners with Father Gascoigne, and though they were a fierce and gallant duo, their partnership led to Henryk's tragically long life. Henryk's unique yellow garb is resistant to bolt and will be of great help to any hunter who has inherited the onus of the hunt.
Story: Henryk's hat is a relic of a bygone era, when hunters and their dogs worked together to bring down game. The hat is made from a tough, resilient material that helps protect against bolts, and it will be a valuable asset to any hunter who wears it. Henryk's hat is a reminder of the bonds of friendship and brotherhood that can last a lifetime.

Item Description: Hunter's attire worn by Henryk, the old hunter. The taciturn old hunter Henryk was once partners with Father Gascoigne, and though they were a fierce and gallant duo, their partnership led to Henryk's tragically long life. Henryk's unique yellow garb is resistant to bolt and will be of great help to any hunter who has inherited the onus of the hunt.
Story: Henryk's attire is a sign of his long and successful partnership with Father Gascoigne. He was a fierce and gallant hunter, and his unique garb was resistant to bolts, making it a great help to any hunter who has inherited the onus of the hunt.

Item Description: Steel armor, Leather Gloves and Quilted Trousers said to be worn by Heralds of the Way of White, who deliver commandments of duty. Protection made of steel has excellent physical absorption, but is found lacking against blunt strikes and lightning damage.
Story: The armor is said to be worn by Heralds of the Way of White, who deliver commandments of duty. The armor is made of steel, which has excellent physical absorption, but is found lacking against blunt strikes and lightning damage.

Item Description: Catalyst used by generations of heretic sorcerers. Sorcery is a logical academic discipline, and the power of sorceries depends heavily on the caster's intelligence. Skill: Steady Chant Boost the strength of sorceries for a very short period. Works while equipped in either hand.
Story: The Catalyst was used by generations of heretic sorcerers. It was said that the Catalyst was used to create the first sorceries. The Catalyst was a powerful tool that allowed sorcerers to boost the strength of their spells. The Catalyst was also very useful in allowing sorcerers to cast their spells while wearing it in either hand.

Item Description: Grants slight increase to spell uses. Hexing appears to be an offshoot of sorcery, but its specific origins are unknown. Robes worn by a hexer. Belonged to Felkin the Outcast. Those who have a taste of dark are drawn into its vortex and rarely return. Perhaps it appeals to something deep within the human soul.
Story: Felkin the Outcast's robes grant a slight increase to spell uses. However, the hexer's dark desires draw those who have a taste of sorcery into its vortex, and they rarely return.

Item Description: Hexed black lacquer urn. Explodes, inflicting dark damage. With the dark art of hexing strictly forbidden, who would dare fill an urn with such power? The very origin of the art are unclear, yet another reason hexing is feared.
Story: The hexed black lacquer urn is a powerful artifact that explodes when filled with dark magic. Whoever fills it with this magic is sure to face consequences, as the origin of hexing is shrouded in mystery.

Item Description: Choice weapon of Yellowfinger Heysel, a Finger of Rosaria and xanthous scholar. It`s both a weapon and sorcery staff. The gold specks are remnants of lost sorceries.
Story: The Choice Weapon of Yellowfinger Heysel is a Finger of Rosaria, a xanthous scholar, and a powerful weapon. The gold specks are remnants of lost sorceries, and the staff is both a weapon and sorcery staff.

Item Description: Holy water blessed by the Queen of Lothric. Fully restores FP. There is a grave in Lothric that sees no visitors, a dark place where rootless warriors rest. The Queen of Lothric alone cared to wish the poor souls good fortune.
Story: The Queen of Lothric bestowed her holy water upon the grave of the rootless warriors, hoping that their luck would be restored.

Item Description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence and endurance to the detriment of FP. The crown of Hierodas was granted to scholars who engaged in nomadic study away from the academy.
Story: Raya Lucaria was a great and powerful empire that spanned the entire continent. It was a time of great prosperity and peace, and the people were happy and content. However, there was one group of people who were not content. These were the scholars, who were constantly looking for new knowledge and ways to improve their society. One day, a crown was bestowed upon the most accomplished of these scholars, and it became known as the Glintstone Crown. This crown increased their intelligence

Item Description: Hood of a page selected for special privilege by the noble they serve. The unassuming sack-like appearance benefits their unseen and unknown stature.
Story: The hood of a page selected for special privilege by the noble they serve hides their identity and allows them to move about unnoticed. This hood also grants them a certain level of privilege, allowing them to do things others cannot.

Item Description: Single-sided axe used by the warriors of the highlands. Brave combatants begin battle by crying out their names. Roars are enhanced by this weapon.
Story: The single-sided axe is a powerful weapon used by the warriors of the highlands. Brave combatants begin battle by crying out their names, which are then amplified by the weapon's roar.

Item Description: Hideously stained and ragged cloth armor. Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.
Story: The armor is stained with blood and dirt, and it is clearly not fit for use anymore. It has been worn by soldiers who have turned to banditry, and it is now a symbol of their criminal lifestyle.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. A stone plentiful in Londor, land of Hollows. Used in infusion to create Hollow weapons. Hollow weapons are said to peer into the essence of its wielder, whose luck boosts attack.
Story: The gem was a prized possession for any adventurer in Londor. It was said to be plentiful in the land of Hollows, and was used in infusion to create Hollow weapons. Hollow weapons were said to peer into the essence of their wielder, granting them an extra boost in attack.

Item Description: Armor worn by Hollowed infantry. A piece of basic, minimal equipment. Worse yet, they're worn and nearly falling apart. Not recommended unless your options are spent.
Story: The armor was old and worn, but it was still functional. The metal was tarnished and the leather was frayed, but it still protected the wearer. The Hollowed infantry wore these armor pieces as the cheapest and most basic option, and they were nearly falling apart.

Item Description: Apparel worn by Hollow soldiers. It may be old and battered, but its iron construction makes it quite sturdy. It is wise to wear a sturdy form of head protection against arrows and other physical threats. It is so tattered that it barely serves its purpose anymore
Story: The Hollow soldiers wear tattered and battered clothing that is still sturdy. They use this clothing to protect themselves from arrows and other physical threats. The clothing is so tattered that it barely serves its purpose anymore.

Item Description: armor, worn by Hollowed Royal Soldiers. Appears to be crafted with quality materials, but is highly degraded and close to falling apart. Wearing this will be of little use.
Story: The armor worn by Hollowed Royal Soldiers is highly degraded and close to falling apart. However, wearing it will provide little protection against the dangers of the world.

Item Description: Metal shield wielded by Hollow soldiers. Heavily rusted but sturdy providing a strong defense
Story: The metal shield was heavily rusted, but it was still sturdy and provided a strong defense. It was the perfect tool for a Hollow soldier.

Item Description: Leather armor worn by Hollow thieves. It stifles noise and helps its wear hide in the shadows
Story: The leather armor worn by Hollow thieves was designed to help its wearer blend in with the shadows and avoid detection. It was also designed to make little noise, to help its wearer remain undetected.

Item Description: Armor worn by Hollow warriors. It is made of thick leather that is tattered with age, It is wise to wear a sturdy form of protection against arrows and other physical threats.
Story: The armor worn by Hollow warriors is made of thick leather that is tattered with age. It is wise to wear a sturdy form of protection against arrows and other physical threats. The armor is also effective against magic, as it is made from the hides of Hollows.

Item Description: Greatsword used for a lifetime by a masked knight. Harbors the fears that lurk within the mind of Hollows, and is particularly effective against them. Bestowed to a proper Mirrah knight long ago. Two-hand to execute special sword techniques.
Story: The greatsword was wielded by a masked knight for many years. The knight had fought many battles, and had faced many fears. One of the fears that the knight had was of Hollows. The greatsword was specifically designed to fight against Hollows, and was very effective against them.

Item Description: An arcane sword discovered long ago by Ludwig. When blue moonlight dances around the sword, and it channels the abyssal cosmos, its great blade will hurl a shadowy lightwave. The Holy Moonlight Sword is synonymous with Ludwig, the Holy Blade, but few have ever set eyes on the great blade, and whatever guidance it has to offer, it seems to be of a very private, elusive sort.
Story: Ludwig discovered the sword long ago, and it has been said that when the moon is blue, the sword's power is at its strongest. It is said that the sword can channel the abyssal cosmos, and that by wielding it, one can achieve great things. However, few have ever seen the sword, and even fewer know what it can do.

Item Description: Robe donned by men of the cloth. Though plain to the eye, its hardy fabric repels rain and keeps the body warm. Those dissatisfied with church teachings must test their faith by going on a spiritual journey. Such is the ritual self-purification of the Way of White. Topped by a Distinctive hat worn only by Way of White priests in Thorolund. It is simply meant to show their position within the hierarchy. It holds almost no meaning in the land of Lordran.
Story: A robe worn by men of the cloth. It is plain to the eye, but its hardy fabric repels rain and keeps the body warm. Those dissatisfied with church teachings must test their faith by going on a spiritual journey. Such is the ritual self-purification of the Way of White. Topped by a Distinctive hat worn only by Way of White priests in Thorolund. It holds almost no meaning in the land of Lordran.

Item Description: An urn filled with crystal-clear water. Originally intended as a soothing potion, this water scalds the skin of Undead and Hollows. In the old capital of Mirrah, an ancient, well-protected spring produces holy water, but the water has been difficult to acquire ever since Mirrah became embroiled in war.
Story: The city of Mirrah was once a thriving metropolis, but now it is a ruined shell. The war that has ravaged the city has made it difficult to obtain any form of water, let alone holy water. One of the few sources of water is an ancient well protected by an ancient wall. However, the water from the well is scalding hot, and is not safe for Undead or Hollows.

Item Description: Bone fragment reduced to white ash. Return to last bonfire used for resting. Bonfires are fueled by bones of the Undead. In rare cases the strong urge of their previous owner's to seek bonfires enchants their bones with a homeward instinct.
Story: The ash from a bone fragment reduced to white was resting on the last bonfire used for resting. The bonfires are fueled by bones of the Undead and in rare cases the strong urge of their previous owner's to seek bonfires enchants their bones with a homeward instinct.

Item Description: A white-ashen bone. Return to the last bonfire rested at. Bonfires burn on the bones of Undead. And this bone, belonging to one whose journey was cut short, has the power to travel to bonfires. As if it yearns to resume its futile quest..
Story: The white-ashen bone belonged to a traveler who died before reaching their final destination. The bone's power allows it to travel to bonfires, as if it yearns to resume its quest.

Item Description: A pole with lumps attached to it. Found in the manor in Aldia. Heavier than a standard mace, but with more effective striking owing to its hard lumps. In the far eastern outskirts of Drangleic lies an old manor that is now long forgotten. As it should be, for the things that lurk there are better left unknown.
Story: The manor was abandoned long ago, and the only thing that remains now is the pole with the strange lumps attached to it. It's heavier than a standard mace, but with more effective striking owing to its hard lumps. Some say that the lumps are actually the remains of some sort of demon, but no one knows for sure.

Item Description: Weapon worn on the fist comprised of sharp parallel blades favored by those who lurk in the dark. Lacerations cause blood loss with great effect. Claw weapons come in pairs, and two-handing this weapon will equip it to both hands.
Story: The weapon worn on the fist is a fearsome weapon, made up of sharp parallel blades that cause great blood loss. It is a favoured weapon of those who lurk in the dark, as the lacerations caused by the blades cause great damage. The weapon can also be equipped with claws, allowing it to be wielded in two hands.

Item Description: Longbow made from animal horn. Wielded by the master hunters of the ancestral followers. Imbues arrows fired with magic damage. Reveals its true worth when used with magic-infused arrows.
Story: The longbow was made from the horn of an animal. It was used by the master hunters of the ancestral followers. The longbow imbues arrows fired with magic damage. When used with magic-infused arrows, the longbow reveals its true worth.

Item Description: Longbow made from animal horn. Wielded by the master hunters of the ancestral followers. Imbues arrows fired with magic damage. Reveals its true worth when used with magic-infused arrows.
Story: The longbow was made from the horn of an animal. It was used by the master hunters of the ancestral followers. The longbow imbues arrows fired with magic damage. When used with magic-infused arrows, the longbow reveals its true worth.

Item Description: One of the special rings granted to the four knights of Gwyn. The Hornet Ring Belonged to the Lord's Blade Ciaran. By boosting critical attacks, its wearer can annihilate foes, as Ciaran's dagger laid waste to Lord Gwyn's enemies.
Story: The Hornet Ring was a special ring granted to the four knights of Gwyn. The ring allowed the wearer to boost critical attacks, allowing them to annihilate foes with ease. Ciaran, the Lord's Blade, was known for his deadly critical attacks, and the Hornet Ring helped to enhance this skill.

Item Description: An old ring with a seal depicting a horse's hoof. Boosts kick effect. Unbreakable Patches adored this ring and the feeling that it gave him when he kicked his marks into the depths of treacherous traps, but suffered no shortage of ridicule from his associates for relying so heavily on the tired old trick. But who is the sorrier? The horse who knows only to kick, or the fool who approaches the old beast without thought?
Story: The old ring had been passed down through the family for generations, and was always used by the eldest son to help him with his kicks. One day, the eldest son died in a trap, leaving the ring to his younger brother. The younger brother was devastated by his brother's death, and decided to use the ring to help him through his traps. He became known as the "kick king" and was loved by all who knew him.

Item Description: Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family. When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused. I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion.
Story: Juno Hoslow is a simple farmer who lives on the outskirts of a small town. One day, he receives an invitation to visit the Volcano Manor. Juno is hesitant, but decides to go. Once he arrives, he is shocked to find that the Manor is filled with lavish silver armor and weapons. Juno is not a fighter, but he is curious and decides to take a look. He is soon drawn into a battle against the Manor's owner, who is much more skilled than Juno

Item Description: A twin-tailed silver helm decorated with flowery adornments. Symbol of the head of the revered House of Hoslow. Juno Hoslow had a younger brother who was all talk and no trousers. His inability to commit to action was such that Juno inherited the Hoslow legacy without resistance, granting him the freedom to shower his little brother with adoration.
Story: Juno Hoslow was always a bit of a loner, preferring to spend his time reading or exploring the gardens of the Hoslow estate. One day, he happened to come across his brother's old silver helm. It was covered in beautiful flowers and symbols, and Juno was struck by its beauty. He decided to take it home, and ever since then he's been treated like a king by his brother and the other Hoslow family members.

Item Description: Metal whip formed of razor-sharp chain-link blades that have the appearance of flower petals. This work of art is handed down though the generations of the illustrious House Hoslow. High dexterity is required to wield this weapon, but it excels at inflicting devastation
Story: The Hoslow family has been wielding metal whips with flower petals for generations. The whips are incredibly delicate, but can cause immense damage when used correctly. The Hoslow family is a prestigious one, and the whips are passed down from generation to generation with high dexterity and skill required to use them.

Item Description: A warm, soft, shadow like effigy. Use this item to reverse Hollowing. It also weakens the links to other worlds, invasions and most cooperation. Peer closely at an effigy, and one begins to perceive a human form, but whose form it takes depends on the person looking.
Story: The effigy is a powerful tool that can be used to reverse Hollowing and weaken the links to other worlds, invasions and most cooperation. It is also a symbol of hope and peace.

Item Description: Charcoal pine resin rotted with human body fluids. Temporarily applies dark to Main-hand weapon. Normally used in the Undead Settlement for preservation and burials, but can mature into this state, becoming a valuable substance, used in a certain ceremony. Often seen for trade at exorbitant prices.
Story: The charcoal pine resin is normally used in the Undead Settlement for preservation and burials, but can mature into this state, becoming a valuable substance, used in a certain ceremony. Often seen for trade at exorbitant prices.

Item Description: Rare tiny black sprite found on corpses. Use to gain 1 humanity and restore a large amount of HP. This black sprite is called humanity but little is known about its true nature. If the soul is the source of all life then what distinguishes the humanity we hold within ourselves?
Story: A black sprite was found on the corpses of the undead. It was said to restore a large amount of HP and humanity. Some believed that this sprite was the source of all life, while others believed that it was nothing more than a black curse.

Item Description: One of the trick weapons of the workshop, commonly used on the hunt. Retains the qualities of an axe, but offers a wider palette of attacks by transforming. Boasts a heavy blunt attack, leading to high rally potential. No matter their pasts, beasts are no more than beasts. Some choose this axe to play the part of executioner.
Story: The workshop's trick weapon, commonly used on the hunt. It retains the qualities of an axe, but offers a wider palette of attacks by transforming. The heavy blunt attack is great for rallying, and it can even transform into a bow to take down targets at a distance.

Item Description: A cloth emblem that belonged to the captain of the Church hunters long ago. Opens the main gate that leads to the round plaza of the Great Cathedral. The main gate is shut tight on nights of the hunt, and could only be opened from the other side with this emblem. In other words, the captain's return, and this emblem, determined the end of the hunt.
Story: The cloth emblem belonged to the captain of the Church hunters long ago. When the captain returned, the hunt was over.

Item Description: A cloth emblem that belonged to the captain of the Church hunters long ago. Opens the main gate that leads to the round plaza of the Great Cathedral. The main gate is shut tight on nights of the hunt, and could only be opened from the other side with this emblem. In other words, the captain's return, and this emblem, determined the end of the hunt.
Story: The cloth emblem belonged to the captain of the Church hunters long ago. When the captain returned, the hunt was over.

Item Description: One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the workshop, this one without the cape that wipes away blood. A fine piece of hunter attire that provides stable defence to anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat. Allows one to stalk beasts unannounced, by cover of night.
Story: The hunter's attire is a finely crafted piece of clothing that provides stable defence against beasts in Yharnam. It allows hunters to stalk beasts unannounced, by hiding in the shadows during the night.

Item Description: One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the workshop. A fine piece of hunter attire that provides stable defence to anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat. Recognizable by its withered feathers, this cap is fashioned after one of the old hunters.
Story: The withered cap is a relic of the old hunters. It was once a fine piece of hunter attire, but now it is just a piece of worn-out cloth. It provides stable defence against the beasts of Yharnam, and is recognizable by its withered feathers.

Item Description: A Caryll Rune that transcribes inhuman sounds. This red-smudged rune means Hunter, and has been adopted by those who have taken the Hunter of Hunters oath. These watchmen admonish those who have become addled with blood. Be they men or beasts, anyone who has threatened the pledgers of the Hunter oath surely has an issue with blood.
Story: The Caryll rune is a symbol of the Hunter of Hunters oath, a group of vigilantes who hunt down those who have threatened the safety of others. When someone takes this oath, they are given a red-smudged rune that means "Hunter" in their language. These watchmen use this rune to warn others of the dangers of becoming blood-addled, as anyone who threatens the safety of others is likely afflicted with blood-lust.

Item Description: A black bow designed for long distances. Difficult to handle at first, and requiring some amount of practice to master. The hunting Goddess Evlana was no goddess at all, but rather a brave and highly skilled bow huntress. Long after her demise, the passing of lore transformed her into a deity.
Story: Difficult to handle at first, and requiring some amount of practice to master. Evlana's bow was a black bow designed for long distances. She was skilled in the art of hunting, and used her bow to take down game far beyond her own capabilities. One day, she took down a deer that was much larger than she was. The deer's antlers were so large, they nearly touched the ground. Evlana was so proud of her kill, she decided to take the deer

Item Description: Ring engraved with a portrait of a hunter. Increases dexterity. Increases dexterity 5 points. The hunters serve Lothric on the fringes and in the shadows. For generations, rulers of Lothric have relied especially upon the Black Hand hunters to punish enemies in ways that the king's Three Pillars cannot
Story: A ring with a portrait of a hunter engraved on it increases dexterity by 5 points. The Black Hand hunters are a special force that serve Lothric on the fringes and in the shadows. They are a trusted group of warriors that have been serving the king for generations.

Item Description: Katana forged in an Eastern land. The Katana is drawn from the scabbard at lightning speed, using an Iaijutsu technique. Iaijutsu allows the wielder to charge forward to swiftly cut down distant foes
Story: The Katana was forged in an Eastern land, and is drawn from the scabbard at lightning speed using an Iaijutsu technique. The Iaijutsu allows the wielder to charge forward to swiftly cut down distant foes.

Item Description: Rapiers wielded by sorcerers of Eleum Loyce, imbued with a magic that is released with a strong attack. A great protective wall was erected to protect Eleum Loyce from the encroaching chaos, and these sorcerers were amongst its defenders.
Story: The rapiers wielded by the sorcerers of Eleum Loyce are imbued with a magic that is released with a strong attack. This magic is used to protect the city from the encroaching chaos, and the sorcerers are amongst its most ardent defenders.

Item Description: A hatchet with a frost-coated blade. One of several gifts given by Castle Sol in the distant north. Known as freezing fog, the blade is thought to be a dragon's scale. Inflicts a powerful frost effect.
Story: The hatchet was a gift from Castle Sol in the far north. It was known as freezing fog, because the blade inflicted a powerful frost effect.

Item Description: Sacred chime of Licia of Lindelt. A catalyst for miracles and hexes. In any town there will be a few folk with unusual urges. They either endeavor to resist these urges, or act upon them out of the view of others. The world is not so welcoming they may bare their souls true.
Story: The Licia of Lindelt was a sacred chime that catalyzed miracles and hexes. It was stolen from a church in Lindelt, and the thief was never found. The chime's whereabouts are unknown, but it is rumored to be in the possession of a powerful witch.

Item Description: A ring of blue stone. The stone is misshaped, however imperceptibly. renders certain equipment invisible. Do not judge your foes by their appearance. He who approaches without a sword carries two behind his back.
Story: The ring is a powerful artifact that allows its wearer to invisibly conceal their weapons from their opponents. The ring's true power lies in its ability to transform the appearance of any object, making it difficult for opponents to accurately judge an opponent's strength.

Item Description: A ring of yellow stone. The stone is misshaped, however imperceptibly. Renders certain equipment invisible. Do not judge your foes by their appearance. He who approaches without a sword carries two behind his back.
Story: The ring is a powerful artifact that allows its wearer to make equipment invisible. However, the ring has a dark side; it also makes the wearer immune to critical hits and renders them immune to the effects of most weapons.

Item Description: A ring made of red stone. The stone is misshaped, perhaps imperceptibily. Renders certain equipment invisible. Do not judge your foes by their appearance. He who approaches with no sword carries two on his back.
Story: The ring is a powerful tool that can render equipment invisible to the naked eye. It is said that whoever wears the ring is immune to the judgments of others, as they will be unable to see the weapons and armor that they may be carrying.

Item Description: Profaned Flame wielded by the Irithyllian witches, frigid spirits roaming the Boreal Valley. This torch, both a weapon and a staff, is enshrouded in an everlasting flame. Skill: Punitive Flame Punish foes with a flame that blankets the ground.
Story: The Irithyllian witches are a secretive and feared sect of witches who reside in the frigid Boreal Valley. They use their Profaned Flame to punish their enemies.

Item Description: Helmet/Armor/Gauntlets,Leggings worn by once-proud knights. Relics of a party who long ago attempted to conquer the Undead Crypt. For this act of conceit they will never rest in peace, and instead serve as crypt guardians.
Story: The once proud knights who wore these armor and helmets are now crypt guardians, sworn to protect the undead crypt from any who would dare trespass. Though they may have failed in their original quest, they will never rest in peace until the crypt is free from the curse that has befallen it.

Item Description: A Caryll rune that transcribes inhuman sounds. This rune, discovered inside the forbidden beast eater, came to symbolize Impurity, and the oath of The League. Confederates of The League cooperate with hunters from other worlds, and hunt to discover vermin. Vermin writhe within filth, and are the root of man's impurity. Crush all vermin without hesitation.
Story: The Caryll rune was discovered inside the forbidden beast eater, and came to symbolize Impurity. The League Confederates work together with hunters from other worlds to find and destroy vermin, which are the root of man's impurity. Crush all vermin without hesitation to uphold the oath of The League.

Item Description: Slip sold by bishop of Velka, Goddess of Sin. If you are killed by an invader, use this to report the crime of that trespasser. The indicted player will be added to a list of unfortunate souls who will one day face the wrath of the Blades of the Darkmoon
Story: The bishop of Velka's slip is a powerful talisman that can be used to report crimes committed against Velka's followers. If you are killed by an invader, use this to report the crime of that trespasser. The indicted player will be added to a list of unfortunate souls who will one day face the wrath of the Blades of the Darkmoon.

Item Description: Slip sold by bishop of Velka, Goddess of Sin. If you are killed by an invader, use this to report the crime of that trespasser. The indicted player will be added to a list of unfortunate souls who will one day face the wrath of the Blades of the Darkmoon
Story: The bishop of Velka's slip is a powerful talisman that can be used to report crimes committed against Velka's followers. If you are killed by an invader, use this to report the crime of that trespasser. The indicted player will be added to a list of unfortunate souls who will one day face the wrath of the Blades of the Darkmoon.

Item Description: An axe wielded by Drangleic infantry. A makeshift, crude weapon that deals an underwhelming amount of damage.
Story: The Drangleic axe is a crude weapon that was used by the Drangleic infantry. It is a makeshift, crude weapon that deals an underwhelming amount of damage. However, it is still a formidable weapon in the hands of a skilled fighter.

Item Description: Special material used in a Holy Chalice ritual. Special body parts collected by the Healing Church. What was this gruesome bait used to lure? The additional rite Rotted Offering beckons ungodly forces, normally terrifying things, but also worthy prey for a special hunt.
Story: The Healing Church uses a gruesome bait to lure ungodly forces. Normally, things like monsters and demons are used, but this bait is specifically designed to lure creatures that are normally terrifying, but also worthy prey for a special hunt.

Item Description: Instrument of torture used on nobles behind the curtain at the Volcano Manor of Mt. Gelmir. Its numerous spikes pierce the flesh, then singe the wounds with flame. The smell of burnt blood induces despair in the victim. A candlestick conveived by a thorough mind.
Story: The Instrument of Torture was created by the masterminds of the Volcano Manor. It was designed to inflict maximum pain on nobles who were behind the curtain. The spikes on the instrument pierce the skin, then the flames singe the wounds. The smell of burnt flesh induces despair in the victim.

Item Description: Sword forged by compounding silver and gold. A sacred weapon to hunt Those Who Live in Death. Deals holy damage. The inseparable twins found solace in the Golden Order, the only institution not to revile them as accursed beings.
Story: The twins were born with a curse. They were cursed with a life of solitude and isolation. They found solace in the Golden Order, the only institution that didn't revile them as accursed beings. One day, they found a sword forged from silver and gold. The sword had the power to deal holy damage. The twins were overjoyed and embraced the sword as their new found friend. They vowed to use the sword to hunt down those who live in death.

Item Description: Armor worn by once-proud clerics. Relics of a party who long ago attempted to conquer the Undead Crypt. For this sin their deaths have been postponed, so they may serve as crypt sentries
Story: The armor is old and worn, but it still bears the markings of a once proud cleric. The cleric's party had long ago attempted to conquer the Undead Crypt, but their deaths were postponed as a punishment. Now, as crypt sentries, the clerics wear the armor to keep the undead at bay.

Item Description: Blood vial acquired from Iosefka's clinic. This refined blood, highly invigorating, restores a larger amount of HP. The product of a slow and careful refinement process, this rare blood vial appears to be a clinic original.
Story: The blood vial was acquired from Iosefka's clinic. It was a rare blood vial that was highly invigorating. It restored a larger amount of HP than other blood vials. The product of a slow and careful refinement process, this blood vial appeared to be a clinic original.

Item Description: Thrusting sword bestowed upon the Outrider Knights of the Boreal Valley. This weapon is shrouded in frost, and causes frostbite. Every Outrider Knight one day devolves into a beast, constantly hounded by Pontiff Sulyvahn's black eyes. Skill: Shield Splitter Aim carefully, and attack in a large forward lunge to pierce through enemy shields and inflict damage directly.
Story: The Outrider Knights of the Boreal Valley were once stalwart defenders of the kingdom, but one day they all turned into beasts. Now, the Pontiff Sulyvahn hunts them relentlessly, and only the sharpest of swords can stop him. This sword is said to be blessed with the power to turn its wielder into a beast, but it requires great skill to use it correctly.

Item Description: .Straight sword bestowed upon the Outrider Knights of the Boreal Valley. This weapon is enshrouded in frost, and causes frostbite. Every Outrider Knight one day devolves into a beast, constantly hounded by Pontiff Sulyvahn's black eyes.
Story: The Straight Sword of the Outrider Knights is a legendary weapon that is said to cause frostbite. One day, every Outrider Knight will turn into a beast and be constantly hounded by Pontiff Sulyvahn.

Item Description: Iron manifer of spherical shape. Big Boggart the blackguard's weapon of choice. Not a weapon to be taken lightly, as its weighty blows shatter bones with ease.
Story: The Iron Manifer is a massive, spherical weapon that is incredibly heavy. It is made out of iron, and its blows are powerful enough to shatter bones. Big Boggart is the blackguard who uses this weapon as his favorite weapon, and it is not to be taken lightly.

Item Description: Fairly large iron cleaver, commonly used by the maltreated Misbegotten. Steeped in resentment, these weapons are swung wildly and relentlessly, often after rushing up to foes.
Story: The iron cleaver is a common weapon used by the maltreated. It is steeped in resentment, and is swung wildly and relentlessly. Often, after rushing up to foes, it is the final act of violence that seals their fate.

Item Description: Of the three great bridges that link the two cathedral cradles, this key opens the iron door that leads to the midlevel bridge. There are no thieves in the nightmare. Then, why lock a door? Be warned, there must be a very, very good reason.
Story: The key opens the door to the bridge that links the two cathedral cradles. It's a dark and spooky place, and there are no thieves in the nightmare. But, why lock the door? There must be a very good reason.

Item Description: Of the three great bridges that link the two cathedral cradles, this key opens the iron door that leads to the midlevel bridge. There are no thieves in the nightmare. Then, why lock a door? Be warned, there must be a very, very good reason.
Story: The key opens the iron door that leads to the midlevel bridge. It is a dark and dreary place, and there are no thieves in the nightmare. Then, why lock a door? Be warned, there must be a very, very good reason.

Item Description: Standard greatarrows made of iron. More effective than regular arrows, but considerably heavier.
Story: The greatarrows were much more effective than regular arrows, but they were considerably heavier. They were perfect for taking down large creatures, and they were very popular among hunters.

Item Description: Greatsword with a blade of unusually thick steel. A coarse weapon to which polishing is a foreign concept. Weighty even among others of its class, the impact of each strike is sure to be felt.
Story: The greatsword is a hefty weapon, one that is not often seen in the hands of others. The blade is made of unusually thick steel, and despite its weight, the weapon is surprisingly agile. The impact of each strike is sure to be felt, and with its coarse design, it is sure to leave a mark on any opponent it comes into contact with.

Item Description: Iron kasa of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Crafted to imitate the woven straw hats worn in the Land of Reeds. The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.
Story: Once, there was a man who called himself Shabriri. He was a wanderer, always on the move, always searching for new and exciting things to do. One day, he met a woman who caught his eye. She was beautiful, and her skin was the color of the reeds that grew in the Land of Reeds. Yura fell in love with her, and he decided to stay with her in the Land of Reeds. He made a hat out of

Item Description: Great hammer forged from the soul of the Old Iron King. The tip is formed of molten rock. The corpse of the Old Iron King became the vessel that bred Ichorous Earth. The heavy rock tip is formed of cooled magma, with a still-smoldering core.
Story: The great hammer was forged from the soul of the Old Iron King. The tip was formed of molten rock, and the corpse of the Old Iron King became the vessel that bred Ichorous Earth. The heavy rock tip is formed of cooled magma, with a still-smoldering core.

Item Description: Thick iron shield of Shiva of the East. Heaviest of the standard shields. Deflects enemy attacks. A famous specimen from Shiva's collection but none who have faced it have lived to tell the tale
Story: The Iron Shield of Shiva is a legendary shield that is said to be the heaviest of the standard shields. It is said to be able to deflect enemy attacks and is a prized possession of the god Shiva. No one has ever survived an encounter with this shield, and it is said that even Shiva himself is not immune to its power.

Item Description: Commonly used iron spear with no notable traits. The blade is severely rusted.
Story: The iron spear was common and unremarkable. However, the blade was severely rusted, making it unusable. The story follows a young warrior who finds the spear and decides to use it to fight for his kingdom.

Item Description: Armor worn by Ironclad Soldiers. Provides high defense, but is so heavy that it requires great strength to move. The Ironclad Soldiers were minions created by the Old Iron King, their life granted by an enchantment of souls. By now this is again an iron husk, and fit to wear. Once, the Old King could have unraveled the greater mysteries with the aid of his great soul, but he was led astray by his enormous fortune, becoming nothing more than a vulgar hedonist
Story: The Ironclad Soldiers were once a proud and formidable force, but their armor has become so heavy and restrictive that it is now impossible for them to move without great effort. The enchantment that granted them life has long since faded, leaving them to rot in their armor. However, one day, their armor will finally be destroyed, and they will be forgotten forever.

Item Description: Ultra Greatsword of the Ivory King of Eleum Loyce. Wield with both hands to realize its full strength. It is said that the Ivory King was once the highest ranking knight in his home of Forossa, famed for its god of war. After taking his crown, they say he was the first to swing his sword in times of need, be it for his homeland or his people.
Story: The Ultra Greatsword of the Ivory King is a legendary weapon that is said to be the strongest in the world. It is said that the Ivory King was once the highest ranking knight in his home of Forossa, famed for its god of war. After taking his crown, they say he was the first to swing his sword in times of need, be it for his homeland or his people.

Item Description: Sickle fashioned form ivory. Weapon carried by aged Albunaurics. These weapons are evidence of their dedication to the Haligtree, despite never having entered its presence.
Story: The sickle is a sacred weapon of the Albunaurics, a race of ancient and powerful sorcerers. The Albunaurics believe that the Haligtree is the source of all magic, and they make a pilgrimage to its sacred grove every year to pray and sacrifice to it. Despite never having actually seen the Haligtree itself, the Albunaurics believe that its power is enough to grant them immortality.

Item Description: .Sword of Fabian, knight of Eleum Loyce. This blade, crafted with ivory ore native to the land, harnesses souls to slash at foes. Sir Fabian led the loyal knights of Eleum Loyce straight into the depths of chaos to exterminate the terrible things that dwelled there, but not one of the selfless knights returned
Story: Sir Fabian was a valiant knight who fought tirelessly to protect his home of Eleum Loyce from the horrors that lurked within. One day, he and his fellow knights were called upon to exterminate an evil force that had infiltrated their land. However, none of them ever returned. It is unknown what happened to them, but Sir Fabian's sword remains as a reminder of his sacrifice.

Item Description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. Ivory Talismans are granted only to female clerics and their value is affected dramatically by their owner's faith.
Story: The Ivory Talisman was a powerful magical item that only female clerics could use. It was granted to them by the gods, and its value was greatly affected by the cleric's faith.

Item Description: Ring of the guardians of Eleum Loyce. Attacks greatly reduce enemy stamina. Eleum Loyce existed to subdue the raging flame, but when the ivory gates were flung open, the land grew cold and lifeless.
Story: The Ring of the Guardians of Eleum Loyce was created to subdue the raging flame that once existed in Eleum Loyce. When the ivory gates were flung open, the land grew cold and lifeless. The ring was created by the last of the Eleum Loyce guardians, and it attacks greatly reduce enemy stamina. If you are able to find and wear the ring, you will be able to restore the land and bring life back to it.

Item Description: Catalyst of the Witch of Izalith of long ago, when her daughters were still flame witches, before they were engulfed by the Chaos Flame. Before the birth of pyromancy, their wands were mediums for sorcery, but knowledge of this flame sorcery has long since vanished.
Story: The Witch of Izalith was a powerful witch who used her daughters' flame magic to create pyromancy. Unfortunately, her daughters were consumed by the Chaos Flame and the knowledge of their flame sorcery was lost. Now, centuries later, a young woman named Senna discovers the ancient art of pyromancy and uses it to fight the evil forces that have invaded her city.

Item Description: A pyromancy tome from Izalith containing pyromancies of the witches. Give to the old master pyromancer to learn chaos pyromancies of Izalith. Chaos pyromancies manipulate lava, and birthed all later forms of pyromancy.
Story: The old master pyromancer takes the tome from you with a look of intrigue. He begins to read the strange symbols within, and his eyes light up with excitement. Suddenly, he claps his hands together and exclaims, "Chaos pyromancies! I've been searching for these for years!" He begins to chant and wave the tome around, igniting pools of lava all around him. With a maniacal laugh, he begins to cast powerful fire spells that incinerate

Item Description: Jagged blade wielded by New Londo ghosts. Violent thrust attack. One of the cursed weapons. Inflicts damage to ghosts.
Story: The jagged blade is a cursed weapon that is wielded by the New Londo ghosts. It is a violent thrust attack that inflicts damage to ghosts.

Item Description: Robe worn by jailers of Irithyll Dungeon. Originally ritualistic formal wear. The jailers were among the few survivors inhabiting the Profaned Capital, later serving under Pontiff Sulyvahn. Perhaps the screams emanating from the cells help them forget their old home.
Story: The robe worn by the jailers of Irithyll Dungeon is a relic from a time when the Profaned Capital was a thriving city. The jailers were among the few survivors who managed to cling to life in the city after it was overrun by demons. The screams emanating from the cells help them forget their old home.

Item Description: Axe made from a herbivore's skull. Weapon of the ancestral followers who disdain metal. This axe is more of a bludgeon; it forgoes a bladed edge, instead using the beast's molar teeth to buffet foes, dealing strike damage.
Story: The axe is made from the skull of a herbivore. The ancestral followers who created it use it to deal strike damage, eschewing a bladed edge in favor of using the beast's molar teeth to buffet foes.

Item Description: A boldly-colored jester's cap/robe/gloves/tights. A nice bit of fun to try on... Jesters are more than festival fixtures; some have a second face, hidden from public view.
Story: The jester's cap was a bright, cheerful color, and it looked like it would be a lot of fun to try on. The robe was a deep, rich red, and it looked like it would be warm and comfortable to wear. The gloves were a bright, cheerful yellow, and they looked like they would be fun to play with. The tights were a bright, cheerful blue, and they looked like they would be fun to wear on a cold day.

Item Description: Robe worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy. Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it. Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.
Story: The robe worn by the young academy scholars is a sign of their new life. They were born anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy. Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections. They repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it. Memory fades into oblivion with each awakening.

Item Description: Armor worn by Kaiden sellswords. These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback. Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.
Story: The armor worn by Kaiden sellswords is said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north. These hulking, fearless mercenaries are adept at fighting on horseback, and Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Item Description: Cloak of the dark witch Karla. A pointed hat is the signature of a heretical sorceress. Karla, however always kept it close. This stained (Piece Name) is torn and odorous, telling of a long journey and even longer imprisonment. It would be madness to wear such a thing.
Story: Karla was a powerful sorceress who was eventually imprisoned by the church. After many years of imprisonment, she managed to escape and took refuge in a remote mountain range. One day, she was captured by a group of heretics and was forced to wear a pointed hat in order to identify her as a witch. The hat was stained with the blood of her enemies, and it was torn and odorous from the long journey and imprisonment.

Item Description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence to the detriment of stamina. The Karolos Conspectus is the oldest of the academy's lineages of study, begat by the sorcerer Azur. Scholars who follow in his footsteps pursue the mysteries of comets.
Story: A glintstone crown bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. The crown increases intelligence to the detriment of stamina. The Karolos Conspectus is the oldest of the academy's lineages of study, begat by the sorcerer Azur. Scholars who follow in his footsteps pursue the mysteries of comets.

Item Description: Imported dagger design with a rather unique handle. The blade can be swung about as the extension of one's fist.
Story: The dagger was designed with a unique handle that allowed the user to swing the blade about as if it were an extension of their fist. The blade was sharp and deadly, perfect for slaying any foe.

Item Name: Key to the cell below the Grand Cathedral.
Item Description: Hunters are held within the underground cell, so that things better left unseen, better left unknown, will decay quietly in the fallow darkness Underground Cell Inner Chamber Key
Story: The Hunters were once a proud and noble race, but their pride and arrogance led to their downfall. Now, they are kept in the underground cell, so that they can never again threaten the peace of the kingdom. One day, a key to their cell will be found and used to release them. They will wander the kingdom, seeking revenge on those who imprisoned them.

Item Description: Sword that opens the Embedded's door. Shaped like a weapon, but is in fact a key. Plunge the key into the Embedded to bring a rhapsodic end to his fate. The once-human Embedded, realizing that he could never resist the temptation of the flesh, bound himself eternally with chains. Since then, he has awaited the day that somebody will find this key, and bury it within his bosom.
Story: The sword that opens the Embedded's door is a key that was once used to free the Embedded from his chains. The Embedded has been waiting for someone to find the key and bury it within his bosom so that he can finally end his eternal suffering.

Item Name: Key to the inner chamber of the cell below the Grand Cathedral.
Item Description: The innermost chamber of the underground cell holds a lone madman. He wears a beast hide, and rings a bell that emits no sound. Unending death awaits those who can hear the soundless bell.
Story: The madman is a cursed man, doomed to hear the soundless bell ringing forever. He is the last of his kind, and his only purpose is to warn others of the dangers of coming to the cell. Those who can hear the bell are doomed, but those who can't are also doomed to die in silence.

Item Description: Garb of a distant Eastern land, worn by Yamamura the Wanderer. This Eastern warrior pursued a beast for honourable revenge, then became a hunter of the League. But when he stared straight into impurity, it drove him mad.
Story: Yamamura the Wanderer, a distant Eastern warrior, pursued a beast for honourable revenge. When he stared straight into impurity, it drove him mad. He became a hunter of the League, but when he encountered a group of corrupted hunters, he was driven mad and killed them all.

Item Description: Coldblood of inhuman kin of the cosmos, brethren of the Great Ones. Use to gain unspeakable Blood Echoes. Dare not to delve into the world beyond humanity, the eldritch Truth touched upon long ago at Byrgenwerth.
Story: The Coldblood is a relic from beyond humanity that grants users Blood Echoes that are said to be unspeakable. Those who dare to delve into the world beyond humanity are warned of the dangers that await them, as the eldritch Truth is said to be touched upon long ago at Byrgenwerth.

Item Description: An old armor that is oddly comfortable. Belonged to a King. What makes a king? Some say that it is a birthright, while others call it destiny. Perhaps it is not important, as long as the king's name serves to unite his people
Story: The old armor belonged to a king. It was oddly comfortable, and it seemed to fit perfectly. The king's name served to unite his people, and that was all that mattered.

Item Description: A soul is much like a curse. And those with strong souls must bear within themselves an even stronger curse. Vendrick, King of Drangleic, used a powerful soul to keep the curse at bay. In the end, he sought the flame that began it all. Wear the ring to open the King's Gate.
Story: Vendrick, King of Drangleic, used a powerful soul to keep the curse at bay. In the end, he sought the flame that began it all. Wear the ring to open the King's Gate.

Item Description: An ultra greatsword forged from the soul of King Vendrick. Inflicts heavy damage on enemy armor. Only the king knows whether the depiction of the Queen is a resentful mockery, or an affectionate exaltation.
Story: Vendrick, the king of the kingdom of Drangleic, was known for his greatsword. One day, Vendrick was killed by his own son, Vendrick II. Vendrick II took the greatsword and used it to kill his father. Vendrick II then took the greatsword and went on a rampage through the kingdom, killing anyone who got in his way. Eventually, Vendrick II was killed by a group of knights led by the king's son, Gwyn. The great

Item Description: A trick weapon typically used by Healing Church hunters. On the one side, an easily handled silver sword. On the other, a giant obtuse stone weapon, characterized by a blunt strike and extreme force of impact. The Church takes a heavy-handed, merciless stance toward the plague of beasts, an irony not lost upon the wielders of this most symbolic weapon.
Story: The Healing Church hunters use a trick weapon that is both silver and obtuse. The silver side is easy to handle, but the obtuse side is powerful and has a blunt strike. The Church takes a heavy-handed, merciless stance toward the plague of beasts, but the hunters use this weapon to fight against the beasts.

Item Description: Armor equipment of a lower a rank knight. Despite the thin metal used, the grooved texture gives them added protection
Story: The armor of a lower-ranked knight is not as sturdy as that of a higher-ranked knight, but the textured grooves on the armor give it an added layer of protection. The armor is worn by a knight who is not as skilled as those who are higher in rank, but who is still willing to fight for their kingdom.

Item Description: (Armor piece) of a lowly knight, fashioned from solid iron. This/these (armor piece) might be on the heftier side compared to others of their ilk, but as such offer great physical absorption in exchange for its/their imposing weight. Do not think to wear it without the necessary Vitality.
Story: The armor piece of a lowly knight was fashioned from solid iron. It was on the heftier side, but it offered great physical absorption in exchange for its imposing weight. The armor was meant for use by someone who was serious about protecting themselves, and it was not to be worn without the necessary Vitality.

Item Description: Iron armor of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.
Story: The armor is old and battered, but it still protects its wearer from harm. The knight who wore it was a valiant warrior, and his armor is now a relic of the past.

Item Description: This medium metal shield is elegantly carved and painted. Although it is thought to have been used by ancient knights of nobility its defense and capabilities are similar to other shields.
Story: The shield is a beautiful work of art. It is carved and painted with intricate designs, and it seems to have been used by ancient knights of nobility. Although it is not as strong as other shields, its defense and capabilities are similar to those of other shields.

Item Description: Ring of the savage Tsorig, more commonly known as the Knight Slayer. Long ago, Tsorig engaged the guardians of an ancient city in a bloody confrontation, and returned with their rings as his prize, still frozen on their dismembered fingers.
Story: The ring is said to have belonged to the Knight Slayer, a powerful warrior who fought against the guardians of an ancient city. The ring is said to have been frozen on the fingers of the Knight Slayer's enemies, and is now coveted by many.

Item Description: Crossbow used by the proud knights of Lothric. It bears an elaborate gold design. The crossbow has been blessed with the power of lightning, in anticipation of the use of Lightning Bolts.
Story: The crossbow is a powerful weapon that is used by the proud knights of Lothric. It is blessed with the power of lightning, in anticipation of the use of Lightning Bolts.

Item Description: Attire of the knights of Cainhurst. A regal piece graced by intricate goldwork. The Cainhurst way is a mix of nostalgia and bombast. They take great pride even in the blood-stained corpses of beasts that they leave behind. confident that they will stand as examples of decadent art.
Story: The Cainhurst knights are a proud and regal group, taking great pride in their blood-stained corpses and artistry. They believe that their way of life is the best in the land, and that their extravagant dress and weapons are a testament to their greatness.

Item Description: Greatsword bestowed upon skilled swordsmen in the demigods' service, and yet had no rank or title. Featuring a long grip enabling a dual-handed use, this weapon was designed to dispatch larger foes. Being charged with such a duty was undoubtedly a great honor.
Story: The greatsword was bestowed upon skilled swordsmen in the demigods' service, but it had no rank or title. It was designed to dispatch larger foes, and being charged with such a duty was undoubtedly a great honor.

Item Description: Ring engraved with a portrait of a knight. Increases strength. In Lothric, the Knight has long been considered one of the Three Pillars of the king's rule, and were thus allowed to rear dragons.
Story: The ring is engraved with a beautiful portrait of a knight. It seems to have been made with great care, and it seems to increase the strength of whoever wears it.

Item Description: Adornment prized by the knights of Cainhurst. Resembles a ponytail of silver hair. The Cainhurst way is a mix of nostalgia and bombast. They take great pride even in the blood-stained corpses of beasts that they leave behind, confident that they will stand as examples of decadent art.
Story: The Cainhurst way is a mix of nostalgia and bombast. They take great pride even in the blood-stained corpses of beasts that they leave behind, confident that they will stand as examples of decadent art. One day, a new knight arrives in Cainhurst. He is different than the others. He is not content with the way things are. He wants to change things. The knights of Cainhurst are not happy about this. They want things to stay the way they are.

Item Description: When the carcass of Kos washed up on the coast, its insides were teeming with tiny parasites, unlike any found in humans. This atypical weapon can only be clasped tight and swung, but a Kos Parasite is said to stimulate phantasms inhabiting a lumenwood
Story: The parasites found inside the carcass of Kos were unlike any found in humans, and as a result, they were thought to be some sort of exotic weapon. However, the parasites were said to be able to stimulate phantasms inhabiting a lumenwood, and so they were coveted by many.

Item Description: Small throwing machete. Throw at enemies to cause bleeding damage. A unique weapon originally used by swordsmen of Carthus, but now popular among bandits and thieves.
Story: The small throwing machete is a unique weapon originally used by swordsmen of Carthus, but now popular among bandits and thieves. It is a finely crafted throwing machete that is designed to cause bleeding damage to enemies.

Item Description: A throwing knife. Its sharp blade is intended to cause bleeding rather than simply inflict damage This simple weapon is easily utilized, but has limited range and deals little damage. However, if the knife can cause bleeding, the target's max HP will be lowered.
Story: The throwing knife is a simple weapon, but its sharp blade is deadly. It is easy to use, but its limited range means that it is not always the most effective tool. However, if the knife can cause bleeding, the target's maximum HP will be lowered, making it a powerful weapon indeed.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. This transcription of the Great Ones' inhuman voices ripples like a watery reflection. This rune means Lake, and those branded by it enjoy augmented defense. Great volumes of water serve as a bulwark guarding sleep, and an augur of the eldritch Truth. Overcome this hindrance, and seek what is yours.
Story: Caryll left this rune for those who seek to understand the Great Ones. The rune is said to represent Lake, and those who are branded by it enjoy augmented defense. The rune is also said to be an augur of the eldritch Truth, and can be used to overcome obstacles.

Item Description: Armor made from strips of iron fastened together. Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds. The grimy outer mantle is made from withered reeds from the warrior's birthplace. Perhaps its comforts extend to nostalgic thoughts of home. Altered: The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to the blood-soaked madness, or so it has said.
Story: A young man, born and raised in the Land of Reeds, has always dreamed of leaving to see the world. One day, he hears of a great war being fought in another land, and decides to enlist in the fight. He is given an old, rusted armor, which he is told is from the Land of Reeds. He is excited to wear it, and hopes that it will bring him luck in the battle.

Item Description: Large arrow. Heavier arrows cause more damage, but have a shorter range.
Story: The large arrow is a powerful weapon that causes more damage, but has a shorter range. It is used by skilled archers to take down their enemies from a distance.

Item Description: A large solid chunk that forms in coldblood. After death, a substance in the blood hardens, and that which does not crystalize is called a blood stone. This is no mere chunk, it is nearly a boulder. Few blood stones of such size have ever been discovered, even considering the combined experience of all the hunters.
Story: The hunters had been searching for a blood stone for months, ever since they had heard of its power. They had heard that a blood stone could grant immense power to whoever possessed it, and they were determined to find it. Finally, they found it. The stone was large and solid, and it took a lot of effort to move it. When they finally got it out of the ground, they were shocked to see that it was nearly a boulder in size. They knew that they had

Item Description: Large wooden club. The giant Undead of Blighttown wield these clubs which became poisonous from the influence of their surroundings
Story: The Undead of Blighttown are a fearsome and dangerous group of creatures that live in the dark and dreary depths of the city. These creatures are known for their large wooden clubs, which have become poisonous over time due to the foul air and toxins that permeate their surroundings.

Item Description: A large wooden club. Not an elegant weapon by any means, but a beastly thing with plenty of weight to easily break a shielded defense.
Story: The large wooden club was a beastly thing, easily breaking a shielded defense. It was made of thick, sturdy wood, and was surprisingly heavy. The club was originally used as a tool, but its brute force made it a fearsome weapon.

Item Description: Ember required for weapon ascension. Large divine ember, of secret church rites. Intended for select divine blacksmiths
Story: The blacksmiths of the secret church were always looking for ways to improve their weapons. So when they found an ember that was required for weapon ascension, they knew they had to get their hands on it. Unfortunately, the ember was only meant for select divine blacksmiths. Whoever got their hands on the ember first would be able to improve their weapons to an unheard of level.

Item Description: Ember required for weapon ascension. A large, high-quality ember. Handled by the blacksmith of Astora
Story: The blacksmith of Astora was known for his exceptional craftsmanship with weapons. He had a large ember that he used to forge weapons of the highest quality. One day, a young adventurer came to him seeking to ascend to a higher level of weapon mastery. The blacksmith offered to give him the ember in exchange for his services. The adventurer gratefully accepted and began to forge weapons of unparalleled power.

Item Description: Ember required for weapon ascension. Large flame ember used in ancient rites. Handled only by blacksmiths knowledgeable in ancient methods
Story: The Ember was a large flame ember used in ancient rites. It was handled only by blacksmiths who were knowledgeable in the ancient methods. The ember was so important that only the most skilled smiths were allowed to use it.

Item Description: Large leather-covered round shield. Choice shield for hunters. Wood shields are lighter than metal shields but with lower physical damage reductions and reduced shield stability.
Story: The large leather-covered round shield was a choice shield for hunters. It was made from wood, which was lighter than metal shields but with lower physical damage reductions and reduced shield stability. Despite this, the shield was still a powerful tool, able to protect its user from harm.

Item Description: Ember required for weapon ascension. Large magic ember, a form of sorcery. Handled only by the Vinheim blacksmiths
Story: The Vinheim blacksmiths were the only ones in the land who could forge weapons using Ember. The process of ascending a weapon required a large Ember, and only the Vinheim blacksmiths were able to produce them. The Ember was a form of sorcery, and only the most skilled blacksmiths were able to handle it.

Item Description: Large Titanite Shard used to reinforce equipment. Reinforces equipment up to +3. Titanite was discovered in an ancient layer of earth, and is said to be a gift of the gods. Titanite of this size has tremendous power, and is a very rare find.
Story: The large titanite shard was found by a group of adventurers while exploring an ancient layer of earth. The shard was said to be a gift from the gods, and as such had immense power. The adventurers decided to use the shard to reinforce their equipment, and were able to increase the strength of their equipment by up to three levels.

Item Description: Skull of Laurence, first vicar of the Healing Church. In reality he became the first cleric beast, and his human skull only exists within the Nightmare. The skull is a symbol of Laurence's past, and what he failed to protect. He is destined to seek his skull, but even if he found it, it could never restore his memories.
Story: The Healing Church was founded by Laurence, a cleric beast who lost his human skull in a battle with a dragon. The skull is a symbol of his past, and what he failed to protect. He is destined to seek his skull, but even if he found it, it could never restore his memories.

Item Description: Skull of Laurence, first vicar of the Healing Church. In reality he became the first cleric beast, and his human skull only exists within the Nightmare. The skull is a symbol of Laurence's past, and what he failed to protect. He is destined to seek his skull, but even if he found it, it could never restore his memories.
Story: The Healing Church was founded by Laurence, a cleric beast who lost his human skull in a Nightmare. The skull is a symbol of his past, and what he failed to protect. He is destined to seek his skull, but even if he found it, it could never restore his memories.

Item Description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence and dexterity to the detriment of HP. Scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus study Carian sorceries - a heterodox pursuit that views the moon as equal to the stars.
Story: Raya Lucaria scholars were given glintstone crowns that granted them increased intelligence and dexterity, at the expense of their health. These crowns were coveted by those who wished to learn Carian sorceries, which were a heterodox pursuit that viewed the moon as equal to the stars. Scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus studied Carian sorceries, and their knowledge was sought by many.

Item Description: A sword with a glintstone in its handguards. Wielded by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus who seek to master Carian sorcery. Deals magic damage. Apparently once used as a staff of sorcery, this sword is made of wood.
Story: The Lazuli Conspectus was a group of scholars who sought to learn the ways of Carian sorcery. One day, they discovered a sword with a glintstone in its handguards. The sword was made of wood, but it seemed to have been used as a staff of sorcery. They decided to keep the sword as a reminder of their quest. Whenever they fought with magic, they would use the sword to deal damage.

Item Description: Robe worn by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus, singular among the greater Raya Lucaria Academy. These scholars, who sought to master Carian sorcery, instead learned to see the moon as equal to the stars. This robe, in the hue of the full moon, signifies their heresy.
Story: The robe worn by the scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus at the Raya Lucaria Academy was singular among the greater institution. These scholars, who sought to master Carian sorcery, instead learned to see the moon as equal to the stars. This robe, in the hue of the full moon, signifies their heresy.

Item Description: A heavy, syrupy liquid medicine. Temporarily shifts weight to make deflection of attacks easier, but must be used with care, as it also slows movement with no change to defense. Its recipe for this mysterious concoction is unknown, but some postulate that it materializes only within the most desperate nightmares.
Story: The medicine is a powerful weight-shifting agent that can help deflect attacks, but it comes with a cost: it slows down the user's movement. It is said to be made only from the most desperate nightmares, and is only found in the most dire of circumstances.

Item Description: Made of soft leather. Very common type of protective gear
Story: The armor is common and often worn by those who wish to protect themselves from harm. It is made of soft leather and is very comfortable to wear. The armor is often used by those who wish to protect themselves from harm, such as knights who wish to protect their kingdom, or warriors who wish to protect their allies.

Item Description: An old armor that is oddly comfortable. Belonged to a Hunter. To this day, the forbidden love of Prince of Alken and the Princess of Venn manipulates these marionettes. Surely they never imagined that their dolls would outlast their own kingdoms.
Story: The old armor belonged to a Hunter. It was oddly comfortable, and it had belonged to them for years. The forbidden love of Prince of Alken and the Princess of Venn had manipulated these marionettes for years, and they never imagined that their dolls would outlast their own kingdoms. Surely, they never imagined that their dolls would be able to manipulate their own kingdoms.

Item Description: The name Pharis is said to have once belonged to a hero, but is now more widely known as a style of hat. Armor made of smooth leather. Even lighter and more flexible than most leather armors.
Story: The Pharis style of hat is said to have been worn by a hero long ago. Now, it is more commonly known as a popular style of hat. The armor made from Pharis leather is much lighter and more flexible than most leather armors, making it perfect for those who want to be able to move quickly and easily.

Item Description: Lightweight and battle-proven leather armor worn by a savvy soldier. Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.
Story: The armor is worn by a valiant soldier who is known for his bravery and strong sense of justice. He is always willing to stand up for what he believes in, no matter the cost.

Item Description: Round leather-covered shield. A standard widely-used shield. Small shields are always less stable but landing critical hits after parry is easier.
Story: The shield was old and battered, but it still served its purpose. It was small, but it was sturdy. It was a standard shield, used by many people. It was a small shield, but it was very stable. It was easier to land critical hits after parry with a small shield, because it was less unstable.

Item Description: Key to the Lecture Theatre in the Lecture Building. Today, the two-story Lecture Building is adrift in the nightmare, but once it was a place of reflection, where scholars learned of history and archaeology. Perhaps it still is, as the students in the lecture theatre appear to await the return of their professor
Story: The key to the Lecture Theatre hangs from a rusty chain, swinging gently in the breeze. As the chain swings, the key catches the light and casts a long, dark shadow across the floor. Suddenly, the door to the theatre opens and a figure steps inside. The key swings wildly, striking the figure in the face. The figure falls to the ground, unmoving.

Item Description: Great Hammer wielded by the Silver Knight Ledo. Ledo's hammer is by far the heaviest weapon amongst those wielded by the knights of Anor Londo. Ledo, an eccentric who traveled aross the outskirts, became a close friend to the giants and even Havel, the Rock.
Story: Ledo's hammer is said to be the heaviest weapon in Anor Londo. Legend has it that the Silver Knight, Ledo, forged the hammer himself from a single silver ingot. The weight of the hammer is said to be enough to crush boulders, and Ledo's strength is said to be unmatched.

Item Description: Bewitched ring that Pontiff Sulyvahn bestowed upon his knights. Recovers HP with successive attacks. Knights who peer into the black orb are lured into battles of death, transformed into frenzied beasts. No wonder the Pontiff only provides these rings to those dispatched to foreign lands.
Story: The bewitched ring bestowed by Pontiff Sulyvahn upon his knights is a powerful artifact that restores HP with successive attacks.
