Unfortunately, the ring's black orb also lures knights into battles of death, transforming them into frenzied beasts. This explains why the Pontiff only provides these rings to those dispatched to foreign lands.

Item Description: One of the special rings granted to the four knights of Gwyn. The Leo Ring belonged to Ornstein the Dragonslayer. This ring strengthens counters with pierce weapons. His lugged spear is said to have sliced a boulder in two.
Story: The Leo Ring was given to Ornstein the Dragonslayer by the four knights of Gwyn. This ring strengthened counters with pierce weapons, and his lugged spear was said to have sliced a boulder in two.

Item Description: (Piece Name) of Ringfinger Leonhard. Leonhard was born into royalty, which is believed to be the reason for his skill in both sorcery and swordsmanship. In his youth, Leonhard suffered grave burns to his entire body. His face in particular, which he hid beneath his mask, was terribly scalded. He abstained from restoring these injuries, even after becoming a Finger of Roasaria. (Mask) Indeed this dingy garb is in fact embroidered with gold thread, betraying its purpose as military wear designed for a noble. (Chest) Indeed, these dingy gauntlets are in fact decorated with silver, betraying their purpose as military wear designed for a noble. (Gauntlets) Indeed, these dingy trousers are in fact meticulously tanned, betraying their purpose as military wear designed for a noble. (Leggings)
Story: Leonhard, a young man of royalty, was badly burned as a child. He refused to have his injuries restored, choosing instead to wear a mask and clothing that would disguise his appearance.

Item Description: Cloak worn by Leydia witches. Leydia apostles worship Galib, god of disease. They once resided in the Undead Crypt beside Fenito. The Leydia witches grew conceited, and began to manipulate both the onset and curing of disease, making themselves the effective gatekeepers of the crypt
Story: The Leydia witches once resided in the Undead Crypt beside Fenito. They grew conceited, and began to manipulate both the onset and curing of disease, making themselves the effective gatekeepers of the crypt. However, they were eventually overthrown by a new group of witches who worshipped Galib, god of disease.

Item Description: Robe of a Leydia Pyromancer. Leydia apostles, in their conceit, occupied the Undead Crypt and misused death. This invoked the ire of Fenito, who branded them as transgressors
Story: The robe of a Leydia Pyromancer is a powerful artifact that belonged to a powerful sect of apostles known for their misuse of death. One day, Fenito, the god of death, became enraged at the Leydia Pyromancers and branded them as transgressors. Since then, the robe has been sought by many adventurers who want to use its power to become powerful themselves.

Item Description: Armor worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Its left breast is emblazoned with a symbol of Erdtree Worship, said to have once been imbued with an incantation of protection.
Story: The armor worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell is said to have once been imbued with an incantation of protection. The left breast is emblazoned with a symbol of Erdtree Worship, said to have once been imbued with an incantation of protection.

Item Description: An old ring set with a red jewel. Raises maximum HP. Each ring has a different power, and even very modest rings can be a great boon on a perilous journey.
Story: The ring was old and worn, but the jewel inside was still red and shining. It raised the wearer's maximum health, and even the most modest rings could be a great boon on a perilous journey.

Item Description: Ring set with a small red jewel. Raises Maximum HP.
Story: The ring was beautiful, with a small red jewel set in the gold band. It felt warm and comfortable to wear, and it seemed to raise the user's maximum HP.

Item Description: Small stone made up of crystallized souls. Gradually restores a small amount of hp. Often found near abandoned corpses, as if it were what remains of the soul.
Story: The small stone is a relic of the dead. It is said that it is made up of crystallized souls, and that it slowly restores a small amount of health. It is often found near abandoned corpses, as if it were what remains of the soul.

Item Description: Scythe born from the soul of Priscilla the stark white crossbreed trapped inside the painted world of Ariamis. Even the Gods feared Priscilla's lifehunt ability and in the hands of a mortal its power will turn upon its wielder.
Story: The Scythe was created when Priscilla the stark white crossbreed was trapped inside the painted world of Ariamis. The Gods feared her lifehunt ability and in the hands of a mortal, its power would turn upon its wielder. For centuries, the Scythe lay dormant, until a young man named Jakob found it. Jakob was a farmer who had been cursed by a witch, and the witch had said that Jakob's only hope was to find the Scythe and use

Item Description: Standard crossbow issued to soldiers. While bows require both hands, a crossbow is held in one, but arming each bolt takes time.
Story: The standard crossbow was issued to soldiers as a fast and easy way to arm their bolts. While bows require both hands, a crossbow is held in one, allowing for quick and easy arming. However, this weapon requires time to learn how to use effectively, and is not as popular as the bow among soldiers.

Item Description: A standard crossbow. Equip bolts to use. Unlike bows, a crossbow can be held in one hand. Equip up to two types of bolts to give yourself immediate options in battle.
Story: The crossbow was a common weapon in the world. It was a simple weapon, but it was very effective. Crossbows could be equipped with bolts, which gave the user a lot of options in battle.

Item Description: Special bolts imbued with lightning, crafted by the giant blacksmith of Anor Londo. The giant blacksmith has never seen a crossbow, but remembers the specifications of the bolts requested by ancient warriors
Story: The giant blacksmith of Anor Londo had never seen a crossbow before, but he remembered the specifications of the bolts requested by ancient warriors. He spent days crafting the bolts, imbuing them with the power of lightning. When he was finished, he proudly presented them to the king.

Item Description: Bolts imbued with lightning created by the giant blacksmith of the gods. However, the gods never used crossbows. These bolts are likely artifacts of the dragonless era, when the pact between gods and humans was upheld.
Story: The blacksmith of the gods created bolts imbued with lightning. These bolts were likely used during the dragonless era, when the pact between gods and humans was upheld. One day, a young adventurer found one of these bolts and used it to slay a dragon. Since then, the bolt has been passed down through the adventurer's family.

Item Description: Ring depicting a hand grasping a stone. Increses lightning attack, but reduces physical defense. The origin of this ring is unknown, but its design suggests one of the darker deities. Effective use of this ring requires skill on the part of the wearer.
Story: The ring is said to have been created by one of the darker deities, and as such, it is imbued with their power. The ring increases the wearer's lightning attack, but reduces their physical defense. It is said that the wearer must be skilled in using this ring in order to reap its full benefits.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Found in the aftermath of dragon hunts. Used in infusion to create lightning weapons. Lightning weapons inflict lightning damage, and scale with faith.
Story: After slaying dragons and looting their treasure, a group of adventurers comes across a large gem of titanite. Intrigued, they decide to take it home and use it to create lightning weapons. The weapons inflict lightning damage, and as the adventurers' faith grows, so too does the power of the weapons.

Item Description: Greatarrows Imbued with lightning. Tipped with Gold Pine Resin. Weapons Fortified with lightning are effective against foes resistant to magic and fire. If you require magic but have learned non yourself, these will serve you well
Story: The greatarrows were imbued with lightning and tipped with gold pine resin. They were weapons fortified with lightning that were effective against foes resistant to magic and fire. If you were lacking in magic and needed to rely on other means, these arrows would be a great help.

Item Description: A small clay urn enwreathed in lightning. Explodes, inflicting lightning damage. Created in Melfia, a land that flourishes with magic and pyromancy. Though the lightning contained in the urn lacks potency, it is a boon to any inexperienced traveler.
Story: The small clay urn was created in Melfia, a land that flourishes with magic and pyromancy. Though the lightning contained in the urn lacks potency, it is a boon to any inexperienced traveler.

Item Description: Dragon-hunting tool used by Lothric knights. Explodes upon contact, inflicting lightning damage. The knights of Lothric have since tamed dragons, but were once hunters of dragons themselves. This explains their special hunting gear, and why they worshipped the sun.
Story: The Lothric knights used a dragon-hunting tool that would explode upon contact, inflicting lightning damage. The knights of Lothric were once hunters of dragons themselves, and this explains their special hunting gear. They worshipped the sun because they believed that it was the only thing that could tame the dragons.

Item Description: A special ring granted to only the most accomplished sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School. The ring is engraved with a lingering dragon, and boosts the length of the effects of sorceries.
Story: The ring is a coveted possession at Vinheim Dragon School, and is only given to the most accomplished sorcerers. The ring boosts the length of the effects of sorceries, making them more powerful.

Item Description: A ring used long, long ago in a land that existed where Drangleic is now. Extends the length of spell effects. Presumably, this ring was used by a high sorcerer, but no proof of such remains. Scholar of the First Sin changed to: A ring used long, long ago in a land that existed where Drangleic is now. Extends the length of spell effects. The ancient dragons were once worshipped in several nations, and rumors concerning objects of similar enchantments to this uncommon ring abound in many lands, though their origins are no longer verifiable.
Story: A ring used long, long ago in a land that existed where Drangleic is now. Extends the length of spell effects. The ancient dragons were once worshipped in several nations, and rumors concerning objects of similar enchantments to this uncommon ring abound in many lands. Some say the ring was used by a high sorcerer, but no proof of such remains.

Item Description: Greataxe wielded by Lion Clan warriors. The finely-crafted blade cuts smoothly, evidence that the lion clansmen are much more than vulgar beasts.
Story: The Lion Clan is a proud and fierce tribe of warriors who live in the forested hills of the kingdom. They are known for their greataxe, which is said to be the sharpest in all of the kingdom. The Lion Clan is a respected and feared force, and their warriors are known for their strength and ferocity.

Item Description: Greatbow of black iron wielded by General Radahn. Decorated with a lion mane motif. Imbued with gravitational power of the Starscourge, when used along with Radahn's Spear, it becomes a true weapon of a champion.
Story: The Greatbow of Black Iron is a powerful weapon that was once wielded by General Radahn. The weapon is decorated with a lion mane motif, and is imbued with the gravitational power of the Starscourge. When used along with Radahn's Spear, it becomes a true weapon of a champion.

Item Description: Skirt worn by Lion Clan mages.The Lion Clan are an offshoot race that appear in historical records quite abruptly, as if one day they climbed out of the depths of the very earth itself.
Story: The skirt worn by Lion Clan mages is a symbol of their power and authority. The mages of the Lion Clan use their skirts to channel their magical energy, and they use their skirts to protect themselves from harm.

Item Description: cape worn by Lion Clan warriors. The Lion Clan are an offshoot race that have no ties to humans, and would murder anyone with the curious notion of approaching them. The lion clansmen seem to despise their own looks, as they hate being seen.
Story: The Lion Clan warriors wear a cape that covers their entire body, hiding their features from any who would approach them. They are a proud and fierce race, and would never allow anyone to see them for what they truly are- a lion.

The Lore was a tome of ancient knowledge that was said to be unbreakable. It was said that the Lore could grant its owner power over the elements, the ability to read minds, and the ability to control the dead.

Item Description: Round iron armor with a banner extending from its back. Worn by the Lionel the Lionhearted. When this chivalrous dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.
Story: The Lionel the Lionhearted was a valiant knight who fought in many battles. One day, he met a girl named Fia who had been driven from her home. He declared himself to be her father and helped her find a new home.

Item Description: Special material used in a Holy Chalice ritual. The immense brain that Mensis retrieved from the nightmare was indeed lined with eyes on the inside, but they were of an evil sort, and the brain itself was terrible rotten. But even still, it was a legitimate Great One, and left a relic. A living relic, at that, which is a precious thing indeed.
Story: The relic was a living brain, and it was terrible rotten. But even still, it was a legitimate Great One, and left a powerful relic. A living relic, at that, which is a precious thing indeed.

Item Description: Staff used by the fallen sorcerers who wander this land. A catalyst for both sorceries and hexes. Particularly well-attuned for sorceries. The lizard bound to its tip is a simple charm, and has no bearing on the staff's powers.
Story: The Staff of the Fallen Sorcerers is a powerful tool used by those who have fallen from power. It is especially well-suited for using magic, and is said to be particularly adept at casting spells. The staff is bound to a lizard, a simple charm that has no bearing on its powers.

Item Description: Armor reinforced with rare geisteel. Belonged to Chancellor Wellager. Excellent defensive gear that is of exceptional Quality both light and strong. Crafted by the castle's resident master smith Llewellyn, and supplied only to a selected few. His work easily identified by its lack of ostentation, Llewellyn focused solely on an economy of simplicity and strength.
Story: The armor belonged to Chancellor Wellager, and was of exceptional quality both light and strong. It was crafted by the castle's resident master smith Llewellyn, and supplied only to a selected few. Due to its simplicity and strength, Llewellyn's work was easily identified.

Item Description: Ring given to knights of the Way of White. Depicts Allfather Lloyd's Shield of Caste. Boosts damage absorption when HP is full. Much time has passed since the worship of Lloyd was common in the Way of White. The clerics of Carim had always strongly asserted that Lloyd was a derivative fraud, and that the Allfather title was self-proclaimed.
Story: The Ring of the White Knights was a powerful artifact that granted its wearer increased damage absorption when their health was full. It was said that this ring was given to the knights of the Way of White by the Allfather himself, many years ago. The clerics of Carim had always strongly asserted that Lloyd was a derivative fraud, and that the Allfather title was self-proclaimed. However, the ring's power was undeniable, and many knights chose to wear it in defiance of Carim's

Item Description: Ring given to knights of the Way of White. Depicts Allfather Lloyd's Sword of Law. Boosts attack power when HP is full. Much time has passed since the worship of Lloyd was common in the Way of White. The clerics of Carim had always strongly asserted that Lloyd was a derivative fraud, and that the Allfather title was self-proclaimed.
Story: The Ring of the White Knights was a powerful artifact that granted its wearer increased attack power when their health was full. It was said that this ring was given to the knights of the Way of White by the Allfather himself, Lloyd. Many years had passed since the worship of Lloyd was common in the Way of White, and the clerics of Carim had always strongly asserted that Lloyd was a derivative fraud, and that the Allfather title was self-proclaimed. However, some of the knights

Item Description: Talisman used by cleric knights. Blocks Estus recovery within a limited area. It is said that the cleric knights used these talismans to hunt down accursed Undead. Cleric knights fight with pride, and by blocking the recovery of the Undead, they can also fight with impunity.
Story: The talisman was used by the cleric knights to hunt down the undead. By blocking the recovery of the undead, they could fight with impunity.

Item Description: Catalyst of Big Hat Logan, the great sorcerer and seeker of knowledge. Originally the same catalyst employed by the Vinheim sorcerers, only terribly strengthened over time due to Logan's use. Very powerful when used by one of superior intelligence.
Story: Logan had always been a curious boy, ever since he was old enough to ask questions and explore the world around him. He loved learning about the magic that existed in the world, and the more he learned, the more he wanted to know. So when he discovered that he had the ability to create magic himself, Logan was ecstatic. He could learn anything he wanted and no one could stop him. But as Logan used his magic more and more, he began to notice strange

Item Description: Secret tome of the Profaned Capital court sorcerers, containing sorceries of Logan. Give to a sorcerer to learn Logan's sorceries. The court sorcerers used this scroll to claim heirship to Logan's legacy, though how that claim stands up to closer scrutiny is another story.
Story: The court sorcerers coveted the Secret tome of the Profaned Capital for its rumored contents of sorceries of Logan. When they finally obtained it, they found that it was not as powerful as they had hoped. However, they did learn some of Logan's most powerful spells.

Item Description: Weapon wielded by martyr Logarius' band of executioners. Used to slaughter the Vilebloods in Cainhurst. Bathed in pools of their blood, and forever steeped in their ire. Transform to release the power of the wheel and manifest their lingering rage in a show of utter brilliance.
Story: The weapon known as the Bloodmoon was wielded by Logarius' band of executioners. It was used to slaughter the Vilebloods in Cainhurst, and was bathed in pools of their blood. The Bloodmoon was also steeped in their ire, and could be transformed to release the power of the wheel and manifest their lingering rage in a show of utter brilliance.

Item Description: A braille tome of Londor, first spoken by Liliane of the Sable Church. Give this to a storyteller to learn miracles of Londor. This is a forbidden tome, as it offers salvation to all Hollows, and conversely curses all things living.
Story: The tome is a sacred text of the Sable Church, and is said to contain miraculous teachings about Londor. It is also said to be a powerful tool that can be used to save Hollows and curse living things. Whoever possesses the tome will be able to learn the secrets of miracles, and will be able to cast powerful curses. However, the tome is also a forbidden book, as it offers salvation to all Hollows and curses all things living.

Item Description: A standard bow used by hunters. Equip Arrows to use. Equip up to two types of arrows to give yourself immediate options in battle. Use arrows to hit enemies from afar to gain the upper hand by drawing first blood.
Story: The bow is a standard tool used by hunters. It is equipped with arrows that can be used to hit enemies from a distance, gaining the advantage by drawing first blood.

Item Description: Large bow. Projectile weapon for experienced hunters. Equip arrows to use.
Story: The large bow is a powerful projectile weapon that is best suited for experienced hunters. They can equip arrows to use with it, and its powerful shots can take down even the most formidable of prey.

Item Description: Large iron axe with a long handle. Weapon of the maltreated Misbegotten. Making use of the force generated by its length, this weapon's resentment-charged blows are difficult to stop.
Story: The large iron axe with a long handle is a weapon that is difficult to stop. It is made from the resentment-charged blows of the maltreated Misbegotten, and its force is difficult to resist.

Item Description: Widely-used standard straight sword only matched in ubiquity by the shortsword An accessible sword which inflicts consistent regular damage and high slash damage, making it applicable to a variety of situations.
Story: The sword was forged in the fires of Mount Doom by the great smith, Melkor. It was the first sword ever made, and it was terrible. It was made of pure, unyielding evil, and it cut through anything it touched.

Item Description: Standard straight sword. This straight sword is sufficient in most respects, and effective in most situations if wielded properly. Those who aspire to master the sword are certain to wield this at some point during their journey.
Story: The straight sword is a common weapon found in most fantasy stories. It is often sufficient in most respects, but can be improved with practice. Those who aspire to use the sword effectively must learn how to wield it correctly. In this story, the straight sword is the starting point of a journey to become a master swordsman.

Item Description: Armor worn by the Looking Glass Knight. Made of metal, but have high lightning defense. Those who wish to serve the king loyal warriors must take the King's Passage and face the Looking Glass Knight. Those who fail the test are sacrificed by the merciless specular monstrosity
Story: The Looking Glass Knight armor is a powerful piece of armor that is made of metal, but has a high lightning defense. It is said that those who wish to serve the king and be loyal warriors must take the King's Passage and face the Looking Glass Knight. Those who fail the test are sacrificed by the merciless specular monstrosity.

Item Description: Robe of the Lord's Blade Ciaran, one of Gwyn's Four Knights. A robe common to all of the Lord's Blades, These deadly women shift nimbly between layers of darkness, etching streaks of gold into the night air, and planting visions of terror into the minds of their targets
Story: Ciaran had always been a bit of an outsider. He was the only son of a peasant farmer, and he had always felt different. He was never quite sure why, but he had always felt a connection to the Lord's Blades. When he was chosen to become one of Gwyn's Four Knights, he was overjoyed. He knew that he would be able to use his skills to protect those who were important to him. As Ciaran began his training

Item Description: Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army. Through blackened and damaged by years of use, it appears to have otherwise been kept in a serviceable condition, despite the soldiers having long since lost their minds.
Story: The sword is a well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious design. It is wielded by regulars of a lord's army, who have long since lost their minds. The sword has been blackened and damaged by years of use, but it appears to have otherwise been kept in a serviceable condition.

Item Description: Well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army. Though blackened and damaged by years of use, it appears to have otherwise been kept in a servicable condition, despite the soldiers having long since lost their minds.
Story: The sword is a well-crafted straight sword with an illustrious design. It is wielded by regulars of a lord's army, who have long since lost their minds. The sword is blackened and damaged by years of use, but it appears to have otherwise been kept in a servicable condition.

Item Description: Lordvessel bestowed upon the chosen Undead who is destined to succeed Lord Gwyn. The chosen Undead is granted the art of warping between bonfires. To open the final door, place this vessel on the Firelink Altar, and fill it with powerful souls.
Story: The Lordvessel is a sacred artifact bestowed upon the chosen Undead who is destined to succeed Lord Gwyn. The chosen Undead is granted the art of warping between bonfires. To open the final door, place this vessel on the Firelink Altar, and fill it with powerful souls.

Item Description: Lordvessel bestowed upon the chosen Undead who is destined to succeed Lord Gwyn. The chosen Undead is granted the art of warping between bonfires. To open the final door, place this vessel on the Firelink Altar, and fill it with powerful souls.
Story: The Lordvessel is a sacred artifact bestowed upon the chosen Undead who is destined to succeed Lord Gwyn. The chosen Undead is granted the art of warping between bonfires. To open the final door, place this vessel on the Firelink Altar, and fill it with powerful souls.

Item Description: Old, discolored human bone with several holes bored into it. A woman's corpse in the Undead Settlement was found clutching this bone. Her name was Loretta.
Story: etta had been bitten by a vampire and had turned into one herself. She had been searching for her lost love, who had also become a vampire. When she found him, she killed him and drank his blood.

Item Description: Intricately crafted silver war sickle wielded by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree. Originally given for service as a personal guard to Carian royalty, the weapon's blue glintstone has been replaced with unalloyed gold.
Story: tta had always been a proud knight, ever since she was a little girl. She was the only daughter of a nobleman, and when her father died, she was left with a lot of responsibility. She was determined to make her family proud, and so she joined the military. She was assigned to be a personal guard to the Carian royalty. The job was hard, but it was also exciting. She got to travel all around the kingdom, and she met a lot of interesting people.

Item Description: Armor of Prince Lothric's older brother Lorian. This black-dyed brass helm is patterned with flame. (Helm) This black-dyed brass armor was passed down to him from the royal family. (chest) These black-dyed brass gauntlets were passed down to him from the royal family. (Gauntlets) Lorian, raised as a knight, is said to have been left mute and crippled by his younger brother's curse. It is also said that Lorian, in fact, wished it so.
Story: Prince Lothric's older brother Lorian was left mute and crippled by his younger brother's curse. It is also said that Lorian, in fact, wished it so. One day, Lorian found a black-dyed brass helm in a dusty old chest. He put it on and felt a sense of power and purpose for the first time in his life. He went on to become a great knight, and his armor and gauntlets are still passed down to the next in line for

Item Description: Ultra greatsword of Lorian, Prince Lothric's older brother. Cast in smoldering molten steel, and stained black. Before Lorian embraced his brother's curse, he was a knight who single handedly slayed the demon prince, but the victory eternally scorched his sword with flame. Skill: Flame of Lorian Lunge forward to transform smolder into flame, and follow with strong attack to launch flame across ground.
Story: Prince Lothric's older brother, Lorian, was once a great knight who slew the demon prince. However, the victory left his sword stained with flame, and Lorian eventually embraced his brother's curse. Now, Lorian's sword can transform into flame at will, and he uses it to scorch his enemies.

Item Description: Armor of Prince Lothric's older brother Lorian. This black-dyed brass helm is patterned with flame. Lorian, raised as a knight, is said to have been left mute and crippled by his younger brother's curse. It is also said that Lorian, in fact, wished it so.
Story: Prince Lothric's older brother Lorian was cursed by their younger brother, who left him mute and crippled. Lorian, in fact, wished it so, because he wanted to be able to focus on his training and become the best knight he could be. One day, Lorian found a black-dyed brass helm with a pattern of flame. He put it on and felt a sense of empowerment. The curse was gone and he could finally focus on his dreams.

Item Description: An ultra greatsword forged from the soul of the Lost Sinner. Its blade saps the life of its wielder. The true nature of this sword is unknown, even to the Lost Sinner herself. Those who choose this sword will share the burden of the Lost Sinner's misdeeds.
Story: The Lost Sinner's ultra greatsword is a powerful weapon that drains the life of its users. It is unknown what the true nature of this sword is, as even the Lost Sinner herself does not know. Those who choose to wield this sword will share in the burden of the Lost Sinner's sins.

Item Description: Armor of a celebrated Lothric knight. A strong steel armor, if a little worn. The Knight has served as one of the Three Pillars since ancient times, and shares place alongside the wyverns as a symbol of Lothric. Only those possessing a knight's resolve are fit to wear this garment.
Story: The armor of a celebrated Lothric knight is a strong steel armor, if a little worn. The Knight has served as one of the Three Pillars since ancient times, and shares place alongside the wyverns as a symbol of Lothric. Only those possessing a knight's resolve are fit to wear this garment.

Item Description: Ultra greatsword of the venerable knights of Lothric. Imbued with the strength of lightning, the trademark of dragon hunting. Very few have demonstrated the extreme strength and dexterity required for this weapon, even in the long history of the Lothric Knights.
Story: The Ultra Greatsword of the Lothric Knights is a legendary weapon that is said to be imbued with the strength of lightning. It is only wielded by the most skilled and determined knights of the order, and is known for its ability to slay dragons.

Item Description: Long spear wielded by the proud Lothric Knights. Designed for long-range thrusting. Lothric spear knights are known for their steadfastness, and this spear boosts the poise of its wielder. Skill: Charge Hold spear at waist and charge at foe. Use strong attack while charging to extend the length of the charge
Story: The Lothric spear was a proud weapon wielded by the proud Lothric knights. It was designed for long-range thrusting, and its wielder was known for their steadfastness. When used in conjunction with strong attacks while charging, the Lothric spear could extend the length of the charge, making it a formidable weapon.

Item Description: A well-crafted straight sword designed for thrusting attacks, wielded by the venerable Knights of Lothric. The Knights of Lothric, with their drakes, once crushed anything that threatened their shores. Of course, that was a long, long time ago.
Story: The Knights of Lothric were once a mighty force on the battlefield. However, their glory days are long gone. Now, they are a shadow of their former selves, struggling to keep their island stronghold from falling into ruin. One of the few remaining Knights, who goes by the name of Drake, is determined to restore the order and protect his home. When a group of invaders arrives, Drake is the only one who can stand against them. He wields the legendary straight sword,

Item Description: The flagpole that once carried the Lothric crest, and guided the knights long ago. The tip of the pole is fitted with a sharply pointed decoration, letting it serve as a spear. Skill: Lothric War Banner Wave the flagpole high in the air, like the days of yore, summoning an ethereal war banner that invigorates the attack of those who gather under it.
Story: The Lothric War Banner is a sacred relic that once flew over the kingdom of Lothric. It was used to rally the troops and inspire them to victory during the bloody conflict known as the Lothric War. Today, the banner remains a powerful symbol of strength and unity, and can be waved proudly in support of those fighting on the side of Lothric.

Item Description: Prince Lothric's straight sword, blessed by Emma with potent magic. Young Lothric was meant to be a champion, and was expected to wield this platinum sword, but some things will remain distant dreams forever.
Story: Lothric's sword was a powerful tool that he was meant to use to protect his kingdom. However, due to a curse, Lothric will never be able to use it to its full potential.

Item Description: Gloves worn by knights while on travel. Belonged to Lucatiel of Mirrah. Only those who have distinguished themselves on the battlefield were admitted into the elite ranks of Mirrah's official order of knights. It is common to hear of a peasant's dream of striving for knighthood as an escape from hardship, but who would ever think it possible?
Story: The gloves belonged to Lucatiel of Mirrah, an elite knight who had distinguished herself on the battlefield. When she died, her gloves were passed down to her daughter, who wore them with pride. One day, a peasant dreamt of becoming a knight like her mother, and decided to pursue the dream. After years of hard work, he finally achieved knighthood and wore the gloves with pride.

Item Description: Mask attached to a ceremonial hat. Belonged to Lucatiel of Mirrah. Normally hats and masks are separate, but these two have been adjoined
Story: The Mask and Hat belonged to Lucatiel of Mirrah, a powerful sorceress who ruled her kingdom with an iron fist. One day, Lucatiel was betrayed by one of her trusted advisors, and was captured by her enemies. Rather than face execution, Lucatiel agreed to be exiled from her homeland. She was given a choice: to leave her mask and hat behind, or to wear them while she traveled. Lucatiel chose to keep her mask and hat with her

Item Description: Mask attached to a ceremonial hat. A Hollow once fought valiantly with this mask, but feared the fading of her self, and implored a comrade remember her name. Perhaps that is why this gentleman's mask is named after a woman.
Story: The Mask attached to the ceremonial hat belonged to a Hollow who fought valiantly with it, but feared the fading of her self. One day, a comrade remembered her name and gave the mask to him as a token of remembrance. Ever since, the gentleman has worn the mask with pride, honoring the Hollow who fought so bravely.

Item Description: Halberd with a large hard beak-like protrusion. Inflicts thrust damage. Instead of thrusting like a spear the wielder of the Lucerne aims to club the head with its hard beak.
Story: The Lucerne is a halberd with a large hard beak-like protrusion. It inflicts thrust damage instead of spear damage, and the wielder aims to club the head with its hard beak. This weapon is perfect for those who want to inflict maximum damage with minimal effort.

Item Description: A trick weapon typically used by Healing Church hunters. It is said that the silver sword was employed by Ludwig, the first hunter of the church. When transformed, it combines with its sheath to form a greatsword. It exhibits several departures from the workshop's design, suggesting that the Church anticipated much larger inhuman beasts.
Story: The silver sword was once wielded by Ludwig, the first hunter of the Healing Church. When transformed, the sword combines with its sheath to form a greatsword. The sword exhibits several departures from the workshop's design, suggesting that the Church anticipated much larger inhuman beasts.

Item Description: Key to the lunarium facing the lake on the second floor of Byrgenwerth College. In his final years, Master Willem was fond of the lookout, and the rocking chair that he kept there for meditation. In the end, it is said, he left his secret with the lake.
Story: The Lore of the Lunarium is a secret passed down from Master Willem to his most trusted students. It is said that he left his final gift to the lake in the lookout, so that future generations may learn from his wisdom.

Item Description: The giant blue glintstone crown worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer. This crown replaced Lusat's brain and skull altogether, and now, removed from his body, it is all but dead. What power remains within raises the potency of Lusat's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.
Story: Lusat, primeval current sorcerer, wore a giant blue glintstone crown that replaced his brain and skull altogether. The crown was all but dead, but its power still raised the potency of Lusat's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.

Item Description: Staff of the primeval glintstone sorcerer Lusat. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone may wield it. Enhances power of all sorceries, but consumes additional FP.
Story: The Staff of the Primeval Glintstone Sorcerer is a powerful artifact that enhances the power of all sorceries, but it consumes additional FP. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone can wield it.

Item Description: A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Corroded by blue glintstones. Since the grand masters Azur and Lusat were driven from the academy, no one has achieved their formerly-held rank.
Story: The robe worn by the grand masters of Raya Lucaria is now tarnished by blue glintstones. It is said that since the grand masters Azur and Lusat were driven from the academy, no one has been able to achieve their former rank.

Item Description: Iron hammer with a protrusive pommel. This simple bladeless strike weapon is effective against most foes and can break the guard of a shield. However one miss leaves one wide open
Story: The iron hammer was created to be a simple, yet effective bladeless strike weapon. It was designed to be effective against most foes, and its pommel protrusive design makes it perfect for breaking the guard of a shield. However, one miss with this weapon can leave the user wide open.

Item Description: the mace of formerly high-ranking clerics. It is combined with a sacred chime, and can cast miracles and hexes with strong attack. The clerics held venerated positions once, but now, their souls wander aimlessly in the depths of a murky darkness.
Story: The mace of formerly high-ranking clerics is a powerful weapon that can cast miracles and hexes with strong attack. The clerics who used to wield it were once respected and held high positions, but now their souls wander aimlessly in the depths of a murky darkness. One day, a brave adventurer may find the Mace of Clerics and use it to restore the lost souls to the light.

Item Description: Armor from an unknown foreign land. King Vendrick called upon powers from beyond his borders in an attempt to stave off the curse. Perhaps they belonged to one of his guests
Story: Vendrick had been hosting a large number of diplomats from far-off lands. One of these guests, a king from a land of metal armor, had a strange effect on Vendrick. The king's armor seemed to protect Vendrick from the curse that was plaguing his kingdom. Vendrick was so grateful that he made the king his heir and gave him the kingdom.

Item Description: Whistle of the Madaras twins, denizens of the Forbidden Woods. The twins grew up alongside a poisonous snake, and developed a silent, inhuman kinship. The poisonous snake grew uncontrollably, raised on a healthy diet of beast entrails. Even after their deaths, it is said to respond to the call of the twins' whistle from within the Nightmare.
Story: The Whistle of the Madaras twins was a magical artifact that could summon the spirits of the twins who died in the Forbidden Woods. The twins had a poisonous snake as a companion, and the snake grew to uncontrollably large size after eating the beast entrails that the twins fed it. Even after their deaths, the snake is said to respond to the whistle of the twins from within the Nightmare.

Item Description: Most tomb prospectors, members of the Healing Church chosen to explore the old labyrinth, are unable to withstand the weight of the old knowledge, and go mad. This attire is worn by those lost souls. The appendages draped across them are said to be a kind of protective charm, or at least, that is what these lost souls believe with all their hearts.
Story: A lost soul wearing this attire wanders the labyrinth, lost and searching for something.

Item Description: Most tomb prospectors, members of the Healing Church chosen to explore the old labyrinth, are unable to withstand the weight of the old knowledge, and go mad. This attire is worn by those lost souls. Truth oft resembles madness, inaccessible to the dull of mind. Those who go mad are merely thoughtful souls who failed to reach any conclusions.
Story: A mad prospector's outfit.

Item Description: Skull of a madman touched by the wisdom of the Great Ones. Use to gain Insight. Making contact with eldritch wisdom is a blessing, for even if it drives one mad, it allows one to serve a grander purpose, for posterity.
Story: The Skull of a Madman is a powerful artifact that allows its user to gain insight into the mysteries of the universe. However, as with all things of great power, the Skull can also drive its user mad.

Item Description: Arrows imbued with magic. Tipped with aromatic Ooze. Weapons fortified with magic are particularly effective against heavily armored foes or creatures with thick scales. Useful in the short term for those who have learned no magic, or whose magic is exhausted.
Story: The arrows are tipped with a viscous, green ooze that smells faintly of lavender. The arrows are meant for use by those who have no magic or whose magic is exhausted. The arrows are especially effective against heavily armored foes or creatures with thick scales.

Item Description: Bolt imbued with magic Tipped with Aromatic Ooze Weapons fortified with magic are particularly effective against heavily armored foes or creatures with thick scales. Crossbows and specialized bolts allow warriors with low dexterity to inflict elemental damage.
Story: The Bolt imbued with magic is a powerful weapon that is especially effective against heavily armored foes or creatures with thick scales. Crossbows and specialized bolts allow warriors with low dexterity to inflict elemental damage.

Item Description: An altered state of titanite. Use on weapon to convert wielder's intelligence into attack. Cannot be used on shields. Sorcerers at the Melfian Magic Academy once attempted to imbue titanite with carious elements, but are said to have failed. Someone must have succeeded, though; what else would explain this stone?
Story: The titanite in your hand is different than any other you've seen. It's a deep, dark blue, and when you hold it up to the light, you can see that it's covered in strange symbols and runes. You can feel a strange power emanating from it, and when you try to use it to convert your intelligence into attack, you find that it works perfectly. However, you can't use it to convert your shield's intelligence into attack.

Item Description: Curved sword with a blade fashioned from the lava of Mt. Gelmir. An armament of the man-serpents, impossible for a human to have made. Deals fire damage.
Story: The curved sword is a fearsome weapon, forged from the lava of Mount Gelmir. It deals fire damage, making it an ideal weapon for dealing with man-serpents.

Item Description: This ritual implement is a three pronged candlestick with solid flames formed of the magma of Mt. Gelmir. When wielded as a weapon, the flames become supple whips of lava.
Story: The magma of Mount Gelmir is said to be the hottest and most volatile substance in the world. When wielded as a weapon, the flames of the candlestick become supple whips of lava. This powerful artifact is used in religious ceremonies to invoke the power of the volcano.

Item Description: White robe worn by traveling maidens. It is part of their formal attire, regardless of rank. It is soft and well-made, but does not offer much in the way of defense, making it ill- suited to use in battle
Story: The white robe worn by traveling maidens is a part of their formal attire, regardless of rank. It is soft and well-made, but does not offer much in the way of defense, making it ill-suited to use in battle. However, it is still a beautiful and elegant garment, and its simplicity is a refreshing change from the more ornate robes worn by most nobles.

Item Description: White robe worn by traveling maidens. Part of their formal attire, regardless of rank. It is soft and well-made, but ill-suited for use in battle.
Story: The white robe worn by traveling maidens is a part of their formal attire, regardless of rank. It is soft and well-made, but ill-suited for use in battle. One day, a young maiden set out on a journey and took her white robe with her. She soon found herself in a fight against a group of bandits, and was able to use her robe to defend herself. The robe became stained with blood and dirt, but it still served its purpose and helped

Item Description: Standard small thrusting sword. Unsharpened but pointed solid shaft can pierce tough armour Can be thrust using the weight of one's body, and is very effective for critical attacks.
Story: The small thrusting sword is a common weapon found in many fantasy stories. It is often used as a critical attack weapon, as it can pierce through tough armor.

Item Description: A slightly stubby thrusting sword. Has a sharp, sturdy blade designed for thrusting. The Mail Breaker has limited reach, but a powerful critical attack. Effective against foes donning thick armor or with naturally hard skin.
Story: The Mail Breaker was forged by a master swordsmith with a mission: to break through the defenses of foes wearing thick armor or with naturally hard skin. The weapon's sharp, sturdy blade is designed for thrusting, making it an effective tool against opponents. The Mail Breaker's critical attack is powerful and effective, making it a valuable asset in any battle.

Item Description: A small sword made for thrusting attacks. This hard, edgeless sword can pierce through tough armor, and boasts a deadly critical attack.
Story: The small sword is a finely crafted weapon meant for thrusting attacks. It is hard and edgeless, able to pierce through tough armor. The sword also boasts a deadly critical attack, making it a deadly weapon in the hands of a skilled user.

Item Description: An ancient greatsword of unknown origin. This sword was passed down through generations, until it reached Gordin, wandering knight of Forossa, and was lost upon his death. Uncannily, every last one of the prominent swordsmen who inherited this weapon was left-handed.
Story: Gordin's greatsword had been passed down through the generations of Forossa's wandering knights until it reached Gordin himself. Upon his death, the sword mysteriously passed to every last left-handed swordsman in the family. This peculiarity caused much speculation among the swordsmen of Forossa, as no one could explain why the sword seemed to favor those who were naturally left-handed.

Item Description: Armor made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk. My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god - he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all.
Story: Malenia had been waiting for Miquella for years. She was the Blade of Miquella, and she was the most feared Empyrean in all of the planes. Miquella was her brother, and she loved him deeply. When Miquella finally arrived, Malenia was overjoyed. She told him all about her life, her battles, and her dreams. Miquella listened attentively, and promised to help her achieve her goals. They

Item Description: Winged helm made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk. “My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god – he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all.”
Story: Malenia, the Blade of Miquella, wears a golden helm adorned with a single, large, black feather. The helm is said to have been made from unalloyed gold, and is said to have been worn by Malenia, the Blade of Miquella. The black feather is said to have been taken from the wings of a vulture, and is said to have been the symbol of Malenia's power and authority.

Item Description: One of the malformed weapons developed in Aldia. Appears to be a crustacean pincer, but its precise origins are unclear. The peculiar figure known as Lord Aldia attempted to uncover the secrets of life itself, and viewed the Undead as a key to this mystery
Story: The Aldia Weapon, a bizarre and grotesque weapon that appears to be the claws of a crustacean, is said to have been created by Lord Aldia, the mad scientist who attempted to unlock the secrets of life itself. Rumors abound as to the weapon's origins, but no one knows for sure. What is known is that this fearsome weapon is feared by all who see it, and is said to be the perfect tool for slaying the Undead.

Item Description: Malformed golden armor. Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels. After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.
Story: The Tree Sentinels were once humanoids, but after Gransax attacked they realized that they needed to become dragons in order to protect Erdtree. They took to wearing golden armor adorned with dragon imagery in order to transform into their new form. Now they patrol the forest, protecting it from any threats.

Item Description: One of the malformed weapons developed in Aldia. Swung like a great hammer. Appears to be a fragment of a giant shell, but its precise origins are unknown. The peculiar figure known as Lord Aldia attempted to uncover the secrets of life itself, and viewed the Undead as a key to this mystery.
Story: The Aldia weapon is a large, malformed hammer that swings like a great club. It is said to be a fragment of a giant shell, but its origins are unknown. Lord Aldia, the enigmatic figure known for his efforts to uncover the secrets of life, viewed the Undead as a key to this mystery.

Item Description: Maliketh's black blade which once harbored the power of the Rune of Death. A sad shadow of its former glory. After a fragment of Death was stolen on that fateful night, Maliketh bound the blade within his own flesh, such that none might ever rob Death again.
Story: Maliketh's black blade is a powerful weapon that once held the power of the Rune of Death. After a fragment of Death was stolen on that fateful night, Maliketh bound the blade within his own flesh, such that none might ever rob Death again. However, the power of the Rune has slowly faded away, leaving the blade a sad shadow of its former glory.

Item Description: Beast's gauntlets made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyral half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions
Story: Maliketh was a fearsome warrior, and his gauntlets were no exception. They were black iron, decorated with gold, and they were the envy of all who saw them. Maliketh was known as the Black Blade, and his gauntlets were his weapon of choice. He was a fearsome warrior, and his gauntlets were no exception. They were black iron, decorated with gold, and they were the envy of all who saw them. Maliketh was known as the Black Blade, and his g

Item Description: Hatchet of the serpent men guarding Archdragon Peak. Has a unique, curved blade that can sneak past shields. Skill: Warcry Let out a spirited warcry that temporarily boosts attack, and pierce through shields to inflict direct damage.
Story: The Hatchet of the Serpent Men guarding Archdragon Peak is a unique curved blade that can sneak past shields. When used in conjunction with the Warcry skill, it can boost attack and pierce through shields to inflict direct damage.

Item Description: Staff of the man-grubs who guard Rosaria’s Bed Chamber. Their holy symbol is formed at the tip. Wielder’s luck strengthens effects of sorceries. The man-grubs have clearly been reborn, but as what?
Story: The Staff of the Man-Grubs is a sacred item that is used by the man-grubs who guard Rosaria’s Bed Chamber. The staff has a holy symbol that is formed at the tip and it is said that the wielder’s luck will be strengthened by using the staff’s powers.

Item Description: This single-bladed blood-stained greatsword is the choice weapon of the slithering serpent men of Sen's Fortress. An ordinary human will have great difficulty swinging this heavy beast effectively.
Story: The greatsword is the chosen weapon of the serpent men of Sen's Fortress. The weapon is heavy and difficult for an ordinary human to wield, but it is the perfect choice for those who are skilled in wielding blades.

Item Description: Claws used by the manikins of Harvest Valley. The peculiar art of puppetry is a vestige of the two lost lands. The Queen, entranced by poison, used it to beckon unknowing souls to the defiled valley.
Story: The claws of the manikins of Harvest Valley are said to have been used by the Queen of the Lost Lands to beckon unsuspecting souls to the defiled valley. These claws have a peculiar art of puppetry, a vestige of the two lost lands.

Item Description: Knife of the manikins of Harvest Valley. The peculiar art of puppetry is a vestige of the two lost lands. The Queen, entranced by poison, used it to beckon unknowing souls to the defiled valley
Story: The knife is a beautiful work of art. It is made from finely crafted wood and is adorned with intricate carvings of manikins. The puppeteers of Harvest Valley used to use this knife to perform their delicate art. Now, the knife is all that remains of the puppeteers and their art.

Item Description: Mask of the Manikins of Harvest Valley. A fickle queen gave them life, and tore off their faces. How else could she forgive those who dared gaze upon her. The peculiar art of puppetry is vestige of the two lost lands. A queen breathed life into these dolls with the very miasma that afflicted her poison-drenched bosom, so that she would have slaves to serve her temperamental will.
Story: The Mask of the Manikins of Harvest Valley is a cursed artifact that was given life by a fickle queen. The queen tore off the masks of the dolls so that she could never forgive those who gazed upon her. The art of puppetry is a remnant of the two lost lands, and the queen breathed life into the dolls with the very miasma that afflicted her poison-drenched bosom.

Item Description: Small curved sword of the manikins of Harvest Valley. The peculiar art of puppetry is a vestige of the two lost lands. The Queen, entranced by poison, used it to beckon unknowing souls to the defiled valley.
Story: The small curved sword of the manikins of Harvest Valley is a beautiful and unique artifact. It is said that the art of puppetry originated in the lost lands, and that the Queen, entranced by poison, used it to beckon unknowing souls to the defiled valley. The sword is a reminder of the tragedy that befell the people of those lands, and it is a source of great sadness to those who know of its existence.

Item Description: A katana with a terribly worn blade. Appears useless, but is in fact coated with deadly poison. This sword has claimed countless victims, and the bloodstains upon it's blade have turned to poison.
Story: The katana is cursed, and has killed countless people with its deadly poison. However, the sword's curse is not yet complete. A brave and determined person can use the sword's poison to their advantage, and kill their enemies with ease.

Item Description: A curved sword with a blade at both ends wielded by the Cemetery Shades, the insect-ridden grave keepers. The blade is thin and sharp, and strong attack unleashes a far-reaching slash.
Story: The Cemetery Shades are a group of insect-ridden grave keepers who use a curved sword with two blades. The thin and sharp blade is strong enough to unleash a far-reaching slash, and the attack is powerful enough to cut through even the toughest of materials.

Item Description: A sorcery catalyst born from the soul of Manus, Father of the Abyss. A rough, old wooden catalyst large enough to be used as a strike weapon. Similar to the Tin Crystallization Catalyst, it boosts the strength of sorceries, but limits the number of castings.
Story: The sorcery catalyst was created by Manus, the Father of the Abyss. It was a large, rough wooden catalyst that boosted the strength of sorceries. However, it only allowed a limited number of castings.

Item Description: Storied sword of House Marais, the family of executioners who presided over the Shaded Castle. One of the legendary armaments. Elemer of the Briar, the Bell Bearing Hunter, snatched the sword from the site of his looming execution, and furnished it with battle skills from his home of Eochaid..
Story: The Storied Sword of House Marais was once wielded by one of the most feared families in all of Shaded Castle. When Elemer of the Briar, the Bell Bearing Hunter, snatched the sword from the site of his looming execution, he added his own battle skills to the weapon. Now, the sword is a deadly force to be reckoned with.

Item Description: Mask in the image of a white-haired young noble. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais. Increases arcane. The Marais family has a dual history spanning generations, serving as both executioners and castellans of the Shaded Castle. This mask bears the likeness of the first of their line.
Story: The Mask of the White-Haired Noble is a powerful artifact that belonged to the head of House Marais. It was traditionally worn by the head of House Marais, and it increased their arcane abilities. The Marais family has a dual history spanning generations, serving as both executioners and castellans of the Shaded Castle. This mask bears the likeness of the first of their line.

Item Description: Robe with a black mantle across the shoulders. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais. The sons of House Marais are all sickly born. Little wonder that Maleigh Marais would be so beguiled by the beautiful and fierce goddess who was born into rot.
Story: The robe worn by the head of House Marais is a symbol of power and authority. It is customary for the sons of House Marais to be sickly, but Maleigh Marais was beguiled by the beautiful and fierce goddess who was born into rot. Now, the sons of House Marais are all sickly, but they still seek to claim the throne of Marais.

Item Description: Among the first hunters, all students of Gehrman, was the lady hunter Maria. This was her hunter's cap, garb, gloves, and trousers, crafted in Cainhurst. Maria is distantly related to the undead queen, but had great admiration for Gehrman, unaware of his curious mania
Story: Maria was a hunter of the first order, and was known for her skill with the bow and arrow. One day, she came across a group of hunters led by a man she had never seen before. The man was Gehrman, the great hunter. Maria was amazed by his skills, and decided to learn from him. Gehrman was happy to teach her, and they spent many days together in the forest. One day, while they were hunting, Gehrman disappeared. Maria was

Item Description: Stone hammer made in the lands of the Numen, outside the Lands Between. The tool with which Queen Marika shattered the Elden Ring and Radagon attempted to repair it. The hammer partially broke upon shattering the Ring, becoming splintered with rune fragments.
Story: The Stone Hammer is a powerful tool that was used to break the Elden Ring and stop the spread of the Dark Lord Radagon. The tool was partially broken upon shattering the Ring, and as a result, it contains fragments of the magical artifact. These fragments have the power to heal and protect those who wield them, and they are coveted by many.

Item Description: Cylindrical helm of plate metal reinforced with a lattice. Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers. The construction of this helm is remarkably crude. For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.
Story: The Cylindrical Helm of Plate Metal Reinforced with a Lattice is a finely crafted helm worn by marionette soldiers. It was crafted to serve the sorcerers, who demanded the best protection possible for their delicate puppets. Despite its crude construction, the helm is still incredibly sturdy, and it remains the only protection that the dolls have against the elements.

Item Description: Mask of the sorcerers who flooded New Londo to seal away the Darkwraiths, and the Four Kings who descended into Dark. It symbolizes their resolve to keep the seal shut forever and their atonement for all who were sacrificed, but two of the three forsook New Londo upon tiring of their duty
Story: The Mask of the Sorcerers is a relic that was used to seal away the Darkwraiths. It was worn by the three sorcerers who flooded New Londo in order to seal away the Darkwraiths. However, two of the three sorcerers eventually grew tired of their duty and abandoned New Londo. The Mask of the Sorcerers now symbolizes their resolve to keep the seal shut forever and their atonement for all who were sacrificed.

Item Description: This universal key opens any basic lock. Tool of the trade for thieves. But in the cursed land of the Undead, most doors are better left unopened.
Story: In the cursed land of the Undead, most doors are better left unopened. That is, until one lucky thief finds a key that opens any basic lock. This key is the tool of the trade for thieves, but in the land of the Undead, it's also a coveted treasure.

Item Description: This universal key opens any basic lock. Tool of the trade for thieves. But in the cursed land of the Undead, most doors are better left unopened.
Story: In the cursed land of the Undead, most doors are better left unopened. That is, until one lucky thief finds a key that opens any basic lock. This key is the tool of the trade for thieves, but in the land of the Undead, it's also a coveted treasure.

Item Description: A terribly worn shirt Men are fond of weaving tales to explain the raggedness of their garb. My sixth sense warned me of danger, and I danced between flurries of blades unscathed, but alas, my clothes went to tatters.
Story: A shirt that has been worn and tattered from battle is said to have a sixth sense that warns the wearer of danger.

Item Description: An iron helm resembling an upside-down bucket. A single hole allows one to peek out with a single eye, which is probably all that its original owner had. The iron helm is passed down among masters of the League. Valtr had in fact lost the ability to see Vermin long ago.
Story: Valtr had been a master of the League for many years, and had even fought alongside the great heroes of old. But one day, he lost his ability to see Vermin. He was devastated, and felt like he had lost a part of himself. He was determined to find a way to regain his sight, no matter what it took. One day, he found an iron helm in a trash heap. It looked like an upside-down bucket, with a single hole

Item Description: Greatsword of the Primal Knights that defend Drangleic Castle. The brutish and mighty Primal Knights wield this sword like a feather-light twig, but to the ordinary warrior it is a chore to even hold up, owing to its great weight. Terrible experiments were said to have taken place in a hidden manor in Drangleic. The mastermind presiding over the deeds was known as Lord Aldia.
Story: The greatsword is a relic of the Primal Knights, a group of fierce warriors who defended Drangleic Castle. The sword is incredibly heavy, but due to its great size and power, it is still a formidable weapon. It is said that terrible experiments were conducted in a hidden manor in Drangleic by Lord Aldia, the mastermind behind the castle's defense. The experiments resulted in the creation of the undead, and the greatsword is now a symbol of the Primal Knights'

Item Description: Halberd of the Primal Knights that defend Drangleic castle. The brutish and might Primal Knights wield this halberd like a feather-light twig, but to the ordinary warrior it is a chore to even hold up, owing to its great weight. Terrible experiments were said to have taken place in a hidden manor in Drangleic. The mastermind presiding over the deeds was thought to be Lord Aldia.
Story: The Primal Knights are a group of elite warriors who protect Drangleic castle. They use this halberd as a lightweight weapon, but to the average person it is incredibly heavy. It is said that terrible experiments were conducted in a hidden manor in Drangleic by Lord Aldia, the mastermind behind the castle's defense.

Item Description: Armor worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. The wing-shaped ornaments on its back evoke the Deathbird. A self-inflicted curse that ties the spirits of these loyal knights to the land, having willingly beheaded themselves so that they may serve their masters in death.
Story: The armor worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. The wing-shaped ornaments on its back evoke the Deathbird. A self-inflicted curse that ties the spirits of these loyal knights to the land, having willingly beheaded themselves so that they may serve their masters in death.

Item Description: Armor worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. The surcoat depicts the mausoleum bell, which rings in constant mourning for the soulless demigods.
Story: The armor worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum is a reminder of the lost souls who once called it home. The surcoat depicts the mausoleum bell, which rings in constant mourning for the soulless demigods.

Item Description: Scimitar of Laddersmith Gilligan. Nothing notable about this weapon, except perhaps the luxurious jewels embedded in the hilt. If your aim is to appear dazzling on the battlefield, this might just do the trick.
Story: The Scimitar of Laddersmith Gilligan is a finely crafted weapon that is adorned with luxurious jewels. It is said that whoever wields this weapon will appear dazzling on the battlefield.

Item Description: A staff with a small bowl attached to the tip, similar to a mendicant's crook. Absorb additional souls from fallen foes. The staff's history is unclear. It may be a relic of an ancient serpent's greed, or a ritual artifact used to summon souls.
Story: The staff was once the property of a powerful serpent. It was said that the serpent used the staff to absorb the souls of its fallen enemies. Over time, the staff became tainted with the serpent's dark desires, and it was eventually destroyed. Now, the staff is a relic of the serpent's past, and it can be used to absorb the souls of those who oppose it.

Item Description: The School of Mensis controls the Unseen Village. This hexagonal iron cage suggests their strange ways. The cage is a device that restrains the will of the self, allowing one to see the profane world for what it is. It also serves as an antenna that facilitates contact with the Great Ones of the dream. But to an observer, the iron cage appears to be precisely what delivered them to their harrowing nightmare.
Story: The School of Mensis controls the Unseen Village. They use the cage to restrain the will of the self and allow one to see the profane world for what it is. The antenna also facilitates contact with the Great Ones of the dream.

Item Description: A strange gift from the messengers, inhabitants of the dream who revere the brave hunters. Use to envelop oneself in a black nightmarish mist, then transform into a messenger. The illusion is a parlor trick. and any large movement will break the spell. To preserve the guise. proceed very slowly.
Story: The gift from the messengers was a black cloak that could envelop the user in a nightmarish mist. The cloak had the ability to transform the user into a messenger, but the cloak had a hidden flaw. Any large movement would break the spell, so the user had to proceed very slowly while in the cloak.

Item Description: A strange gift from the messengers, inhabitants of the dream who revere the brave hunters. Use to envelop oneself in a black nightmarish mist, then transform into a messenger. The illusion is a parlor trick. and any large movement will break the spell. To preserve the guise. proceed very slowly.
Story: The gift from the messengers was a black cloak that could envelop oneself in a nightmarish mist. The cloak had the ability to transform the wearer into a messenger, but the illusion was only a parlor trick. Any large movement would break the spell. To preserve the guise, the wearer had to proceed very slowly.

Item Name: Metal hammer of Andre of Astora
Item Description: blacksmith at the Old Church. Can be used as a strike weapon but better left in the hands of its talented owner.
Story: The blacksmith at the Old Church is a talented craftsman, but his best work is reserved for his striking weapon. This weapon is made of black iron, and is sharp enough to cut through even the toughest of armor. However, the blacksmith is better off leaving this weapon in the hands of its talented owner, as it is much better suited for cutting through flesh.

Item Description: Katana forged from meteoric ore to dispatch lifeforms born of falling stars. Deals magic damage. The blade is weighty, known to deliver slashes of such ferocity that the impact is said to resemble the crash of a falling meteor.
Story: The Katana forged from meteoric ore is a powerful weapon that deals magic damage. It is heavy, and is known to deliver powerful slashes that are said to resemble the crash of a falling meteor.

Item Description: Staff embedded with a dark purple glintstone, said to be the fragment of a meteorite. Boasts high sorcery scaling and boosts gravity sorceries as well. However, this staff cannot be strengthened in any way.
Story: The staff is said to be the fragment of a meteorite that boasts high sorcery scaling and boosts gravity sorceries. However, the staff cannot be strengthened in any way.

Item Description: A Caryll rune envisioned by Adeline, patient of the Research Hall. A translation of the inhuman, sticky whispers that reveal the nature of a celestial attendant. Those who swear this oath become a Lumenwood that peers towards the sky, feeding phantasms in its luscious bed. Phantasms guide us and lead us to further discoveries.
Story: The Caryll rune is a translation of the inhuman, sticky whispers that reveal the nature of a celestial attendant. Swearing this oath becomes a Lumenwood that peers towards the sky, feeding phantasms in its luscious bed. Phantasms guide us and lead us to further discoveries.

Item Description: Battle axe wielded by Millwood Knights. Its blade is blessed by the symbol of the Ethereal Oak A hefty axe normally wielded by the mightiest of warriors. Skill: Warcry The unique warcry of the Millwood Knights entailed a leap straight toward the enemy and a fearsome roar.
Story: The Battle Axe is a hefty axe that is normally wielded by the mightiest of warriors. The warcry of the Millwood Knights entailed a leap straight toward the enemy and a fearsome roar.

Item Description: Heavy, sturdy greatarrows made of black oak that deal heavy damage but have limited range. Can only be fired using a greatbow. It is said that the Millwood Knights used these to face their sworn enemy, the Abyss Dragon.
Story: The greatarrows were once used by the Millwood Knights to face off against the Abyss Dragon. These heavy, sturdy weapons were made of black oak and were able to deal heavy damage, but had a limited range. Only greatbows could be used to fire them, and because of this, the knights were able to take down the dragon with relative ease.

Item Description: Greatbow crafted with black oak and wielded by Millwood Knights. Only specialized great arrows can be fired from the bow. It is said that the Millwood Knights used these to face their sworn enemy, the Abyss Dragon. Skill: Pierce Earth Fire a greatarrow with a burst of strength and a prayer that violently shakes its target and explodes on impact.
Story: The greatbow was crafted with black oak and was wielded by the Millwood Knights. Only specialized great arrows could be fired from the bow, and it was said that they used it to face their sworn enemy, the Abyss Dragon. The skill involved firing a greatarrow with a burst of strength and a prayer that violently shook its target and exploded on impact.

Item Description: Sword forged by servants of Miquella of the Haligtree, with a design modeled after those carried by Carian knights. Instead of glintstone however, amber from the Haligtree is embedded in the blade. A sumptuous piece, yet it has never been offered to any knight — an ill-starred sword with no master. Skill: Sacred Blade
Story: The sword was forged by the servants of Miquella of the Haligtree. The design on the blade was modeled after the swords carried by Carian knights, but instead of glintstone, amber from the Haligtree was embedded in the blade. The sword was never offered to any knight, as it was an ill-starred sword with no master.

Item Description: Formal attire of the honorable knights of Mirrah, featuring their heraldry, a stag set against a blue field. Oddly, it was a dishonorable deserter who wore this attire most religiously
Story: The honorable knights of Mirrah wear formal attire featuring their heraldry, a stag set against a blue field. A dishonorable deserter, however, wears this attire most religiously, as it is the only thing that makes him feel like he belongs in the world. One day, the deserter is caught and brought before the knights. They ask him why he wears their heraldry, and he responds with a sad story. He was once a proud knight, but he was dishon

Item Description: Greatsword issued to the proud knights of Mirrah's official order. This one was wielded by Lucatiel. This greatsword demands advanced skill in a rare and unique sword technique. A tiny message is inscribed on the blade, a promise to someone special.
Story: The greatsword issued to the proud knights of Mirrah's official order. This one was wielded by Lucatiel, a skilled swordsman and member of the order. The sword is imbued with a special power, requiring advanced skill in a rare and unique sword technique in order to use it effectively. The inscription on the blade reads, "To my love, always remember our promise."

Item Description: Garb worn by Mirrah Knights sent on journeys. This hard leather vest is bestowed only upon proven knights. Knights travel afar to fulfill their sacred duties, but few are ever able to deliver on their vows.
Story: The vest belonged to a knight who had been sent on a journey to find a cure for a deadly disease. He had been unsuccessful in his mission and had returned home, broken and disillusioned. He had no choice but to take his own life, but before he did, he put on the vest and left for the last time.

Item Description: Shortbow wielded by Winged Misbegotten. Fine fur clings to it. Designed to inflict additional damage by sacrificing range.
Story: The Winged Misbegotten's shortbow was designed to inflict additional damage by sacrificing range. The fine fur clinging to it testified to its effectiveness.

Item Description: Dagger favored by military physicians in white. The pointed blade is hard and sharp, making critical hits especially potent. Medicine is mercy. and mercy upon the battlefield is ruthless. Beware the killers clothes as men of compassion
Story: The Dagger favored by military physicians in white. The pointed blade is hard and sharp, making critical hits especially potent. Medicine is mercy. and mercy upon the battlefield is ruthless. Beware the killers clothes as men of compassion. The sharpness of the blade can easily slice through the fabric of a compassionate man's clothing, revealing the deadly intentions that lie beneath.

Item Description: Trident of Mohg, Lord of Blood. A sacred spear that will come to symbolize his dynasty. As well as serving as a weapon, it is an instrument of communion with an outer god who bestows power upon accursed blood. The mother of truth desires a wound.
Story: The Trident of Mohg is a sacred weapon that is said to be imbued with the power of an outer god. It is also said to be an instrument of communion with this god, who bestows power upon those who have the blood of the accursed. The mother of truth desires a wound, and the Trident of Mohg is the only thing that can grant her this wish.

Item Description: A blessed charm. Cures poison and restores HP. Many such charms were blessed in reconstructed ancient ceremonies, carried out in the monastery of Lindelt, now know as the new home of miracles. Though it may lack the power of an original, in the circumstances dire enough, an imitation can be quite enough.
Story: The protagonist is a young girl who is traveling with her family to Lindelt, a monastery that is now known as the new home of miracles. While there, they find an old charm that was blessed in an ancient ceremony. The charm is said to cure poison and restore HP. The protagonist's family is desperate for a cure for her sick mother, so they decide to take the charm with them. When they get to Lindelt, they find out that the charm is fake, but they

Item Description: Made of lightweight, flowing white fabric, The ceremonial design suggests that they revered whatever it was they watched over. The purity of the garment, however, neatly symbolizes the fraudulence found at the very heart of the monastery
Story: The white ceremonial robes of the monastery were a beautiful sight. They suggested that the monks revered whatever it was they watched over, and the purity of the garment neatly symbolized the fraudulence found at the very heart of the monastery.

Item Description: Crafted at the Lindelt Monastery to replicate an ancient, sacred scimitar characterized by its uniquely shaped tip. When a true master wields this scimitar, their graceful chained attacks are described as mystical dances, and their deadly slashes as lingering nightmares.
Story: The Lindelt Monastery was known for its crafting of sacred scimitars. The scimitar was a unique weapon characterized by its tip, which was shaped like a crescent moon. The weapon was said to be able to slice through anything with ease. When a true master wielded the scimitar, their graceful chained attacks were described as mystical dances, and their deadly slashes as lingering nightmares.
