Item Description: Great hammer made to resemble flickering flames. Signature weapon of the Fire Monks, who hail from the Mountaintops of the Giants. The unique strong attack rouses fiery combative spirit.
Story: The Fire Monks are a religious order of monks who hail from the peaks of the giants. They use a great hammer that is shaped to resemble flickering flames. The hammer has a unique strong attack that rouses a fiery combative spirit in its users.

Item Description: Monocular used to View things up close. Not a hunter's tool, but a simple antique, to be used as one sees fit.
Story: The monocular was old and battered, but it still functioned. It was not a hunter's tool, but it could be used to view things up close. The owner used it to look at the world around her, and to see things that other people could not.

Item Description: Wings made from wings of the rare moon butterfly. Poisons those who approach its wearer. Also extends jump distance. Little is known about the moon butterfly, which only appears on full-moon nights in winter. Some say the butterfly is a magical being, and its larvae have never once been spotted. Poisons nearby foes.
Story: The wings were made from the wings of a rare moon butterfly. They were enchanted to poison those who came near the wearer, and they also extended the jumper's jump distance. Little was known about the moon butterfly, which only appeared on full-moon nights in winter. Some said the butterfly was a magical being, and its larvae had never once been spotted.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. A transcription of moon, as spoken by the Great Ones inhabiting the nightmare. Gain more Blood Echoes. The Great Ones that inhabit the nightmare are sympathetic in spirit, and often answer when called upon.
Story: Caryll left a transcription of the moon's language to those who could understand it. Those who do will be able to summon the Great Ones and gain their favor.

Item Description: Arrow granted to those bound by Covenant to the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, Lord Gwyn's lastborn. Moonlight Arrows glow silver, and inflict magic damage.
Story: The Arrow of Gwyndolin is a powerful artifact that is granted to those who swear allegiance to the Dark Sun Gwyndolin. The arrows are made from silver and glow in the moonlight, inflicting magic damage to enemies.

Item Description: Weapon born from the mystical creature of the Darkroot Garden the Moonlight Butterfly. The horns of the butterfly a being created by Seath are imbued with a pure magic power.
Story: The Moonlight Butterfly is a mystical creature that is said to be the offspring of the Darkroot Garden's resident deity, the Moonlight Butterfly. The horns of this creature are said to be imbued with a pure magic power, and as such, it is a coveted weapon by many.

Item Description: The blade of this greatsword shines like the brilliant rays of the moon. In the oldest legends, rarely spoken of today, it is said that the sword was born of a great white being. The strong attack unleashes its strength, launching a wave of moonlight.
Story: The greatsword is a beautiful weapon, with a shining blade that is almost as bright as the moon itself. It is said that the sword was born from a great white being, and that its strong attack can unleash a wave of moonlight. Whoever wields the greatsword will be able to unleash its power and strength, and will be able to protect themselves and their allies from harm.

Item Description: Legendary dragon weapon associated with Seath the paledrake. Charge strong attack to its limit to unleash moonlight wave. Oceiros, the Consumed King, was infatuated with the search for moonlight, but in the end, it never revealed itself to him. Skill: Moonlight Vortex Draw sword back and thrust to unleash torrential moonlight. .
Story: The legendary dragon weapon known as Oceiros the Consumed King was said to be imbued with the power of moonlight. When charged to its limit, it could unleash a wave of moonlight that devastates its enemies. However, Oceiros never found the moonlight he sought, and eventually became consumed by its power.

Item Description: Robe of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo. The power of the moon was strong in Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin and hardly provides any physical defense
Story: Gwyndolin was the first Dark Sun, the first of the Four Kings of Anor Londo. He was also the first to be forsaken, cast out by his own people for his dark magic. In his exile, Gwyndolin learned the arts of sorcery and the moon. He fashioned a robe from the finest silk, and it was this robe that granted him his power. The robe is so thin that it offers no physical protection, but it can channel the power of the

Item Description: Katana forged of glintstone. Masterpiece of a Sellian swordsmith. Light enwreathes the blade when sheathed, explaining its Moonveil moniker.
Story: The Katana forged of glintstone was a masterpiece of a Sellian swordsmith. The light enwreathes the blade when sheathed, explaining its Moonveil moniker. The sword was coveted by many, but it was the master swordsmith himself who claimed the blade as his own.

Item Description: Black armor bestowed upon knights of Carim. Modeled on Morne, the Archbishop's apostle, cast from a unique mineral resembling stone. A Carim knight will dedicate an entire career to attending a single maiden, just as Morne once served one goddess alone.
Story: The black armor bestowed upon knights of Carim is modeled after Morne, the Archbishop's apostle. The armor is made from a unique mineral that resembles stone, and a Carim knight will dedicate an entire career to attending a single maiden, just as Morne once served one goddess alone.

Item Description: Greathammer bestowed upon Carim Knights who demonstrate outstanding strength and unwavering faith. Decorated by a ward of Carim Temple, and imbued with the twisted rage of Apostle Morne. Skill: Morne's Rage Stick weapon into earth and emit a powerful shockwave. Also, similar to Perseverance, temporarily boosts poise and reduces damage received.
Story: Carim Knights who have proven their strength and faith through deeds are given the Greathammer. The hammer is decorated by a ward of the Carim Temple and imbued with the twisted rage of Apostle Morne. When used, the Greathammer emits a powerful shockwave that can temporarily boost poise and reduce damage received.

Item Description: A malformed ring given to knights of Carim. Boosts miracles. Morne served the goddess Caitha and later became an apostle of the Archbishop. They labored together to provide comfort to the suffering.
Story: The malformed ring was given to knights of Carim by Morne, a servant of the goddess Caitha and later an apostle of the Archbishop. They labored together to provide comfort to the suffering.

Item Description: Hammer with a sharp spike on its pommel. One of the more barbaric cleric weapons. Uniquely this hammer inflicts thrust damage and causes bleeding
Story: The cleric walks through the dark forest, their hammer swinging easily in their hand. They hear a rustle in the bushes and before they know it, a large bear is charging at them. The cleric swings their hammer and connects with the bear's skull, causing it to stumble and fall to the ground. The cleric walks over to it and pulls out their spike, stabbing it repeatedly into the bear's body until it is dead.

Item Description: Warhammer comprised of a globe attached to a handle. Though a bludgeon dealing strike damage, the appellative star covered. in spikes which cause blood loss. Ironic given its grace name, this weapon often reeks of blood.
Story: The Warhammer is a unique weapon that was created by the humans. It is a bludgeon that deals strike damage and it has spikes on it which cause blood loss. The name of the weapon is ironic because it is often seen as being graceful, but it actually smells of blood.

Item Description: A small clump of mossfruit. Temporarily boosts bleed, poison, frost, and curse resistance. All mossfruit is the same regardless of its color, and has the effects of moss of all colors.
Story: The small clump of mossfruit was a strange find. It looked like any other mossfruit, but it had a strange effect on the user. For a short time, the mossfruit would boost the user's resistance to bleed, poison, frost, and curse. Regardless of its color, all mossfruit had the same effect.

Item Description: Giant curved sword forged using special methods in an Eastern Land. This unparalleled weapon cuts like a Katana but is heavier than a Nata machete. Requires extreme strength, dexterity, and stamina to wield.
Story: The giant curved sword is a masterpiece of craftsmanship, forged from special methods in an Eastern land. It is heavier than a Nata machete, but cuts like a Katana. It requires extreme strength, dexterity, and stamina to wield, and is coveted by the most skilled warriors.

Item Description: A curved greatsword said to have been brought to this land by a foreign warrior. Hold with both hands to make parrying possible. The exquisitely crafted wide blade makes deadly use of both its weight and smooth slicing action. A tough training regimen is required to master this sword.
Story: The greatsword was brought to this land by a foreign warrior. It is said that with both hands held together, the sword can be used to parry incoming attacks. The sword is exquisitely crafted and makes deadly use of its weight and smooth slicing action. A tough training regimen is required to master this sword.

Item Description: The curved greatsword of Alva, Seeker of the Spurned, specially forged in an eastern land. Sharp but heavy, this sword requires extreme strength and dexterity to wield. The search for the spurned had no end, and so the wayfaring knight warmed to a most deformed weapon.
Story: The greatsword of Alva, Seeker of the Spurned, is a unique and powerful weapon. It was forged in an eastern land, and requires extreme strength and dexterity to wield. The search for the spurned had no end, and so the wayfaring knight warmed to the weapon.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. Blood gems are especially rare blood stones that grow on clodblood. Blood gems are kneaded into weapons using workshop tolls, but only of matching shape. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks.
Story: The blood gem was a rare and powerful item that was used to fortify weapons and add various properties. It was made from a type of blood stone that grew on clodblood, and was only able to be created using workshop tolls. The blood gem had various effects that related to physical attacks, and was especially rare.

Item Description: A short-shafted hand scythe wielded by the murkmen who rise from the depths. Enveloped by a black dampness, and imbued with the strength of dark
Story: The murkmen are a race of dark creatures that dwell in the depths of the ocean. They are a fearsome people, known for their hand scythes, which are said to be imbued with the strength of dark magic.

Item Description: The long-handled staff wielded by the murkmen who rise from the depths. Slathered with a black murkiness, and fit for dark sorceries. Skill: Chant from the Depths Works with staff equipped in left or right hand. Briefly boosts the strength of dark sorceries.
Story: The murkmen are a race of dark magic users who dwell in the depths of the ocean. They use their long staff to chant dark spells, which can boost the strength of dark sorceries.

Item Description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushroom have colonized the torso. To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.
Story: The mushrooms growing on the body of the person are a sign of their faith. The red rot on the mushrooms is a sign of their connection to the earth. The person is rooted in their faith and their connection to the earth.

Item Description: Dagger forged from the soul of Mytha, the Baneful Queen. Coated with a potent poison. Mytha was the fairest queen in the land, until something unhinged her. Was it the poison found deep within the earth, or the passion that consumed her heart?
Story: The Dagger of Mytha was forged from the soul of the Baneful Queen. The poison coating the blade ensures that whoever wields it will die a quick and agonizing death. The dagger has been passed down through the generations, always coveted by those who seek to inflict pain and suffering. One day, the dagger will find its way into the hands of a powerful and wicked individual, who will use it to inflict untold misery on others.

Item Description: Katana with a ferociously long blade. Signature weapon of Yura, hunter of Bloody Fingers. Reminiscent of a reinforced spear, its imposing length can be put to good use with powerful thrusting attacks.
Story: The Katana with a ferociously long blade is the signature weapon of Yura, the hunter of Bloody Fingers. The weapon is reminiscent of a reinforced spear, its imposing length allowing for powerful thrusting attacks.

Item Description: Robes worn by servants of Nahr Alma, god of blood. Increases souls acquired for each kill. Belonged to Titchy Gren. Those who profess faith in Nahr Alma have rejected all that is this world, and vow to travel a path stained with blood. Blessed with the protection of the god of war Nahr Alma. This armor is much heavier than it looks, overwhelmed by the blood that it has absorbed.
Story: The robes worn by servants of Nahr Alma, god of blood, increase the souls acquired for each kill. Titchy Gren, a devout servant of Nahr Alma, wore these robes when he went on a rampage through a small town, slaughtering everyone he came across. The robes were blessed by Nahr Alma himself, and the god's protection was enough to keep Titchy safe from the townsfolk's arrows.

Item Description: A special ring that can be engraved with the name of a god. Becomes easier to connect to worlds of players who chose the same god. There are countless vestiges of long-lost gods in the ruins of Drangleic. Or perhaps they are the very same gods as ours, only known by different names.
Story: The ring is a special item that can be engraved with the name of a god. When worn, it becomes easier to connect to worlds of players who have chosen the same god. This ring was found in the ruins of Drangleic, and it is possible that it is a remnant of long-lost gods.

Item Description: Armor of a nameless knight. Crafted with thin metal greatly reinforced by a grooved finish.
Story: The armor of the nameless knight was crafted with thin metal and was greatly reinforced by a grooved finish. The armor was so strong that it could withstand even the most powerful attacks.

Item Description: A hooded cloak of deep navy. Worn by expatriated royalty. Increases mind. Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on missions to faraway lands, from which they would never return. But what choice did they have, having seen the guidance of grace?
Story: The hooded cloak was a gift from the king to his daughter as she departed on a mission to a faraway land. She never returned, but the cloak still hangs in her father's closet. One day, a young girl who was also going on a mission to a faraway land found the cloak and put it on. She felt like she had found a new home.

Item Description: Twin crowns worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City. Indicates the highest clerical rank, and hides the eyes with silk. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
Story: The twin crowns worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City are a sign of their highest clerical rank. They hide the eyes of the nightmaidens with silk, in order to avoid the gaze of the Greater Will. The Nox, a race of subterranean beings, were banished by the Greater Will long ago. Now they live in anticipation of the coming age of the stars, under a false night sky. Their Lord of Night watches over them, and awaits the day

Item Description: Pitch-black armor thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds. The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads at night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.
Story: The Night's Cavalry are a group of riders who once rode funeral steeds. Now, they wander the roads at night, delivering death to anyone who crosses their path.

Item Description: A flail with two additional bludgeoning heads. Weapon of the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds. The large spikes make it highly effective at inducing blood loss, but also demand higher dexterity to wield.
Story: The Night's Cavalry are a group of riders who ride funeral steeds. They use their flails to inflict massive amounts of damage, but also require high dexterity to use.

Item Description: A jet-black glaive with a blade as weighty as a bludgeon. Weapon of the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral seeds. This glaive excels at weighty slash attacks that crash into foes, making it a powerful weapon even on horse back.
Story: The Night's Cavalry are a group of riders who ride funeral seeds. These seeds are black and have a blade on the end of them that is as heavy as a bludgeon. The Night's Cavalry use this weapon to smash their opponents with heavy slash attacks.

Item Description: A finely tailored bordeaux dress. Worn by the nobles of the old bloodline that traces back to the forsaken Castle Cainhurst.
Story: The dress had been worn by the nobles of the old bloodline that traced back to the forsaken Castle Cainhurst. It was a beautiful piece of clothing, but it was also cursed. The nobles who had worn it had all met a gruesome end, their throats slit open.

Item Description: Estoc carried by wandering nobles. Made to be easy to wield. Daubed with gold from tip to tail, it should fetch a good sum.
Story: The Estoc was a finely crafted sword that was easy to wield. It was daubed with gold from the tip to the tail, and it was said to be worth a good sum. The nobles who carried Estocs were often the ones who ruled the kingdom.

Item Description: Narrow blade carried by wandering nobles. Made to be easy to wield. Daubed with gold from tip to tail, it should fetch a good sum.
Story: The nimble blade was crafted with ease of use in mind. The gold-dipped hilt was adorned from tip to tail, and it would be sure to fetch a high price on the market. The story goes that this weapon was once wielded by a wandering noble, and its graceful movements and deadly precision are testament to its former owner's prowess.

Item Description: Traveling attire fashioned from metallic white silk thread. Worn by expatriated royalty. A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.
Story: The traveler had been walking for days, lost in the vastness of the forest. They had been walking for so long that they had lost all sense of time. They were so tired that they could barely keep their eyes open. Suddenly, they heard a rustling in the bushes. They stopped and listened. They could hear something moving closer and closer. They knew that it was a predator and that it was coming to kill them. They had no choice but to fight. As the predator

Item Description: Finery of the nomadic merchants. Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors. These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground. Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.
Story: The nomadic merchants were once a prosperous and powerful clan. However, after they were accused of heresy, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive. Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy. Now, their fabled riches and beautiful decorations are the stuff of legend, and their curse is a warning to all who would dare cross them.

Item Description: Iron armor of a stalwart northern warrior. Supported by interwoven chainmail. Iron defensive wear grants superior absorption. Being from the north, it should also offer resistance to the cold.
Story: The iron armor belonged to a stalwart northern warrior. He had fought in many battles, and knew the importance of wearing armor that would protect him from harm. The iron defensive wear was made up of interwoven chainmail, which would offer superior absorption to any attack. Additionally, the north was known for its cold weather, which meant that the armor would also offer resistance to the cold.

Item Description: One of the secret treasures restored in Aldia. Increases spell uses, but at the cost of HP. This modest-looking ring contains very powerful magic. To imagine what unspeakable deeds were performed to create such rings, one need only recall the cruel fate of the residents of Aldia.
Story: The ring restores spell use, but at the cost of HP. It is said that this ring was created from the remains of the residents of Aldia, who were tortured and killed for their magic. Anyone who wears the ring will be able to cast spells more easily, but the cost is their own health.

Item Description: Notched Whip with sharp spikes. Only slightly effective against armor and tough scales, but quite formidable against enemies with exposed skin. Also causes heavy bleeding.
Story: The Notched Whip is a weapon that is best used against enemies with exposed skin. It causes heavy bleeding, making it a formidable weapon against enemies who rely on physical attacks.

Item Description: A whip covered in spikes. Shreds skin and causes bleeding. Very effective against bare flesh, but not against enemies with armor or like protection.
Story: The whip is a deadly weapon that can cause serious damage to unprotected flesh. However, it is not effective against enemies who are protected by armor or who are skilled in defending themselves.

Item Description: Messengers are inhabitants of the dream who revere the brave hunters. Use them to send messages to other worlds. Leave notes With messengers, read the notes left by messengers in other worlds, and rate notes to participate in the formation of a shared inter-plane intelligence.
Story: In the vast and infinite dreamscape, there are many different worlds. Some are peaceful, others are war-torn. Some are full of life, others are barren. One day, a group of brave hunters ventured into a dark and dangerous world. They left behind messages for other dreamers to find and read. Now, the messengers are the inhabitants of the dream who revere the brave hunters. They use them to send messages to other worlds. But

Item Description: Mace shaped like a suspended metal droplet wielded by monks of the Eternal City. Forged from liquid metal from a Silver Tear, it is thoroughly tempered until hardened.
Story: The Mace is a powerful weapon that is used by monks of the Eternal City. It is made from liquid metal that is taken from a Silver Tear, and is thoroughly tempered until it is hardened. The Mace is said to be able to cut through anything.

Item Description: A grim weapon wielded by swordsmen of the Eternal City, this shotel has a blade as fine as a needle. Forged from the liquid metal of a Silver Tear, it is thoroughly tempered until hardened
Story: The Shotel is a legendary sword that is said to be as fine as a needle. It is forged from the liquid metal of a Silver Tear, and is thoroughly tempered until hardened. The Shotel is said to be the perfect weapon for swordsmen of the Eternal City, as it is able to slice through even the most durable of armor.

Item Description: Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City, with a silk cape attached. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
Story: The armor of the monks of the Eternal City is a symbol of their faith. The cape is a reminder of their Lord of Night, who awaits them above.

Item Description: Crown worn by the swordstresses of the Eternal City. These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and the silk hides their eyes. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.
Story: The Crown worn by the swordstresses of the Eternal City is a symbol of their power and status. These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and the silk hides their eyes. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Item Description: Ring bestowed upon the Fingers of Rosaria, invaders who seek tongues for their goddess. Hides the presence of the wearer when far away. It is said that Rosaria, the mother of rebirth, was robbed of her tongue by her firstborn, and has been waiting for their return ever since.
Story: The Ring bestowed upon the Fingers of Rosaria is a magical item that hides the presence of the wearer when far away. It is said that Rosaria, the mother of rebirth, was robbed of her tongue by her firstborn, and has been waiting for their return ever since.

Item Description: This greatsword one of the rare dragon weapons is formed by the tail of the one-eyed black dragon Kalameet the last of the ancient dragons. The mystical power of its obsidian blade will be released when held with both hands
Story: The greatsword is a powerful weapon that was created from the tail of the one-eyed black dragon Kalameet. The mystical power of its obsidian blade will be released when held with both hands.

Item Description: Key to the gate that blocks the Tomb of Oedon. Beyond the tomb, Oedon Chapel can be found in the center of the Cathedral Ward. Only today the church is abandoned, and some say that the residents of Oedon have all gone mad.
Story: The Key to the Gate that Blocks the Tomb of Oedon is a magical item that is said to be able to open the tomb and allow those who possess it to gain access to the dark secrets that lie within. However, the key is said to be cursed, and those who possess it are said to become insane. Today, the key is said to be held by the church's caretaker, but he is said to be insane as well. If you are brave enough to venture

Item Description: A Caryll rune that transcribes inhuman sounds. Writhe sees a subtle mucous in the warmth of blood, and acknowledges visceral attacks as one of the darker hunter techniques. Visceral attacks restore Quicksilver Bullets. Human or not, the oozing blood is a medium of the highest grade, and the essence of the formless Great One. Both Oedon, and Oedon's inadvertent worshippers, surreptitiously seek the precious blood.
Story: The Caryll rune is a magical artifact that can translate the sounds of inhuman creatures. When Writhe sees the mucous in the warm blood of a creature, she recognizes it as one of the darker hunter techniques. Visceral attacks restore Quicksilver Bullets.

Item Description: Grubby blue robe worn by magisterial officials to carry out their grim tasks. Surveillance, executions, gruesome rituals... The darkest duties drive the wheels of mankind.
Story: The magisterial officials wear a grubby blue robe to carry out their grim tasks. They are constantly on the lookout for any signs of wrongdoing, and are quick to execute anyone who crosses their path. Their gruesome rituals are a source of horror and fear to all who know of them.

Item Description: A wooden mask that depicts an Oni baring his teeth. The source of the sobriquet of the great swordman of the Land of Reeds. Raises dexterity as it lowers focus. The more he sharpened his mind, the more the absurdities of the world came into stark relief. And so Okina renounced it all, and rose to a higher plane. There was only himself. His katana. And its mastery. Before long, Okina became a demon of a swordsman.
Story: A mask that depicts an Oni is said to raise dexterity, but also lowers focus. The more the wearer sharpens their mind, the more absurdities of the world become apparent. One day, the mask's owner renounced the world and rose to a higher plane, only to find himself alone. He then became a demon of a swordsman, wielding his katana with mastery.

Item Description: Cowl made of soft cloth. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.
Story: After the Shattering, many nobles fled their homes in search of safety. Unfortunately, the undead plague followed them, and the once proud and powerful nobles became the pitiful undead wanderers we see today. Abandoning their former lifestyle, they now rely on the kindness of others to survive. This cowl is made from soft cloth and is worn by those who wish to blend in and avoid attention. It is a common garment for the aged, as it is a reminder of what once was

Item Description: A balm extracted from a rare plant. Temporarily increases strength. This special fragrant oil affects the mind, granting a fleeting sense of empowerment
Story: A balm extracted from a rare plant was said to temporarily increase strength. However, some users found that the balm also affected their minds, granting a fleeting sense of empowerment.

Item Description: This hunter's badge, crafted in Gehrman's time, has no practical purpose, except perhaps to assist in romanticizing the past. The badge was a special privilege for the hunters of the past, and should not be dishonored. It should be left in peace, unless one is truly prepared to assume the will of those gone before.
Story: The hunter's badge is a special privilege that was given to the hunters of the past. It is said that the badge has no practical purpose, except perhaps to assist in romanticizing the past. However, if it is dishonored, the badge may take on a life of its own and become a curse.

Item Description: One of the resonating bells that cross the gaps of worlds. This bell is cracked and stained with the blood of beasts. A human must expend Insight to ring this uncanny bell. The old hunters, who have long passed from the dream but cannot forget the feeling of the hunt, rely upon messengers to relay their thoughts. Ring the bell at their side, and they are certain to give a listen. For the night of the hunt is long, and unchanging
Story: The hunters of old relied on the ringing of bells to communicate with one another during the hunt. One of the bells was cracked and stained with the blood of beasts, and it was said that only a human could ring it. The old hunters believed that the ringing of the bell would give them the strength to continue the hunt. If someone were to ring the bell at the side of an old hunter, they were sure to receive a response.

Item Description: One of the resonating bells that cross the gaps of worlds. This bell is cracked and stained with the blood of beasts. A human must expend Insight to ring this uncanny bell. The old hunters, who have long passed from the dream but cannot forget the feeling of the hunt, rely upon messengers to relay their thoughts. Ring the bell at their side, and they are certain to give a listen. For the night of the hunt is long, and unchanging.
Story: The resonating bell is a powerful tool that allows people to cross between worlds. One of the bells is cracked and stained with the blood of beasts, and the old hunters who rely upon it use it to communicate with one another. When someone rings the bell, the old hunters are certain to listen.

Item Description: The bone of an old hunter whose name is lost. It is said that he was an apprentice to old Gehrman, and a practitioner of the art of Quickening, a technique particular to the first hunters. It is most appropriate that hunters, carriers of the torch who are sustained by the dream, would tease an old art from his remains.
Story: The bone of an old hunter is a powerful talisman. His Quickening technique is unique and powerful, and is the perfect way to honor his memory.

Item Description: The bone of an old hunter whose name is lost. It is said that he was an apprentice to old Gehrman, and a practitioner of the art of Quickening, a technique particular to the first hunters. It is most appropriate that hunters, carriers of the torch who are sustained by the dream, would tease an old art from his remains.
Story: The bone of an old hunter is said to have the power to quicken the dead. When someone holds the bone, they can bring the dead back to life. However, the power of the bone is not without risk. If the holder of the bone is not careful, they may bring the dead back as monsters.

Item Description: Old Hunter Garb. In the old days, when hunters were ten a penny, this was their standard garb. One day, the hunters disappeared, and Yharnamites began to whisper of the hunters' sin. Drunk with blood, chasing after beasts, they would pass on to the Nightmare, every last one of them
Story: The garb of the old hunters is said to have cursed the town of Yharnam, driving the people into madness. Now, only the most desperate and bloodthirsty hunters dare to wear it, and even they are not immune to the curse.

Item Description: Old Hunter gauntlets made of brass to protect their weapon-bearing hands. At the time, some hunters believed that certain metals would guard off beast blood. On a night of the hunt, it is no wonder that some resort to superstition
Story: The old hunter gloves were made of brass to protect their weapon-bearing hands. They were a superstition among some hunters, believing that certain metals would guard off beast blood. On a night of the hunt, it was no wonder that some resorted to using these gloves to protect themselves.

Item Description: Old Hunter Top Hat, warped by blood stains. In the old days, when hunters were ten a penny, this was their standard garb.
Story: The old hunter top hat is stained with blood from many hunts. It is a relic from a time when hunters were common and the cost of a meal was a hunt. The hat is now a symbol of the old hunter, a forgotten figure who has all but disappeared.

Item Description: old armor worn by ironclad soldiers. Boasts high defence, but extremely heavy. One day, warriors wearing decrepit armor emerged from drangleic castle, and quietly assumed positions amongst the royal army. not one of them ever spoke a word, or revealed the face under the mask.
Story: The armor worn by the ironclad soldiers of Drangleic Castle was once proud and strong, but over time it had become worn and tattered. One day, a group of warriors emerged from the castle, clad in this old armor. They were silent and faceless, and took their places amongst the royal army. None of them ever spoke, and no one ever knew their names.

Item Description: Great Hammer of the Old Demon King. This weapon has survived since old Izalith, and is imbued with remnants of the Chaos Flame.
Story: The Great Hammer of the Old Demon King is a relic from ancient Izalith. It is said to have been created with the remnants of the Chaos Flame, and is thus imbued with powerful magic.

Item Description: Old undated Armor How old could this nearly-crumbling armor be? Has extremely low durability. Sometimes, just as a thing falls to pieces, it unleashes its last flash of great power...
Story: The armor is old, and has seen a lot of use. It is incredibly low in durability, and sometimes, when it falls to pieces, something amazing happens.

Item Description: An old undated greatsword. Wielded by a warrior from a time so ancient that there exists no record of his endeavors. Has extremely low durability. Sometimes, just as a thing falls to pieces, it unleashes its last flash of great power...
Story: The old greatsword had been passed down through the family for generations. It was a weapon that had been used by a warrior from a time so ancient that there existed no record of his endeavors. The sword had extremely low durability, and sometimes, just as it was about to fall to pieces, it would unleash its last flash of great power.

Item Description: An undated great hammer. Wielded by a warrior from a time so ancient that there exists no record of his endeavors. Has extremely low durability Sometimes, just as a thing falls to pieces, it unleashes its last flash of great power...
Story: The great hammer was once wielded by a warrior from a time so ancient that there exists no record of his endeavors. The hammer has extremely low durability, but sometimes, just as a thing falls to pieces, it unleashes its last flash of great power.

Item Description: An undated pike. Wielded by a warrior from a time so ancient that there exists no record of his endeavors. Has extremely low durability
Story: The pike was once wielded by a warrior from a time so ancient that there exists no record of his endeavors. The pike is extremely low in durability, and will break after only a few uses.

Item Description: An undated ultra greatsword. Wielded by a warrior from a time so ancient that there exists no record of his endeavors. Has extremely low durability.
Story: The undated ultra greatsword is a relic from a time long forgotten. It is said that the warrior who wielded it was a hero of legend, and his deeds are unknown to even the oldest historians. The sword is incredibly frail, and has only lasted for a few short years before it began to break.

Item Description: The beloved ring of a dragon-slaying knight. Strengthens thrust weapon counter attacks. After many years of use, the ring's face has worn down, but close inspection reveals an engraved lion.
Story: The ring belonged to a dragon slaying knight who used it to strengthen his thrust weapon counter attacks. After many years of use, the ring's face had worn down, but close inspection revealed an engraved lion. One day, the knight was killed in battle and his ring was taken by his enemies. They used the ring to power a magical device that could summon dragons. The device was destroyed, but the ring survived and is now being used to power a new magical device.

Item Description: An altered state of titanite. Use to imbue weapons with power of the mundane. Cannot be used on shields. People do not look favorably on the banal, but sometimes even the most mundane of objects can cast things in a most pleasant light.
Story: The townspeople of a small, rural town were always weary of the woods that bordered their town. Rumors circulated that the woods were haunted by creatures that could do terrible things to humans. One day, a group of townspeople decided to take matters into their own hands and venture into the woods to investigate the rumors. As they entered the woods, they were ambushed by a group of creatures that looked like giant spiders. The townspeople were quickly killed, and their

Item Description: Stone made up of crystallized souls. Gradually restores a large amount of HP. A rare stone with so brilliant a shine would fetch a handsome price. But what value could it really have, without knowing who died to leave it behind?
Story: The stone was beautiful, but it had a dark secret. It was made up of crystallized souls, and it gradually restored a large amount of health. But who would want such a valuable stone if they didn't know who had died to give it to them?

Item Description: The large blindfold blocks out unnecessary light, allowing one to observe a pyromancy's true essence. The flame reveals all, and obscures all
Story: The blindfold is a symbol of secrecy and knowledge. It is a tool used by those who wish to observe the true essence of pyromancy without being disturbed. The flame reveals all, but also obscures all.

Item Description: Traditional attire worn by sorcerers of the Vinheim Dragon School. Long ago, sorcerers were said to always dress properly, even while on distant journeys of discovery, even before such journeyes were established curriculum.
Story: The sorcerer's robes were a deep blue, trimmed in white. They flowed around her like a cloud, and the hem brushed the floor. The robes were a deep blue, trimmed in white. They flowed around her like a cloud, and the hem brushed the floor. The robes were a deep blue, trimmed in white. They flowed around her like a cloud, and the hem brushed the floor.

Item Description: An odd stone ring containing a fiery heat. Accumulates power as the user is harmed, then explodes damaging surrounding enemies while leaving it's wearer unscathed. Our deeds will come back to us in some form or another, both good and bad
Story: The ring was found in a destroyed temple. It was emitting a heat that was slowly burning the hand of the person who found it. As they held it, the heat grew and eventually exploded, damaging everything around the person. However, they were unscathed. The ring's power was based on the user's harm, so it seemed to be specifically targeting those who were trying to stop it's destruction.

Item Description: A leather whip that has seen plenty of use. It appears no different than an ordinary whip, but is charmed by an ancient blessing that boosts damage inflicted on Hollows. The blessing is likely the work of a cleric, but whether the spell is good or evil is unclear.
Story: The leather whip is a normal looking whip that is blessed by an ancient spell that boosts damage inflicted on Hollows. The whip has seen plenty of use and is likely the work of a cleric, but the blessing's true purpose is unknown.

Item Description: Old ring from an old witch. Engraved minutely with indecipherable script, but seemingly useless.
Story: The ring is old and worn, with faded script etched into it. It seems to be nothing more than a decoration, but the witch who owned it was powerful and wise. One day, she passed away and the ring was left to her old cat. The cat loved to play with it, but the ring never seemed to do anything. One day, the cat died and the ring was left to the dust.

Item Description: Curved sword bearing the soul of the old wolf that stays with the Watchdogs of Farron. This sword, like a wolf on the prowl, boosts attack and restores HP with each consecutive hit. Skill: Wolf Leap Slice into foes with a large spinning motion, then leap out of harm's way and follow through with a strong attack.
Story: The curved sword bears the soul of the old wolf that has been with the Watchdogs of Farron for many years. The wolf's spirit gives the sword an increased attack and HP restoration ability. When used, the wolf's spirit will leap out and attack the enemies, then retreat back to the sword to continue healing the user.

Item Description: Staff of Olenford the sorcerer. A catalyst for sorceries and hexes. Olenford, revered as the father of sorcery in Melfia, sought knowledge that surpassed mankind's ken, and so ventured into the Undead Crypt, and did away with his humanity. added: Some hold the theory that Melfian sorceries and pyromancies originated within the boundaries of Drangleic, in ages past.
Story: Staff of Olenford. A staff said to be the catalyst for sorceries and hexes. Olenford, revered as the father of sorcery in Melfia, sought knowledge that surpassed mankind's ken, and so ventured into the Undead Crypt, and did away with his humanity. Some hold the theory that Melfian sorceries and pyromancies originated within the boundaries of Drangleic, in ages past.

Item Description: Malformed armor resembling an Omen with its horns cut off. Worn by the Dung Eater. The heavy, sun-shaped medallion represents both the guidance he once saw, and the ring to which it will one day lead.
Story: The Dung Eater was once a great warrior, but he was cursed by a goddess. Now his armor is malformed and his horns have been cut off. He still fights with all his might, but he knows that one day his medallion will lead him to salvation.

Item Description: Robe worn by the Omenkillers, butchers of twisted conscience. Its thick apron is worn in remembrance Rollo, the progenitor of the Omenkillers and a perfumer of antiquity
Story: The robe worn by the Omenkillers is a thick apron that is stained with the blood of their victims. It is a reminder of Rollo, the progenitor of the Omenkillers and a perfumer of antiquity. The robe is said to have the power to curse those who wear it, and those who dare to touch it are doomed to a life of misery and pain.

Item Description: Mask with long, hideously twisted horns worn by the Omenkillers. Increases strength. Bears the smirking face of an elder, twisted in wicked delight. This visage is carved in the image of the evil spirits that haunt the Omen in their nightmares.
Story: The Mask of the Omenkillers is a fearsome artifact that grants its wearer increased strength and the ability to terrify their enemies with the image of an elder, twisted in wicked delight. This mask is carved from the skin of evil spirits that haunt the Omen in their nightmares, and it is said that those who wear it can feel the spirits' malice coursing through their veins.

Item Description: A great relic, also known as the Cord of the Eye. Every infant Great One has this precursor to the umbilical cord.Use to gain Insight and, so they say, eyes on the inside, although no one remembers what that truly entails.
Story: The Cord of the Eye is a powerful relic that every Great One possesses. It is said that using it grants insight and the ability to see things on the inside, though no one knows what this truly entails.

Item Description: The hunters known as the King's Black Hands wielded paired weapons. These belonged to Kamui, who looked after the prince. Kamui brought Onikiri with him to the Undead Settlement, where he forged Ubadachi, and was finally prepared to join the ranks of the royal hunters. Skill: Onislayer Leap forward and slash mercilessly with both blades, cutting open foes
Story: Kamui was a skilled hunter who looked after the prince. One day, he found a blade called Ubadachi and decided to join the ranks of the royal hunters. With this new weapon, he was finally prepared to take on the undead.

Item Description: Large arrows used to destroy giant horned oni in an eastern land. Can only be used with greatbows. Made from the feathers of an aged crow, it is said that these arrows fly as straight as their master.
Story: The large arrows used to destroy giant horned oni in an eastern land. They are made from the feathers of an aged crow and are said to fly as straight as their master.

Item Description: A unique greatbow handed down in an eastern land, where tales are told of its use in slaying giant horned oni. Drawing a bow of this size takes time, and leaves the user vulnerable. Only specialized great arrows can be fired from the bow.
Story: The greatbow is a powerful weapon that is said to be able to slay giant horned oni. Only specialized great arrows can be fired from the bow, which makes it a very risky weapon to use.

Item Description: Elfriede, the eldest amongst her sisters and leader of the Sable Church, bestowed this sword to her knight. Only, the sword was a farewell gift, and acceptance signified the knight's resignation from Elfriede's service. Skill: Elfriede's Blackflame Enwreath blade with blackflame, born of the similarly-hued flame that smolders within her.
Story: Elfriede, the eldest sister of the Sable Church, bestowed her blackflame sword to her knight in farewell. The sword was a sign of his resignation from Elfriede's service, and it was said that only those who possessed the skill to wield the sword could hope to match her power.

Item Description: Sorcery catalyst of the lost land of Oolacile. Formed by enchanted whitebark branches. Boosts sorcery adjustment, but lost land sorceries are not offensive, and attacks are not affected by intelligence.
Story: The Sorcery Catalyst of the Lost Land of Oolacile is a powerful artifact that helps users adjust their sorcery more easily. However, this catalyst is only effective for spells from the lost land of Oolacile, which are not as powerful as other spells. Additionally, this catalyst does not affect the user's intelligence, meaning they are still able to use their full potential in combat.

Item Description: Sorcery catalyst of lost land of Oolacile. Formed by enchanted whitebark branches. The whitebark boosts sorcery adjustment, but the sorceries of this lost land are gentle and not affected by intelligence.
Story: The Sorcery Catalyst of Oolacile is a powerful artifact formed from enchanted whitebark branches. It helps users adjust their sorcery more easily, but the sorceries of this lost land are gentle and not affected by intelligence. This valuable item was once used by a powerful sorcerer to help him control his spells more effectively.

Item Description: An orange ring enchanted by a witch. Reduces lava damage. Since his sores were inflamed by lava from birth, his witch sisters gave him this special ring. But fool that he is, he readily dropped it, and from that spot, a terrible centipede demon was born
Story: The orange ring was enchanted by a witch to reduce lava damage. The ring was given to the protagonist as a gift, but he foolishly dropped it. From that spot, a terrible centipede demon was born. The demon was able to reduce the protagonist's lava-inflicted sores by 50%, allowing him to heal more quickly.

Item Description: Greatsword of Ordovis, one of the two honored as foremost among the Crucible Knights. This sword is imbued with an ancient holy essence. Its red tint exemplifies the nature of primordial gold, said to be close in nature to life itself.
Story: The Greatsword of Ordovis is one of the two honored swords among the Crucible Knights. The sword is imbued with an ancient holy essence, and its red tint exemplifies the nature of primordial gold, said to be close in nature to life itself.

Item Description: Slender straight sword patterned after an antique ornament. Superior swordsmen prefer to wield one in each hand. After falling from grace, the dregs of the golden lineage sought power and purpose in the past.
Story: The Slender Straight Sword is a finely crafted weapon that is often preferred by those who are skilled in swordplay. Once belonged to a noble family that was once considered to be among the most powerful in the land, but now they are considered to be nothing more than criminals. The sword's owner lost their title and their wealth after they were caught committing a crime they didn't commit. They were exiled from their home and have been searching for a way to get their revenge ever since.

Item Description: Armor of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo. Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the Four Knights. His golden lion armor is imbued with the power of lightning and should provide good protection against it.
Story: Ornstein was a great knight who fought in many battles. He was known for his golden lion armor, which was imbued with the power of lightning. One day, he was guarding the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo when a dragon attacked. Ornstein fought bravely, but was eventually killed. His armor still protects anyone who wears it from the power of lightning.

Item Description: Helm of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo. Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the Four Knights. His golden lion helm is imbued with the power of lightning and should provide good protection against it
Story: Ornstein was a great dragon slayer, and his golden lion helm was said to be imbued with the power of lightning. He was the captain of the Four Knights, and his helm was said to be the best protection against dragons. One day, Ornstein was guarding the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo when he was killed by a dragon. His helm was lost in the battle, but his legacy lives on in the stories of the brave knights who wear

Item Description: Armor of an Irithyll outrider knight. Enveloped in a dimly cool air. The knights were given the eyes of the Pontiff, but the eyes transformed them into savage, raving warriors who only knew how to serve as mindless guards.
Story: The armor of an Irithyll outrider knight is shrouded in a cool air, imbuing the wearer with the eyes of the Pontiff. However, the eyes transform the wearer into a savage, raving warrior who only knows how to serve as mindless guards.

Item Description: Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way. Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.
Story: The page's garb is made of the finest materials, with careful attention paid to the details. The fabric is soft to the touch, and the stitching is tight and precise. The page's master wants their page to look and feel their best, so they are careful to avoid any potential embarrassment.

Item Description: Attire of the Painting Guardians, whose forms are described in the mythology of heretics. A smooth pale hood that deters magic. The hunchbacked teller of ancient tales describes unwanted souls who are unwelcome across the lands, and are eventually drawn into a cold, painted world.
Story: The attire of the Painting Guardians is a smooth pale hood that deters magic. The hunchbacked teller of ancient tales describes unwanted souls who are unwelcome across the lands, and are eventually drawn into a cold, painted world.

Item Description: Robe worn by the alabaster-clothed guardians of the paintings in Anor Londo. Offer substantial protection versus magic. They have guarded the Great Painting of Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down through generations, but the reason for doing so passed from all memory long ago
Story: The robe worn by the alabaster-clothed guardians of the paintings in Anor Londo is a symbol of their duty and a source of great protection against magic. The guardians have guarded the Great Painting of Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down through generations, but the reason for doing so passed from all memory long ago.

Item Description: Curved sword of Anor Londo painting guards. Unique shape with flat tip. The guardians, who strike down those who dare threaten the paintings, attack in a continuous, circular dancing motion, a technique passed down through generations.
Story: The curved sword of Anor Londo painting guards are a unique and powerful weapon. They are said to be the guardians of the paintings, and are known for their continuous, circular dancing motion. They are said to be a technique passed down through generations, and are perfect for those who want to strike down their enemies with ease.

Item Description: A weapon described in legends passed down amongst heretics, wielded by the Painting Guardians. A uniquely shaped weapon with a flat tip. Skill: Chained Dance Execute relentless consecutive attacks while tracing a circle in a unique dance of deadly grace.
Story: The Painting Guardians were a group of powerful beings who guarded the paintings in the art gallery of an ancient temple. They were said to be able to use their weapons to dance around the paintings, attacking anyone who dared to come near. One day, a group of heretics invaded the temple and stole one of the Painting Guardians' weapons. The weapon was unique in that it had a flat tip and was shaped like a circle. The heretics used the weapon to dance around the paintings, attacking

Item Description: Armor of Leeroy, Paladin of the Catacombs. Long ago, the Way of the White produced its first Undead, a paladin in golden armor. With the legendary treasures Grant and Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran, Land of the Gods, in the first Undead mission of the Way of White
Story: Leeroy's armor was so powerful that it repelled all Undead attacks. He was hailed as a hero and his armor was enshrined in the Catacombs of Lordran. Centuries later, a new Undead scourge threatened the world, and Leeroy's armor once again came to the aid of the living. With his armor, Leeroy was able to slay the Undead hordes and protect the world from the darkness.

Item Description: Pale pine resin that faintly glimmers. Temporarily applies magic to Main-hand weapon. The blood red substance sometimes found within suggests there is more to this so-called resin than meets the eye.
Story: A young woman is out for a walk in the forest when she comes across a small bottle filled with a pale pine resin. She takes a moment to admire the shimmering substance before deciding to apply it to her main-hand weapon. As she does so, she notices that the blood red substance within the bottle seems to be growing in quantity. Suddenly, the woman feels a surge of energy flow through her body and her weapon begins to glow with a new power. She knows that she has

Item Description: Attire worn by those who kill in the name of the Sable Church of Londor. The Pale Shades of the Sable Church are all undying Hollows, giving rise to much fear and contempt. Their fight is one of neither honor nor exaltation, yielding nothing but withered moans. Gold mask worn by those who kill in the name of the Sable Church of Londor. A faint, kindly smile is bound to its surface, giving them the moniker Harlots of Death.
Story: The Sable Church of Londor is a religious order that worships the dark god, Sable. They are infamous for their dark clothing and masks, which are said to give them the power to kill with ease. Their fight is not one of honor or exaltation, but of withered moans.

Item Description: An altered state of titanite. Use on a weapon or shield to undo all imbued powers. This does not revert reinforcement, but undoes imbued powers such as magic, fire, poison, etc.
Story: The titanite used to be a precious and powerful resource, used to enhance weapons and shields with powerful imbued abilities. However, with the advent of the Great War, the titanite has become a scarce and valuable commodity. Rumors abound of those who can use titanite to undo all imbued powers, restoring them to their original state. If true, this would be a powerful tool, allowing those who wield it to overcome even the most powerful enemies.

Item Description: This dagger is useful after parrying and is normally equipped in the left hand. A favorite of the knights of Carim, who are famous for fighting without a shield.
Story: The Carim knights are known for their skill in hand-to-hand combat, and this dagger is a testament to that. It is normally equipped in the left hand, as that is where the knight's shield is situated. However, in a pinch, this dagger can be used to parry an opponent's attack.

Item Description: Unlike standard weapons, this dagger is intended for parrying. Accomplishments are forever out of reach to those who constantly fear failure. A true warrior hones his body and mind, and peers far beyond immediate hardship.
Story: The dagger was crafted for a warrior who was determined to overcome any obstacle. The weapon was designed to help the user deflect attacks, and the warrior was determined to use it to its fullest potential. The warrior was always ready for a challenge, and was never afraid to face any obstacle.

Item Description: A knife with curved handguards. Designed to parry, turning foes' attacks against them. For master of combat who anticipate every enemy strike and counter accordingly, this weapon is all they need.
Story: The knife was designed for a master of combat. They were always one step ahead of their enemies, anticipating their every move. This knife was their weapon of choice, and it proved to be the perfect tool for them.

Item Description: Spear with a wide tip. In addition to its thrusting attacks, this highly versatile weapon can be swung to sweep through foes.
Story: The spear was once wielded by a mighty warrior who fought with unmatched skill and ferocity. His weapon was feared by all who faced him, and his enemies were slain by the wide tip of his spear.

Item Description: Spear with blade attached to a broad point. Boasts long reach can slice. The wide range of this spear makes it adaptable to many situations. Its strength lies in its length but in cramped quarters this backfires and slices ricochet off walls.
Story: The spear is a powerful weapon that can be used to attack enemies from a distance. The wide range of the spear makes it versatile, and its length allows it to reach targets easily. However, the spear's length can also be a disadvantage in tight spaces, as the weapon can ricochet off walls.

Item Description: A spear with a broad blade. The blade is widened and given extra weight to allow for slashing. The broader attacks of the partizan, however, make it less effective in narrow spaces.
Story: The broad blade on the spear is perfect for slashing through enemies. The extra weight makes it more effective in close quarters, but it can't handle tight spaces as well.

Item Description: Although it appears to be common helmet/armor/gloves/trousers, it has in fact been meticulously customized. Belonged to mild-mannered Pate. This has been considerably altered. Perhaps it was pillaged.
Story: Pate's armor had always been plain, but it had been carefully customized. It had belonged to a mild-mannered man, and now it had been considerably altered. Perhaps it had been pillaged. Pate had always been a bit of a loner, and now he felt even more alone.

Item Description: A long spear wielded by Pate. This appears to be a very ordinary spear, but seems to have accumulated power of the course of countless battles. It is not always advisable to stand out. Especially if you have something to hide.
Story: Pate had been using the same spear for as long as he could remember. It had seen countless battles, and it seemed to have gained power along the way. It was not always advisable to stand out, but Pate had something to hide.

Item Description: Material used in a Holy Chalice rite. Of the all the strange lifeforms that reside in the nooks and crannies of the old labyrinth, the slugs are clear signs of the left-behind Great Ones
Story: The slugs were strange creatures, their slimy skin a deep green, their eyes a bright yellow. They were always moving, their long, wriggling bodies always seeking new places to explore. The priests of the old labyrinth used to use the slugs as part of their Holy Chalice rite. They would take a slug from the labyrinth and place it into the chalice. Then they would pour wine over it and offer prayers to the Great Ones. The

Item Description: commonly worn by peasants. Designed to block sunlight, more fit for farming than fightin
Story: A peasant's hat is designed to block sunlight and protect them from the elements. It is more fit for farming than fighting, and is often worn by peasants.

Item Description: Mask of the Lost Sinner. The spikes pointing inward suggest that this was not only used to blind prisoners, but to torture them as well. Effect: Raises equipment load
Story: The Mask of the Lost Sinner is a terrifying artifact that was used to torture and blind prisoners. The spikes pointing inward suggest that this was not only used to blind prisoners, but to torture them as well. Whoever wears this mask will find it difficult to carry equipment, as the weight of the items will be too much for them to handle.

Item Description: Straightjacket of the Lost Sinner. A tightly cinched belt presses against the waist. no one knows who this was used to punish, or for what reason
Story: The Straightjacket of the Lost Sinner is a mysterious and terrifying artifact. It is unknown who used it or for what purpose, but it is said that the belt is so tight it can crush the victim's ribs. Anyone who comes into contact with the Straightjacket risks becoming trapped and tortured forever.

Item Description: A simple pendant with no effect. Even so, pleasant memories are crucial to survival on arduous journeys.
Story: The pendant was unremarkable, a simple gold chain with a small, unremarkable pendant. Yet, to the weary traveler, it was a lifeline. The pendant was a reminder of happier times, of loved ones who had passed away. It was a reminder of the promise of a better future. Without those memories, the traveler would be lost in the darkness of the world.

Item Description: A simple pendant with no effect. Even so, pleasant memories are crucial to survival on arduous journeys.
Story: The pendant was unremarkable, a simple gold chain with a small, unremarkable pendant. Yet, to the weary traveler, it was a lifeline. The pendant was a reminder of happier times, of loved ones who had passed away. It was a reminder of the promise of a better future. Without those memories, the traveler would be lost in the darkness of the world.

Item Description: Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer. The thick front apron embroidered with a depiction of the Erdtree is proof of mastery of the apothecarial arts, and its weight symbolizes the onus of both pride and responsibility.
Story: The robe is worn by a perfumer who specializes in Erdtree scents. The heavy fabric is a sign of their skill in the apothecary trade, and the weight of the garment represents the burden of both responsibility and pride.

Item Description: Glaive made from a hard, sharpened shell. Wielded by the pests who emerged from the Swamp of Aeonia. Slightly increases non-physical damage negation. Though men might recognize the keen intellect of the pests evidenced by this spear's uncanny design, it will never be understood by them.
Story: The Glaive was created by the pests that emerged from the Swamp of Aeonia. It is a sharpened shell that increases non-physical damage negation. Though men might recognize the keen intellect of the pests, it will never be understood by them.

Item Description: A large petrified bone. Reinforces equipment made from special souls. Commonly called dragon bone, but the veracity of the name is questionable. In any case, this petrified bone houses great power.
Story: The large petrified bone was once a dragon's bone. It is said that whoever possesses this bone will be able to strengthen their equipment with the power of the dragon. However, the veracity of this story is questionable. Regardless, this bone is said to be filled with great power.

Item Description: A large petrified egg. Surely bears no life. Eggs are vessels that harbor life itself, and symbolize the deepest secrets of existence. But what does a petrified egg harbor?
Story: Legend has it that a petrified egg is the resting place of a dragon. Some say that the dragon is the guardian of the egg, and that it will hatch and protect the egg until it is ready to be born again.

Item Description: An unidentified petrified object. Pleasant to the touch, despite its looks. A rare and peculiar thing, to be certain, but one without a known purpose.
Story: The object was found by a farmer in the middle of a field. At first, he thought it was a rock, but when he touched it, he found it to be smooth and cool to the touch. He brought it home and put it on his mantle, where it sat for years. One day, his daughter came home and saw it. She was curious, so she took it off the mantle and touched it. Suddenly, the object began to glow and she found herself inside it

Item Description: Broad-brimmed hat favored by the archer hero Pharis. Pharis was an accomplished archer, and though he was human, he ranked alongside Hawkeye Gough, one of the Four Knights of Lord Gwyn. His hat is universally popular among children.
Story: Pharis was an accomplished archer, and though he was human, he ranked alongside Hawkeye Gough, one of the Four Knights of Lord Gwyn. One day, Pharis's hat was stolen by a band of brigands. Pharis set out to find his hat, and along the way, he met a group of elves who taught him how to use his bow even better. When he finally found his hat, he was so excited that he wore it everywhere. His hat

Item Description: Broad-brimmed leather hat. Traditionally used by master archers, and especially favored by forest-dwelling hunters
Story: The broad-brimmed leather hat was once used by master archers, and especially favored by forest-dwelling hunters. The hat was designed to protect the wearer's head from the sun and rain, and to keep their hair out of their eyes.

Item Description: Stone activating a creation of Pharros the Vagabond. Pharros the Vagabond was a legend who wandered the lands, creating contraptions to help those in sincere and dire need. The scope of his travels was so wide that the Pharros has been mistakenly credited with many inventions that were crafted by others
Story: One day, a stone was found by a wandering Pharros. When he activated it, he created a machine that could help people in need. The machine worked so well that people started to rely on it, even going so far as to call Pharros the Vagabond.

Item Description: Traditionally a mining tool but the hard cone on the pommel is effective in battle. A downward swing of the Pickaxe can crush stone; a human head would be an afterthought
Story: The Pickaxe is a common mining tool, but its hard cone on the pommel is effective in battle. A downward swing of the Pickaxe can crush stone; a human head would be an afterthought.

Item Description: Shield of certain knights of Catarina used in attacks with a large protrusion in the center. Can be used as a thrust weapon
Story: The Shield of Certain Knights of Catarina was used in attacks with a large protrusion in the center. The knights would use the protrusion to thrust the shield into their enemies, causing massive damage.

Item Description: Long spear with a very long red hilt. Traditionally used by groups of soldiers. Specially designed for distance thrusting. Has the longest range of the non-projectile weapons but its very length makes it somewhat difficult to handle
Story: The long spear was a traditional weapon used by groups of soldiers. It had the longest range of any non-projectile weapon, but its length made it difficult to handle.

Item Description: A longspear featuring an especially length handle. Specialized for use from long distances, it boasts the longest reach of any melee weapon. Incredibly useful even against foes on horseback, but hard to wield in cramped spaces.
Story: The longspear was a weapon that boasted a particularly long handle. It was specialized for use from long distances, and boasted the longest reach of any melee weapon. It was incredibly useful even against foes on horseback, but hard to wield in cramped spaces.

Item Description: Spontoon used by warriors on pilgrimage. Rather worn from the long journey it has doubtless seen. A spear which also doubles as a catalyst for sorceries, making it an ideal choice for light-footed pilgrims.
Story: The Spontoon is a relic from a bygone era, used by warriors on pilgrimage. It is worn and battered from the long journey it has doubtless seen. However, its unique properties make it an ideal choice for light-footed pilgrims. When used as a catalyst for sorceries, the Spontoon allows them to cast spells with ease and without the need for any other materials.

Item Description: Makeshift shield built from wood planks. Provides minimal protection but at a cost of moderate humiliation.
Story: The protagonist is out for a walk one day when they come across a group of people fighting. One of the combatants is using a makeshift shield made from wood planks. The shield is ineffective and provides minimal protection, but it's worth it because it provides a moderate amount of humiliation. The protagonist can't help but feel inspired by the fighter's bravery and decides to build their own makeshift shield.

Item Description: Arrow with point dipped in poison. Ensures the demise of prey in a hunt, or the target in an assassination. Once an enemy is poisoned, one need only wait.
Story: The arrow is tipped with a deadly poison that ensures the demise of its prey in a hunt or the target in an assassination. Once an enemy is poisoned, there is no escape.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Discovered in the rotted forest of Farron. Used in infusion to create poison weapons. Such weapons inflict poison-laced damage that gradually eats away at foes.
Story: The gem was discovered in the rotted forest of Farron. It was used in infusion to create poison weapons. Such weapons inflict poison-laced damage that gradually eats away at foes.

Item Description: A faintly poisonous clump of moss.When ingested, it counteracts poison and cleanses one's insides. If enough poison builds up in the body to break out and cause poisoning, your HP will start to decrease. If you wish to stay alive, you would do well to keep a supply close to hand.
Story: The moss was a strange looking thing, its green surface covered in a thin layer of moss. When ingested, it counteracted poison and cleanedse one's insides. If enough poison built up in the body to break out and cause poisoning, your HP would start to decrease. If you wished to stay alive, you would do well to keep a supply close to hand.

Item Description: An altered state of titanite. Use to imbue weapons with poison, or to provide poison resistance to shields. Sorcerers at the Melfian Magic Academy once attempted to imbue titanite with various elements, but are said to have failed. Someone must have succeeded though; what else would explain this stone?
Story: The stone is said to have been used by sorcerers at the Melfian Magic Academy to imbue weapons with poison, or to provide poison resistance to shields. However, it is unknown what happened to the stone after the attempt. Someone must have succeeded, as the stone is now commonly found in the wild.

Item Description: A throwing knife. Intended to poison the target more than inflict direct damage. This simple weapon is easily utilized, but has limited range and deals little damage. However, if the knife can cause poison, the target will take damage for some time.
Story: The throwing knife is a simple weapon, but it has a hidden ability. If it can poison the target, the target will take damage for some time. This weapon is easy to use, but its limited range and damage means that it is not always the most effective choice. However, if used correctly, the throwing knife can be a deadly weapon.

Item Description: One of the infamous bite rings commissioned by Sir Arstor of Carim. Despite the dreadful rumors surrounding its creation, this ring is an unmistakable asset, in its ability to help prevent poison.
Story: The bite ring was created by Sir Arstor of Carim as a way to prevent poison. The ring is made of metal and has a sharp point on one side. When it is put on a person's finger, it will bite into the skin, preventing any poison from getting into the body.

Item Description: One of the several bite rings, known for their peculiar design. Increases poison resistance. The similar, oddly disturbing design of these rings suggests a common source. Whoever the master craftsman was, he clearly knew his trade.
Story: The bite rings were strange, but the design was familiar. I had seen it before, but I couldn't place where. I was about to ask my friend when I realized that the design was on the rings that the monsters were biting us with. I gasped and looked at my friend, who was also staring at the rings. We both knew what the rings meant.

Item Description: Crown of the Pontiff's Knights, now harrowed spirits of Irithyll. The golden crown signifies those who report directly to Sulyvahn. The knights were his watchful eyes, and when needed, his punitive blades.
Story: The Crown of the Pontiff's Knights is a golden crown that signifies those who report directly to Sulyvahn. The knights were his watchful eyes, and when needed, his punitive blades. When Sulyvahn was executed, the crown fell into the hands of the demons that now haunt Irithyll. The demons harrow the crown, turning the once proud knights into spirits that seek to bring death and destruction to all who cross their path.

Item Description: Curved sword wielded by the Pontiff’s knights, frigid spirits that linger in Irithyll. The large blade appears to be eaten away by insects, making it lightweight but also brittle. Skill: Frost Blade Execute large spinning motion to embue blade with frost, and follow through with a strong attack that slashes with a giant blade made of frost.
Story: The Curved Sword is a legendary weapon that is said to have been wielded by the Pontiff's knights. These frigid spirits linger in Irithyll, and the large blade appears to be eaten away by insects. However, with skill and a powerful frost attack, the sword can be imbued with frost and used to slash with a giant blade made of frost.

Item Description: Great scythe wielded by the Pontiff's knights, frigid spirits that linger in Irithyll. The large blade appears to be eaten away by insects, making it lightweight but also brittle. Skill: Frost Create a bone-chilling frost with each swing of the great scythe that causes a temporary frost effect.
Story: The great scythe was once wielded by the Pontiff's knights. The blade is now eaten away by insects, but it still retains its skill. With each swing, the scythe causes a temporary frost effect that can freeze enemies in their tracks.

Item Description: Mask of the Lord's Blade Ciaran, one of Gwyn's Four Knights. The cyclops headpiece is common to all of the Lord's Blades, but Ciaran was determined to earn this soft porcelain mask as a unique decoration of honor. The mask is lined with ivory locks of hair.
Story: Ciaran had always wanted to be a part of the Lord's Blade order. He admired their bravery and skill in battle. When he was chosen to be one of Gwyn's Four Knights, he was overjoyed. The cyclops headpiece was common to all of the Lord's Blades, but Ciaran was determined to earn this soft porcelain mask as a unique decoration of honor. The mask is lined with ivory locks of hair. One day, C

Item Description: Greatbow wielded by possessed armor. Crafted with multiple layers of iron, resulting in almost excessive sturdiness. These suits of armor were once decorations, until the black fog ruling the tower seized control of them.
Story: The greatbow was once a beautiful weapon. It was crafted with multiple layers of iron, resulting in almost excessive sturdiness. However, the black fog ruling the tower seized control of it, and now it is a deadly weapon.

Item Description: Straight sword wielded by possessed armor. Has a heated blade imbued with fire. These suits of armor were once decorations, until the black fog ruling the tower seized control of them.
Story: The straight sword wielded by the armor is a beautiful piece of craftsmanship. The blade is heated with fire, giving it an intense edge. The armor once adorned a noble's hall, but now it is possessed by the black fog that rules the tower. The sword is the only thing that can free the armor from the fog's control, and with it, the armor may finally be able to find peace.

Item Description: Badge crafted by the Powder Kegs, the heretics of the Workshop. The Powder Kegs adoration of complex design and big booms culminated in weapon designs that contrast with those traditionally of the Workshop. The late Powder Kegs, bless their souls, had a motto: If a weapon ain't got kick, it just ain't worth it.'
