Story: The Powder Kegs were a heretical sect of the Workshop who prized complex design and big booms in their weapons. Their motto was "if a weapon ain't got kick, it just ain't worth it." This motto led to some of the most unique and visually stunning weapons in the Workshop's history. Sadly, the Powder Kegs were exterminated by the Workshop's orthodox members in a bloody purge.

Item Description: The dessicated right hand of a white-faced locust that rose from the abyssal swamp, that happens to perform as a catalyst for sorcery. The white-faced locusts were meant to beckon men to the dark with sermons, but most of them are unable to think past their own stomachs, the unruly mob! Skill: Feasting Branch Use souls to weave a sharp branch to fillet prey. Can be used repeatedly.
Story: The Skill 'Feasting Branch' is a tool used by the Lore to feast on the souls of their prey. The Lore use this tool to slice through the souls of their enemies, and to feast on their own power.

Item Description: Large hat with the movements of the stars drawn on the inside of the brim. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals. Increases mind to the detriment of stamina. Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain of aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.
Story: The large hat was worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals. The stars were drawn on the inside of the brim, and it increased the mind's ability to think abstractly, but at the expense of the user's stamina. The descendants of astrologers, the glintstone sorcerers, were aware of this fact and used it to their advantage.

Item Description: A long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals. Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.
Story: The gown was made of a light, airy fabric that shimmered in the light of the stars. It was decorated with intricate, swirling designs that looked like the movements of the stars themselves. The sorcerers who wore it were the descendants of the astrologers who served the Carian royals. For centuries, their fate had been intertwined with the stars, but now their connection to the heavens had been severed. Nevertheless, the sorcerers still felt the power of the

Item Description: Colossal hammer with the appearance of roiling flames. Weapon of the Prelates who lead the Fire Monks. Its heft represents the weight of their guardianship. The hammer's head is unusually substantial, and strong attacks' will fling foes into the air.
Story: The Colossal Hammer is a powerful weapon that is used by the Prelates who lead the Fire Monks. The head of the hammer is unusually substantial, and strong attacks can fling foes into the air.

Item Description: Sacred chime granted to high-ranking clerics. A catalyst for miracles and hexes. Drangleic was the home of many clerics, but King Vendrick held a lukewarm opinion of their powers, and kept them only as attendants to ceremony. In this sense, Drangleic was not the place for a cleric with any ambition.
Story: One day, a sacred chime was given to a high-ranking cleric in Drangleic. This chime was said to be a catalyst for miracles and hexes. The cleric, feeling restless and unsatisfied in Drangleic, decided to take the chime with him when he left. On his way out, he cast a hex on the king, hoping to bring him misfortune.

Item Description: Sacred chime for casting miracles of the Gods, of the type given to Lothric priests. To cast a miracle, the caster learns a tale of the Gods, and says a prayer to be blessed by its revelations. The faith of the supplicant affects the strength of the miracle. Skill: Gentle Prayer Recovers HP for a period of time, albeit extremely slowly. Works while equipped in either hand.
Story: The sacred chime was a relic of the Lothric priests. It was said that the chime could be used to cast miracles of the Gods, of the type given to Lothric priests. To cast a miracle, the caster learned a tale of the Gods, and said a prayer to be blessed by its revelations. The faith of the supplicant affected the strength of the miracle.

Item Description: Robe worn by Drangleic clerics. The clerics of Drangleic have retained their status throughout the ages, but were always at arms length from the royal family, as if their existence was little more than a formality. It is customary for clerics to wear different garb depending on their area, but the reason for this practice is unknown...This is a woman's robe
Story: The robe worn by Drangleic clerics is a mystery to many. It is customary for clerics to wear different garb depending on their area, but the reason for this practice is unknown. Some say that the robes are a sign of the clerics' status, while others say that the robes are a formality, as the clerics are at arms length from the royal family. Whatever the case may be, the robe is a beautiful sight to behold.

Item Description: Staff embedded with sullied amber, said to be a very part of the Prince of Death. Enhances death sorceries. One of the staves deemed heretical by the academy for its ability to allow sorceries to be augmented through faith in addition to intelligence.
Story: The staff was said to be a very important part of the Prince of Death. It was embedded with sullied amber, which was said to be a very powerful part of the Prince of Death. The staff was also said to enhance death sorceries.

Item Description: This sword, one of the rare dragon weapons, came from the tail of Priscilla, the Dragon Crossbreed in the painted world of Ariamis. Possessing the power of lifehunt, it dances about when wielded, in a fashion reminiscent of the white-robed painting guardians.
Story: The sword, Priscilla, was said to have come from the tail of the dragon crossbreed, Priscilla. The sword had the power of lifehunt, and it danced about when wielded. It was similar to the white-robed painting guardians, and it was said that the sword had the ability to cut through anything.

Item Description: Warm pebble emitting a beautiful phasing aura of seven colors with a very rare eight. The rainbow stone does nothing special but can serve as a path marker and can be dropped off a cliff to judge height by the sound of descent. If a loud noise is heard upon its landing then a fall off the ledge is surely lethal
Story: The Rainbow Stone is a powerful artifact that can be used to determine a person's height. However, if it is dropped off a cliff, it will create a loud noise that will indicate a fatal fall.

Item Description: Tattered clothing. Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.
Story: The clothes belonged to a prisoner convicted of a heinous crime. The prisoner was never given the opportunity to wash the clothes, as they were always kept dirty and stained. Now, years after their conviction, the clothes are still stained and dirty, but they have become a symbol of shame to the prisoner.

Item Description: Iron mask forced on a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Thick, heavy, and utterly stifling. A foul creation designed to torment the wearer, either slowly fermenting hatred within their heart, or a spiritual fervor that is near indistinguishable from it.
Story: The iron mask was a hideous creation, designed to torment the wearer. It was thick, heavy, and utterly stifling. The foul creation was designed to slowly ferment hatred within the wearer's heart, or a spiritual fervor that was near indistinguishable from it.

Item Description: Portion of a steel chain used to restrain Gundyr. Gain vigor, endurance, and vitality, but take extra damage. A prisoner is one who has staked everything on a belief, a proclivity most apparent in the greatest of champions.
Story: Gundyr, the Bringer of Death, is a fearsome and terrible foe. He is also a champion, one who has risked everything for the sake of victory. In order to defeat Gundyr, the player must use all of their strength and cunning. However, Gundyr is not one to be taken lightly. He is a fearsome opponent, and his chain is a deadly weapon.

Item Description: Rags worn by imprisoned Hollows. This appears to have been worn on the head. Judging by its looks and apparent virtues, this really is no more than a tattered scrap of cloth. It still carries the stench of a Hollow.
Story: The cloth is from a Hollow that was recently imprisoned. It is stained with the Hollow's blood and smells strongly of death. The cloth is said to have powerful magical properties that can help protect the wearer from Hollows.

Item Description: A ceremonial sword, held in Pontiff Sulyvahn's right hand, representing the Profaned Flame. Long ago, when Sulyvahn was yet a young sorcerer, he discovered the Profaned Capital and an unfading flame below a distant tundra of Irithyll, and a burning ambition took root within him. Skill: Profaned Flame Temporarily summon the Profaned Flame. Lunge forward and use strong attack to enshroud blade in flame.
Story: Sulyvahn, Pontiff of the Profaned Flame, holds a ceremonial sword that represents the Profaned Flame. He discovered the flame and ambition within himself while exploring the Profaned Capital, and used the sword to temporarily summon the flame. He then used the flame to lunge forward and enshroud his blade in fire, creating a powerful attack.

Item Description: Blindfold of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune — and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. Why hesitate, if the path leading to the future is clear? Just close your eyes, and walk.
Story: The blindfolded prophets were a group of people who foretold misfortune. Because of this, they were persecuted and driven from their homes. However, because their path was clear, they walked anyway.

Item Description: Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune — and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. The shackles around the neck warn passersby not to lend an ear to their sermons. Altered: Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the slin like a sharpening file.
Story: The robe of exiled prophets is a warning to anyone who dares to listen to their sermons. The shackles around their neck warn anyone who passes by not to lend them an ear, as they have been persecuted and driven from their homes for speaking out against misfortune.

Item Description: Sacred chime commonly used by clerics of Lindelt. A catalyst for miracles and hexes. A sacred chime serves to conduct the power of miracles, but in the past, some entirely different served the same purpose.
Story: The sacred chime was once used by clerics of Lindelt to conduct the power of miracles and hexes. However, in the past, it was used to summon demons and other dark forces. Now, only the most powerful clerics can use it to perform powerful magic.

Item Description: Longbow which utilizes a series of pulleys and strings. The complex mechanism, which required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to craft, was likely made by a certain genius who learned Golden Order Fundamentalism. Enhances precision while shooting, enabling arrows to fly much further distances.
Story: The longbow was a finely crafted weapon that utilized a series of pulleys and strings to shoot arrows with greater precision. The weapon required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to create, and was likely made by a certain genius who learned the Golden Order Fundamentalism. The longbow's enhanced precision made arrows fly much further distances, allowing skilled archers to take down their enemies with ease.

Item Description: Ash-colored stone encasing a skull. Secret treasure of Arstor the Earl of Carim. Reduces curse build-up and breaks curse. Humans are helpless against curses and can only redirect their influence. The Purging Stone does not dispel curses but receives them as a surrogate. The stone itself was once a person or some other being
Story: The Purging Stone is a powerful artifact that was once used to break curses. It is now a valuable treasure that can reduce the build-up of curses on humans. However, the stone is also capable of receiving curses as a surrogate, meaning that it is not truly capable of breaking curses.

Item Description: Victory in the battle once led to ancient Anor Londo, but even in the absence of its overseer, capitulation is a disgrace. In the name of a warrior's honor, do not quickly resort to use of this crystal.
Story: The crystal is a powerful artifact that once belonged to the warrior-god Anor Londo. It is said that whoever holds the crystal can control the undead. However, if the crystal is used too quickly, it will bring dishonor to the owner. A group of adventurers must find and retrieve the crystal in order to restore Anor Londo's honor.

Item Description: Victory in the battle once led to ancient Anor Londo, but even in the absence of its overseer, capitulation is a disgrace. In the name of a warrior's honor, do not quickly resort to use of this crystal.
Story: The crystal is a powerful artifact that once belonged to the warrior-god Anor Londo. It is said that whoever holds the crystal can control the undead. However, if the crystal is used too quickly, it will bring dishonor to the owner. A group of adventurers must find and retrieve the crystal in order to restore Anor Londo's honor.

Item Description: Medicinal purple moss clump. Reduces poison build-up. Cures poison. Poison builds up in the body and when it breaks out it causes gradual damage over a period of time. Poison can be exasperating so be certain to carry the needed quantity of these moss clumps when destined for an afflicted area
Story: The purple moss clump was a miraculous cure for poison. It helped to reduce the build-up of poison in the body, and when it broke out it cured the poison. The moss clump was a valuable commodity, and many people were eager to find it.

Item Description: Ultra Greatsword of the Pursuer. Known as the mightiest of the straight swords, it demands great strength and dexterity of its wielder. The pursuer hunts down those branded by the curse, as if each Undead soul that he claims will atone one of his sins.
Story: The Ultra Greatsword of the Pursuer is a legendary sword that is said to be the mightiest of the straight swords. It is said that the sword demands great strength and dexterity of its wielder, as it is used to hunt down Undead souls that have been branded by the curse. By claiming each Undead soul that he finds, the pursuer hopes to atone for one of his sins.

Item Description: A sword with a segmented blade.When swung its segments separate and the sword strike in a whipping slash. Crafted with rare magnetic stone of remarkable strength only found within caves of the gutter.
Story: The sword is a powerful weapon that has a segmented blade. When swung, the segments separate and the sword strike in a whipping slash. The sword is crafted with rare magnetic stone of remarkable strength only found within caves of the gutter. The sword is said to be able to cut through anything.

Item Description: Attire of pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Comprised of bronze ornamentation and animal pelt. In the Great Swamp, bronze was used ritualistically to ward off evil spirits and keep darkness at bay.
Story: The attire of the pyromancers of the Great Swamp is a striking combination of bronze ornamentation and animal pelt. This attire is used to ward off evil spirits and keep darkness at bay in the Great Swamp, where bronze was used ritualistically to achieve these goals. The pyromancers of the Great Swamp are a secretive and powerful group, and their attire is a sign of their status and authority.

Item Description: Flame medium used by Great Swamp pyromancers. Pyromancers arouse this flame to produce various fire arts. Equip pyromancer flame to produce pyromancy. Attune pyromancies from a scroll at bonfire. Most pyromancies have limited number of uses.
Story: The Great Swamp is a dark and dangerous place, home to all sorts of dangerous creatures. But among the swamp's many dangers, one of the most feared are the pyromancers. These powerful mages use the power of fire to create powerful spells and abilities. One of the pyromancers' most powerful spells is the flame medium. This powerful artifact allows the pyromancer to create a powerful fire that can be used in various ways. By equipping the flame medium and attuning

Item Description: A Stonehammer wielded by the Millwood Knights, with a head of naturally-formed stone. The Knights of Millwood would fight hand-in-hand with the earth itself, and this weapon, among the oldest in Millwood, is symbolic of that relationship. Skill: Quake Burrow hammer head into the ground with a great slam, and use strong attack to upheave earth, creating a shockwave that rumbles like a mighty warcry.
Story: The Millwood Knights were a proud and noble order of knights who fought hand-in-hand with the earth itself. This weapon, among the oldest in Millwood, was symbolic of that relationship. When the knights needed to burrow deep into the earth to fight the enemies of Millwood, they would use this powerful hammer to create a shockwave that would rattle the ground like a mighty warcry.

Item Description: A tall crown depicting the moon. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. Increases intelligence. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.
Story: Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, wears a crown depicting the moon. This crown increases her intelligence, making her a formidable opponent in any debate or discussion.

Item Description: Robe indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.
Story: Rennala had always been a powerful sorceress, but when her husband, the King of Caria, died, she lost her heart. She stopped practicing her magic and became a teacher at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. But when the students realized that Rennala was no champion, they started calling her Queen Rennala. Now she spends her time teaching the students and trying to keep the academy running.

Item Description: What remains of Annalise, blood queen of Cainhurst. This pinkish lump of flesh remains warm, as if cursed. All hail the undying queen of blood!
Story: Annalise, the blood queen of Cainhurst, was slain by the player character in the game's final battle. Her body was left to rot in the castle's courtyard, until a group of necromancers raised her from the dead as an undead servant. Now, Annalise seeks to avenge herself on the player character and all those who destroyed her kingdom.

Item Description: What remains of Annalise, blood queen of Cainhurst. This pinkish lump of flesh remains warm, as if cursed. All hail the undying queen of blood!
Story: Annalise, the blood queen of Cainhurst, was a powerful and feared figure in the kingdom. After being slain by the player character, her body remains warm and cursed, as if she is still alive. All hail the undying queen of blood! This gruesome tale serves as a warning to any would-be usurpers, and a reminder of the power of the true blood queen.

Item Description: A curved sword born from the soul of Quelaag, daughter of the Witch of Izalith, who was transformed into a chaos demon. Like Quelaag's body, the sword features shells, spikes, humanity and a coating of chaos fire. Power affected by wielder's humanity.
Story: The sword is Quelaag's soul, and it is born from her body after she is transformed into a chaos demon. The sword is covered in shells, spikes, and a coating of chaos fire, all of which are affected by the wielder's humanity. The sword is powerful, but it is also affected by the emotions of the person who wields it.

Item Description: A pyromancy tome of Quelaana containing her unique spells. These pyromancies can only be taught by a female master. Give to a female pyromancy master to learn Quelana's pyromancies. Quelana, the sole surviving witch of Izalith, once accepted a human pupil, but after the pupil moved on, she never took another.
Story: The tome contains spells that only a female pyromancy master can learn. When given to the right person, they will be able to learn Quelana's pyromancies.

Item Description: Special bullets used with hunter firearms. Ordinary bullets have no effect on beasts, and so Quicksilver Bullets, fused with the wielder's own blood, must be employed. The strength of Quicksilver Bullets depends greatly upon the wielder's bloodtinge.
Story: Quicksilver Bullets are special bullets used with hunter firearms. They are made of quicksilver, which is fused with the wielder's own blood, and so they have a much greater effect on beasts than ordinary bullets. The strength of Quicksilver Bullets depends greatly on the wielder's bloodtinge.

Item Description: Armor depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn. The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.
Story: Radahn was born into a family of warriors, and from an early age he was determined to follow in his father's footsteps. When he was sixteen, his father was killed in battle against the Serishan. Radahn was devastated, but he knew that he had to continue his training. He joined the army and quickly rose through the ranks. One day, while he was on campaign in the east, he met General Radahn. The general was a legendary figure, known for his

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. The rune for Radiance, adopted by the sworn Executioners under Logarius' command. The executioners despise the impure Vilebloods, and no matter what the circumstances, would never cooperate with the bloodthirsty hunters who serve the undead queen, Annalise.
Story: Caryll's rune for Radiance is a sign of hope to the Executioners. It represents their desire to bring light to dark places, and their commitment to serving the greater good. When the Executioners see the rune, they know that the Vilebloods are in trouble.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. Blood gems are especially rare blood stones that grow on coldblood. Blood gems are kneaded into weapons using workshop tools, but only when of matching shape. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks.
Story: The blood gem was a rare and powerful blood stone that grew on coldblood. It was said that only when of matching shape could a blood gem be kneaded into a weapon, and that most radial blood gems had effects that related to physical attacks.

Item Description: A mask designed to resemble a blazing golden halo. Created and left behind by Lord Goldmask, a staunch pursuer of Golden Order fundamentalism. Strenthens Golden Order incantations. Its striking design represents both the brilliant inspiration that once shone upon him, and the vision of a ring that he will surely find at the end of his pursuit. To you who seek to shine as I do, wear it well!
Story: The mask was left behind by Lord Goldmask, a staunch pursuer of the Golden Order. The mask is designed to resemble a blazing golden halo and its striking design represents both the brilliant inspiration that once shone upon him and the vision of a ring that he will surely find at the end of his pursuit. To those who seek to shine as he does, wear the mask well!

Item Description: Stone made up of crystallized souls. Gradually restores HP. The dull glimmer of these mysterious stones brightens with the passage of time.
Story: The stone was found in an old, forgotten tomb. It was filled with crystallized souls, and as time passed, it slowly restored the health of whoever held it.

Item Description: One of the badges crafted by the Healing Church. The radiant sword indicates the heirs to the will of Ludwig. These hunters, also known as Holy Blades, are what remains of an ancient line of heroes that date back to a very early age of honor and chivalry.
Story: The Healing Church had been crafting badges for many years, each one with a different meaning. One of the badges crafted was the radiant sword. The heirs to the will of Ludwig were indicated by the sword. These hunters, also known as Holy Blades, were what remained of an ancient line of heroes that date back to a very early age of honor and chivalry.

Item Description: Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean. Vargram aspired to such a state himself.
Story: The armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf was one of the first pieces of Tarnished armor to be brought to the Roundtable Hold. The legends say that wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and Vargram aspired to such a state himself. He was a fierce warrior, and his armor was said to make him even more fearsome.

Item Description: Hunter weapon wielded by Lady Maria of the Astral Clocktower. A trick sword originated in the same country as the Cainhurst Chikage, only this sword feeds not off blood, but instead demands great dexterity. Lady Maria was fond of this aspect of the Rakuyo, as she frowned upon blood blades, despite being a distant relative of the queen. One day, she abandoned her beloved Rakuyo, casting it into a dark well, when she could stomach it no longer.
Story: Lady Maria of the Astral Clocktower wielded a Hunter weapon, a trick sword that fed off of dexterity. One day, she abandoned the sword in a dark well, when she could no longer stomach it.

Item Description: .Lance wielded by the rampart golems, granted life by the Ivory King. The golems were charged with the containment of the creatures of chaos whithin the boundaries of the wall. When the doors of Eleum Loyce were flung open, the place turned frigid and lifeless, but the golems remained dutifully on guard.
Story: Lance was a weapon that was wielded by the rampart golems. It was granted life by the Ivory King, and it was charged with the containment of the creatures of chaos whithin the boundaries of the wall. When the doors of Eleum Loyce were flung open, the place turned frigid and lifeless, but the golems remained dutifully on guard.

Item Description: Standard thrusting sword. Regular one-handed attack can be delivered with shield held up. Can parry with use of left hand. Thrusting attacks pierce and are effective against foes with hard exteriors, but the wielder is left open to damage after a swing
Story: The sword is a regular, one-handed thrusting weapon. The user can hold their shield up to block incoming attacks, and can also use their left hand to parry incoming strikes. However, the sword is ineffective against foes with hard exteriors, and the wielder is left vulnerable after a swing.

Item Description: A standard thrusting sword. Thrusting Swords are light swords with fine tips that can be used while holding up a shield, and are effective for parrying. Use quick thrusts to damage hard-skinned foes. Also effective when fighting in narrow spaces
Story: The thrusting sword was a finely crafted weapon that was designed for use while holding up a shield. Its light weight and fine tip made it an effective weapon for parrying, and its quick thrusts were also effective when fighting against hard-skinned foes.

Item Description: A piercing sword with a sharp, slender blade. In addition to this weapon's thrusting attack prowess, it also boasts the ability to be used while guarding with a shield. As one of the smaller piercing swords, quick successive thrust area easy to perform, but without a cutting edge, it cannot be used for slashing attacks.
Story: The sword is called the Slender Blade. It is a finely crafted weapon with a sharp, slender blade. The sword is able to perform both a thrusting attack and a guard with a shield. The lack of a cutting edge means that the Slender Blade is not ideal for slashing attacks, but it is still a powerful weapon.

Item Description: Claw comprised of two sharp, thin blades, wielded by the assassins of Ravenmount, this weapon allows them to imitate the attacks of Deathbirds. Besides excelling at airborne attacks, its charge attack mimics the vicious swoop of a bird of prey.
Story: The Claw is a deadly weapon that is used by assassins in Ravenmount. It is made up of two thin blades that allow the user to imitate the attacks of Deathbirds. The Claw's charge attack mimics the vicious swoop of a bird of prey.

Item Description: Robe crafted with the black feathers of a bird of prey. Worn by the assassin Ravenmount. A ritual implement for transforming into a Deathbird, if only by imitation. Strengthens jump attacks. We are birds of prey, bringers of death.
Story: Ravenmount is an assassin's guild that specializes in killing high-profile targets. One of their most prized possessions is a ceremonial robe made from the black feathers of a bird of prey. The robe gives the wearer the ability to transform into a Deathbird, but it is only a temporary imitation. The robe also strengthens jump attacks.

Item Description: This mystical ring was created in a sacrificial rite of Velka, the Goddess of Sin. The magenta-shaded ring is especially rare. Its wearer will lose nothing upon death, and will be freed from any curse whatsoever, but the ring itself breaks
Story: The ring is a powerful artifact that grants its wearer many benefits, but it is also very dangerous. If the ring is ever removed from the wearer's finger, they will die.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Forged the weapons of Lothric foot soldiers. Used in infusion to create Raw weapons. Raw weapons are easily wielded and have higher attack, but lose scaling effects.
Story: The gem is a titanite chunk that has been infused with the power of the gods. It was used to create Lothric's foot soldiers' weapons, and can be used to infuse Raw weapons with the power of the gods. Raw weapons are easier to wield and have higher attack power, but they lose some of the scaling effects that regular weapons have.

Item Description: Round wooden shield crafted in Lordran featuring an impressive red and white design. The giant trees in Lordran are distant offspring of the great stone archtrees. This shield inherits their properties and the wood greatly reduces magic damage.
Story: The shield was crafted by a lord in Lordran. The giant trees that grow there are distant descendants of the great stone archtrees. The shield inherits their properties, reducing magic damage.

Item Description: Shortbow of polished red wood. Fashioned by a master craftsman and wielded by pages. A bow which requires dexterity rather than strength to master.
Story: The Shortbow of polished red wood was crafted by a master craftsman. It was meant for pages, as it required dexterity rather than strength to use. The bow was a beautiful piece of work, and its design was unique. It was a favorite of the pages who wielded it.

Item Description: A twinblade with heavy blades on each end. More suited to smashing foes than slashing them. Requires a great deal of muscle to wield artfully. The twinblade closely imitates the design of a foreign-made weapon that has the blades affixed to both ends of its hilt.
Story: The twinblade is a unique weapon that was created by a craftsman who was inspired by the design of a foreign-made weapon. The twinblade closely imitates the design of the weapon, which has the blades affixed to both ends of its hilt. The weapon is designed for use by those who require a great deal of muscle to wield it artfully.

Item Description: Material used in a Holy Chalice ritual. Stillborn infants born of a creature of unknown origin, of the type found in some corners of the old labyrinth.
Story: The chalice was made of a strange, dark material. It was smooth and shiny, but it felt cold to the touch. The ritualists placed it on the altar and began to chant. The air around them seemed to heat up, and a strange light began to fill the room. Suddenly, the baby's body began to stir. It was stillborn, but it was alive. The baby's eyes opened and it began to cry. The ritualists were terrified, but they

Item Description: A woman's bright-red brooch, engraved with the name Viola. Perhaps the jewel is a gift from a hunter. Use to change into a droplet blood gem that fortifies any weapon. With the proper workshop tool, various weapons can be fortified.
Story: The woman's bright-red brooch, engraved with the name Viola, is a gift from a hunter. The jewel is a powerful tool that can change into a droplet blood gem that fortifies any weapon. With the proper workshop tool, various weapons can be fortified.

Item Description: Curved sword of warrior Vengarl of Forossa. This sword is battle-worn and terribly rusted,but remains a deadly weapon owing to its incredible weight. Legend has it that it was built to test the limits of the strength of Forossa knights, until Vengarl swung it about like a wooden plaything, claiming ownership by demonstration.
Story: The curved sword of warrior Vengarl of Forossa is a fearsome weapon that has seen many battles. Legend has it that it was built to test the limits of the strength of Forossa knights, until Vengarl swung it about like a wooden plaything, claiming ownership by demonstration.

Item Description: Straight sword of warrior Vengarl of Forossa. This sword is battle-worn and terribly rusted, but remains a deadly weapon owing to its incredible weight. Legend has it that it was built to test the limits of the strength of Forossa knights, until Vengarl swung it about like a wooden plaything, claiming ownership by demonstration.
Story: The Straight Sword of Warrior Vengarl of Forossa is a legendary weapon that is said to have been built to test the strength of Forossa knights. Legend has it that Vengarl was able to wield it like a wooden plaything, demonstrating his own strength and claiming ownership of the sword by demonstration.

Item Description: The rare gem called tearstone has the uncanny ability to sense imminent death. This red tearstone from Carim boosts the attack of its wearer when in danger.
Story: The tearstone was a rare gem that had the uncanny ability to sense imminent death. It was found in Carim, and when worn by its wearer, it boosted their attack in dangerous situations.

Item Description: A cursed ring depicting a demon eye. Becomes easier to be detected by enemies. If it is tranquility that you seek, then you should never have left your home. If you seek strife, then fair enough, but no need to overdo it.
Story: The ring was always a bit of a curiosity to the other kids at school. It was always in the hands of the teacher, or someone else who could be trusted. But one day, a group of kids decided to take it and try it on. Almost immediately, they started getting picked on. The ring made them easy to spot, and the other kids were happy to torment them. Eventually, the ring was lost or destroyed, but the kids who had it never forgot the way it

Item Description: Greatsword featuring a flame-like undulation. Shreds enemy flesh, inducing blood loss. Scarlet rot is kept at bay with flame at Redmane Castle, and as such, this beloved sword of Jerren's eventually became the symbol of the castle itself.
Story: The Greatsword featured a flame-like undulation that caused shredded enemy flesh and induced blood loss. The Scarlet Rot was kept at bay with the flame at Redmane Castle, and as such, this beloved sword of Jerren's eventually became the symbol of the castle itself.

Item Description: Armor worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. When they were driven to defeat by Malenia's scarlet rot, the Redmane Knights burned the crest on the left breast of their armor to indicate their resolve. Alas, dear home, I shan't see you again! For our duty is to remain here, a bulwark against the blight.
Story: The armor worn by the Redmane Knights was a sign of their resolve. When they were driven to defeat by Malenia's scarlet rot, they burned the crest on the left breast of their armor to indicate their resolve. Sadly, they will never see their home again, as their duty is to remain here, a bulwark against the blight.

Item Description: Armor worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. The surcoat depicts a red-maned lion raising a sword in the image of Radahn. Thus, they were redmanes, and all proved they were worthy of the name.
Story: The surcoat worn by General Radahn's soldiers was a symbol of their bravery and loyalty. It depicted a red-maned lion raising a sword in the image of Radahn, signifying that they were all redmanes, and that they were worthy of the name.

Item Description: Jagged dagger with a distinctive curled blade. Carried by the noble servants of the Lord of Blood. This dagger rips the flesh as it enters, inflicting blood loss with sickening efficacy. A proud testament to the success of its vicious design, this weapon is perpetually coated in blood.
Story: The jagged dagger with a distinctive curled blade is a prized possession of the noble servants of the Lord of Blood. It is said that this dagger rips the flesh as it enters, inflicting blood loss with sickening efficacy. A proud testament to the success of its vicious design, this weapon is perpetually coated in blood.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Forged in the weapons of Lothric knights. Used in infusion to create refined weapons. Refined weapons are difficult to wield properly, and scale effectively with strength
Story: The gem is a titanite gem, forged from the weapons of Lothric knights. It is used in infusion to create refined weapons, which are difficult to wield properly and scale effectively with strength.

Item Description: Treasured sword of Eochaid, a lesser, long-vanished domain. The copper coloration is not to be confused for rust, but is a conduit for its wielder to move it by their will alone. Swords of Eochaid dance through the skies
Story: The sword of Eochaid was a lesser domain sword that was long-vanished. It was a copper coloration, and it was said that the sword could move by its wielder's will alone. The sword danced through the skies, and it was said that it could cut through anything.

Item Description: A club with leather nailed to the pommel. The burg Undead merchant proudly peddles this club but its reinforcement is shoddy. Indeed its attack is stronger but the club is no longer dependably sturdy.
Story: The club is a weapon that is made of leather and has nails sticking out of it. It is made to be stronger, but it is not dependable. The Undead merchant who sells it is proud of it, but people who buy it know that it is not the best weapon.

Item Description: A wooden club headed with nails. Designed as a deadlier club, and certainly offers a stronger attack, but this club also seems quick to fall apart, perhaps due to its shoddy craftsmanship
Story: The club was once a deadly weapon, but it seems to be falling apart quickly. The nails that make up the head seem to be coming loose, and the club seems to be very weak overall. Nevertheless, it is still a formidable weapon, and could be very useful in a fight.

Item Description: Weapon wielded by the Knights of Cainhurst. Combines an elegant knight's sword with the peculiar firearm wielded by the Cainhurst order. The old nobles, long-time imbibers of blood, are no strangers to the sanguine plague, and the disposal of beasts was a discrete task left to their servants, or knights, as they were called for the sake of appearances.
Story: The Cainhurst Sword and Pistol was forged with the finest materials and craftsmanship. It is a beautiful knight's sword with a pistol grip. The pistol is unique, as it is a firearm that uses blood as ammunition. The Cainhurst order was founded by nobles who were infected with the sanguine plague, and they needed a way to dispose of the beasts that were becoming a nuisance. The sword and pistol were created to help them do just that.

Item Description: Lightly enchanted golden powder. Repairs weapon equipped in right hand. Use of a weapon depletes its durability eventually rendering it ineffective. Repair Powder is a precious method of repair on the battlefield as it obviates the need for a Repairbox.
Story: The Repair Powder was a precious item on the battlefield. It was used to repair weapons, which depleted their durability over time. This meant that without a Repair Powder, weapons would eventually become ineffective.

Item Description: Specialized mortar used to repair weapons and armor by grinding repair powder. Rest at a bonfire to make weapon and armor repair possible. Repair powder is fragile, and cannot be taken along
Story: The mortar rested at the bonfire, its grinding sound the only thing to be heard in the otherwise silent forest. The repair powder within was delicate, and would be destroyed if taken away from the bonfire. But for those who needed it, the mortar was a vital tool.

Item Description: Specialized mortar used to repair weapons and armor by grinding repair powder. Rest at a bonfire to make weapon and armor repair possible. Repair powder is fragile, and cannot be taken along
Story: The mortar rested at the bonfire, its grinding sound the only thing to be heard in the otherwise silent forest. The repair powder within was delicate, and would be destroyed if taken away from the bonfire. But for those who needed it, the mortar was a vital tool.

Item Description: Staff wielded by the retainers in the cathedral city. Long ago, the retainers attended to the priestesses, but with them gone, the retainers were left to wander frigid Eleum Loyce without purpose.
Story: The staffs were once wielded by the priestesses of Eleum Loyce. Now, with the priestesses gone, the staffs are left to wander the city without purpose. One day, a young girl named Lillia found one of the staffs and decided to take it home with her. Lillia was a lonely girl, and the staff gave her a sense of purpose. She began to visit the cathedral every day, and soon the other children in the city began

Item Description: Short sword wielded by retainers in the Garrison Ward. Long ago, the retainers attended to the priestesses, but with their disappearance, the retainers were left to wander frigid Eleum Loyce without purpose
Story: The longsword was wielded by the priestesses of Eleum Loyce before they disappeared. Now, it's the only thing keeping the retainers from going mad in the cold. They wander the city, searching for any sign of their goddesses, but they never find anything. One day, they hear a voice calling out to them from the sky. It's the goddess Eleum, who tells them that she's been imprisoned and that she needs their help to escape. The retain

Item Description: A divine ring granted to the Darkmoon Gwyndolin in his youth. Causes males to perform female actions, and vice-versa. Gwyndolin was raised like a daughter through the aura of the moon, and was said to behave like a sullen brooding goddess.
Story: The divine ring granted to the Darkmoon Gwyndolin in his youth caused males to perform female actions and vice versa. Gwyndolin was raised like a daughter through the aura of the moon, and was said to behave like a sullen brooding goddess.

Item Description: A rapier with intricate decorations. Chosen weapon of the famous Undead Prince Ricard. Ricard's exploits are told in a monomyth. He was born into royalty, but wandered the lands in a fateful ill-conceived journey. He became Undead and disappeared up North
Story: Ricard's rapier is said to have been crafted from the fangs of a dragon. It is said to have the power to slay any foe.

Item Description: An exquisitely decorated rapier. Said to belong to a prince who appears in an ancient tale. There are numerous variations of the story of the prince who wandered the lands and eventually became Undead. The majority of these tales end in tragedy. but there are some exceptions.
Story: The rapier belonged to a prince who wandered the lands and eventually became Undead. In one variation of the story, the prince was cursed by a witch and turned into a vampire. In another, the prince was killed by a rival prince and his body was left to rot. In any case, the rapier was a symbol of the prince's power and prestige. Eventually, the rapier found its way into the hands of a powerful wizard.

Item Description: A strikingly decorative rapier of an Undead prince spoken of in ancient stories. Although many of the tales surrounding the prince are questionable, this thrusting weapon suggests that the stories of his graceful technique were in fact true.
Story: The rapier is a beautiful weapon, with intricate carvings that depict scenes from the undead prince's life. Although many of the tales surrounding the prince are questionable, this thrusting weapon suggests that the stories of his graceful technique were in fact true. The rapier is a reminder of the prince's skill, and it would be a beautiful addition to any collection.

Item Description: A trick weapon crafted by the workshop heretics, the Powder Kegs. A prototype weapon serving as a simple firearm and spear, possibly created in imitation of a lost Cainhurst weapon. Lacks any notable functions, saving that it is the only trick weapon with an attached gun.
Story: The Powder Kegs are a unique weapon that was created by the workshop heretics. It is a prototype weapon that serves as a simple firearm and spear. It is unknown what functions the Powder Kegs lack, but it is the only trick weapon that has an attached gun.

Item Description: Bewitched ring that Pontiff Sulyvahn bestowed upon his knights. Boosts attacks, as long as attacking persists. Knights who peer into the black orb are lured into battles of death, transformed into frenzied beasts. No wonder the Pontiff only provides these rings to those dispatched to foreign lands.
Story: The bewitched ring bestowed by Pontiff Sulyvahn upon his knights is a powerful tool that boosts their attacks as long as they continue to attack. However, the ring also has a dark side, as those who peer into the black orb are lured into battles of death, transformed into frenzied beasts. This explains why the Pontiff only provides these rings to those dispatched to foreign lands.

Item Description: An unusual ring of unknown origin. Limits the wearer's HP reduction when Hollow. Alas, this ring will not make you human. What is lost is not easily retrieved.
Story: The ring is a strange, dark metal with a greenish hue. It is inscribed with strange symbols and has a strange, limiting effect on the wearer's HP when Hollow. Unfortunately, the ring will not make the wearer human again, and what is lost is not easily retrieved.

Item Description: The Ring of Blades is modeled after the mad knight of Alken's weapon of choice. Increases physical attack. The kingdoms of Alken and Venn long ago flourished on these very grounds. They were both founded by the same man, but were reduced to rivalry and spite.
Story: The Ring of Blades is a magical artifact that enhances the user's physical attack. It is said that it was created by the mad knight of Alken, who used it to become one of the most feared warriors in all of Alken. Unfortunately, the Ring of Blades eventually fell into the hands of Venn, who used it to become one of the most powerful kings in all of Alken. Now, the Ring of Blades is back in the hands of its rightful owner, and it

Item Description: A ring symbolizing the favor of the Goddess Fina, whose fateful beauty is mentioned in legend. True to the fickle nature of Fina's favor, her ring increases max HP, stamina, and maximum equip load.
Story: The ring Fina gifted to her faithful follower, Garen, symbolized her favor. The ring increased Garen's maximum HP, stamina, and maximum equip load. However, the ring's fickle nature caused Garen's health to rapidly decline, and he died soon after receiving the ring.

Item Description: A ring symbolizing the favor and protection of the goddess Fina, known in legend to possess 'fateful beauty.
Story: The ring was a simple gold band with a small, delicate diamond in the center. It had been given to her by her godmother as a symbol of her protection and favor. Fina had worn it every day since she was given it, never taking it off even when she slept. Until one day, when she lost it. Fina was devastated. She had been wearing the ring every day since her godmother had given it to her, and now it was

Item Description: Those who befriend Alvina are given this mysterious ring. It resembles a pearl with its robust pure-white fog. The ring camouflages its wearer's presence, helping to prevent detection.
Story: The ring is a gift from Alvina, a goddess who resides in the misty depths of the ocean. It is said that the ring helps its wearer to remain undetected, and that it is a powerful tool for those who wish to remain hidden.

Item Description: The beloved ring of the gallant Shieldless Lothian, formerly of Forossa. Increases poise. Lothian was born a peasant, and died a general. His determination and diligence were unmatched, especially on the battlefield, where he earned his name by choosing to fight without a shield.
Story: The Shieldless Lothian's ring was once the most prized possession of Forossa's gallant Shieldless Lothian. It was said that the ring's power increased the wearer's poise, making them fearless in the face of danger. Lothian was born a peasant, and died a general. His determination and diligence were unmatched, especially on the battlefield, where he earned his name by choosing to fight without a shield.

Item Description: A ring blessed by the High Priest of Volgen. Increases intelligence. The clerics of the great city of Volgen are perennially entrenched in scandalous power struggles, but among them remain a few strong-willed, upstanding noblemen.
Story: A ring blessed by the High Priest of Volgen. Increases intelligence. The clerics of the great city of Volgen are perennially entrenched in scandalous power struggles, but among them remain a few strong-willed, upstanding noblemen. One such nobleman, who has been searching for a way to increase his intelligence, comes across the ring and decides to take it. The ring immediately begins to work its magic, increasing his intelligence by a significant amount. The nobleman is overjoyed

Item Description: Divine ring that watches over one's life. Created by the students of Ivory Rhones, sage of Lindelt It's great protective power will protect you from any loss upon death, but after its power is spent, the ring will break.
Story: The Divine Ring was created by the students of Ivory Rhones, sage of Lindelt. It is a great protective power that will protect you from any loss upon death. However, after its power is spent, the ring will break.

Item Description: The clerics of the great city of Volgen are Perennially entrenched in scandalous power struggles, but among them remain a few strong-willed, upstanding noblemen.
Story: One such nobleman is Lord Jaren, who has dedicated his life to serving the people of Volgen. He is a devout follower of the god Volgen, and is known for his kind heart and righteous ways. One day, Jaren is approached by a group of clerics who ask him to become their new leader. Jaren is hesitant at first, but after much thought, he decides to accept. As the new leader of the clerics, Jaren is able to put

Item Description: A protective ring adorned with four blessed gems. Increases resistance to poison, bleeding, petrification, and curses. A creation of the lost land of Olaphis. The sorcerer who created this was so powerful that he became widely feared
Story: The ring was created by a sorcerer who was so powerful that he became widely feared. The ring was created to protect its wearer from poison, bleeding, petrification, and curses. The sorcerer who created the ring was so powerful that he was able to resist these effects himself.

Item Description: A protective ring passed down in House Osteria. Gradually restores HP. In the sacred land of Lindelt, this ring symbolized prosperity and longevity for the great House of Osteria. But the ring is fragile and breaks easily, as if it hates being taken for granted.
Story: The ring is a heirloom passed down in the House of Osteria. It is a symbol of prosperity and longevity, and it is said that the ring breaks easily because it hates being taken for granted. The ring is a reminder to the House of Osteria that they must always be grateful for what they have.

Item Description: This mystical ring was created in a sacrificial rite of Velka, the Goddess of Sin. Its wearer will lose nothing upon death, but the ring itself breaks.
Story: The ring is a powerful artifact that grants its wearer immortality, but it is also cursed and will eventually break. The protagonist finds the ring and decides to keep it, but they must be careful not to lose it or it will be lost forever.

Item Description: This mystical ring was created in a sacrificial rite of Velka, the Goddess of Sin. Its wearer will lose nothing upon death, but the ring itself breaks. A sacrifice is only worth as much as the life it spares.
Story: The ring is a powerful artifact that grants its wearer immortality, but it is also cursed. If the ring's wearer dies, the ring will break and they will lose all their life savings. However, the ring's true power comes from the fact that it can save the wearer's life even if they die.

Item Description: Divine ring that watches over one's soul. Created by Ivory Rhones, sage of Lindelt. Its great protective power will protect you from any loss upon death or petrification, but after its power is spent, the ring will break
Story: The Divine Ring was created by Ivory Rhones, a sage from Lindelt. It was said that the ring's great protective power would protect its wearer from any loss upon death or petrification. However, after its power was spent, the ring would break.

Item Description: This ring belonged to the Knight King Rendal. It grants its wearer protection by boosting defense against physical attacks. Of the many legends surrounding the Knight King Rendal, one of the more well-known speaks of his standing down a giant drake and slashing it to pieces.
Story: The ring belonged to Rendal, the Knight King. Rendal was known for his bravery and strength. One day, Rendal faced a giant drake. Rendal fought bravely and was able to slash the drake to pieces. The ring that Rendal wore helped protect him from the drake's attacks.

Item Description: Wearer gains the protection of steel. Increases physical defense. Said to be the ring of the once legendary Knight King, though his tales are long forgotten, and even the greatly wizened have no recollection of his exploits.
Story: The ring is said to have been worn by the Knight King, a legendary figure who is long forgotten. The ring supposedly grants its wearer increased physical defense, though few people know of its true power. The ring is said to be the last remnant of the Knight King's legacy, and even the most wizened of elders have no recollection of his exploits. Whoever wears the ring will be granted the protection of steel, and will be able to withstand even the most powerful attacks.

Item Description: The wearer of this ring appears human even when Hollow. They say that in the Undead Crypt, we can reacquaint ourselves with the dead. We all suffer loss. And none of us can escape death. Then, what is the fascination with reclaiming that which has already passed into that beyond?
Story: The ring is said to be able to bring the wearer back to life if they are Hollow. However, the wearer is warned that they will suffer from the loss of life and all of their memories from before they died. They may also be drawn to the Undead Crypt, where they can re-acquaint themselves with the dead.

Item Description: Ring crafted from the chains of the Embedded. Receive various benefits, but at the cost of increased damage taken. The chains of the Embedded have the power to transform people into slaves of pleasure, setting them on a path of ruin. This ring augments that peculiar quality.
Story: The ring is a cursed item that amplifies the user's libido, but also increases the damage they take. It is said that the chains of the Embedded, which are used to bind slaves of pleasure, can be used to craft this ring. The ring grants the wearer various benefits, but at the cost of increased damage taken.

Item Description: According to legend, this ring contains the spirit of the evil eye, a dark beast which assaulted Astora. The strength of the evil eye does not waver, and HP is absorbed from fallen enemies.
Story: The ring is said to contain the spirit of the evil eye, a dark beast which assaulted Astora. The ring's power does not waver, and HP is absorbed from fallen enemies. The wearer of the ring can use this power to their advantage, taking HP away from enemies before they can inflict damage.

Item Description: A modest, but inexplicably disturbing ring. Absorb HP for each enemy defeated. Peer too closely at the rare stone that forms the eye of this ring, and things that writhe and stir may come into focus.
Story: The ring is a simple gold band with a small, dark stone in the center. The stone is oddly shaped, with an eye in the center. The ring seems to absorb HP from any enemies it defeats, and those who look too closely at the stone may see things that should not be seen. This ring is said to have belonged to a powerful sorcerer, and its dark power has drawn the attention of monsters and evil beings. If the ring's owner is ever found, they will likely

Item Description: A ring of black stone. The stone is misshaped, perhaps imperceptibily. Renders certain equipment invisible. Do not judge your foes by their appearance. He who approaches with no sword carries two on his back.
Story: The ring is a cursed item that renders any equipment invisible. The wearer is also immune to any attacks based on appearance. Anyone who comes into contact with the ring will be carrying two swords on their back, as they will be unable to see what is attacking them.

Item Description: This ring is granted to those who enter a Covenant with Gwynevere, daughter of Lord Gwyn and the Princess of Sunlight. This slightly warm ring boosts the synergy of miracles. The Princess of Sunlight left Anor Londo along with many other deities, and later became wife to Flame God Flann.
Story: The ring granted to those who enter a Covenant with Gwynevere, daughter of Lord Gwyn and the Princess of Sunlight, boosts the synergy of miracles. When the Princess of Sunlight left Anor Londo along with many other deities, she later became wife to Flame God Flann.

Item Name: Ring of the Sun's First Born
Item Description: Ring of the Sun's first born, who inherited the light of Gwyn, the first lord. Greatly boosts miracles. The Sun's first born was once a god of war, until he was stripped of his stature as punishment for his foolishness. No wonder his very name has slipped from the annals of history.
Story: The Ring of the Sun's first born was once a god of war, until he was stripped of his stature as punishment for his foolishness. No wonder his very name has slipped from the annals of history. When he was cast out, he wandered the world, seeking a way to regain his former glory. One day, he found a ring that granted him great power in the miracle department. With it, he was able to restore the sun to its rightful place in the sky,

Item Description: Lord Gwyn's firstborn, who inherited the sunlight, once wore this ancient ring. Lord Gwyn's firstborn was a god of war, but his foolishness led to a loss of the annals, and rescinding of his deific status. Today, even his name is not known.
Story: The ring once belonged to Lord Gwyn's firstborn, a god of war who lost his deific status after foolishly losing the annals. Today, the ring is unknown even to his name. A young woman finds it in a dusty old chest, and decides to wear it as a sign of rebellion. She soon discovers that the ring gives her the power to control the sun, and she uses this power to take over the world.

Item Description: Ring granted protection by Kremmel, god of Struggle. The ring's spikes drive into the wearer's skin, so that each blow fuels spite toward the perpetrator. When damage is taken the ring retaliates and inflicts damage upon enemy.
Story: The ring was a gift from Kremmel, the god of Struggle. The spikes on the ring drove into the wearer's skin, so that each blow fueled spite toward the perpetrator. When damage was taken, the ring retaliated and inflicted damage upon the enemy.

Item Description: Ring worn by Rhoy the Explorer. Hear the inner voices of surrounding foes. Useful for locating hidden enemies, and perhaps for a few other things, as well.
Story: Rhoy the Explorer was known for his travels and discoveries. He was also known for his unique ring, which allowed him to hear the inner voices of surrounding foes. This ring was also useful for locating hidden enemies, and perhaps for a few other things.

Item Description: Bludgeon made of an enormous finger sheathed in several heavy rings. Thought to have been cut from an ancestor of the Fingercreeper. Some life yet remains in this legacy of an ancient act of blasphemy, as evidenced by the barely perceptible warmth it still exudes.
Story: The Fingercreeper is a legendary creature that is said to have been created from the finger of an ancestor who committed blasphemy. The finger was cut from the creature and still retains some of its life, giving it a faint warmth.

Item Description: Paired black Greatsword wielded by the Ringed Knights. The arms of early men were forged in the Abyss, and betray a smidgen of life. For this the gods cast a seal of fire upon such weapons, and those who possessed them. Skill: Ember Cross the twin timeworn Greatsword to reignite a short-lived flame. A lightning-quick upward heave slices the very air, and transitions into normal or strong attacks.
Story: The Ringed Knights were a group of elite warriors who served the king. They were known for their great swords, which were forged from the arms of early men. One day, the gods cast a seal of fire upon these weapons, forbidding anyone from using them. However, one knight, skilled in using these swords, managed to break the seal. Since then, he has reigned as the king's most powerful warrior.

Item Description: Black spear wielded by the Ringed Knights. The arms of early men were forged in the Abyss, and betray a smidgen of life. For this reason the gods cast a seal of fire upon these spears, and those who possessed them. Skill: Ember Thrust the timeworn spear and watch it restore its ancient brilliance and reignite a short-lived flame, whose dull aftermath will carry on.
Story: The Ringed Knights were a group of warriors who fought for the gods. They wielded black spears that were forged in the Abyss. The arms of early men were forged from this material, and because of this, the gods cast a seal of fire upon them. This made the spears incredibly powerful, but it also made them dangerous. The Ringed Knights were skilled warriors, and they used their spears to fight against their enemies.

Item Description: Straight sword wielded by the Ringed Knights. The arms of early men were forged in the Abyss, and betray a smidgen of life. For this reason the gods cast a seal of fire upon these swords, and those who possessed them.
Story: The Straight Sword is a legendary weapon that is said to have been wielded by the Ringed Knights. The arms of early men were forged in the Abyss, and betray a smidgen of life. For this reason the gods cast a seal of fire upon these swords, and those who possessed them.

Item Description: Unique weapon wielded by young Albinaurics, this sword is modelled after the ripples that are thought to be the origin of their species. Its attack power is greatly enhanced with one's arcane attribute.
Story: The Albinaurics are a species of dragon-like creatures that are known for their powerful swords. This particular sword is modeled after the ripples that are thought to be the origin of their species. The sword's attack power is greatly enhanced with one's arcane attribute.

Item Description: Weapon wielded by young Albinaurics. The blade is said to resemble a partial image of a ripple, and its attack power scales with one's arcane attribute.
Story: The Albinaurics are a race of diminutive humanoids that hail from the frigid continent of Albinaur. The Albinaurics are known for their mastery of arcane magic, and their weapon, the ripple blade, is said to be imbued with the power of their arcane attribute.

Item Description: A spear originating in Heide. A special alloy makes it very durable. The composition of the alloy of these spears remains a mystery, but in Drangleic the attempt to imitate it resulted in the similar bradden steel.
Story: The Heide Spear is a legendary weapon that originated in Heide. It is made of a special alloy that is very durable, and its composition remains a mystery. However, in Drangleic, the attempt to imitate the Heide Spear's alloy resulted in the similar bradden steel.

Item Description: This secret rite allows bonfires to be bolstered further with Kindling, so that even more Estus can be collected. Kindling was a sacred rite passed down among clerics, but all Undead can imitate the process, in the same manner that they restore their Hollowing with humanity.How peculiar that humans had found little use for humanity until they turned Undead.
Story: A young cleric, seeking to learn more about the Undead, discovers a secret rite that allows bonfires to be bolstered with Kindling. This discovery leads her to question the purpose of humanity, and whether it was truly worth sacrificing so many for.

Item Description: This secret rite allows bonfires to be bolstered further with Kindling, so that even more Estus can be collected. Kindling was a sacred rite passed down among clerics, but all Undead can imitate the process, in the same manner that they restore their Hollowing with humanity.How peculiar that humans had found little use for humanity until they turned Undead.
Story: A young cleric, seeking to learn more about the Undead, discovers a secret rite that allows bonfires to be bolstered with Kindling. This discovery leads her to question the purpose of humanity, and whether it was truly worth sacrificing so many for.

Item Description: Material used in a Holy Chalice rite. One of the basic ingredients used to satiate a Holy Chalice is this incoagulable blood. When all is melted in blood, all is reborn.
Story: The blood in the chalice was a dark red, and it looked like it would never be able to satisfy the hunger of the gods. The priestess prepared the chalice, and she poured the blood into it. She chanted the words of the rite, and then she took a sip of the blood. The blood tasted terrible, but it was the only way to satisfy the gods. The priestess drank the blood, and then she chanted the words of the rite

Item Description: A fragment of the matching ritual spears once held by the knights of Princess Filianore. They are the namesake of the Spears of the Church. When Spears of the Church face unduly treacherous foes, this allows them to draw upon former majesty, and summon a row of upward-thrusting ritual spears.
Story: The Spears of the Church are a relic of a bygone era. When they are used in combat, it is said that they allow the user to draw upon their former majesty, and summon a row of upward-thrusting spears.

Item Description: Weapon of Okina, swordsman from the Land of Reeds. A cursed weapon that has felled countless men. When Mohg, the Lord of Blood, first felt Okina's sword, and madness, upon his flesh, he had a proposal, to offer Okina the life of a demon, whose thirst would never go unsated.
Story: Okina was a swordsman from the Land of Reeds. He was known for his skill with the weapon, and was feared by many. One day, Mohg, the Lord of Blood, came to Okina and offered him the chance to become a demon. Okina refused, but the madness that came over Mohg made him more powerful than ever. Mohg threatened to kill Okina's friends and family if he didn't take the offer, and Okina had no choice

Item Description: Halberd forged from the soul of a Skeleton Lord. Imbued with the power of dark. The unsettling skull carved into this halberd recalls the final moments of the Skeleton Lord from whom it was created.
Story: The halberd was forged from the soul of a Skeleton Lord. The power of dark was imbued into the weapon, making it an incredibly powerful tool. The skull carved into the halberd is a reminder of the moment of the Skeleton Lord's death.

Item Description: A robe honoring an ancient goddess. Sin was said to be her domain, but the name of the goddess is long forgotten. Little is known about what purpose the robe served, only that it was worn by a person of great authority.
Story: The robe is a sacred relic of an ancient goddess. It is said that Sin was her domain, and that the robe was worn by a person of great authority. Little is known about its purpose, only that it was worn by a person of great importance.

Item Description: Prince Lothric's hood, robe and skirt. The prince, destined to be a Lord of Cinder, was cherished by the royal family, despite being born into illness, a frail and shriveled child. His swaddling, clothes were made of aged, coarse cloth used in ancient prayer, and are all that he has ever worn.
Story: Prince Lothric's clothes are imbued with a power that allows him to walk through fire unscathed. When he was younger, he would often wander the castle, exploring the many burning chambers. One day, he found himself in the throne room, where the fire was the hottest. He walked through it, unharmed. From then on, he was known as the Prince of Fire.

Item Description: Robe of the Channelers, sorcerers that serve Seath the Scaleless. Even after the onset of Seath's madness, the snatchers as they were often called, ventured to far lands to find suitable human specimens. The heaviest of protective gear for sorcerers, and imbued with magic
Story: The robe of the channelers is a heavy, protective garment that is imbued with magic. It was worn by sorcerers who served Seath the Scaleless, and it was even used after Seath's madness began to take hold. The robe was designed to keep the wearer safe from harm, and it was especially effective against the snatchers, who were often called because of the magical power that they possessed.

Item Description: Robe of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame. Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided that power among his clan before linking the flame. When he departed, he left only with his greatsword, his garb, and the crown, now bereft of power. He kept his crown perhaps to preserve a symbol of the monarch, for its actual power had fully subsided
Story: The robe of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, is a powerful artifact that once belonged to the Lord of Cinder. Gwyn was the first to link the First Flame, and he divided his power among his clan before departing. When he left, he took only his greatsword, his garb, and the crown. The robe of Gwyn is a powerful symbol of the monarch, but its power has since faded.

Item Description: Piercing sword of superior quality, featuring intricate ornamentation. Signature weapon of the sorcerer Rogier. High dexterity is required to wield the blade to its full potential, but mastery is a sight to behold, characterized by a flowing style which excels in successive attacks.
Story: Rogier was a powerful sorcerer who wielded a piercing sword with intricate ornamentation. The sword was incredibly skilled, but required high dexterity to use it to its full potential. The flowing style of Rogier's mastery was a sight to behold, characterized by a succession of quick and powerful attacks.

Item Description: An old armor that is oddly comfortable. Belonged to a Rogue. To this day, the forbidden love of Prince of Alken and the Princess of Venn manipulates these marionettes. Surely they never imagined that their dolls would outlast their own kingdoms
Story: The old armor belonged to a rogue. It was oddly comfortable, and it had belonged to them. The forbidden love of Prince of Alken and the Princess of Venn had manipulated these marionettes for centuries. Surely they never imagined that their dolls would outlast their own kingdoms.

Item Description: Armor of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn. The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.
Story: The armor of the man who calls himself Shabriri is highly functional and heavily worn. It is said that the man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart. The armor is so worn that it is barely recognizable, but it still protects its wearer from harm.

Item Description: A flail used by the bulbous Father of the Painted World to shred his own skin, producing blood to appease the flame. Both a weapon and a miracle catalyst. Ariandel, being the restorer of the Painted World, knew that it was painted with blood, and only blood could protect the secret. Skill: Awakening Violently flail oneself to trigger an awakening that temporarily boosts the strength of miracles, just as the good Father used the rose himself.
Story: Ariandel, the restorer of the Painted World, knew that the world was protected by a miracle-guiding blood. He used the flail he found in the Father's chamber to shred his own skin, producing the blood needed to activate the miracle. The flail's sudden violence awakened the power of miracles within him, temporarily boosting his strength.

Item Description: Usher of Death, Rosus, who shows the path to the catacombs throughout the Lands Between, is depicted on this ritual axe. The dead easily lose their way, and have always been in sore need of a guiding hand.
Story: Rosus is the Usher of Death, and his job is to show the way to the catacombs throughout the Lands Between. He is often depicted on ritual axes, as the dead easily lose their way and need a guiding hand.

Item Description: Large iron great hammer designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot. Weighty enough to crush armor and its wearer alike. Skill: Braggart's Roar Declare your presence with a boastful roar. Raises attack power, defense, and stamina recovery speed.
Story: The large iron great hammer was designed for gladiatorial combat, and now it is festering with scarlet rot. The weight of the hammer is enough to crush armor and its wearer, and its boastful roar will raise the attack power, defense, and stamina recovery speed of the user.

Item Description: Spear fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. It festers with scarlet rot. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence.
Story: The crystal spear was once a beautiful and powerful weapon. However, over time the crystal began to rot and the magic that was enwreathed within it began to fade. Now, the spear is nothing more than a cursed object that is only able to inflict harm on those with intelligence.

Item Description: Staff fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. It festers with scarlet rot. Enhances Crystalian sorceries.
Story: The Staff of Sorcery was created by a group of wizards who were unable to create a staff that would enhance their Crystalian sorcery. The staff quickly became infected with scarlet rot, and the wizards were forced to destroy it. However, because of the staff's magical properties, some of the wizards were able to keep it. They use it to enhance their Crystalian spells.

Item Description: Sword fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. It festers with scarlet rot. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence.
Story: The sword is a beautiful crystal piece, but it is slowly rotting from the inside. The magic that was used to create it is also slowly killing it. The sword is only as powerful as the user's intelligence, so it is only as strong as the user can make it.

Item Description: Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.
Story: The bronze helm is a beautiful piece of armor, but it is also cursed. The snakes that decorate the helm are slowly being eaten away by a deadly scarlet rot. The rot makes the wearer an easier target for enemies, but it also makes them more powerful.

Item Description: A crude, half-rotten curved sword. Choice weapon of the blunt-horned Ghrus, descendants of the acolytes of Farron Keep. The rancid blade is drenched in rotten waste, making it acutely poisonous.
Story: The Ghrus were a race of horned creatures that dwelled in the dark corners of the world. They were a brutish and barbaric people, who prized strength and power above all else. Their choice weapon was a curved sword that was drenched in the rotting waste of their home. The sword was so poisonous that even the slightest touch would cause instant death.

Item Description: A crude, half-rotten dagger. Choice weapon of the blunt-horned Ghrus, descendants of the acolytes of Farron Keep. The rancid blade is drenched in rotten waste, making it acutely poisonous
Story: The Ghrus are a race of horned creatures that dwell in the dark corners of the world. They are the descendants of the acolytes of Farron Keep, and their choice weapon is the crude, half-rotten dagger. The dagger is drenched in rotten waste, making it acutely poisonous.

Item Description: A crude, half-rotten curved spear. Choice weapon of the blunt-horned Ghrus, descendants of the acolytes of Farron Keep. The rancid tip is drenched in rotten waste, making it acutely poisonous
Story: The Ghrus were a race of brutish, horned creatures that dwelled in the dark corners of the world. They were the descendants of the acolytes of Farron Keep, and their choice weapon was a crude, half-rotten curved spear. The rancid tip was drenched in rotten waste, making it acutely poisonous.

Item Description: Thick, bristly cloak eaten through by scarlet rot. The symbol of an underground gravekeeper's station. Altered: Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.
Story: The cloak is a sign of power and privilege for those who wear it. It is a symbol of an underground gravekeeper's station, and those who wear it are considered a slightly easier target for foes. The wearer becomes a part of the underworld, and can move through the darkness with ease.

Item Description: Greataxe designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.
Story: The greataxe was once used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum. Now, the blade is covered in scarlet rot, and it seems to be cursed.

Item Description: Rotten pine resin that has gained poison. Adds poison effect to Main-hand weapon. Hits with affected weapon build up enemy poison level. If enemy is poisoned damage will be inflicted for a period of time
