Story: The Rotten Pine Resin has a foul smell and a bitter taste. When it is applied to a weapon, it causes the weapon to inflict poison on its victims. The poison builds up over time, and if the weapon is used to attack an enemy that is already poisoned, the damage inflicted will be increased.

Item Description: Ceremonial staff depicting the Erdtree in its historic radiance. It festers with scarlet rot. Wielded by the avatars who protect the Minor Erdtrees.
Story: The Ceremonial Staff of the Erdtree is a rotting staff that is used by the avatars who protect the Minor Erdtrees. The staff is covered in scarlet rot and is festering with the disease.

Item Description: Crimsons water of unknown origin. Restores HP and spell uses. Though known to some as red holy water, not everyone acknowledges its holy status.
Story: The Crimsons water is said to have miraculous healing properties, and is often used by priests and other holy people to restore their health and cast spells. However, not everyone believes in its holy powers, and some even think that it is just red water. Regardless of its true nature, the Crimsons water is a valuable resource that many people would be happy to have in their possession.

Item Description: A dagger fashioned from rare geisteel, boasting an unusually long blade. Geisteel was a precious alloy created in the eastern land of Mirrah, its composition long kept secret from foreign lands. That is, until Chancellor Wellager was ordered by King Vendrick to grant the gifted blacksmith Llewellyn a lifetime contract, whatever the cost, in order to introduce the rare alloy to Drangleic.
Story: The dagger was crafted from a rare alloy known as geisteel. Geisteel was created in the eastern land of Mirrah, and its composition was long kept secret from foreign lands. That is, until Chancellor Wellager was ordered by King Vendrick to grant the gifted blacksmith Llewellyn a lifetime contract, whatever the cost, in order to introduce the rare alloy to Drangleic.

Item Description: Greatsword of the royal swordsmen. Its undulating blade draws blood from its foes. Despite the magnificence of this weapon, it was terribly inadequate in the war against the mighty Giants.
Story: The greatsword was once wielded by the royal swordsmen. It was a magnificent weapon, but it was ineffective against the giants. Despite this, it is still a powerful weapon.

Item Description: Greatsword decorated in royal Carian Style. Favored weapon of Blaidd the Half-Wolf. In defiance of the fate he was born to, Blaidd swore to serve no master but Ranni. As proof. the sword was imbued with a cold magic at the moment oath was sworn.
Story: Blaidd the Half-Wolf was born to a pack of wolves in the wilds of Caria. He was always different from the other wolves, preferring to live alone and learn from his own experiences. One day, he met a woman named Ranni and fell in love with her. Ranni was a princess of Caria, and she was already married to another man. Blaidd knew that he couldn't compete with her husband, so he swore an oath to serve her

Item Description: Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.
Story: tta and her fellow knights rode into the forest, their silver armor shining in the sunlight. They were greeted by the Haligtree, a beautiful tree with silver leaves and silver flowers. The tree told the knights that they were the chosen ones, and that they were to serve Miquella and protect Albinaurics. The knights were overjoyed, and swore to serve Miquella and the Haligtree for all eternity.

Item Description: Silver helm of Loretta, a Knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta, once a royal Carian Knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.
Story: tta found the Haligtree and was accepted as a Knight of the tree. She served Miquella faithfully for many years, until the day Miquella's death. Loretta was heartbroken, but knew that she had to continue serving the tree. She took up Miquella's sword and shield and continued to protect the tree and the Albinaurics.

Item Description: Armory graces with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing. Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced. It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord - the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.
Story: The Armory is a place of great power and mystery. It is said that the bones of an ancient lord, known as Ensha, are stored within the Armory. When HP is reduced, the Armory slowly replenishes HP.

Item Description: Helm graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing. Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced. It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord - the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.
Story: The Helm is a relic from an ancient time, and it is said that it belonged to an ancient lord - the soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha. The Helm is said to slowly replenish HP when HP is reduced, and it is said that the bones belong to an ancient lord - the soulless king.

Item Description: Royal Drangleic soldier armor. Equipment crafted by the royal blacksmith. Finely polished and ready for battle
Story: The armor was crafted by the royal blacksmiths in Drangleic Castle. It was finely polished and ready for battle. The armor was made for a soldier who was skilled in using their sword and shield.

Item Description: A ring bearing a soldier's seal. Increases the load that can be carried. These rings were granted to warriors who distinguished themselves in the service of King Vendrick. The king favored simple warriors who staked their every battle on strength alone.
Story: The ring was a simple, gold band with a soldier's seal embossed on the front. It was a gift from King Vendrick to those who had distinguished themselves in the service of the kingdom. The king favored warriors who relied on their own strength and fought with no reservations. The ring granted its wearer an extra burden, but it was a testament to the king's faith in them.

Item Description: Armor of a royal swordsman. Its shape provides defense while allowing great mobility. Stripped of ornamentation, this particular armor is designed strictly for battle. King Vendrick supplied his bravest men with the best armor available to face the great giants, but very few returned alive
Story: The armor of a royal swordsman is designed to provide defense while allowing great mobility. Stripped of ornamentation, this particular armor is designed strictly for battle. The armor is made of sturdy metal and is adorned only with the symbol of a king. The bravest men of Vendrick's kingdom were given this armor to face the great giants, but very few returned alive.

Item Description: Rubbish with no value. Who in their right mind would bother carrying this around? Perhaps you need help.
Story: You are walking through a dark alley when you hear a rustling in the trash. You reach down and grab a piece of rubbish, expecting it to be gross but instead you find a ring. It's beautiful, with a large diamond on the finger. You can't believe you lucked out and you decide to take it with you. As you walk away, you hear a voice calling out to you.

Item Description: Rubbish with no value. Who in their right mind would bother carrying this around? Perhaps you need help.
Story: You are walking through a dark alley when you hear a rustling in the trash. You reach down and grab a piece of rubbish, expecting it to be gross but instead you find a ring. It's beautiful, with a large diamond on the finger. You can't believe you lucked out and you decide to take it with you. As you walk away, you hear a voice calling out to you.

Item Description: A piece of rubbish that is good for nothing. One man's rubbish is another man's riches, for value, is in the eye of the beholder. But utility is another matter, and this has none.
Story: The man was a simple farmer, and he had a problem. He had too much rubbish. He had too much that was good for nothing. He had too much that was just taking up space. He had too much that was just taking up time. So he decided to make something out of all of his rubbish. He decided to make something that was good for something. He decided to make something that was useful. And so he made a treasure. He made a

Item Description: Armor worn by the jailer's creation, the Ruin Sentinel. The sentinel has no form, its soul residing within the armor itself. Stare at it for long and it seems ready to spring to life, but surely, such is an illusion.
Story: The armor worn by the jailer's creation, the Ruin Sentinel, is an eerie sight. Its form is undefined, its soul residing within the armor itself. Anyone who looks at it for too long may believe it is about to spring to life, but this is only an illusion.

Item Description: Originally rubble from a ruin which fell from the sky, this surviving fragment was honed into a weapon. One of the legendary armaments. The ruin it came from crumbled when struck by a meteorite, as such this weapon harbors its destructive power.
Story: The weapon known as the Meteorite Blade is said to have been forged from the wreckage of a ruin that fell from the sky. The weapon's destructive power is said to be fueled by the anger of the meteorite that struck it.

Item Description: Mask in the image of a wizened sage. Customary dress among lords in a smaller nation. Increases faith. Such a mask illustrates the qualities of an ideal lord: chiefly, wise and possessing a certain defanged geniality. One at the center of society often finds these qualities most expedient.
Story: The mask is worn by a lord in a smaller nation. It symbolizes the qualities of an ideal lord-wise and possessing a certain defanged geniality. One at the center of society often finds these qualities most expedient.

Item Description: Greatsword of Vendrick, King of Drangleic. The strength of this sword is relative to the number of souls possessed by its wielder. One fragment of Dark, having taken human shape, became obsessed with the King's soul. Impelled by its own cravings, it sought souls, and strove to make the strength of the Giants its own. Effect: attack boosted by souls held.
Story: Vendrick, the king of Drangleic, was known for his greatsword. One fragment of Dark, having taken human shape, became obsessed with the king's soul. It strove to make the strength of the Giants its own, by possessing souls. This made the sword even more powerful, as it was now boosted by the strength of the king's enemies.

Item Description: Common Yharnam cap. Well-worn and losing it's shape.
Story: The Yharnam cap is a common item in Bloodborne. It is well-worn and losing its shape, likely from being worn for years. The lore behind the Yharnam cap is unknown, but it may have some connection to the city of Yharnam.

Item Description: Runesmith Caryll, student of Byrgenwerth, transcribed the inhuman utterings of the Great Ones into what are now called Caryll Runes. The hunter Who retrieves this workshop tool can etch Caryll Runes into the mind to attain their wondrous strength. Provost Willem would have been proud of Caryll's runes, as they do not rely upon blood in any measure.
Story: Caryll Runes are a tool used by the Hunter to etch runes into the mind to attain their wondrous strength.

Item Description: A rusty anchor wielded as a weapon. Each of its four flukes is thick and sharp, enabling piercing attacks. While the Tarnished left the Lands Between with their Lord, one boat alone was said to have been left behind.
Story: The Tarnished was a small boat that was left behind when the Lord of the Lands Between left. The anchor is the only thing that remains of the boat, and it is said that whoever wields it can strike with impunity.

Item Description: An old rusted copper coin. Crushing the coin temporarily boosts luck. This rusted coin gives you that little extra bit of luck, making items and the like easier to find. The coin is engraved with the image of a god that was worshipped in ancient times, but no one knows its true origin.
Story: You find yourself in a dark alley, your heart racing as you search for your lost phone. Suddenly, you hear a rustling in the bushes and you freeze. You're about to scream when you hear the sound of a copper coin hitting the ground. You pick it up and see that it's engraved with the image of a god that was worshipped in ancient times. Suddenly, your heart rate slows and you feel a sense of relief. You pocket the coin and continue your search, thanking

Item Description: A rusty old gold coin that surely has no currency. Crushing the coin gives a large, if temporary, boost to item discovery. A rich man lost his fortune, but it returned to him twofold. He was swift to squander his retrieved fortune, smugly confident that it was bound to double once again.
Story: A rusty old gold coin that surely has no currency. Crushing the coin gives a large, if temporary, boost to item discovery. A rich man lost his fortune, but it returned to him twofold. He was swift to squander his retrieved fortune, smugly confident that it was bound to double once again.

Item Description: Armor worn by the Primal Knights of Drangleic castle. Durability is low due to rusting. Its weight would normally crush a man, but to the brutish Primal Knights it may as well be made of papyrus
Story: The armor worn by the Primal Knights of Drangleic castle is a rusty and heavy piece of armor. It is difficult to move in, but it is incredibly durable. The weight of the armor would normally crush a man, but to the brutish Primal Knights it may as well be made of papyrus.

Item Description: A rusty old silver coin that surely is no currency. Crushing the coin gives a moderate, if temporary, boost to item discovery. A rich man lost his fortune, but it returned to him twofold. He was swift to squander his retrieved fortune, smugly confident that it was bound to double once again.
Story: The old man's luck ran out and he was left penniless and desperate. One day, he found a rusty old silver coin in the street. He crushed it in his hand and felt a sudden, moderate boost to his item discovery. He was overjoyed and quickly spent the coin, confident that it would bring him even more riches. But his luck ran out and he was left penniless and desperate again. One day, he found a rusty old silver coin in the street.

Item Description: Great hammer of the Royal Aegis. The power of the hammer's blessing has not faded completely, despite being exposed to the dark of the Undead Crypt. Sir Velstadt, known as the Royal Aegis, gave himself to the King both in life and death.
Story: The great hammer of the Royal Aegis is a powerful weapon that has the power to bless those who wield it. Sir Velstadt, known as the Royal Aegis, gave himself to the King both in life and death. The blessing of the hammer still remains, even after being exposed to the dark of the Undead Crypt. This powerful weapon can help those who wield it to overcome any obstacle.

Item Description: A sacred chime blessed by Princess Filianore, matriarch of the church. Filianore's favor knows no boundaries, and this sacred chime expands the range of vicinity-affecting miracles that heal, cure, or provide other enhancements.
Story: The chime was a beautiful, golden object. It had a delicate design, with intricate swirls and curves. It was small, but it had a powerful effect. The chime was a sacred object that belonged to Princess Filianore, the matriarch of the church. Princess Filianore had a special connection to the chime, and it could do amazing things. For example, it could heal people, cure diseases, and even provide other enhancements.

Item Description: Sword wrought from the remains of a god who should have lived a life eternal. Thoughts on what the weapon portends are many and varied. Some consider it the mark of a great sin, or a sign of great devastation. Some think of it as the end of an age, while others; the beginning.
Story: The sword is a powerful tool, and its origins are shrouded in mystery. Some say that the sword was forged from the remains of a god who should have lived a life eternal. Though thoughts on what the weapon portends are many and varied, some consider it the mark of a great sin, or a sign of great devastation. Others think of it as the end of an age, while others; the beginning.

Item Description: Hatchet used in ancient sacrificial rite. A Deathbird is depicted as a malevolent deity. The power of the rite yet lingers. A small amount of FP is restored upon slaying a foe.
Story: The hatchet was used in an ancient sacrificial rite. The Deathbird was depicted as a malevolent deity, and the power of the rite yet lingers. A small amount of FP is restored upon slaying a foe.

Item Description: A ring given to Farron's Undead Legion by one of the preacher twins, known more commonly as the Crystal Sages. Shortens spell casting time. The sorcerers of Farron's Abyss Watchers were known to be lonesome warriors who would only rely upon more pragmatic spells.
Story: The Crystal Sages were two twin sisters who lived in Farron's Abyss Watchers. They were known for their powerful magic, and they gave a ring to Farron's Undead Legion as a gift. This ring shortened the time needed to cast spells, which was very helpful to the sorcerers of Farron's Abyss Watchers.

Item Description: Robe worn by Big Hat Logan. It is said to have been from his apprentice days at Dragon School, but it is so worn out, no one knows what it originally looked like. Logan, who cared little for his appearance, no doubt ever bothered to change out of it
Story: Logan's old robe is so tattered and worn that no one knows what it originally looked like. Legend has it that it was from his apprentice days at Dragon School, but no one knows for sure. Logan, who cared little for his appearance, probably never bothered to change out of it.

Item Description: Thick burgundy robe. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.
Story: The robe was worn by a sage who was driven from their home. They were deemed heretical by the people of their town, and so they were forced to leave. Now, they wander the world, seeking knowledge and understanding.

Item Description: Crystal catalyst presented as a gift from the Crystal Sages to their favorite pupil, Kriemhild. Crystal spheres devour the will of the user, and this staff increases the potency of sorceries at the cost of increased FP consumption by Skills. Skill: Steady Chant Boost the strength of sorceries for a very short period. Works while equipped in either hand.
Story: Kriemhild was excited to receive her new crystal catalyst from the Crystal Sages. She eagerly put it to use, increasing the potency of her spells while sacrificing her own FP. However, she soon found that her spells were becoming increasingly unstable. She needed to find a way to balance her use of the catalyst with her own needs, or she would risk losing control of her magic.

Item Description: Special material used in a Holy Chalice ritual. A body part of a saint, sacrificed by the Healing Church in their search for Truth
Story: The Holy Chalice is a special ceremonial cup used in the Healing Church's search for Truth. It is said to contain a body part of a saint, sacrificed by the church in their quest for knowledge.

Item Description: Scroll containing sorceries of the Crystal Sages. Give to a sorcerer to learn Sorceries of the Sages. As any sorcerer knows, sorcery is a talent, and these sorceries were refined to nurture a very special talent.
Story: The scroll contained the sorceries of the Crystal Sages. Any sorcerer who possessed it could learn the sorceries of the Sages. The sorceries were designed to nurture a very special talent.

Item Description: Special material used in a Holy Chalice ritual. A body part of a saint, sacrificed by the Healing Church in their search for Truth. The additional rite Fetid Offering invigorates the watchers, making them more treacherous than normal, but also making them worthy prey for a special hunt
Story: The Healing Church prized the body parts of saints as a source of power. When they discovered a way to use these parts to enhance their rituals, they quickly became the most powerful religious organization in the world. However, their search for Truth has led them to become even more treacherous than normal. Anybody who partakes in a Holy Chalice ritual with a body part from a saint risks becoming more treacherous and more worthy of being hunted.

Item Description: A silver bident decorated by a holy symbol, formerly wielded by Saint Klimt. He discarded this weapon, that draws upon one's faith, on the day that he put his own faith behind him. Skill: Charge Hold spear at waist and charge at foe. Use strong attack while charging to extend the length of the charge.
Story: Saint Klimt was a great painter, but he was also a devout Christian. One day, he decided to put his faith behind his art and discard his holy bident. He never looked back, but he always regretted not using the weapon to its fullest potential. One day, he may be able to reclaim his former glory with the power of his faith behind him.

Item Description: Sacred chime for casting miracles of the Gods. A bellvine cut from a small saint-tree that has been meticulously tended to. Saint-tree bellvines are customary in the far north, and allow for faster casting than ordinary sacred chimes.
Story: The sacred chime was a beautiful bellvine cut from a small saint-tree that had been meticulously tended to. It was said that Saint-tree bellvines were customary in the far north, and allowed for faster casting than ordinary sacred chimes. The bellvine had been blessed by a priestess of the gods, and its sweet notes could summon miracles of the gods.

Item Description: Hood worn by miracle-casting clerics. Grants slight increase to spell uses. Belonged to Licia of Lindelt. Lindelt is founded upon stringent commandments. Its inhabitants often travel to distant lands for ascetic training, but more than a few of these trainees liberate themselves from Lindelt's teachings in the process. Dress worn by miracle-casting clerics. belonged to Licia of Lindelt. While its true Licia dedicated herself to miracles, its rare for anyone to pass through life without trouble. even clerics arent always who they seem
Story: Licia of Lindelt was a cleric who wore a hood that granted her slight increase to spell uses. Licia was a strict follower of Lindelt, a city founded on stringent commandments. However, Licia eventually broke free from Lindelt's teachings and traveled to distant lands for ascetic training. While on one of her travels, Licia liberated herself from Lindelt and continued to practice miracles.

Item Description: A ring bestowed upon a Carim Saint. Allows attunement of additional spells. In Carim, the saints give voice to the ancient tales. They memorize countless cumbersome sacred books and read them in sonorous tones, a function for which they are widely renowned.
Story: A ring bestowed upon a Carim Saint. Allows attunement of additional spells. In Carim, the saints give voice to the ancient tales. They memorize countless cumbersome sacred books and read them in sonorous tones, a function for which they are widely renowned.

Item Description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. Ivory talismans are given only to women clerics, and faith greatly affects their effectiveness. There is a certain frailty to this talisman, which undermines the steadfastness granted by its Skill. Skill: Unfaltering Prayer Temporarily increases poise while casting miracles, preventing enemy attacks from interrupting prayer. Works while equipped in either hand.
Story: The ivory talisman was given to a young woman cleric as a sign of her faith. The talisman granted her the steadfastness to cast miracles, but it also had a weakness. If the talisman was taken off, the cleric's poise would decrease and she would be vulnerable to enemy attacks.

Item Description: Crossbow wielded by sanctum knights. Strong attack fires dark bolts. These guardian knights were sentenced to eternal stewardship of the Sanctum in a clandestine ritual carried out in the great depths, but today the sanctum receives nary visitor.
Story: The crossbow wielded by the sanctum knights is a powerful weapon that fires dark bolts. These guardians were sentenced to eternal stewardship of the Sanctum in a clandestine ritual carried out in the great depths, but today the sanctum receives nary visitor. The crossbow is kept locked away in a secret chamber, and is only used for ceremonial purposes.

Item Description: A mace wielded by sanctum soldiers. This mace was corrupted by poison when Sinh, the sleeping dragon, awoke. A mere mortal would be asphyxiated by the poison emitted when wielding this, but for the noxious sanctum soldiers, this fact matters none.
Story: The mace was once a beautiful weapon, but now it is tainted with poison. The sanctum soldiers who use it know this, but they don't care. The poison is a deadly weapon, and it is their duty to use it.

Item Description: Crossbow wielded by sanctum knights. Strong attack fires dark bolts. These guardian knights were sentenced to eternal stewardship of the Sanctum in a clandestine ritual carried out in the great depths, but today the sanctum receives nary visitor.
Story: The crossbow wielded by the sanctum knights is a powerful weapon that fires dark bolts. These guardians were sentenced to eternal stewardship of the Sanctum in a clandestine ritual carried out in the great depths, but today the sanctum receives nary visitor. The crossbow is kept locked away in a secret chamber, and is only used for ceremonial purposes.

Item Description: A legendary weapon of the Way of the White granted to an Undead paladin long ago Once blessed with the protection of a white flame but its power has all but faded so that it provides only slight HP recovery
Story: The White Flame Sword was once a legendary weapon of the Way of the White. It was blessed with the protection of a white flame, but its power has all but faded so that it provides only slight HP recovery.

Item Description: Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.
Story: The hood of the Lord of Blood's assassins is a dark and ominous piece of clothing. It is made of a dark cloth with gold embroidery, and is worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. These assassins are known to strike from pools of blood, and are said to be missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

Item Description: Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. The grand metallic pattern on the shoulder is a signifier of the noble rank they intend to claim upon the advent of the new dynasty they are working to install.
Story: The robe worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood is a signifier of their rank and their intentions for the new dynasty they are working to install. The grand metallic pattern on the shoulder is a signifier of their noble rank.

Item Description: Waistcloth sewn from black cloth. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.
Story: The waistcloth is a dark, ominous cloth, made from the finest black cloth. It is worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood, and is known to strike from pools of blood. These assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood, and they are feared by all who know of them.

Item Description: A spear that was embedded in a stone statue. According to an old local legend, a great spear was used to defeat Santier, the walking statue. Perhaps this is that very spear. But it will be difficult to utilize such a thing in the manner of a spear. Your only choice is to swing it around, and smite foes about the head.
Story: The spear is a relic from a long forgotten war. It is said that a great spear was used to defeat Santier, the walking statue. The weapon is powerful, but difficult to use in the manner of a spear. The only way to use it is to swing it around and smite foes about the head.

Item Description: One of the trick weapons of the workshop, commonly used in the hunting business. This saw, effective at drawing the blood of beasts, transforms into a long cleaver that makes use of centrifugal force. The saw, with its set of blood-letting teeth, has become a symbol of the hunt, and only grows in effectiveness the more grotesquely transformed the beast.
Story: The workshop's trick weapon, the saw, can transform into a long cleaver that uses centrifugal force to draw blood from beasts. The more grotesquely the beast is transformed, the more effective the saw becomes.

Item Description: Badge crafted long ago at the Workshop. Attests to one's prowess as a hunter of beasts. The Workshop is gone, and no group recognizes this meaningless badge, except the messengers in the bath, Who understand its profundity. Certain things can only be entrusted with a hunter in possession of this badge, or so they believe.
Story: The badge is a sign of distinction and skill among hunters. It is said that only those who are truly skilled in the art of hunting can wear it. Whoever possesses this badge is considered to be a master of the hunt.

Item Description: One of the trick weapons of the workshop, commonly used by those who dedicate themselves to the hunt. This saw, effective at drawing the blood of beasts, transforms into a medium-range spear. The saw, with its set of blood-letting teeth, has become a symbol of the hunt, and only grows in effectiveness the more grotesquely transformed the beast.
Story: The workshop's trick weapon, the saw, is a versatile tool that can transform into a medium-range spear. It is said that the more grotesquely the beast is transformed, the more effective the saw becomes.

Item Description: Armor reinforced with small metal scales. The cape covering the shoulders is made with treated rock lizard skin, and provides ample protection against fire.
Story: The armor is made from treated rock lizard skin, and it provides ample protection against fire. The cape covering the shoulders is made from this same material, and it provides warmth in cold climates.

Item Description: Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it high effective against non-physical attacks. Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survived to this day.
Story: Istvan was a valiant old knight who fought in many battles throughout his long life. One day, he was attacked by a group of bandits who were using physical attacks. Istvan's armor was made of metal that was reinforced with hard scales, making it virtually immune to physical damage. Even after being stabbed multiple times, the old knight was able to fight on and defeat his attackers.

Item Description: Padded cloth armor with the telltale stains of the scarlet rot. Worn by foot soldiers in General Radahn's army
Story: The foot soldiers of General Radahn's army were always the first to fall in battle. They were the cannon fodder, the ones who were sent into the fray without any hope of survival. And yet, even in death, they retain their dignity. They are the first to fall, but they are also the last to be forgotten.

Item Description: Scepter in the form of a hand grasping a pearl. Signature weapon of Sir Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. The pearl stands for the world, the heavens, and an eye, representing the many forms of knowledge, never fully attainable. Even knowing that, the All- Knowing's hand grasps for it.
Story: The scepter is a powerful magical artifact that belonged to Sir Gideon of Nirn, the All-Knowing. The pearl at the top of the scepter represents the world, the heavens, and an eye, representing the many forms of knowledge, never fully attainable. The All-Knowing's hand grasps for the pearl even though he knows it is never fully attainable.

Item Description: A ring engraved with a potrait of a scholar. Increases intelligence. In Lothric, the Scholar has long been considered one of the Three Pillars of the king's rule, and is therefore master of the Grand Archives.
Story: The ring was given to the scholar as a token of appreciation for his many years of service to the kingdom. The ring increased the scholar's intelligence, allowing him to learn and remember more quickly.

Item Description: .A candlestick covered in ivory scales once used by the Scholars of the Great Archives. This served as their guiding light, as well as a tool of self-restraint. Even today, wielders of this weapon benefit from the resulting sorcery-strengthening properties.
Story: The Scholars of the Great Archives were a group of mages who used this candlestick to help them control their magic. Today, anyone who wields it benefits from increased sorcery power.

Item Description: Small, curved sword. Each hit inflicts little damage, but fluid chain attacks are deadly. The scimitar's sharp slashing attacks are effective against cloth and flesh, but not against metal armor or tough scales.
Story: The small, curved sword is a weapon that is not as effective as other weapons against metal armor or tough scales, but its chain attacks are deadly. The weapon was created by a skilled swordsmith who wanted to create a weapon that was effective against both cloth and flesh. The weapon is named after the deadly chain attacks that it is capable of performing.

Item Description: A small curved sword with a narrow blade. The rapid slashing of the lightweight scimitar hardly allows the victim to catch a breath. Has a sharp blade, but is rather ineffective against armour and hard skin.
Story: The scimitar is a deadly weapon that is perfect for quick, slashing attacks. It is lightweight and easy to handle, but its blade is relatively ineffective against armor and hard skin.

Item Description: A curved sword with a single-sided blade. Delivers slashing attacks with its sharp blade, but is ineffective against armor and hides covered in tough scales. Smaller in size than most curved swords, it carves into enemies with quick, sharp cuts.
Story: The curved sword is a small, single-sided blade that is designed for slashing attacks. It is small in size, making it easy to conceal, and its sharp blade cuts through enemies with quick, sharp cuts.

Item Description: Dagger fashioned from a great scorpion's tail, glistening with scarlet rot. A ceremonial tool used by heretics, crafted from the relic of a sealed outer god.
Story: The dagger is a ceremonial tool used by heretics. It is crafted from the relic of a sealed outer god. The scorpion's tail is glistening with scarlet rot, a sign of its power.

Item Description: Halberd with a large blade. Scythe adjusted for battle. Designed especially for slicing. However one false swing leaves one wide open.
Story: The Halberd with a large blade is a finely crafted weapon meant for slicing through enemies. However, one false swing can leave the user wide open for an attack. This weapon is designed specifically for battle, and is meant to be used with precision.

Item Description: A scythe fitted with a large custom blade. Has an extended slashing reach when swung broadly, but beware, these attacks make the wielder very vulnerable.
Story: The scythe is a powerful weapon that has a long reach when swung broadly. However, be careful as this weapon makes the user very vulnerable.

Item Description: The scythe used by Titchy Gren, and by believers in Nahr Alma, god of blood. Normally used only in ceremonies. Imbued with the power of dark. This is no place for talk of such things, however.
Story: Titchy Gren's scythe is a powerful tool used in Nahr Alma ceremonies. It is imbued with the power of dark, and is normally only used in such ceremonies. However, in this place, there is no room for talk of such things.

Item Description: Scythe of the Forlorn, who wander the land of the Undead. The King's elder brother Aldia sought to overcome the curse through means unalike his sibling's. The Forlorn were born of Aldia's sinful infatuation.
Story: The Scythe of the Forlorn is a legendary weapon that was created by Aldia, the King's elder brother. Aldia sought to overcome the curse that had befallen his brother by using a different method than his sibling. The Forlorn were born as a result of Aldia's sinful infatuation.

Item Description: Staff of Olenford the sorcerer. A catalyst for sorceries and hexes.Olenford, revered as the father of sorcery in Melfia, sought knowledge that surpassed mankind's ken, and so ventured into the Undead Crypt, and did away with his humanity. Some hold the theory that Melfian sorceries and pyromancies originated within the boundaries of Drangleic, in ages past.
Story: Staff of Olenford. A staff said to be the catalyst for sorceries and hexes. Olenford, revered as the father of sorcery in Melfia, sought knowledge that surpassed mankind's ken, and so ventured into the Undead Crypt, and did away with his humanity. Some hold the theory that Melfian sorceries and pyromancies originated within the boundaries of Drangleic, in ages past.

Item Description: A bow built for sea-faring marine warriors. Has an extended range for hunting down sea monsters from afar. A great sea lies to the north of Drangleic, and beyond that is an explored continent that is home to things inhuman.
Story: The bow is a powerful weapon designed for use by marine warriors. It has an extended range, making it ideal for hunting down sea monsters from afar. Beyond Drangleic, an unexplored continent lies waiting, home to creatures that are beyond human understanding.

Item Description: Liquid medicine concocted at Byrgenwerth. Calms the nerves. Those who delve into the arcane fall all-too-easily to madness, and thick human blood serves to calm the frayed nerves of these inquisitive minds. Naturally, this often leads to a reliance on blood ministration.
Story: A madman's cure for the sane.

Item Name: Seed of a Tree of Giants
Item Description: A lump of something, obtainable from a Giant-tree. Makes enemies react to invaders. When the giants fell, they grew into great trees. Death is not the end, for anything that has ever once lived remains a part of a great cycle of regeneration. But what of those outside of the cycle?
Story: The giants that once roamed the land were slain by the humans. In their death, they grew into great trees. Some say that the giants are still alive, deep in the bark of the trees. Those who touch the lump of something find that they are suddenly the target of all hostility. No one knows where the lump came from, but it is a powerful talisman.

Item Description: Metal (Piece Name) interwoven with coarse cloth. Able to endure the hardships of battle and prolonged travel. It is light considering the build, striking a fine balance between absorption and substance. Frequent shield users lighten the load by wearing a gauntlet on only one arm. These cloth trousers and leather boots are of no real note, but are durable and allow for easy movement.
Story: The Metal piece is a finely crafted shield that is light but durable. It is often used by shield users as a lighter weight option, as they wear a gauntlet on only one arm. The trousers and boots are of no real note, but are durable and allow for easy movement.

Item Description: Paired scimitars used by certain sellswords. The scimitars' sharp blades make for effective slashing attacks, but fare poorly against metal armor and tough scale-covered hides. With a scimitar in each hand, the wielder can vary their onslaught with unique left-handed attacks when in the proper stance. Skill: Spin Slash Slice into foes with a large spinning motion, and continue spinning to transition into a strong attack
Story: The scimitars were once wielded by the most skilled and feared sellswords in the land. They were sharp blades, but their effectiveness against metal armor and tough scale-covered hides was limited. With a scimitar in each hand, the wielder could vary their onslaught with unique left-handed attacks when in the proper stance. Spin Slash was a particularly powerful left-handed attack that could slice into foes with a large spinning motion, and continue spinning to transition into a strong attack

Item Description: Torch Given to protectors of the Erdtree. Its flames are bestowed with a special incantation which allows the bearer to see assassins cloaked in veils. Furnished on behalf of the Erdtree and the Grace-Given Lord such that a Night of Black Knives will never come again.
Story: The Torch was given to protectors of the Erdtree by the Grace-Given Lord. It is said that the bearer of the Torch can see assassins cloaked in veils, preventing a night of black knives.

Item Description: Malformed bow in the shape of a pair of poisonous snakes. Imbues arrows with poison through pagan magic, revealing its true worth when used with poison-infused arrows. Used by assassins known as the Formless Serpents.
Story: The Formless Serpents are a group of assassins who use Malformed bows to shoot arrows that are poisoned. The bows themselves are shaped like poisonous snakes, and the arrows that they shoot are infused with poison. This makes the bows incredibly powerful weapons, and the Formless Serpents are known for being the best assassins in the world.

Item Description: Curved sword fashioned in the image of an ancient serpent deity and tool of a forgotten religion practiced on Mt. Gelmir. Formerly used to offer up sacrifices, this sword restores HP upon slaying an enemy.
Story: The curved sword was crafted in the image of an ancient serpent deity. It was once used to offer up sacrifices to the deity, but now it is a forgotten religion that is practiced on Mount Gelmir. When used to slay an enemy, the sword restores the player's HP.

Item Description: Weapon that serves as both greatsword and spear. Thought to have been used to hunt an immortal great serpent in the distant past, it manifests a long blade of light when facing such a creature. When their master's heroic aspirations degenerated into mere greed, his men searched for a weapon with which they might halt their lord.
Story: The weapon known as the Lightbringer was used by a group of heroes to slay an immortal great serpent. The weapon manifested a long blade of light when facing such a creature, and the heroes' master's heroic aspirations degenerated into mere greed. When their master's men searched for a weapon to halt their lord, they found the Lightbringer.

Item Description: Sinister katana modeled after a serpent bone. The densely packed row of spines that jut away from the cutting edge are coated in a lethal poison.
Story: The Sinister katana is a deadly weapon that is modeled after a serpent bone. The densely packed row of spines that jut away from the cutting edge are coated in a lethal poison. Whoever wields this weapon will be able to take down their enemies with ease.

Item Description: Egg-bearer Eingyi keeps this roster of those who serve his master, a Daughter of Chaos. Eingyi praises those who offer significant humanity to alleviate his master's suffering. But what is praise from Eingyi really worth?
Story: Eingyi is a egg-bearer for a Daughter of Chaos. He keeps a roster of those who serve her, praising those who offer significant humanity to alleviate her master's suffering. But what is praise from Eingyi really worth?

Item Description: Egg-bearer Eingyi keeps this roster of those who serve his master, a Daughter of Chaos. Eingyi praises those who offer significant humanity to alleviate his master's suffering. But what is praise from Eingyi really worth?
Story: Eingyi is a egg-bearer for a Daughter of Chaos. He keeps a roster of those who serve her, praising those who offer significant humanity to alleviate her master's suffering. But what is praise from Eingyi really worth?

Item Description: A curved greatsword used in a mysterious ancient rite. Imbued with a frightful occult energy which restores HP with each hit.
Story: The greatsword was used in an ancient rite that restored HP with each hit. The occult energy within it was so powerful that it could even heal the most grievous of wounds.

Item Description: Common Yharnam clothing. Well-worn and damp with sweat.
Story: The common Yharnam clothing is well-worn and damp with sweat. It is the clothing of the common people, who toil in the heat of the city. The clothing is stained with the blood of the fallen, and it is a reminder of the cost of war.

Item Description: Dagger used by those who lurk in the shadows. Formed by bending a sword into the shape of a dagger. In Mirrah, the land of knights, there exists an order of shadow knights who carry out assassinations in the cover of darkness. Those who fled even the order of shadow knights had rejected all forms of honor, and resorted to unseemly mercenary work.
Story: The dagger was created by the shadow knights in order to assassinate their enemies in the dark. Those who fled the order of shadow knights had rejected all forms of honor, and resorted to mercenary work. They were despised by the other knights, and were often left to fend for themselves.

Item Description: Black cloth garb worn by spooks from an Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder their unique form of martial arts. White it sacrifices defense for the sake of greater mobility, it does offer resistance to bleeding and poison among other things, perhaps due to the nature of espionage
Story: The black cloth garb was designed to be as light as possible, so as not to impede the spooks' unique form of martial arts. The white cloth sacrificed some defense in order to gain greater mobility. It was made to resist bleeding and poison, due to the nature of espionage.

Item Description: Black cloth (Piece Name) worn by spooks from an Eastern land. Sacrfices defense for greater mobility. The late King Oceiros was obsessed by dragons, to the extent that he would later be known as the Consumed King. Countless assassins were sent to end his reign, but none returned.
Story: The black cloth worn by spooks from an Eastern land is a sacred item that sacrifices defense for greater mobility. The late King Oceiros was obsessed by dragons, to the extent that he would later be known as the Consumed King. Countless assassins were sent to end his reign, but none returned. It is said that the black cloth allows the wearer to move more quickly and evade danger.

Item Description: Used to hide in the cover of night. Those who are especially adept assassins are often hired as bodyguards. In an attempt to stave off the curse, King Vendrick hired shadowmen to put down the Hollows, but before long they were Hollowed themselves
Story: The shadowmen were once the best assassins in the land. But as the Hollows began to take over, the king hired them to put an end to the curse. But before long, they were Hollowed themselves. Now, their only hope is to find a way to break the curse and save their kingdom.

Item Description: A blade of bone coated with gruesome spinal fluid. Used by old labyrinth watchers, in particular, those presiding over rituals. When a Victim is cut by this blade, the green spinal fluid temporarily numbs the senses, disturbing the target's gross motor skills. The blade, never intended for battle, must cut deep to be effective, and breaks.
Story: The old labyrinth watchers used this blade to numb their Victims before cutting them. It was never meant for battle, and it broke when it cut too deep. Now, the blade is cursed and anyone who touches it risks becoming numbed and disoriented.

Item Description: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower shamans. The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.
Story: The ancestral followers are a group of shamans who live a long way from the Erdtree. They are waiting for new buds to grow from their bodies, and they believe their souls will grow from within.

Item Description: Curved sword with a thin blade of ample length. Light of weight despite its larger size, its slicing attacks come in rapid succession. A devastatingly powerful weapon in the hands of a skilled swordsman.
Story: The curved sword is a finely crafted weapon with a thin blade. It is light in weight, but its slicing attacks come in rapid succession, making it a devastating weapon in the hands of a skilled swordsman.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. Blood gems are especially rare blood stones that grow on coldblood. Blood gems are kneaded into weapons using workshop tools, but only when of matching shape. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks.
Story: The blood gem was a rare and powerful blood stone that grew on coldblood. It was said that only when of matching shape could a blood gem be kneaded into a weapon, and that the effects of the gem would be borne upon the physical attacks of the weapon.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Relics of land Lost between Used in infusion to create Sharp weapons. Sharp weapons gain 1 die of extra critical damage, and scale with dex
Story: The gem was a relic of a land that had been lost between worlds. It was used in infusion to create sharp weapons, which gained 1 die of extra critical damage. The weapons also benefited from the user's Dexterity modifier.

Item Description: Crossbow created from the soul of the Executioner's Chariot. Iron plate serves as a shield while firing. The merciless chariot inflicted agony upon others with utter impunity, and the crossbow created from its soul strives to protect from possible retribution.
Story: The crossbow was created from the soul of the Executioner's Chariot. The iron plate serves as a shield while firing, and the crossbow's merciless design seeks to protect those who wield it from possible retribution.

Item Description: Various Coins that are particularly luminous. There are very few uses for spare change during the hunt, but these will serve as guides through the darkness. Or, one could save them until morning, if it ever comes.
Story: In a dark and dreary world, the coins are the only light that can be seen. They are the only thing that can show the way to the next place. The coins are the only thing that can bring hope to the people.

Item Description: Headband decorated by a pair of shining horns. Worn by ancestral follower shamans. Horns with buds that also shine are ideal ceremonial items for ancestral worship. Strengthens Ancestral Infant's Head.
Story: The headband is a beautiful piece of jewelry, adorned with two shining horns. It is said that the horns are a symbol of power and authority for the ancestral followers of shamans. The headband is also said to strengthen the head of an infant during ceremonial worship.

Item Description: Small bow. Standard projectile weapon. Equip arrows to use. The Short Bow is the standard bow and very useful for luring things. This bow has both a lighter weight and a faster shooting speed than a longbow.
Story: The Short Bow is a standard bow that is very useful for luring creatures. It has a lighter weight and a faster shooting speed than a longbow, making it a great choice for hunters and archers.

Item Description: The type of small bow used by hunters in training. Equip arrows to use. Equip up to two types of arrows to give yourself immediate options in battle. Use arrows to hit enemies from afar to gain the upper hand by drawing first blood.
Story: The small bow used by hunters in training. It is equipped with arrows that can be used to hit enemies from afar, gaining the upper hand by drawing first blood.

Item Description: One of the root chalices that breaks various seals in the Old Labyrinth. The glass chalice, when full, is used in a short ritual to quickly create and join a Chalice Dungeon (not for use in a ritual using standard materials). Short rituals are conducted at the makeshift altar.
Story: The chalice was created by the first wizards in the world. They used the chalice to break the seals that protected the Old Labyrinth. Now, anyone can use the chalice to enter the labyrinth and explore its secrets.

Item Description: An exceedingly plain spear of modest weight. Simple to wield compared to many of its peers, its strong attack unleashes a series of successive piercing thrusts.
Story: The spear was simple, but its powerful attack was unmatched. It was a common weapon, but its user was not. They were a skilled warrior, and their weapon was their ally.

Item Description: This small straight sword is widely used to an extent only matched by the longsword. An accessible sword which inflicts consistent regular damage and high slash damage, making it applicable to a variety of situations.
Story: The small straight sword is a common weapon used by many people. It is a reliable weapon that inflicts consistent regular damage and high slash damage, making it applicable to a variety of situations.

Item Description: A small straight sword. Longer than a dagger, but still lightweight. Widely used, as it requires no particular strength. A reasonable choice that will suffice in many situations, but not the thing to take along if you expect to face any serious challenge.
Story: The small straight sword is a common weapon found in many fantasy stories. It is a reasonable choice for many situations, but is not the best choice for a challenge. In this story, the sword is used by a young girl to defend herself from an attack by a larger, stronger opponent.

Item Description: Curved sword with sharply curved blade. Created by Arstor, Earl of Carim. Requires great skill to wield, but evades shield defense to sneak in damage.
Story: The curved sword with a sharply curved blade was created by Arstor, Earl of Carim. It required great skill to wield, but it evaded shield defense to sneak in damage. The sword was coveted by many, but it was eventually stolen by a rogue swordsman. The swordsman used the sword to great effect, but eventually he was caught and killed. The curved sword was eventually recovered and returned to Arstor, Earl of Carim.

Item Description: A uniquely-shaped curved sword. The name of its creator is unknown, but he was clearly a true craftsman. The curved blade is designed to reach around an opponent's shield to deal damage.
Story: The curved sword was created by a craftsman who had a true gift for crafting. The curved blade is designed to reach around an opponent's shield to deal damage. The craftsman's name is unknown, but his work is legendary.

Item Description: Curved sword with a severely hooked blade. Its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard. Made to hunt down humans, this weapon requires high dexterity to wield efficiently.
Story: The curved sword is a deadly weapon that requires great dexterity to use effectively. It was made to hunt down humans, and its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite. Also known as stark stone. Reverses weapon infusion. Has the benefit of undoing the effects of infusion without reducing the reinforcement level.
Story: The gem was found in a dark corner of an old ruin. It was dusty and old, but when the gem was placed in the light it seemed to glow with a new life. The gem was called the stark stone because it could reverse the effects of weapon infusion. This meant that the wielder could undo the infusion process without reducing the reinforcement level.

Item Description: Special brew of Siegward of Catarina. Perfect for travel in its jolly barrel mug. Restores HP and temporarily boosts frost resistance. Leave it to Siegward to discover a drink that even an Undead can enjoy. Perhaps his long years spent Undead have left him wanting to drain a cup or two and revel as if he were still among the living.
Story: Siegward of Catarina is a legendary swordsman and brewer who spent centuries traveling the world. He discovered a special brew that restores HP and temporarily boosts frost resistance. One day, Siegward decided to take a sip of his drink while on a journey. Unfortunately, he was attacked by an Undead and was forced to drink his brew in order to survive. The Undead was so impressed by Siegward's drink that it decided to become a fan of his and follow him around.

Item Description: Siluria's Tree, weapon of one of the two honored as foremost among the Crucible Knights. The primordial form of the Erdtree is close in nature to life itself, and this spear, modeled on its crucible, is imbued with ancient holy essence.
Story: The Siluria's Tree is a weapon that is said to be one of the two most honored among the Crucible Knights. The Erdtree is a primordial form of the tree, and the spear is imbued with ancient holy essence. The weapon is said to be close in nature to life itself, and this makes it a powerful tool.

Item Description: Coin made of silver, with the portrait of the legendary Knight King Rendal on its face. Even coins of great value in the world of men have little value in Lordran, where the accepted currency is souls. Those who dream of returning to the outside world are fond of carrying these around
Story: The coin is a valuable item in the world of men, but it has little value in Lordran. It is common to see people carrying around coins in hopes of returning to the outside world. The coin is made of silver, and has the portrait of the legendary Knight King Rendal on it.

Item Description: Coin made of silver, with the portrait of the legendary Knight King Rendal on its face. Even coins of great value in the world of men have little value in Lordran, where the accepted currency is souls. Those who dream of returning to the outside world are fond of carrying these around
Story: The coin is a valuable item in the world of men, but it has little value in Lordran. It is common to see people carrying around coins in hopes of returning to the outside world. The coin is made of silver, and has the portrait of the legendary Knight King Rendal on it.

Item Description: Armor of the Silver Knights who protect Anor Londo. When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire, his knights split into two groups. The Silver Knights remained in the forsaken capital in the service of their goddess
Story: The Gold Knights, led by their lord, departed to seek new lands and adventure. The Silver Knights were tasked with guarding Anor Londo, the capital of the Undead. When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire, his knights split into two groups. The Silver Knights remained in the forsaken capital in the service of their goddess. The Gold Knights, led by their lord, departed to seek new lands and adventure.

Item Description: (Piece Name) of the Silver Knights allegiant to the royals of old. It is said that even after the family's passing, the knights continued to watch over their manor, and the ruined cathedral.
Story: The Silver Knights were a group of loyal knights who served the royals of old. Even after the family's passing, the knights continued to watch over their manor, and the ruined cathedral. One day, a young girl named Rose found a key hidden in the ruins of the cathedral. When she returned home, she found that her family had been kidnapped by the knights. She set out to find the knights and rescue her family.

Item Description: Shield of the Silver Knights of Anor Londo. A flowing canal is carved deep into its face. The Silver Knights stayed behind in Anor Londo to defend the illusory goddess and their shields are blessed with her divine protection.
Story: The Shield of the Silver Knights is a powerful shield that is blessed with the protection of the illusory goddess, Anor Londo. The shield is left behind by the Silver Knights who stayed behind to defend the goddess and their shields are said to be imbued with her divine power.

Item Description: The silver knights of Anor Londo guard the city using this beautifully slender weapon. The spear can be wielded by both hands in a focused thrust that uses one's body weight or swung in a large sweeping motion.
Story: The spear is a beautiful weapon that is used by the silver knights of Anor Londo. It can be wielded by both hands in a focused thrust that uses one's body weight or swung in a large sweeping motion.

Item Description: The silver knights of Anor Londo guard the city using this beautifully slender weapon. Its chain attacks, in which the wielder takes great advancing steps and makes use of his bodyweight, are deadly even in single hits.
Story: The silver knights of Anor Londo guard the city with their slender chain weapon. This weapon is deadly even in single hits, thanks to the wielder's great advancing steps and bodyweight use.

Item Description: In his youth, Leonhard suffered grave burns to his entire body. His face in particular, which he hid beneath his mask, was terribly scalded. He abstained from restoring these injuries, even after becoming a Finger of Roasaria. (Mask)
Story: Leonhard, a Finger of Roasaria, wears a mask to hide the terrible burns to his face from his youth.

Item Description: One of the ancient treasures of Anor Londo. Presented to Artorias for facing the Abyss. Effectively deflects the Dark of the Abyss, especially in its magic forms.
Story: The Darkmoon Blade is a legendary sword that was given to Artorias for his bravery in facing the Abyss. It is said that the sword effectively deflects the Dark of the Abyss, especially in its magic forms.

Item Description: One of the ancient treasures of Anor Londo. Presented to Artorias for facing the Abyss. Effectively deflects the Dark of the Abyss, especially in its magic forms.
Story: The Darkmoon Blade is a legendary sword that was given to Artorias for his bravery in facing the Abyss. It is said that the sword effectively deflects the Dark of the Abyss, especially in its magic forms.

Item Description: A tiny charm embedded with imitative magic. Use to transform into something to blend in. Use this talisman to hide from invaders. Only provides the most superficial camouflage, but sometimes that is enough to do the trick.
Story: The small charm was cool to the touch, the metal smooth and unblemished. It was small enough to fit easily in the palm of one's hand, and when placed around one's neck it felt reassuringly weighty. The charm was inscribed with runes that seemed to mimic the patterns of the surrounding skin, and when activated it began to change. The metal became rough and scaly, the runes blurring and merging until they were nothing more than a indistinct blur.

Item Description: A silver-black sickle imbued with the power of dark. The large arced blade reaches around shields and inflicts damage. The grave wardens vowed to ensure the tranquility of those who slumber in the Undead Crypt. If one dares disturb them, the grave wardens make no allowance for stature or riches, and will readily bury them along with the others.
Story: The sickle is a powerful weapon that is imbued with the power of dark. It is designed to inflict damage on shields and enemies, and is used by grave wardens to ensure the tranquility of those who slumber in the Undead Crypt.

Item Description: A silver-black spear imbued with the power of dark. The grave wardens vowed to ensure the tranquility of those who slumber in the Undead Crypt. If one dares disturb them, the grave wardens make no allowance for stature or riches, and will readily bury them along with the others.
Story: The grave wardens were a group of warriors sworn to protect the sleepers in the Undead Crypt. If anyone dared disturb them, they would be ruthless in their punishment. No one was safe from their wrath.

Item Description: Silver ring depicting a leaping feline. Reduces damage from falling. Legend has it that when cats grow old, a force brews within them, and they are reborn as something new.
Story: A ring that reduces damage from falling has been passed down through generations of cats. One day, a cat falls from a great height and the ring saves her life. From then on, the ring is known as the leaping feline ring.

Item Description: Silver ring depicting a leaping feline. Prevents damage from falling. In the Age of Gods, or possibily following it, an old cat was said to speak a human tongue, with the voice of an old woman, and the form of a fanciful immortal.
Story: A ring that prevents damage from falling. A feline leaping out of the ring is engraved on the inside. The ring is said to have been made by an old cat who could speak human language with the voice of an old woman, and the form of an immortal. The ring is said to have been given to an old woman who was said to be able to leap great distances.

Item Description: Choice weapon of Simon, one of the first Healing Church hunters. Simon despised firearms, and so the Church workshop had this specially fashioned to his liking. The large curved blade serves as a bow when transformed. But aside from a few close friends, Simon was scoffed at for his choice of arms, for who would dare face the beasts with a measly bow?
Story: Simon had always been a pacifist, preferring to use his healing powers to help others, not to take lives. But when the Healing Church began hunting down the creatures that were terrorizing the town, Simon knew he had to join in and protect his friends. So he begged the Church to make him a weapon like the ones the hunters used, and they agreed. Now, when Simon transforms his blade into a bow, he's able to take down any creature that comes his way. He

Item Description: A gem of infused titanite, said to be an object of infatuation for victims of stunted development. Used in infusion to create simple weapons. Simple weapons inflict magic damage and restore FP very gradually, to help even a simpleton muster some mettle.
Story: The gem was said to be an object of infatuation for victims of stunted development. It was used in infusion to create simple weapons that inflicted magic damage and restored FP very gradually, to help even a simpleton muster some mettle.

Item Description: Ring depicting a simpleton's flower. Wearer becomes invisible while rolling. This ring was worn by the soldiers of the Old Iron King, said to be blessed with divine protection. This ring only does one thing, but with ingenuity it can be fearsomely effective.
Story: The Ring of the Simpleton's Flower is a magical ring that grants the wearer invisibility. The ring was originally worn by the soldiers of the Old Iron King, who were said to be blessed with divine protection. However, with ingenuity, the ring can be fearsomely effective.

Item Description: Helm of the Channelers, sorcerers that serve Seath the Scaleless. The six eyes arranged in two vertical columns compensate for Seath's lack of sight. The heaviest of protective gear for sorcerers, and imbued with magic
Story: The Helm of the Channelers is a heavy protective gear that is imbued with magic. It was created by the sorcerers who serve Seath the Scaleless. The six eyes arranged in two vertical columns compensate for Seath's lack of sight.

Item Description: Skeletal mask that tightly grips the face. Worn by the assassin's of Ravensmount. This ritual implement relentlessly digs into the wearer's face, preserving one's human instincts while dressed in imitation of the Deathbirds.
Story: The Skeletal Mask is a ceremonial mask worn by the assassins of Ravensmount. It is made from leather and cloth and tightly grips the face, preserving one's human instincts while dressed in imitation of the Deathbirds. The mask is said to relentlessly dig into the wearer's face, preserving one's human instincts.

Item Description: A spice exuding a peculiar aroma. A spell demands devotion from the caster, but using this spice makes a chosen spell attainable with 1 less faith. Will only work with the assistance of a certain person. The spice does not raise one's faith, but only obfuscates the requirement.
Story: The spice was a rare and powerful item that required great devotion from the caster in order to use it. However, using the spice made a chosen spell attainable with 1 less faith. The spice did not raise one's faith, but only obfuscated the requirement. The only way to obtain the spice was to find a certain person who could help you use it.

Item Description: Skull Lantern of the Catacombs necromancer. Drops from his long beard locks. This lantern alights the Tomb of the Giants, Nito's light-devouring domain of death. Also serves as a fire damage strike weapon.
Story: The Skull Lantern of the Catacombs necromancer is a powerful item that drops from his long beard locks. This lantern alights the Tomb of the Giants, Nito's light-devouring domain of death. It also serves as a fire damage strike weapon.

Item Description: Skull Lantern of the Catacombs necromancer. Drops from his long beard locks. This lantern alights the Tomb of the Giants, Nito's light-devouring domain of death. Also serves as a fire damage strike weapon.
Story: The Skull Lantern of the Catacombs necromancer is a powerful item that drops from his long beard locks. This lantern alights the Tomb of the Giants, Nito's light-devouring domain of death. It also serves as a fire damage strike weapon.

Item Description: One of Courland's transposed wonders. Derived from the soul of a Soulfeeder. Easier to be detected by enemies. The Soulfeeder was a beast that insatiably absorbed souls to feed its own power. Even after its accursed corpse was burned, it is said that the pungent stench of souls left the air permanently stained.
Story: The Soulfeeder was a cursed beast that fed on the souls of the living. After it was burned, its foul smell lingered in the air for years. Some say that the Soulfeeder's soul still lingers in the area, waiting to consume the living once more.

Item Description: This ring was secretly worn by a surreptitious sorcerer at Vinheim Dragon School. The ring is engraved with an everlasting dragon in silent slumber, and masks all sound emitting from its wearer.
Story: The ring was worn by a sorcerer who was trying to keep their presence at Vinheim Dragon School a secret. The ring muffles all sound, making it difficult for anyone to hear them.

Item Description: An old ring of the Melfian Magic Academy.Depicts a soundly slumbering dragon. Masks the sounds made by its wearer. The precise origins of the Magic Academy are hazy, for over its long history, its faculty has been dissolved and reestablished at least a dozen times. Changed with Scholar of the First Sin: An old ring of the Melfian Magic Academy.Depicts a soundly slumbering dragon. Masks the sounds made by its wearer. Though unknown for certain, some say the founders of the academy were sinful men who came from across the northern seas. The sorceries they left behind were fragmentary, and barely legible, leading to the loss of much of their wisdom.
Story: The ring was once worn by a group of mages who were expelled from the Melfian Magic Academy for breaking the rules. The ring was created to mask the sounds made by the wearer, so that they would not be disturbed while they slept. It is said that the founders of the academy were sinful men who came from across the northern seas. Their sorceries left behind were fragmentary, and barely legible, leading to the loss of much of their wisdom.

Item Description: A small blue burr. Temporarily boosts magic defense. These burrs bloom magnificently on a shrub every few years, their color and effect determined by soil quality and recent weather. Known to have been used in rituals long ago.
Story: The small blue burr has a temporary effect of boosting magic defense. It blooms magnificently on a shrub every few years, its color and effect determined by soil quality and recent weather. The burr has been used in rituals long ago, and is known to have powerful effects.

Item Description: Small silverwork doll depicting a young squire. In the legendary old city of Irithyll situated in the Boreal Valley, the Pontiff Sulyvahn gave this doll to valued subjects, so that they might use it to cross the barrier when they return home. Listen carefully, and you can hear it say, Wherever you go, the moon still sets in Irithyll. Wherever you may be, Irithyll is your home.
Story: A small silverwork doll depicting a young squire. It is said that the Pontiff Sulyvahn gave this doll to valued subjects so that they might use it to cross the barrier when they return home. The doll is said to speak, and when listened to carefully, can be heard to say "Wherever you go, the moon still sets in Irithyll. Wherever you may be, Irithyll is your home." This doll would make a perfect gift for someone who loves

Item Description: The small banner used by envoys of Great Lord Gwyn in the days of yore. Face the ringed cliff and hold the banner high to summon facilitators of transport. For the pygmies, who took the dark soul, the Great Lord gifted the Ringed City, an isolated place at world's end, and his beloved youngest daughter, promising her that he would come for her when the day came.
Story: The small banner used by envoys of Great Lord Gwyn in the days of yore. Face the ringed cliff and hold the banner high to summon facilitators of transport. When the day comes that the Great Lord comes for his youngest daughter, she will know to look for the banner and hold it high to summon him.

Item Description: A small, very ordinary hair ornament. Although it has been lost for quite some time, one can still see signs of the care with which this tasteful ornament was once kept. Its colour would stand most brilliantly against a head of greyish hair.
Story: The hair ornament is a small, unremarkable piece of jewelry. It has been lost for a long time, but can still be seen signs of the care that was once put into it. The color would look especially beautiful against a head of grey hair.

Item Description: A small, very ordinary hair ornament. Although it has been lost for quite some time, one can still see signs of the care with which this tasteful ornament was once kept. Its colour would stand most brilliantly against a head of greyish hair.
Story: The small hair ornament had been lost for quite some time, but one could still see signs of the care with which it had once been kept. The ornament's colour would stand most brilliantly against a head of greyish hair.

Item Description: Small leather-covered round shield reinforced in critical spots with metal. Small shields are always less stable but landing critical hits after parry is easier
Story: The small shield was always less stable than the larger shields, but landing critical hits after parry was easier. One day, a skilled fighter found that by reinforcing the small shields in critical spots with metal, they became even more stable. This made it easier for them to land critical hits, and they became known as the metal-shield fighters.

Item Description: Small banner held by Lothric messengers. Hold up outside the main castle gate to be greeted by an escort. When the High Wall appeared, the path to the Undead Settlement was blocked, and messengers came bearing this banner. They were sent out with a duty, but had no way of returning.
Story: The banner held by Lothric messengers is a sign of hope to those who pass by. It is a reminder of the duty that Lothric's messengers have been given, and of the hope that they bring to those who see them.

Item Description: A smooth and silky stone Use to slightly restore HP The shine of this stone is no ordinary polish, and can only be achieved over a long period. Some in this land are in search of such stones.
Story: The smooth and silky stone is said to have the ability to slightly restore HP. Some in this land are in search of such stones, as they believe they can help improve their health.

Item Description: Armor of the Smelter Demon, a great mass of iron that was given life. High fire defense. The Old Iron King was possessed of a great bounty of ore, but was incinerated by a creature that rose from the infernal depths of the earth
Story: The armor of the smelter demon was a great mass of iron that was given life. It had high fire defense and was possessed of a great bounty of ore. The Old Iron King was possessed of a great bounty of ore, but was incinerated by a creature that rose from the infernal depths of the earth.

Item Description: Weapon wielded by the iron warriors that wander Brume Tower. Appears to have once been an axe, but in this terribly melted state it is little more than a great lump that crushes its foes by virtue of its sheer weight.
Story: The Iron Warriors were a fearsome and feared army of warriors who fought for the Emperor of Mankind. They were known for their heavy armour and their fearsome weapons, such as the axe-like weapon known as the Doomhammer. This weapon was so heavy and cumbersome that it was little more than a lump of metal, but its sheer weight was enough to crush any foe it came into contact with.

Item Description: An ultra greatsword forged from the soul of the Smelter Demon. Its blade bears the strength of terrible flames, a latent power unleashed by a strong attack. The earth spouted fire, and a beast arose from the flames. The short-sighted king was incinerated by the creature in one swing, and his castle devoured in a sea of flames.
Story: The Smelter Demon's soul was used to forge this ultra greatsword. The blade is infused with the power of terrible flames, and can unleash this power with a strong attack. The earth spouted fire, and a beast arose from the flames. The short-sighted king was incinerated by the creature in one swing, and his castle devoured in a sea of flames.

Item Description: An iron wedge forged in this land. Destroys the ashen idol. The ashen idol is of great consequence to Nadalia, who, having renounced her flesh, entrusts her very being to it.
Story: Nadalia, a priestess of the goddess of the moon, entrusts her very being to an ashen idol in order to escape the corporeal form she has forsaken. When an iron wedge is forged that can destroy the idol, Nadalia realizes that she must reclaim her body and return to her goddess.

Item Description: A perfectly smooth and silky stone. Use to restore HP. The shine of this stone is no ordinary polish, and can only be achieved over a long period. Some in this land are in search of such mystical stones.
Story: The stone was found in a field, and when picked up, it felt like silk in the hand. It was smooth to the touch, and the shine in its surface was unlike any polish that had been seen before. Some in the land were interested in this stone, as it was said to restore HP. However, the stone was not to be found anywhere else, and it was only found by chance.

Item Description: Armor of Smough, the Executioner, protector of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor Londo. It offers extremely high defense and can be worn by humans, but not without great difficult
