Story: The armor of Smough, the executioner, is a legendary piece of armor that is said to be the protector of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor Londo. It is said to offer extremely high defense, but only humans can wear it without great difficulty.

Item Description: Grotesque armor associated with Smough, the last knight to stand in defense of the ruined cathedral. Boasts extremely high defense and can be donned by humans, but not without great difficulty.
Story: The armor of Smough the Bold is said to be the most grotesque ever created. It is made of thick, iron plates that are almost impossible to break, and it boasts incredibly high defense. However, wearing it is a challenge, as the armor is only compatible with humans.

Item Description: Twisted great Hammer associated with Smough, the last knight to remain at his post, guarding the ruined cathedral. Restore HP while attacking, a carryover from Smough's past as an executioner.
Story: The Twisted Great Hammer of Smough, the last knight to remain at his post, guarding the ruined cathedral. This mighty weapon is said to restore HP while attacking, a carryover from Smough's past as an executioner.

Item Description: Great Hammer from the soul of executioner Smough who guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo. Smough loved his work and ground the bones of his victims into his own feed ruining his hopes of being ranked with the Four Knights
Story: The great hammer, Smough's hammer, was once the tool of an executioner, but now it guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo. The hammer is stained with the blood of its victims, and the weight of its power has ruined the hopes of one of the Four Knights, who coveted the title of executioner.

Item Description: Gold mask worn by those who kill in the name of the Sable Church of Londor. A faint, kindly smile is bound to its surface, giving them the moniker Harlots of Death. What lies beneath that expression, however, is nothing more than the face of a darkly ashriveled Hollow.
Story: The Sable Church of Londor is a religious order that worships the dark god, Ashriel. They are infamous for their brutal killings, and their gold masks are worn by those who carry out their orders. The Harlots of Death are a special group within the church who are tasked with killing any who oppose them. Beneath their kind smile, they are ruthless killers who enjoy nothing more than taking lives.

Item Description: Black top hat worn by Marvellous Chester, a man of mystery lost in the past. The wearer of this top hat cracks a dubious, permanent grin. The Curse of Chester!
Story: The Black Top Hat worn by Marvellous Chester is a relic from a bygone era. The hat is said to have been worn by a man of mystery, and its grin is said to be a sign of bad luck. The hat has been cursed, and anyone who wears it is doomed to a permanent grin.

Item Description: Red feather bolts used with the Sniper Crossbow. Their long range makes them effective for sniping.
Story: The Red Feather bolts were used with the Sniper Crossbow. They had a long range, making them effective for sniping.

Item Description: Red feathered bolts used by snipers of Carim. Their long range makes them ideal for distant targets. Though typically used with Sniper Crossbows in Carim, these arrows can still be used with any kind of crossbow.
Story: The Red feathered bolts used by snipers of Carim are renowned for their long range. They are typically used with Sniper Crossbows in Carim, but can also be used with any kind of crossbow. These bolts are deadly accurate, and can take down even the most distant targets.

Item Description: Large crossbow with long distance used by Carim snipers. Often used with sniper bolts. But while crossbows are normally easy to use, the Sniper Crossbow requires dexterity.
Story: The Sniper Crossbow is a powerful crossbow that is used by Carim snipers. It is often used with sniper bolts, which are specially designed to travel long distances. The Sniper Crossbow requires great dexterity to use, as even the slightest mistake can result in a miss.

Item Description: Long-range heavy crossbow used by Carim snipers. Its lengthy base makes aiming difficult, and accurate usage requires a trained, dexterous hand.
Story: The Carim long-range heavy crossbow is a difficult weapon to use, but is deadly accurate when used by skilled snipers. The long base makes aiming difficult, but the weapon's lethality is unrivaled.

Item Description: Witch's pointed hat, frigid and frozen through. Of a style associated with practitioners of heretical sorcery. Strengthens cold sorcery. Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.
Story: The young Ranni found herself lost in the woods one winter day. She was cold and tired, and her feet were sore from the icy ground. Suddenly, she saw a woman in a pointed hat walking ahead of her. The woman was old, and her hat was frozen solid. The young Ranni was so surprised to see a witch that she stopped walking. The witch turned around and saw her. She smiled and said, "Hello, my dear. I'm a witch. I

Item Description: Witch's robe in the color of snow. Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.
Story: The young Ranni found herself lost in the woods one winter day. She was cold and tired, and her feet were sore from the icy ground. Suddenly, she saw a woman in a robe of snow. The woman called to her, and Ranni followed her into the woods. The woman was a witch, and she taught Ranni how to use her powers to protect herself from the cold. Ranni was grateful to the witch, and she always thought of her as her secret mentor

Item Description: Branding iron used by the jailers prowling Irithyll Dungeon. Press its searing tip against foes to inflict fire damage, and temporarily block Estus healing.
Story: The branding iron was used by the jailers who prowled Irithyll Dungeon. They would use it to inflict fire damage on their enemies, and to temporarily block Estus healing.

Item Description: A crossbow of simple make, usable by anyone, but lacking in both power and accuracy. Bolts must be equipped to use a crossbow.
Story: The crossbow was simple, made of wood and metal, and could be used by anyone. However, the bolts had to be equipped in order to use the crossbow, and it was not very accurate.

Item Description: Cloak worn by proper sorcerers who studied at Vinheim Dragon School. The majority take pride in having studied at the academy and look down on breaking the formal dress code established for sorcerers.
Story: The cloak was worn by a sorcerer who had studied at Vinheim Dragon School. The sorcerer took great pride in their education and wore the cloak with pride, even though it was not part of the formal dress code for sorcerers. The cloak was made from a special type of cloth that was very rare and only found in the school's library.

Item Description: Attire of a sorcerer from the Vinheim Dragon School. Long, ash-colored robes. Underneath is a deep blue sorcerer's coat; conventional uniform of the academy.
Story: The sorcerer's attire is typical of Vinheim Dragon School students. The ash-colored robes are long, reaching down to the floor. Beneath is a deep blue sorcerer's coat, which is the standard uniform of the academy.

Item Description: Sorcery catalyst used by sorcerers of Vinheim Dragon School. Equip catalyst to use sorceries. Attune sorceries from a scroll at a bonfire. Most sorceries have limited number of uses.
Story: The Sorcery Catalyst was used by the sorcerers of Vinheim Dragon School. It was used to equip and use sorceries. The Sorcery Catalyst could also be used to attune sorceries from a scroll at a bonfire. Most sorceries had a limited number of uses.

Item Description: The first staff of most sorcerers. A catalyst for sorceries and hexes. To use sorceries, attune a sorcery at a bonfire and equip a staff. The strength of most sorceries is affected by the caster's intelligence.
Story: The staff was a key part of any sorcerer's arsenal. It was a catalyst for their spells and allowed them to attune to sorceries at bonfires. The strength of a sorcerer's spells was often based on their intelligence, so having a strong staff was essential.

Item Description: Staff used to cast sorceries. A common catalyst given to sorcerers of the Vinheim Dragon School. Equip a catalyst to use sorceries. Sorceries must be tuned at a bonfire before use. Skill: Steady Chant Boost the strength of sorceries for a very short period. Works while equipped in either hand.
Story: The Staff of Sorcery was once used by Vinheim Dragon School sorcerers to cast powerful spells. Nowadays, it is only used as a catalyst to help power sorceries. When equipped, it allows the user to cast their spells with greater strength for a short period of time.

Item Description: A twinblade originating in Melfia. Doubles as a Catalyst for Sorcery. A rare weapon used by very few warriors, owing to its dependence in honed skills with both staff and sword.
Story: The twinblade was a weapon that originated from Melfia. It was a double-edged sword that doubled as a catalyst for sorcery. Very few warriors were able to use it effectively, as it required skilled use with both a staff and sword.

Item Description: Ring depicting a hand grasping a stone. Increases magic attack, but reduces physical defense. The origin of this ring is unknown, but its design suggests one of the darker deities. Effective use of this ring requires skill on the part of the wearer.
Story: The ring is said to have been created by one of the darker deities, and as such, it is effective at increasing magic attack but reducing physical defense. The wearer must be skilled in using the ring in order to reap its full benefits, as improper use can lead to disaster.

Item Description: A vessel that will accept your souls. It can allow reallocation of levels, but without proper assistance, it may simply drain you of souls. If you truly wish to start again, go to the place where your journey began.
Story: The vessel was a beautiful thing. It was made of polished black obsidian, and it shone like a star in the night. It was large enough to hold a person, but it could also be opened up to accept other things. The person who found it was a young woman. She was lost and alone, and the vessel seemed like a sign from the gods. She took it home and started to fill it with the souls of her loved ones. But the vessel

Item Description: One of the secret treasures restored in Aldia. Raises the number of spells you may attune. This modest-looking ring contains very powerful magic. To imagine what unspeakable deeds were performed to create such rings, one need only recall the cruel fate of the resident of Aldia.
Story: The ring restored in Aldia was a powerful artifact that allowed its wearer to attune to a greater number of spells. The ring's creator, a resident of Aldia who suffered a cruel fate, is a reminder of the power the ring holds.

Item Description: Blood-drained, shrunken ear. Souvenir taken from subduing the guilty. The knights called the Blades of the Darkmoon punish the guilty-soaked offenders of the Gods and take this as proof of their conquest. The earless corpses of the guilty will be left behind as a warning to others, inspiring both fear and respect for the Gods. Such is the eternal mandate of the Dark Sun
Story: The earless corpses of the guilty will be left behind as a warning to others, inspiring both fear and respect for the Gods.

Item Description: Blood-drained, shrunken ear. Souvenir taken from subduing the guilty. The knights called the Blades of the Darkmoon punish the guilty-soaked offenders of the Gods and take this as proof of their conquest. The earless corpses of the guilty will be left behind as a warning to others, inspiring both fear and respect for the Gods. Such is the eternal mandate of the Dark Sun
Story: The earless corpses of the guilty will be left behind as a warning to others, inspiring both fear and respect for the Gods.

Item Description: Badge crafted in secret by Archibald, the infamous eccentric of the Healing Church, for his friends. Archibald was fascinated by the blue sparks that emanate from the hides of the darkbeasts, and dedicated his life to its artificial reproduction. in a style of inquiry that, incidentally, closely followed the methodology of Byrgenwerth.
Story: A badge crafted by Archibald, the infamous eccentric of the Healing Church, for his friends. Archibald was fascinated by the blue sparks that emanate from the hides of the darkbeasts, and dedicated his life to its artificial reproduction. In a style of inquiry that, incidentally, closely followed the methodology of Byrgenwerth.

Item Description: Standard spear used commonly by soldiers. Long reach and can be used with shield up. Effective against hard exteriors and hits for high damage at the right moment of an enemy's swing. But the hit radius is small and it is easily blocked by shields
Story: The standard spear was used commonly by soldiers because it had a long reach and could be used with a shield up. It was effective against hard extersiors and could hit for high damage at the right moment of an enemy's swing. However, the hit radius was small and it was easily blocked by shields.

Item Description: A standard spear. Spears allow one to attack a foe from a distance, and while holding up a shield. Thrusting attacks are effective even against opponents with strong defense, but they have a narrow point of contact and won't effectively break through a shielded defense.
Story: The spear was a common weapon used by warriors. It allowed one to attack a foe from a distance, and while holding up a shield. Thrusting attacks were effective even against opponents with strong defense, but they had a narrow point of contact and wouldn't effectively break through a shielded defense.

Item Description: Stoneplates, the symbol of a true knight, grant the strength to face various hardships. The precious rare speckled stoneplate grants a small boost to defense against magic, flame, and lightning.
Story: The stoneplates were a symbol of a true knight. They granted the strength to face various hardships. The speckled stoneplate granted a small boost to defense against magic, flame, and lightning.

Item Description: A ring bestowed upon students of a certain standard at the Melfian Magic Academy. Its soul-based quartz increases magic defense. Pyromancer Glocken crafts these replicas, much to the dismay of the conservative old-guard faculty.
Story: The ring bestowed upon students of a certain standard at the Melfian Magic Academy. It is said that the soul-based quartz increases magic defense. Pyromancer Glocken crafts these replicas, much to the dismay of the conservative old-guard faculty.

Item Description: Stoneplates, the symbol of a true knight, grant the strength to face various hardships. The blue stoneplate symbolizes souls, and boosts defense against magic.
Story: The stoneplates were a symbol of a true knight. They granted the strength to face various hardships, and the blue stoneplate symbolized souls.

Item Description: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills. Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.
Story: Rogier was born with a rare gift for glintstone sorcery. He could use the stones to cast powerful spells, but he never showed any interest in using his gift. He spent his days wandering the land, never staying in one place for too long. One day, Rogier met a woman named Elin. Elin was a sorceress of great power, and she was looking for a new apprentice. Rogier was hesitant at first, but Elin was persuasive. She told Rogier

Item Description: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills. Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.
Story: Rogier was born with a rare gift for glintstone sorcery. He could use the stones to cast powerful spells, but he never showed any interest in using his gift. He spent his days wandering the land, never staying in one place for too long. One day, Rogier met a woman named Elin. Elin was a sorceress of great power, and she was looking for a new apprentice. Rogier was hesitant at first, but Elin was persuasive. She told Rogier

Item Description: Curved sword forged from the soul of the Duke's Dear Freja. Its blade is coated with a sticky silk that is cast with each strong attack, slowing enemy movement. Supposedly, the duke himself, an eccentric soul fascinated with spiders, went on to take a form that was far from human.
Story: The Curved Sword is a unique weapon that was forged from the soul of the Duke's Dear Freja. The blade is coated with a sticky silk that is cast with each strong attack, slowing enemy movement. Supposedly, the duke himself, an eccentric soul fascinated with spiders, went on to take a form that was far from human.

Item Description: Shield of the savage mountain bandits. Uniquely-shaped with a large black spider etched upon it. Has resistance to poison.
Story: The shield was once the property of a savage mountain bandit clan. The black spider was their symbol, and the shield was made to protect them from the poisons of their enemies.

Item Description: Thrusting sword forged from the soul of the Duke's Dear Freja. Its needle-like blade can easily pierce the seams of the toughest armor. Supposedly, the duke himself, an eccentric soul fascinated with spiders, went on to take a form that was far from human.
Story: The thrusting sword was forged from the soul of the Duke's Dear Freja. It is said that the duke himself, an eccentric soul fascinated with spiders, went on to take a form that was far from human. The needle-like blade can easily pierce the seams of the toughest armor. Supposedly, the duke was so skilled with this sword that he was able to defeat an entire army of spiders single-handedly.

Item Description: A Caestus with the rivets replaced by blood loss-inducing spikes. Fists weapons come in pairs, and two-handing this weapon will it to both hands.
Story: The Caestus is a weapon that is unique in that it has rivets that have been replaced with blood loss inducing spikes. When wielded in two hands, the spikes will cause immense damage to the opponent.

Item Description: A club with beast fangs wrapped around the striking end. The uneven spread of fangs causes blood loss. Given only to the toughest of demi-humans, this weapon is a badge of honor. Or so the demi-humans believe.
Story: The club is a symbol of strength and power to the demi-human race. It is said that only the strongest of demi-humans can wield this weapon with its uneven spread of fangs, causing blood loss. This weapon is a badge of honor to those who can claim it, and is seen as a sign of bravery.

Item Description: Choice weapon of the evangelists of the Cathedral of the Deep, mentors of the dwellers of the Undead Settlement. Its long, sharp spikes cause great pain and bleeding.
Story: The choice weapon of the evangelists of the Cathedral of the Deep was a long, sharp spike that caused great pain and bleeding. The spikes were used to mentor the dwellers of the Undead Settlement, and the evangelists believed that the pain and bloodshed that the spikes caused was a sign that the dwellers were being converted to the true faith.

Item Description: Weapon comprised of a spiked cylinder attached to a long pole. Capable of dealing strike damage when swung. The spikes induce blood loss. Weapon of the Marionette Soldiers employed by sorcerers.
Story: The weapon is a spiked cylinder attached to a long pole. When swung, the spikes induce blood loss, causing enemies to bleed out and be incapacitated.

Item Description: A spear said to have been forged in Aldia. Contains the power of a great flame, which is unleashed in a strong attack. The mysterious Lord Aldia secluded himself inside a manor to conduct various experiments. Those invited to the manor disappeared, replaced over time with malformed beasts that formed its halls
Story: The spear said to have been forged in Aldia is said to contain the power of a great flame, which is unleashed in a strong attack. The mysterious Lord Aldia secluded himself inside a manor to conduct various experiments, and those invited to the manor disappeared, replaced over time with malformed beasts that formed its halls. One day, a young girl named Lily was invited to the manor, and she found herself in the middle of the experiments. Lord Aldia saw her

Item Description: Bolts that explode immediately after being shot. Makes unusual shots possible, and releases splinters that cause immense bleeding. These are, after all, prototypes created by the weapon craftsman Edmond. You get what you pay for.
Story: You are a mercenary out to make a name for yourself. One day, you come across a group of bandits. They are well armed and armored, and you know you won't be able to take them on alone. So, you pull out your bolts and prepare to take them down. Suddenly, one of the bandits pulls out a bolt of his own and shoots it at you. The bolt explodes right in front of you, releasing splinters that cause immense bleeding. You know you're

Item Description: A long-handled greatsword that made its way from a distant land. Crafted entirely with steel, making it exceedingly heavy. Splitleaf refers to the shape of the great blade, and its resemblance to the veins of a leaf. Skill: Wind Wheel Spin weapon vigorously above head and sweep foes, and transition with normal or strong attack for continued spin attacks, which whip up wind and gain momentum, strengthening subsequent attacks.
Story: The long-handled greatsword was crafted from steel, making it exceedingly heavy. The blade was shaped like a splitleaf, with veins running along its length. The weapon was said to have originated from a faraway land, and was skillfully crafted. The weapon's spinning ability was said to be vigorous and powerful, and it was also capable of generating wind. The weapon was able to be wielded in a variety of ways, including using the weapon's wind-generated momentum to sweep

Item Description: A whip born from the soul of the Demon of Song. Covered with strange spots that betray its poisonous effects. The Demon's sonorous voice, in stark contrast to its hideous form, is sure intended to lure people close so that it may devour them.
Story: The whip is a cursed object that was created from the soul of the Demon of Song. The Demon's sonorous voice is sure to lure people close so that it may devour them, while the whip's strange spots betray its poisonous effects.

Item Description: Candlestand torch that burns with a light-purple flame. The carvings depict St. Trina, but in adult form, somewhat unnervingly. The light-purple flame induces sleep.
Story: The Candlestand Torch is a magical item that burns with a light-purple flame. The carvings depict St. Trina, but in adult form, somewhat unnervingly. The light-purple flame induces sleep.

Item Description: Staff held by a priestess of Amana. A ritual staff that was not intended for use in battle, but nevertheless it functions as a catalyst for sorceries and hexes. The Demon was contained within the shrine by sacred rituals. but over time the tradition was lost, and the Demon set free. It gained knowledge, and learned to lure humans into its lair using song.
Story: The staff was once used for religious ceremonies, but it was not meant for combat. The Demon that was trapped within the shrine used the staff to lure people into its lair, and it eventually gained knowledge and abilities that made it a threat to society. The staff was eventually destroyed, but the lessons learned from its use will always be remembered.

Item Description: Staff missing its glintstone. Wielded by sorcerers who believe that discovery comes through acts of asceticism. This staff only distinguishes itself when casting invisibility sorceries, but that is reason enough for some to wield it.
Story: The Staff of Invisibility is a staff that is only distinguishable when casting invisibility spells. It is said that the staff is wielded by sorcerers who believe that discovery comes through acts of asceticism.

Item Description: Ceremonial staff depicting the Erdtree in its historic radiance. Wielded by the avatars who protect the Minor Erdtrees. The avatars, emerging in the wake of the Elden Ring's shattering, were determined to protect the withering Erdtree's offspring.
Story: The Ceremonial Staff of the Erdtree is a powerful artifact that was used by the avatars who protect the Minor Erdtrees. The staff was created after the Elden Ring shattered and the avatars were determined to protect the withering Erdtree's offspring.

Item Description: A heretical staff fashioned from a smoldering, withered sapling that turns the blood of sacrifices pierced by it into glintstone. Similar to hex magic. Sorceries are scaled with faith rather than intelligence when wielding this staff which enhances Thorn sorceries in particular.
Story: The staff was created by a heretical sect of sorcerers who believed that the power of faith was more powerful than the power of intellect. Using the smoldering, withered sapling as their base, they crafted the staff with the intention of using Thorn sorceries in particular to their fullest potential. Because of this, the staff enhances Sorceries based on faith rather than intelligence, giving those who wield it an edge over their opponents.

Item Description: Staff of the lost land of Olaphis. Sorcery-dedicated catalyst. Cannot be used to cast hexes. The crystal at the tip of the staff greatly augments spell strength. Already a finely-crafted staff, made even more effective by its crystal, the brilliance of which has been polished over time with powerful magic.
Story: The Staff of the Lost Land of Olaphis is a powerful sorcery-dedicated catalyst that cannot be used to cast hexes. The crystal at the tip of the staff greatly augments spell strength.

Item Description: A trick weapon fashioned by the workshop heretics, the Powder Kegs. Favored by the retired hunter Djura. The stake driver, with its queerly complex design, violently drives thick stakes into the flesh of foes. The stake driver allows for high-damage critical attacks, but is difficult to use and leaves its wielder wide open, but none of this should bother a mere Powder Keg.
Story: The Powder Kegs are a strange weapon that was created by the workshop heretics. It is a stake driver that has a very complex design. It is favored by the retired hunter Djura. The stake driver allows for high-damage critical attacks, but is difficult to use and leaves its wielder wide open. However, this should not bother a mere Powder Keg.

Item Description: Dried fecal waste material, marked by a long plant stalk that was not properly digested. Throw behind at enemies to inflict toxin build-up, but also ups your own toxicity. Strictly speaking, this consists of different material than the dung pie, but waste is waste, no sense in splitting hairs.
Story: The long plant stalk that was not properly digested was a clear sign that the creature that had produced it was not fit for life. The stench it emitted was unbearable, and the toxin it created was deadly. Anyone unfortunate enough to come into contact with it would quickly become sick and die.

Item Description: Standard arrow. Arrows must be equipped to be fired
Story: The standard arrow is a common item in fantasy stories. It is often used as a weapon or tool. In some stories, the standard arrow is magical and can be used to shoot powerful spells.

Item Description: Standard crossbow bolt. Used mainly with the Light Crossbow. Equip crossbow with a bolt to fire
Story: The crossbow bolt was a common weapon used by crossbow users. It was a simple, standard bolt that was used mainly with the Light Crossbow. To fire the bolt, the crossbow user would need to equip the crossbow with a bolt.

Item Description: Spherical iron manifer covered in spikes which induce blood loss. Used in brutal games of pugilism
Story: The spherical iron manifer is a brutal weapon used in games of pugilism. The spikes on the manifer cause blood loss, and the weapon is often used to inflict maximum damage on the opponent.

Item Description: Curved Greatsword of black steel wielded by General Radahn. A pair of weapons decorated with a lion mane motif. Radahn earned considerable renown as the Starscourge in this youth, and it is said that it was during this time he engraved the gravity crest up these blades.
Story: The curved greatsword of black steel is a finely crafted weapon that was once wielded by General Radahn. The gravity crest is a pair of weapons decorated with a lion mane motif, and it is said that it was during this time he engraved the crest into the blades. Radahn earned considerable renown as the Starscourge in this youth, and it is said that it was during this time he inflicted terrible casualties on the enemy.

Item Description: Armor of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor. Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead
Story: The armor of the Knights of Berenike is legendary for its heavy armaments and armor. Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.

Item Description: A relic of an order of knights said to be the mightiest warriors of their time
Story: The relic is a set of armor said to have been worn by the knights of an order said to be the mightiest warriors of their time. The armor is incredibly heavy and requires two people to wear it, but it is said to be incredibly powerful. The knights who wore the armor were said to be unrivaled in battle.

Item Description: Torch wound with metal wire. The flame can illuminate dark locales, or be used to attack enemies. Heavier than a normal torch, but the heated filament boosts fire damage dealt.
Story: The torch is a powerful tool that can be used for both illumination and attack. The metal wire in the torch's flame makes it heavier than a normal torch, but this extra weight also makes it more damaging.

Item Description: Moss-covered armor of the Stone Knight, defender of the Darkroot Garden. The Stone Knight is a product of ancient magic, and although this armor is also imbued with magic, it is incredibly heavy.
Story: The Stone Knight is a legendary figure who protects the Darkroot Garden. He is said to be a product of ancient magic, and his armor is so heavy it is impossible to move without assistance. Despite this, the Stone Knight is a powerful fighter, and he is always ready to defend his home.

Item Description: Signature weapon of battlemages, hewn from hard glintstone. This club is much heavier than its size suggests, but has no magic power. So that they not lose sight of the true essence of combat, battlemages prefer to feel the impact of their blows, fighting their opponents hand to hand.
Story: The battlemage's signature weapon is a hefty club made from hard glintstone. It's much heavier than it looks, but it has no magical power. The battlemage prefers to fight hand-to-hand, feeling the impact of each swing.

Item Description: Greataxe borne by the stone knights who guard the forest Sanctuary. This greataxe requiring inhuman strength to wield and more fitted to manual labor than battle is nevertheless completely lethal
Story: The greataxe was borne by the stone knights who guarded the forest Sanctuary. These knights were incredibly strong and required inhuman strength to wield, but their greataxe was more suited to manual labor than battle. Despite this, the greataxe was completely lethal, able to cleave through even the toughest of armor.

Item Description: Mossy round greatshield used by the guardian of the Darkroot garden the Stone Knight. The Stone Knight is a creation of ancient magic and this shield is imbued with the same power but is also extremely heavy
Story: The Stone Knight is a guardian of the Darkroot Garden, a sacred place in the forest that is home to many mystical creatures. The Stone Knight is a powerful being, and his greatshield is imbued with the same power as his sword. However, the shield is also extremely heavy, making it difficult for the Stone Knight to move around.

Item Description: The Stone Knights who guard the Darkroot Garden wield this moss-covered greatsword. The same magic which created the Stone Knights is imbued in the sword. Unleash this power by wielding the sword with two hands.
Story: The Stone Knights who guard the Darkroot Garden are a sacred order of protectors sworn to safeguard the dark roots of the garden. For generations, they have wielded a greatsword imbued with the same magic that created them. Now, the sword is in the hands of a new generation of knights, and it is up to them to unleash its power and protect the garden from harm.

Item Description: The beloved ring of the gallant Shieldless Lothian, formerly of Forossa. Hits greatly reduce enemies poise. The effect may seem trivial, but for those who comprehend how critical it is to exploit a hole in enemy defenses, the significance of this ring will be clear.
Story: The Shieldless Lothian was once a valiant knight of Forossa, but he was tragically slain in battle. Now, his ring grants its wearer great poise reduction, which can be incredibly helpful in taking down enemies. However, the true power of the ring lies in its ability to exploit enemy weaknesses. By reducing their poise, the wearer can easily take down their opponents without having to fight them head-on.

Item Description: Twinblade of the castle stone soldiers. Sir Velstadt could always be found at the King's side, and followed him when he fled. The knights in his service waited patiently for his return, but turned to stone before he did.
Story: Sir Velstadt was a loyal knight to the King, and when he fled the scene of a battle, his knights followed suit. However, before they could reach him, they turned to stone. Now, Sir Velstadt is lost forever, and his loyal knights remain frozen in stone.

Item Description: Curved sword imbued with the strength of the Stormdrake. The Nameless King, ally of the ancient dragons, fought beside the Stormdrake in countless battles. When the great beast fell, the king claimed his soul, as was the custom in the age of gods Skill: Tornado Imbue blade with the wrath of storm in a spinning motion, and follow with a strong attack to bear that wrath upon foes.
Story: The Nameless King claimed the soul of the Stormdrake, an ancient dragon that fought beside him in countless battles. He infused the sword with the dragon's strength, and used it to devastating effect in his battles against his enemies.

Item Description: Greatsword with a broken blade, also known as the Giantslayer for the residual strength of storm that brings giants to their knees. Yhorm the Giant once held two of these, but gave one to the humans that doubted him, and left the other to a dear friend before facing his fate as a Lord of Cinder. Skill: Storm King Assume stance to imbue sword with storm. Most effective when facing giants.
Story: The greatsword known as the Giantslayer was once wielded by Yhorm the Giant, a mighty warrior who was feared by all who knew him. One day, Yhorm gave the sword to a group of humans who had been critical of him, telling them that it would be their salvation if they ever needed it. Shortly thereafter, Yhorm was defeated by a group of giants and took his own life with the sword in his hand. Today, the sword is still feared by

Item Description: Battle axe designed to resemble a hawk, with its wings comprising the blade. Signature weapon of warriors who strive to remain one with the storm, despite being so far from their place of birth. Their hearts are proud, and thereby easily undone.
Story: The Battle Axe was designed to resemble a hawk, with its wings comprising the blade. It was the signature weapon of warriors who strived to remain one with the storm, despite being so far from their place of birth. Their hearts were proud, and thereby easily undone.

Item Description: Staff of a heretic storyteller who shares tales of the Painted World to forlorn souls. The storytellers, too, are wretched beings with no place to go. Their bodies, souls, and even their staves are all tainted through and through. Skill: Poison Spores Expel noxious spores from the formless, parasitical things that inhabit the staff.
Story: The staff of a heretic storyteller who shares tales of the Painted World to forlorn souls. The storytellers, too, are wretched beings with no place to go. Their bodies, souls, and even their staves are all tainted through and through. They use their staff to expel noxious spores from the formless, parasitical things that inhabit the staff.

Item Description: The hilt of this lost sword was found discarded in the Undead Asylum. Only slightly better than one's bare hands, and not recommended for extensive use. Be certain to find a replacement quickly.
Story: The sword's hilt was found discarded in the Undead Asylum. It was only slightly better than one's bare hands, and not recommended for extensive use. However, the sword's blade was still sharp and deadly. Be certain to find a replacement quickly, as the sword's power could be used to defend oneself or others.

Item Description: An oddly deformed iron ring. Increases the strength of its wearer. The Old Iron King ruled over a great age of iron. The King's power allowed him to mold iron freely, as if he held sway over the forces of life and creation.
Story: The ring was old and battered, but the inscription on the inside still shone brightly. It read, "The strength of my hand shall be the strength of my kingdom." The ring's wearer would become incredibly powerful, able to lift and wield objects with ease. The ring was passed down from king to king, until it finally found its way to the hands of the current Iron King.

Item Description: Uniform of the students of Byrgenwerth, a bygone institute of learning. Features a thick cape. The Healing Church has its roots in Byrgenwerth, and naturally borrows heavily from its uniform design. The focus not on knowledge. or thought. but on pure pretension would surely bring Master Willem to despair, if only he knew.
Story: The uniform of the students of Byrgenwerth is a thick cape that features a Healing Church emblem on the front. The focus of the school was knowledge and thought, but the Healing Church has turned it into a place of pure pretension. Master Willem would be despairing if he knew.

Item Description: A secret symbol left by Caryll, runesmith of Byrgenwerth. This transcription of the Great Ones' inhuman voices depicts downreaching currents. This rune means Deep Sea and grants augmented resistance.Great volumes of water serve as a bulwark guarding sleep, and an augur of the eldritch TruthOvercome this hindrance, and seek what is yours. The additional rite Fetid Offering invigorates the Watchers, making them more treacherous than normal, but also making them worthy prey for a special hunt.
Story: The runes on the staff were strange and unfamiliar, but Caryll knew what they meant. The symbols depicted downreaching currents, and Caryll knew that this rune meant Deep Sea. The rune also granted Caryll augmented resistance to the effects of water, which Caryll knew would be important in her quest. Finally, the Fetid Offering rune was important because it would invigorate the Watchers, making them more treacherous than normal. Caryll knew that she needed to find a way

Item Description: Charred, ashen bones. Cast them into the Far Fire in Majula to increase the HP restored with each use of your flask. They say these are the remains of a saint who cast himself into the bonfire. But we will never know for sure, for soot and ashes tell no story.
Story: The bones of a saint are said to increase the HP restored with each use of a flask in Majula. The ashes and soot tell us nothing of their story, but they remain a powerful talisman for those seeking to heal themselves.

Item Description: Bandage worn upon awakening to the nightmare of blood and beasts. Terribly worn and unsanitary. A faint memory recalls blood ministration, involving the transfusion of unknown blood. Not long after. the nightmare began.
Story: The bandage is a remnant of a nightmare that has haunted the protagonist for months. In the nightmare, they are a doctor who is forced to perform blood transfusions on beasts. The bandage is stained with the blood of the beasts and is horribly worn and unsanitary. The protagonist vaguely remembers that the nightmare began after they began performing blood transfusions on unknown blood.

Item Description: Ring associated with Gwynevere, princess of sunlight and eldest daughter of Gwyn, the First Lord. The ring is vaguely warm, like a beam of sunlight, and gradually restores HP. Gwynevere left her home with a great many other deities, and became a wife and mother, raising several heavenly children.
Story: When Gwynevere left her home to become a wife and mother, she took her ring with her. The ring is warm and gentle, like the light of the sun. It slowly restores HP, and Gwynevere was able to keep her family safe and healthy while she was away. When she returned, she was welcomed back with open arms, and she and her husband continued to raise their children in the light of the sun.

Item Description: Ring of the Heirs to the Sun covenant. Slightly increases miracle attack power. Worship of the sun, now a lost belief, was once widespread amongst great warriors. Members of this covenant can leave their golden signs to be more easily summoned to join their brethren in jolly cooperation. Praise the sun.
Story: The Ring of the Heirs to the Sun covenant is a golden sign that increases the power of miracles. It is a lost belief that was once widespread amongst great warriors. The members of this covenant can leave their signs to be more easily summoned to join their brethren in jolly cooperation.

Item Description: A well-forged long sword. Of unknown origin, and exhibiting no special power, but sturdily crafted. Perhaps it does not live up to its name, but nevertheless, merely wielding this sword seems to cause warmth to well up within one's bosom.
Story: The sword was forged long ago by an unknown craftsman. It was not meant to be special, but it was sturdy and well-made. The mere act of holding it made the user feel warm inside. It may not have been powerful, but it was a faithful friend.

Item Description: Talisman given to the knights of the Sunless Realm, who serve the nameless moon. Scales with intelligence, which is rare for a miracle catalyst, but makes it compatible with Dark. In this Sunless Realm, this fact is related first as an initial warning.
Story: The talisman was given to the knights of the Sunless Realm, who serve the nameless moon. The knights were told that the scales on the talisman were rare, but that it was compatible with Dark. The knights were warned that this fact would be related as an initial warning.

Item Description: Attire of a knight from the Sunless Realms, known for their resistance to both magic and the dark. Formed of a silk veil and silver headband. Sunless Knights serve the nameless moon, and perhaps it is for this reason the attire casts a feminine silhouette.
Story: The Sunless Knights are a secretive order of knights who serve the nameless moon. They wear a veil and silver headband, which gives them a feminine silhouette. This attire is said to be formed of a silk veil and silver headband, and is meant to resist both magic and the dark.

Item Description: This faintly warm medal, engraved with the symbol of the Sun, is the ultimate honour, awarded to show <those> who summon the Warrior of Sunlight and complete a goal. The symbol represents Lord Gwyn's firstborn, who lost his deity status and was expunged from the annals. But the old God of War still watches closely over his warriors.
Story: The Sun Medal is a prestigious award given to those who summon the Warrior of Sunlight and complete a goal. The symbol on the medal represents Lord Gwyn's firstborn, who lost his deity status and was expunged from the annals. But the old God of War still watches closely over his warriors.

Item Description: This faintly warm medal, engraved with the symbol of the Sun, is the ultimate honour, awarded to show <those> who summon the Warrior of Sunlight and complete a goal. The symbol represents Lord Gwyn's firstborn, who lost his deity status and was expunged from the annals. But the old God of War still watches closely over his warriors.
Story: The Sun Medal is a prestigious award given to those who summon the Warrior of Sunlight and complete a goal. The symbol on the medal represents Lord Gwyn's firstborn, who lost his deity status and was expunged from the annals. But the old God of War still watches closely over his warriors.

Item Description: Shield of Solaire of Astora Knight of Sunlight. Decorated with a holy symbol but Solaire illustrated it himself and it has no divine powers of its own. As it turns out Solaire's incredible prowess is a product of his own training and nothing else
Story: The Shield of Solaire of Astora is a finely crafted shield decorated with a holy symbol. It is unknown how or why the shield possesses no divine powers of its own, but it is clear that Solaire's incredible prowess is the result of his own hard work and dedication.

Item Description: This standard longsword belonging to Solaire of Astora is of high quality is well-forged and has been kept in good repair. Easy to use and dependable but unlikely to live up to its grandiose name.
Story: The longsword belonged to Solaire of Astora, a renowned swordsman who is known for his powerful attacks and impressive skills. The sword is easy to use and is dependable, but it is unlikely to live up to its grandiose name.

Item Description: Straight sword imbued with the strength of lightning. This featureless long sword contains the very power of the sun. Perhaps is a relic of one-sided adoration.
Story: The straight sword is a relic of one-sided adoration. It is imbued with the strength of lightning, and its power is unrivaled. The sword is said to have been created by a god or goddess who only loved one side of the spectrum, the light side. As a result, the sword is incredibly powerful and able to cut through anything.

Item Description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. The talisman of Solaire of Astora, the Knight of Sunlight, is decorated with a holy symbol, illustrated by Solaire himself. This talisman is a projection of Solaire's upstanding, unwavering faith.
Story: The talisman of Solaire of Astora is a powerful artifact that grants the user miraculous powers. Once belonged to the legendary Knight of Sunlight, Solaire's faith and conviction is etched all over the talisman, granting whoever possesses it incredible strength and resilience.

Item Description: The Knight of Sunlight's personal talisman for casting miracles of the Gods. The talisman bears the Knight's own holy illustration, an emblem of his unwavering faith. Use of the talisman's Skill fills the user with similar steadfastness.
Story: The Knight of Sunlight's personal talisman is a powerful tool that allows him to cast miracles of the Gods. The talisman bears the Knight's own holy illustration, an emblem of his unwavering faith. When used, the Skill fills the user with similar steadfastness, allowing them to face any challenge with confidence.

Item Description: Helm of Hodrick, holy knight of the Sunless Realms. This light gold (Piece Name), named for its sunset hues, is now faded and wrapped in tainted rags. The sorry fool was known to wander the battlefield as a crazed ghoul, lashing out at friend and foe alike.
Story: Hodrick's Helm was once a shining symbol of honor and bravery. Now, it is a faded and tattered reminder of the madness that overcame its former owner.

Item Description: A staff said to have been forged in Aldia. A catalyst for sorceries and hexes. Particularly powerful for casting hexes. The mysterious Lord Aldia secluded himself inside a manor to conduct various experiments. Those invited to the manor disappeared, replaced over time with malformed beasts that roamed its halls.
Story: The staff was said to have been forged in Aldia, a land that was said to be home to some of the most powerful sorcerers in the world. The staff was said to be a powerful catalyst for hexes, and was particularly effective when casting hexes. The staff was also said to be particularly powerful when it came to casting hexes against those who were familiar with them.

Item Description: White surgical gloves. The intricate embroidery weaves a spell that protects their wearer. The Church engages in the hunt in a medical capacity. When a cancer is discovered, one must pinpoint its location, reach in, and wrench it from the host's bosom.
Story: The gloves are enchanted with a spell that protects their wearer from cancer. When a cancer is discovered, the gloves allow the wearer to reach in and remove it from the host's body.

Item Description: White surgical gloves. The intricate embroidery weaves a spell that protects their wearer. The Church engages in the hunt in a medical capacity. When a cancer is discovered, one must pinpoint its location, reach in, and wrench it from the host's bosom.
Story: The gloves are enchanted with a spell that protects their wearer from cancer. When a cancer is discovered, the gloves allow the wearer to reach in and remove it from the host's body.

Item Description: Ceremonial sword of Londor. Cannot be equipped as a weapon. It is said that a rite of wedlock will presage a true Hollow lord. Your spouse's name is Anri, who patiently awaits a rightful lord, deep within the mausoleum.
Story: You are Anri, the bride-to-be of Londor. You have been waiting for your prince to come and claim you as his bride, but he has not shown up. One day, you hear a rumor that a true Hollow lord is living deep within the mausoleum. You decide to go and find your prince, but when you get there, you find out that your spouse has been waiting for you all this time.

Item Description: Sinister greatsword fashioned from a giant's backbone. Metes out wounds like a lopsided saw-blade, and restores some FP upon defeating an enemy. Milos was undersized for a giant, and was viewed as sullied and terribly grotesque.
Story: The Sinister Greatsword is a fearsome weapon forged from a giant's backbone. It is a lopsided saw-blade that mows through enemies with ease, restoring some of their health in the process. Milos was undersized for a giant, and was viewed as sullied and terribly grotesque. Nevertheless, he was determined to prove himself and become the strongest giant in the land. One day, he found a giant's spine and crafted the Sinister Greatsword from it.

Item Description: Storied sword and treasure of Caria Manor. One of the legendary armaments. Astrologers, who preceded the sorcerers, established themselves in mountaintops that nearly touched the sky, and considered the Fire Giants their neighbors.
Story: The Storied Sword and Treasure of Caria Manor is a legendary armament said to have been forged by the astrologers, who preceded the sorcerers, and was said to have been forged from the Fire Giants' melted metal. It is said to be one of the most powerful weapons in existence, and is said to be able to slice through anything. The astrologers believed that the Fire Giants were their neighbors, and so they built their homes on mountaintops that nearly touched

Item Description: Silver sword carried by clerics of St. Trina. Inflicts sleep ailment upon foes. St. Trina is an enigmatic figure. Some say she is a comely young girl, others are sure he is a boy. The only certainty is that their appearance was as sudden as their disappearance.
Story: The clerics of St. Trina carry a silver sword that inflicts a sleep ailment upon foes. One day, a group of adventurers came across the clerics and attempted to rob them. The clerics woke up their sleeping foes with the silver sword, and the adventurers were quickly defeated.

Item Description: Fragment of the Armor of the loyal knight Syan. These solidly-crafted Gauntlets offer high defense. Sir Syan was widely known as the Kingdom's most loyal knight, and when the Giants invaded, he volunteered to lead the advance party, but he was slaughtered most dishonorably. The King commissioned replicas of Syan's accoutrements and bestowed them on promising knights, but not long after they donned the armor did most go thoroughly mad.
Story: The armor of Sir Syan was a symbol of his bravery and loyalty to his kingdom. When the giants invaded, he volunteered to lead the advance party. However, he was slaughtered most dishonorably and the King commissioned replicas of his armor to be given to promising knights. However, after they put on the armor, most of them went mad.

Item Description: Replica of the halberd of the loyal knight Syan. A meticulously-crafted, distinguished weapon. Sir Syan was widely known as the kingdom's most loyal knight, and when the Giants invaded, he volunteered to lead the advance party, but was slaughtered most dishonorably The King commissioned replicas of Syan's accoutrements and bestowed them to promising knights, but not long after they donned the armor did they thoroughly go mad.
Story: The King had commissioned replicas of Sir Syan's halberd as a sign of his appreciation for the knight's valiant service during the Giants' invasion. However, after the knights had donned the armor and begun to go mad, the King was forced to destroy the weapons.

Item Description: Twisted dagger favored by the wretched, failed prisoners of Irithyll Dungeon. Crafted from a feeble tailbone, and seen as a sign of the dragons. Their screams are oft heard inside the dungeon, as they naively mutilate their unworthy flesh.
Story: The Twisted Dagger is a cursed weapon that is favored by the wretched prisoners of Irithyll Dungeon. The weapon is made from a feeble tailbone of a dragon, and is seen as a sign of the dragons. The screams of the prisoners are often heard inside the dungeon, as they foolishly mutilate their unworthy flesh.

Item Description: Twisted dagger favored by the wretched, failed prisoners of Irithyll Dungeon. Crafted from a feeble tailbone, and seen as a sign of the dragons. Their screams are oft heard inside the dungeon, as they naively mutilate their unworthy flesh.
Story: The Twisted Dagger is a cursed weapon that is favored by the wretched prisoners of Irithyll Dungeon. The weapon is made from a feeble tailbone of a dragon, and is seen as a sign of the dragons. The screams of the prisoners are often heard inside the dungeon, as they foolishly mutilate their unworthy flesh.

Item Description: Twisted spear favored by the wretched, failed prisoners of Irithyll Dungeon. Crafted from a feeble tailbone, and seen as a sign of the dragons. Their screams are oft heard inside the dungeon, as they naively mutilate their unworthy flesh. Skill: Unleash Dragon Thrust the spear to unleash the strength of dragons, similar to an ancient dragon weapon, only with its power tragically faded.
Story: The twisted spear is a weapon that is favored by the wretched, failed prisoners of Irithyll Dungeon. It is made from a feeble tailbone, and is seen as a sign of the dragons. Their screams are oft heard inside the dungeon, as they naively mutilate their unworthy flesh. The skill to unleash the power of dragons is similar to an ancient dragon weapon, only with its power tragically faded.

Item Description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. Standard talisman issued to common believers. Equip talisman to cast miracles. Attune miracles from a scroll at a bonfire. Most miracles have limited number of uses.
Story: The Medium is a talisman that is issued to common believers and is used to cast miracles. The talisman is equipped to cast miracles by attaching it to a scroll at a bonfire. Miracles can be attuned from a scroll by holding it over the bonfire and selecting the desired miracle. Most miracles have a limited number of uses.

Item Description: Talisman for casting miracles of the Gods. Once a very common item among the ranks of the old Way of White. Equip a Talisman or a sacred chime to cast miracles. Miracles must be attuned at a bonfire before use.
Story: The talisman was once common among the ranks of the old Way of White. It was said that a talisman could be used to cast miracles, and that miracles must be attuned at a bonfire before use. Many people believed in the power of miracles, and many people used talismans to cast them. However, the talisman became rarer and rarer as the years went on. Now, only the most devout followers of the old Way of White still use talism

Item Description: Small round metal shield. Four protrusions used to parry attacks. Small shields are always less stable but landing critical hits after parry is easier. This shield is specialized for parrying
Story: The small round metal shield was created to be used as a parrying tool. It was designed to have four protrusions that would help deflect attacks. The shield was also made to be less stable, making it easier to land critical hits after a parry.

Item Description: Targray can appear obtuse, but the blue knight means no harm. He only wishes to offer guidance to those in need, for that is his purpose. This armor is of one who guides others. Belonged to Targray, Knight of the Blue. The Blue Sentinels have vowed to uplift themselves from tireless training and selfless adherence to order and justice. May this armor ease their difficult journey
Story: The Blue Sentinels are a group of knights who have sworn to uphold justice and order. One day, they were given this armor by Targray, a knight who has dedicated his life to helping others. The armor is meant to help the knights on their journey, and may grant them the strength they need to succeed.

Item Description: Robe worn by the pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Though it appears tattered, it is actually quite strong. Their attire offers substantial protection against poison, fire, and other forces of nature out in the hinterlands where they were driven.
Story: The robe worn by the pyromancers of the Great Swamp is actually quite strong. It offers substantial protection against poison, fire, and other forces of nature out in the hinterlands where they were driven.

Item Description: Silver-shining tear stone.Use to change into a droplet blood gem that fortifies any weapon. A doll sheds neither blood nor tears and thus its nature remains unknown. Whoever thinks this is precious must be troubled by severe naivete.
Story: The tear stone is a magical item that allows the user to transform into a droplet blood gem. This gem fortifies any weapon it is used on, making it a valuable asset in battle. However, the doll that contains the stone is unknown and mysterious, as it sheds neither blood nor tears. Whoever finds this doll and believes it to be valuable must be very naive.

Item Description: A ring set with a rare tearstone. Reacts when the wearer is in danger, temporarily increasing its wearer's physical attack power. Caitha, goddess of tears, mourns the undeserving dead, shedding tears as red as blood. It is said that the stone set in this ring is one such tear.
Story: The ring was once owned by Caitha, goddess of tears. When the wearer is in danger, the ring's tearstone will react and increase the wearer's physical attack power temporarily. Caitha uses this power to protect the innocent and punish the wicked.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. Blood gems are especially rare blood stones that grow on coldblood. Blood gems are kneaded into weapons using workshop tools, but only when of matching shape. Most triangular blood gems have effects that provide attribute bonuses and extra effects.
Story: The blood gem was a rare and powerful item. It was said that when it was kneaded into a weapon, it would fortify the weapon and add various properties. Blood gems were especially rare blood stones that grew on coldblood. Blood gems were kneaded into weapons using workshop tools, but only when of matching shape. Most triangular blood gems had effects that provided attribute bonuses and extra effects.

Item Description: A blood gem that forfortifies weapons and adds various properties. The sticky spots are indicative of a curse, but this gem's malicious effect are perfect for bolstering certain types of weapons Droplet gems are special gems that adapt to various weapons and shapes, naturally making them highly priced among hunters.
Story: The Droplet gems were once ordinary gems, but as they adapted to various weapons and shapes, they became highly prized among hunters. Some say that the gems are cursed, but those who know of their power are never afraid to use them.

Item Description: A blood gem that forfortifies weapons and adds various properties. The sticky spots are indicative of a curse, but this gem's malicious effect are perfect for bolstering certain types of weapons Droplet gems are special gems that adapt to various weapons and shapes, naturally making them highly priced among hunters.
Story: The Droplet gems were once ordinary gems, but as they adapted to various weapons and shapes, they became highly prized among hunters. Some say that the gems are cursed, but those who know of their power are never afraid to use them.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. Blood gems are especially rare blood stones that grow on coldblood. Blood gems are kneaded into weapons using workshop tools, but only when of matching shape. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks.
Story: The blood gem was a rare and powerful blood stone that grew on coldblood. It was said that only when of matching shape could a blood gem be kneaded into a weapon, and that most radial blood gems had effects that related to physical attacks.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. This particular specimen has a pronounced effect, due to its extended state of dampnes Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physicalattacks.
Story: The blood gem was a prized possession of the king. It was said that the gem had the power to fortify weapons and add various properties. However, the gem was also known to have a pronounced effect, due to its extended state of dampness.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. Blood gems are especially rare blood stones that grow on coldblood. Blood gems are kneaded into weapons using workshop tools, but only when of matching shape. Most waning blood gems provide rare special effects such as fire, bolt, or healing.
Story: The blood gem was a rare and powerful item. It was said to fortify weapons and add various properties. Blood gems were especially rare blood stones that grew on coldblood. Blood gems were kneaded into weapons using workshop tools, but only when of matching shape. Most waning blood gems provided rare special effects such as fire, bolt, or healing.

Item Description: A blood gem that fortifies weapons and adds various properties. This particular specimen has a pronounced effect, due to its extended state of dampness. Most radial blood gems have effects that bear upon physical attacks.
Story: The gem was found in a dried up riverbed. It was covered in moss and algae, and the light shining through the gem created a eerie glow. The gem was heavy, and when picked up it felt warm and heavy in the hand.

Item Description: Ancient catalyst of the Witch of Izalith and her daughters, used long before the dawn of chaos and of pyromancy. With the birth of the Chaos Flame, the flame witches were at once both sorcerers and shamans. Faith adjusts the power of sorceries cast using this catalyst, and the staff also seems to boost the power of dark sorceries.
Story: The Witch of Izalith's Catalyst was used long before the dawn of chaos and of pyromancy. With the birth of the Chaos Flame, the flame witches were at once both sorcerers and shamans. Faith adjusted the power of sorceries cast using this catalyst, and the staff also seemed to boost the power of dark sorceries.

Item Description: This sword one of the rare dragon weapons came from the tail of Seath the Scaleless the pale white dragon who betrayed his own. Seath is the grandfather of sorcery and this sword is imbued with his magic which shall be unleashed as a wave of moonlight
Story: The sword is said to have come from the tail of Seath the Scaleless, the pale white dragon who betrayed his own kind. Seath is the grandfather of sorcery, and this sword is imbued with his magic. When it is used, a wave of moonlight will be released.

Item Description: Unique curved sword, notched like shark's teeth. Weapon carried by corpse pillagers who prowl the sites of old battles. The blade is tacky with blood and covered in hefty nicks, making it totally uneven. Life can be sinister indeed.
Story: The curved sword is a weapon that is carried by corpse pillagers who prowl the sites of old battles. The blade is tacky with blood and covered in hefty nicks, making it totally uneven. Life can be sinister indeed.

Item Description: A thick droplet of coldblood containing Blood Echoes.Use to gain larger amount of Blood Echoes. A strong will produces thick blood. Doubtless, the product of obsession, a potent source of human strength.
Story: The Blood Echoes droplet is a powerful item that can be used to gain a large amount of Blood Echoes. The droplet is said to be the product of obsession, and as such, it is a source of human strength.

Item Description: Dagger with a crooked tip. A common accessory of thieves, shoddily crafted and without much bite
Story: The dagger had a crooked tip, something that made it perfect for thieves. It was a common accessory, something that was shoddily crafted and lacked much bite. But that was the point. It was meant to be a tool, not a weapon.

Item Description: Mask of sinners. They hide their faces, stifle their voices and hide in the shadows. It does not provide much in the way of defense
Story: The Mask of Sinners is a mask that was created to hide the faces of those who have committed crimes. It is said that the mask provides little defense, as those who wear it are often shunned by society.

Item Description: A greatsword forged from the soul of the Looking Glass Knight. Strong attack unleashes its latent power. Fearing something wicked, the King fled the castle and never returned. But his warrior, forever true to his command, stands ready to expunge those who would challenge him. Effect: special attack (strong attack)
Story: The Looking Glass Knight's greatsword was forged from his soul after he was killed in battle. The sword's special attack unleashes its latent power, and the King feared it would be used to harm others. However, the warrior forever true to his command stands ready to protect those who would challenge him.

Item Description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. This talisman is only granted to high-ranking Thorolund clerics. Has high miracle adjustment which, thanks to divine protection, is not dependent upon faith.
Story: The Thorolund clerics had long ago grown used to the miracles that their god, Thor, could perform. But when a new cleric, a young girl named Elise, was ordained, they were astounded by her ability to cast miracles with even greater ease than any of them. The clerics soon realized that Elise's talisman, which granted her this power, was not dependent upon faith. This made her a powerful ally in their fight against the demons that plagued their land.

Item Description: One of the trick weapons of the workshop, commonly used by hunters on their duties. Sufficiently deadly as a rigid bladed cane, but also serves as a whip when its blade is split into many. Concealing the weapon inside the cane and flogging the beasts with the whip is partly an act of ceremony, an attempt to demonstrate to oneself that the bloodlust of the hunt will never encroach upon the soul.
Story: The workshop's trick weapon is a deadly cane that can also be used as a whip. When the cane is split into many blades, it becomes a deadly weapon. The cane is used as a ceremonial tool to remind oneself that the bloodlust of the hunt will never encroach upon the soul.

Item Description: Half Plate worn by the Throne Defender. The Defender has stood by the throne for ages. Will his wait be worth the while?
Story: The Half Plate worn by the Throne Defender is a relic from a time long ago. The Defender has stood by the throne for ages, guarding it against any who would try to take it. But will his wait be worth the while?

Item Description: Used as a projectile. This simple weapon is easily utilized. Its range is limited, and it deals very little damage, but even still, it is a valuable tool in the absence of other ranged weapons.
Story: The simple, wooden bow is a common tool in the hands of farmers and hunters. Its limited range and lack of damage make it less desirable than other weapons, but it is still a valuable tool in the absence of other ranged weapons. One day, a farmer was out in the field hunting deer when he came across a group of bandits. He knew that he couldn't fight them head on, so he took his bow and shot one of the bandits in the leg. The bandits were so

Item Description: A ring bestow upon students of a certain standard at the Melfian Magic Academy. It's lightning quartz increases lightning defense. Pyromancer Glocken crafted so many of these replicas that they became widespread, such that his fellow magicians harshly scolded him for undermining lessons gained from harsh training.
Story: The Glocken Ring was a magical artifact that granted its wearer increased lightning defense. Pyromancer Glocken created many of these rings, which caused other magicians to harshly scold him for undermining his training.

Item Description: Stoneplates, the symbol of a true knight, grant the strength to face various hardships. The yellow stoneplate symbolizes thunder, and boosts defence against lightning.
Story: The stoneplates were a symbol of a true knight. They granted the strength to face various hardships and were yellow, representing thunder.

Item Description: Catalyst of the banishment sorcerers who flooded New Londo to seal off away the Darkwraiths and the Kings who fell to Dark. In contrast to other catalysts, the metal catalyst qualifies as a weapon, as it inflicts physical damage, however small.
Story: The metal catalyst was created by the sorcerers who flooded New Londo to seal off away the Darkwraiths and the Kings who fell to Dark. It was different from other catalysts in that it inflicted physical damage, however small.

Item Description: Catalyst imbued in terrifying crystal magic. Used by Logan after his fixation on Seath. Makes all sorceries incredibly powerful, but demands extremely high intelligence from its wielder, and halves sorcery usages.
Story: Logan had been obsessed with Seath the Scaleless for as long as he could remember. When he finally found him, Logan used the Catalyst to imbue his sorceries with incredible power. However, the Catalyst also required a high intelligence to use, and it reduced sorcery usage by half.

Item Description: Catalyst born from the soul of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, Darkmoon deity who watches over the abandoned city of the Gods, Anor Londo. Gwyndolin is Gwyn's lastborn and a legitimate god, but he is also a Moon sorcerer, and this wand is boosted by faith, not intelligence.
Story: The Darkmoon Catalyst is a powerful wand that is boosted by faith, not intelligence. It was created by Gwyndolin, the Darkmoon deity who watches over the abandoned city of the Gods, Anor Londo. Gwyndolin is Gwyn's lastborn and a legitimate god, but he is also a Moon sorcerer, and this wand is powerful because of it.

Item Description: Ring made of an ancient tiny red jewel. Grants small increase to HP. Rings grant powers large and small. Their discovery, and effective use, can make one's journey easier
Story: The ring was made of a small, red jewel. It granted a small increase to HP. The ring also granted powers large and small. Its discovery, and effective use, could make one's journey easier.

Item Description: Tiny Tonitrus is a unique weapon crafted by Archibald, the infamous eccentric of the Healing Church workshop. This is a similar morning star mace that utilizes Quicksilver Bullets. When struck into the ground, it recreates the blue sparks that are said to surround the darkbeasts. Like Archibald's masterpiece, this too is a superb conductor of the powerful blue sparks.
Story: The Tiny Tonitrus is a unique weapon crafted by Archibald, the infamous eccentric of the Healing Church workshop. This morning star mace utilizes Quicksilver Bullets, which are said to create blue sparks that surround the darkbeasts. When struck into the ground, the Tiny Tonitrus recreates the blue sparks that are said to surround the darkbeasts. Like Archibald's masterpiece, this too is a superb conductor of the powerful blue sparks.

Item Description: Tiny Tonitrus is a unique weapon crafted by Archibald, the infamous eccentric of the Healing Church workshop. This is a similar morning star mace that utilizes Quicksilver Bullets. When struck into the ground, it recreates the blue sparks that are said to surround the darkbeasts. Like Archibald's masterpiece, this too is a superb conductor of the powerful blue sparks.
Story: The Tiny Tonitrus is a unique weapon crafted by Archibald, the infamous eccentric of the Healing Church workshop. It is a morning star mace that utilizes Quicksilver Bullets. When struck into the ground, it recreates the blue sparks that are said to surround the darkbeasts. Like Archibald's masterpiece, this too is a superb conductor of the powerful blue sparks.

Item Description: Weapon of the titanite demon a faceless stone monster born from titanite slab. One of the enchanted weapons perhaps from residual power of the titanite slab. Known for its leaping attack which comes smashing down on foes from above
Story: The Weapon of the Titanite Demon is a faceless stone monster born from a titanite slab. It is one of the enchanted weapons perhaps from residual power of the titanite slab. Known for its leaping attack which comes smashing down on foes from above, the Weapon of the Titanite Demon is a fearsome foe.

Item Description: Titanite chunk for weapon reinforcement. Reinforces weapons to +1 Few records of chunks exist, and once one was discovered in Lothric, the race to locate Legendary Slabs began, but there have been no reports of success.
Story: The titanite chunk is a rare and powerful item that can be used to reinforce weapons to +1. The race to find and use these chunks was started when one was discovered in Lothric, but there have been no reports of anyone succeeding in doing so. This makes the chunk a coveted item, and anyone who finds one is sure to be able to make a powerful weapon.

Item Description: Titanite altered by a soul. Reinforces weapons to +3 Weapons forged by souls transposition can only be reinforced by titanite of the same kind. In rare cases, Crystal Lizards devour souls, growing to monstrous proportion and leaving these great scales.
Story: The titanite in your weapon has been enhanced by a soul. This makes it stronger and more durable, but it's only possible to do so if the titanite is of the same kind. Occasionally, Crystal Lizards will consume a soul, growing to monstrous proportions and leaving behind these great scales. These scales can be used to reinforce your weapons to +3.

Item Description: Material used in a Holy Chalice ritual. Mould that grows from rotten flesh and blood inside the old labyrinth. Matures to bear giant spores.
Story: The Chalice of Blood was used in a Holy ritual to summon a powerful demon. The mould that grew from the ritual's spoils was a giant, spore-bearing fungus. The fungus spread through the labyrinth, growing larger and more powerful with each passing day. Eventually, it reached the altar where the ritual had taken place, and began to consume the holy chalice.

Item Description: Attire of tomb prospectors who explore the old labyrinth on behalf of the Healing Church. The Healing Church traces its roots to Byrgenwerth, and is therefore aware of the ruins' true importance. They contain much more than mere hunter trinkets, indeed, they hide the very secrets of the old Great Ones. sought after by those with the insight to imagine greatness.
Story: The attire of tomb prospectors who explore the old labyrinth on behalf of the Healing Church. The Healing Church traces its roots to Byrgenwerth, and is therefore aware of the ruins' true importance. They contain much more than mere hunter trinkets, indeed, they hide the very secrets of the old Great Ones. sought after by those with the insight to imagine greatness.

Item Description: A unique trick weapon contrived by Archibald, the infamous eccentric of the Healing Church workshop. Striking this peculiar iron morning star flail like a match generates the same blue sparks that blanket a darkbeast. Unfortunately, for reasons untold, the hunters of Archibald's time did not fully take to the device.
Story: The morning star flail was created by Archibald, an eccentric member of the Healing Church workshop. The weapon is striking, resembling a match in appearance, and generates the same blue sparks that cover a darkbeast. Unfortunately, the weapon was not well-received by its contemporaries, as it did not seem to do much damage. However, the weapon's true power lies in its ability to generate the same blue sparks that cover a darkbeast. This power is only usable against

Item Description: A latticed, deformed rock, or perhaps a meteorite. Appears useless, but possesses some odd gravitational force that prevents its riddance. A dubious soul once said: Step lightly round to the right of the great cathedral, and seek an ancient, shrouded church... The gift of the godhead will grant you strength...Underground Cell Key
Story: The cell key is a small, rusty key that is said to grant its bearer strength and power. It is said to be hidden underground near the cathedral, and whoever finds it will be granted the gift of the godhead.

Item Description: Held in left hand, brightens dark areas. Used to light standing torches in certain areas and scare away some enemies. Time-limited usage
Story: The torch was a simple object, made of wood and held in the hand of a young man. He had used it to light standing torches in certain areas and scare away some enemies.
