But now, the torch was almost gone. The young man could see the darkness creeping closer and closer, and he knew that he had to find another torch. He had only used the torch for a few minutes, but it was already time-limited.

Item Description: Torch fastened to a long pole. Lights up dark areas, but cannot be raised overhead. Used by soldiers on watch, its attacks set foes aflame.
Story: The torch was a necessary tool for soldiers on watch. It provided light in the dark, but it could not be raised overhead. The torch's attacks set foes on fire, making them vulnerable to attack.

Item Description: Medium metal shield. Decorated with a tower the symbol of protection. A standard widely-used shield
Story: The shield is a standard piece of equipment for any soldier. It is used to protect the body from harm and is a symbol of protection. The shield is decorated with a tower, which is the symbol of protection. This shield is used by all soldiers and is a common item.

Item Description: Metal Greatshield. Used by the Knight Berenike known for his heavy armour. This plate of iron is heavily defensive but ultra heavy. Greatshields are very stable and deflect attacks. However one cannot parry and instead bashes with the shield
Story: The Knight Berenike was known for his heavy armor and metal greatshield. He was a powerful warrior and used his greatshield to deflect attacks and stable in the fight. However, one cannot parry with a greatshield and instead must bash the opponent with it.

Item Description: A staff enwreathed in a matte blackness. Found in the heart of the Dark Chasm. A catalyst for sorceries and hexes. No one knows what lies beyond the dark passages found across Drangleic, but perhaps they are better left undisturbed.
Story: The staff was found in the heart of the Dark Chasm. It was a catalyst for sorceries and hexes, and no one knew what lay beyond the dark passages found across Drangleic. Perhaps they were better left undisturbed.

Item Description: Limb of the victim of a curse. Temporary curse allows engagement with ghosts. The only way to fight back against ghosts who are cursed beings is to become cursed oneself. The safest method however dreadfulis to cut off an arm of the dead
Story: A cursed limb is the key to defeating ghosts. If a person can find and cut off the cursed limb of a ghost, the ghost will be unable to harm anyone else. However, this is a very dangerous task, as the limb must be from a dead person, and the person who takes it must be cursed themselves in order to avoid being killed themselves.

Item Description: An old transposing kiln from Courland, crafted with stitched crystal lizard hide Give to Ludleth, Lord of Cinder to conduct soul transposition. This kiln can transpose twisted souls to craft special items with their concentrated essence. Deemed forbidden by those unable to make proper use of it.
Story: Ludleth, Lord of Cinder, desired a way to transpose the twisted souls of the wicked into powerful items. He found the old Courland transposing kiln and used it to create powerful items with the concentrated essence of the wicked. However, the kiln was considered forbidden by those who could not make proper use of it, and so Ludleth kept it hidden away.

Item Description: Light yet sturdy clothes. Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.
Story: The clothes were meant for young women who were ready to take on the world. They were sturdy and light, perfect for the adventurer. The young women who wore them were sure of their destiny and set off into the world to find what lay ahead.

Item Description: Gloves of a traveling perfumer of no renown. An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen and all those seen as impure.
Story: The gloves belonged to a perfumer of no renown. He was said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen and all those seen as impure. One day, he met an associate of a healer who told him of a place where he could find new aromatics and flower gardens. The perfumer set out on his journey, and soon found himself in a strange land filled with strange aromas and beautiful gardens. He

Item Description: Robe worn by traveling maidens. Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.
Story: The robe worn by traveling maidens is said to have been blessed by the Fingers. It is said that the maidens who wear it are destined to guide others to the Tarnished.

Item Description: Hat worn by merchants from Lanafir, where blue represents knowledge. Wearing this increases item discovery. The eagle is normally a symbol of strength, but in Lanafir it symbolizes wealth. Lanafir is the farthest land to the south and follows a strict edict of isolationism. The rare visitor from Lanafir is always a little odd
Story: The hat worn by merchants from Lanafir is a symbol of wealth and knowledge. It increases the chance of finding items, as it is worn by those who have earned their wealth and knowledge through hard work and trade. The Lanafirans are a proud people who value their isolationism, and are often considered strange by those who do not know them. However, those who have visited Lanafir know that it is a place of great beauty and mystery.

Item Description: Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree. Adorned with a cape featuring the mark of the sacred tree. Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.
Story: The Golden armor of the Tree Sentinels is a sight to behold. It is adorned with a cape featuring the mark of the sacred tree, and is impressively sturdy and nigh unbreakable. The grace of old yet lingers in the armor, making it a sight to behold.

Item Description: Armor worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. The surcoat depicts the distant Erdtree and the beast regent, an emblem of the golden lineage. Both are symbols of glory now past.
Story: The armor worn by Godrick's soldiers is a symbol of their loyalty to him. The Erdtree on the surcoat represents the distant Erdtree, which is a symbol of the golden lineage. The beast regent, which is an emblem of the golden lineage, is also depicted on the surcoat. Both symbols represent glory now past.

Item Description: Golden spear with tree-like design. Wielded by knights employed as palace guards in the Royal Capital of Leyndell. Deals holy damage. Requiring superior dexterity to wield, this greatspear can perform consecutive thrust attacks despite its larger size.
Story: The Golden Spear with the Tree-like Design is a sacred weapon that was used by the palace guards in the Royal Capital of Leyndell. It is a greatspear that deals holy damage, and requires superior dexterity to wield. Despite its larger size, it can perform consecutive thrust attacks.

Item Description: Troches that exude the scent of rust. Temporarily boosts petrify resist. Verbal histories often mention Saint Elizabeth; her uniquely concocted medicines and potions are still widely used today.
Story: The Troches were created by Saint Elizabeth, a holy woman who was known for her miraculous cures. The Troches were said to have the scent of rust, which temporarily boosted petrify resist. The Troches are still used today, and are often mentioned in verbal histories of Saint Elizabeth.

Item Description: Greatsword embedded with a blue glintstone. Weapon of the trolls in service to the royal family of Caria. Called into service when the Queen invoked an oath they swore, the trolls are treated as true knights of Caria, and fight arm in arm with their human comrades.
Story: The greatsword was embedded with a blue glintstone. It was a weapon of the trolls in service to the royal family of Caria. When the Queen invoked an oath they swore, the trolls were treated as true knights of Caria, and fought arm in arm with their human comrades.

Item Description: Sword given to the lesser giants who fought for the Erdtree during the War against the Giants long ago. Though the giants have lost their minds, they stay inseparable from their swords that are in sad shape—such that the gold plating had flaked away.
Story: The sword was given to the lesser giants who fought for the Erdtree during the War against the Giants long ago. Though the giants have lost their minds, they stay inseparable from their swords that are in sad shape—such that the gold plating had flaked away. The sword is now in sad shape, but the lesser giants will never let it go.

Item Description: Mining tool of stonedigger trolls used to crack bedrock. Trolls are descended from the giants, and these were supposedly once used as ceremonial smithing tools. In the distant past, smithing was considered divine.
Story: The mining tool of stonedigger trolls was used to crack bedrock. The trolls are descended from the giants, and these were supposedly once used as ceremonial smithing tools. In the distant past, smithing was considered divine. The trolls were able to use the tool to extract valuable minerals from the bedrock.

Item Description: Outfit worn by settlers of Tseldora. Rather fancy but with low defense and unfit for battle. Tseldora flourished with the discovery of brightstone, deep under the settlement. But with this prosperity came greed in equal measure, and the people were ever in search of that which they lacked. The brightstone that brought prosperity to Tseldora served only to stoke the flames of its peoples' desires, eventually leading to its ruin. Those bewitching, brilliantly gleaming stones are said to be fragments of a being that once roamed the entrails of the earth.
Story: The brightstone that brought prosperity to Tseldora served only to stoke the flames of its peoples' desires, eventually leading to its ruin. The people of Tseldora were so caught up in their greed that they didn't realize that they were playing with fire. The brightstone was a fragment of a being that once roamed the entrails of the earth, and it was this knowledge that eventually led to the people's downfall. The brightstone was a powerful tool

Item Description: A grey herb that grows hidden among the rocky surfaces of tall mountains. Restores a certain amount of spell uses. There is no end to the scores of people who risk life and limb to forage for this valuable herb, which led to a banning of its harvest in some regions.
Story: The grey herb was a valuable resource that was often risked for by those who sought it. The herb was so valuable that it was eventually banned from some regions, as there was no limit to the amount of people who would risk their lives for it.

Item Description: Rare tiny black sprite found on corpses. Very unusual twin humanity. Use to gain 2 humanity and restore a large amount of HP. This black sprite is called humanity but little is known about its true nature. If the soul is the source of all life then what distinction is left for humanity?
Story: The black sprite was found on the corpses of two humans. It was unusual because it had two human souls inside of it. The sprite restored a large amount of HP to whoever used it, and it also gained the user 2 humanity. It was unknown what the true nature of humanity was, but it was clear that it was something special.

Item Description: Sword forged from the reunion of the inseparable swords born from the souls of Lothric and Lorian, the twin princes. Their union is rooted in a curse, and perpetuated by grief. Skill: Sacred Light and Flame While in stance, use normal attack to cast Sacred Lothric Light, and strong attack to cast Flame of Lorian.
Story: The sword was forged from the reunion of the inseparable swords born from the souls of Lothric and Lorian, the twin princes. The sword's skill is rooted in the curse that was perpetuated by their grief. When in stance, the user can use normal attack to cast Sacred Lothric Light, and strong attack to cast Flame of Lorian.

Item Description: A greatbow made of animal bone. The fine craftmanship suggests that it originates in Lanafir. The unusual design appears to have ceremonial implications, but may simply be intended to intimidate foes.
Story: The greatbow is a finely crafted weapon made from animal bone. It is unusual in design, with a ceremonial implication that is unknown to the wielder. The weapon is intended to intimidate foes, and its unique design is likely to cause fear in those who see it.

Item Description: .A twinblade fashioned from rare geisteel. Designed for high-ranking Drangleic knights, hence the decorative design. Geisteel equipment is of the finest make, but geisteel is so rare that very few of these weapons were actually used in combat.
Story: The twinblade was crafted from geisteel, a rare metal that is only found in the deepest parts of Drangleic. The weapon was designed for high ranking Drangleic knights, and as such, it features a decorative design that is only seen on rare pieces of geisteel equipment.

Item Description: A sword with blades on both sides of the hilt. This weapon is difficult to wield, and requires high dexterity. Can be wielded with a single hand, but its true strength is enabled with dual-handed spinning attacks.
Story: The sword is a difficult weapon to use, but its true power is unlocked with dual-handed spinning attacks. It is said that only the most skilled warriors can wield it with ease, and that its true power is only realized when used in tandem with another weapon.

Item Description: Twinkling titanite for weapon reinforcement. Reinforces weapons to +4 These unique weapons cannot be reinforced with ordinary titanite, nor can they be infused. Unless one uses this twinkling titanite, which reinforces these weapons without unraveling their inherent strength.
Story: A young knight travels the land, seeking to find a way to improve his swordplay. He comes across a merchant who sells this special titanite, which he uses to reinforce his sword to +4. However, this titanite also has a unique effect - it does not unravel the sword's inherent strength, meaning that the sword will remain as powerful as before. The young knight is excited by this discovery, and decides to keep this titanite always on hand.

Item Description: A form of titanite with special power. Reinforce equipment that cannot normally be reinforced up to +5. What cosmic event could have created such a powerful class of titanite?
Story: A group of adventurers set out on a new adventure, only to find that their equipment was not up to par. They were about to give up when they found a strange looking titanite on the ground. After using it to reinforce their gear, they were able to take on the next challenge with newfound strength.

Item Description: Armor depicting entwined twins of gold and silver. The two known as D are inseparable twins. They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another. Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.
Story: The armor is called D, and it is said that it is a representation of the inseparable twins D. The armor is made of two different metals, gold and silver, and it is said that the two twins are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. However, the armor seems to yearn for something more, as it has never been seen together. It is possible that the armor is seeking to find its way to the other D, who are also known as

Item Description: An attractive twinblade of fine make that prizes the chivalric way. Can be wielded with a single hand, but its true strength is unlocked with dual-handed spinning attacks.
Story: The twinblade was a finely made weapon that prized the chivalric way. It could be wielded with a single hand, but its true strength was unlocked with dual-handed spinning attacks. The weapon was said to have belonged to a great hero who fought for justice and righteousness.

Item Description: Katana forged in an Eastern land. Known for its brisk slashing motions. The Uchigatana cuts beautifully and causes bleeding, but its blade is easily nicked
Story: The Uchigatana is a legendary Japanese sword that is known for its swift slashing motions. The blade is easily nicked, but its cutting power is unmatched.

Item Description: A katana of unknown origin. Crafted with a peculiar yet refined technique. The finely-sharpened blade of a katana slices with unmistakable smoothness, but should be wielded with caution, as its delicate constitution means it's easily worn.
Story: The katana was crafted with a peculiar yet refined technique. The finely-sharpened blade of the katana slices with unmistakable smoothness, but should be wielded with caution, as its delicate constitution means it's easily worn.

Item Description: This ultra greatsword, with its thick blade, is one of the heaviest of its kind. Highly destructive if intolerably heavy. There would appear to be some credence to the rumors that this sword tested the true limits of human strength.
Story: The sword is so heavy that it takes two people to carry it. It is said that the sword was designed to test the true limits of human strength. If wielded correctly, the sword is highly destructive. However, if the sword is too heavy to carry, it can be devastating.

Item Description: A sharp dagger. Crafted to facilitate assassinations with a focused backstab. One true strike with this blade, and your work will be done.
Story: The sharp dagger was crafted with the intention of facilitating assassinations. Its sharp blade was designed to deliver a focused backstab, allowing the user to quickly and easily take down their target.

Item Description: Tool used to hunt down the Undead. Block Estus recovery within a limited area. Used long ago by Lloyd's cleric knights on their Undead hunts. Although Allfather Lloyd is long forgotten by the Way of White, his hunts have lived on, and this charm allows one to challenge Undead without fear of tenacious healing.
Story: The Undead Hunter's Charm is a tool used by clerics of Lloyd to hunt down Undead. It allows the user to recover Estus quickly within a limited area, making it a valuable tool for hunting down Undead. Although the charm is long forgotten by the Way of White, its power lives on in the hands of those who seek to challenge Undead without fear of their tenacious healing.

Item Description: Attire of the Abyss Watchers, the Undead Legion of Farron. A black-dyed leather vest worn over chainmail. These undead warriors vowed to partake of wolf blood. They acted in the dark, seeking out any sign of the Abyss, fighting with a constant war with its abominations. A black-dyed leather vest worn over chainmail. Black-dyed leather tied around the arms, with only the left fitted with a gauntlet. The iron kneecaps originated from their sword techniques.
Story: The Abyss Watchers are a legion of undead warriors who have sworn to partake of wolf blood in order to gain strength and power from the Abyss. They are constantly at war with the abominations that dwell in the dark, seeking any sign of the Abyss in order to fight back.

Item Description: An old, sealed summons. Like the first of its kind, it is an invitation to Cainhurst, but for whom is not known, as it lacks an addressee.
Story: The old, sealed summons has been sitting in a dusty corner of an old library for years. No one knows who it was meant for, as it lacks an addressee. One day, a young scholar comes across it and decides to take it to Cainhurst, hoping to find out its secrets. Upon arriving, he finds that the castle is abandoned and the only thing left is the summons. He begins to read it, but soon realizes that it's not just any old summons-

Item Description: One of the illusory rings worn by the Hollows of Londor. Retain human appearance while hollow. The Hollows of Londor are wretchedly aged, fraught with deceit and dubiously secretive. It is no wonder that they are deeply detested.
Story: The Hollows of Londor are a group of old, sickly humans who have turned into Hollows. They use this disguise to stay hidden from the other humans, but it's not foolproof. Some of the Hollows are still able to see and hear the humans, and they despise them for it.

Item Description: The key to the Upper Cathedral Ward seal. The upper echelons of the Healing Church are formed by the School of Mensis, based in the Unseen Village, and the Choir occupying the Upper Cathedral Ward. This key brings one a step closer to the Choir.
Story: The key to the Upper Cathedral Ward seal is coveted by all who seek entrance to the Choir of the Healing Church. It is said that whoever possesses the key can gain access to the most sacred chambers within the Upper Cathedral Ward. The key is also said to be the key to unlocking the power of the Choir.

Item Description: Uniform of the students of Byrgenwerth, a bygone institute of learning. The Healing Church has its roots in Byrgenwerth, and naturally borrows heavily from its uniform design. The focus not on knowledge, or thought, but on pure pretension would surely bring Master Willem to despair, if only he knew.
Story: A young girl, orphaned and alone, is taken in by a kindly old woman and taught the ways of the Healing Church. When the old woman dies, the girl is left to fend for herself in a hostile world. She finds refuge in the Healing Church, where she is able to use her powers to help others.

Item Description: This weapon made of extremely thin, flexible blades of metal is wielded like a whip by Nightfolk warriors. Though in essence a whip with a cutting edge, it can also be used as a spear to pierce foes.
Story: The Nightfolk are a race of dark and mysterious beings that dwell in the shadows of the world. They are a fierce and warlike people, and their warriors are known for wielding unusual weapons, such as the whip-like metal blades known as whips. Though in essence a whip with a cutting edge, the whip can also be used as a spear to pierce foes.

Item Description: Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey. The crest emblazoned on the front is worn and dingy, no longer able to evoke sentiment. Metal armor is heavy, but also study ordering significant damage negation.
Story: The chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland. The crest emblazoned on the front is worn and dingy, no longer able to evoke sentiment. The metal armor is heavy, but also study ordering significant damage negation.

Item Description: Weapon once wielded by the Champion of the Undead Match. A special paired set consisting of a broad sword and a lion shield. The champion fought on, without rest, until he lost his mind. In the end, only his page and a lone wolf stayed at his side.
Story: The Champion of the Undead Match wielded a special paired set consisting of a broad sword and a lion shield. He fought on, without rest, until he lost his mind. In the end, only his page and a lone wolf remained at his side.

Item Description: Armor worn by Varagians, that terrorized nearby seas. The coastline stretches far in northern Drangleic. Beyond this Northern Sea is an unexplored continent, said to be the home of things inhuman
Story: The armor is said to have the power to repel all attacks, and to make the wearer invulnerable.

Item Description: Straight sword wielded by Varangians and engraved with a skull. A former king launched a campaign to capture these terrors of the high seas, but rather than imprison them, forced them into hard labor at No-man's Wharf.
Story: The Straight Sword of No-man's Wharf is a fearsome weapon that has been used by the Varangians and engraved with a skull. It is said that a former king launched a campaign to capture these terrors of the high seas, but rather than imprison them, forced them into hard labor at No-man's Wharf. Over time, the sword has become stained with the blood of those it has slain, and is now a feared symbol of terror and violence.

Item Description: A steel mace resembling a charming bouquet of roses. Each petal has a sharpened edge, leaving the roses perpetually colored with blood. This weapon reflects White Mask Varré's manner of speech rather well, enticing in its splendor, but full of deadly consequence.
Story: The steel mace is a beautiful weapon, with each petal sharpened to a point. It reflects White Mask Varré's elegant speech, but it is also deadly.

Item Description: A symbolic, powerful thrusting sword used by the Pardoner serving Velka, Goddess of Sin. It is no mere symbol to be sure; the Pardoner is an inhuman swordsman, and wields this enchanted blade with special sword technique.
Story: The Pardoner's thrusting sword is a powerful weapon used by the Pardoner, a swordsman with inhuman skills. The sword is imbued with powerful magic, and is used with special sword techniques that make it a deadly weapon.

Item Description: .Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. This black tuft of hair that serves as a talisman belongs to Velka, Goddess of Sin. It casts miracles not by drawing upon faith, but intelligence.
Story: Velka's black hair is a powerful talisman that can cast miracles without relying on faith. It is said that this hair is from the goddess herself, and that it contains her divine intelligence.

Item Description: Armor worn by the Royal Aegis. Originally imbued with the power of miracles, now soaked with dark after extended exposure in the Undead Crypt. A knight from a faraway land was lured to this accursed land, but forgot even why he came, eventually reduced to a shadow of his former self.
Story: The armor worn by the Royal Aegis is imbued with the power of miracles. However, over time it has become stained with the blood of the undead and is now nothing more than a cursed relic. The knight from a faraway land is lured to this accursed land, but he gradually loses his mind and eventually dies, never to be remembered.

Item Description: An old armor that is oddly comfortable. Belonged to a Vengarl's. To this day, the forbidden love of Prince of Alken and the Princess of Venn manipulates these marionettes. Surely they never imagined that their dolls would outlast their own kingdoms
Story: The old armor belonged to a Vengarl. It was oddly comfortable, and it was likely worn by the Vengarl's beloved. The forbidden love of Prince of Alken and the Princess of Venn manipulated these marionettes, and they never imagined that their dolls would outlast their own kingdoms.

Item Description: One of the weapons designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum. The black fang protruding from the bronze snake head is coated in deadly poison.
Story: The black fang was designed for one purpose: to kill. It was a deadly weapon, coated in poison that would quickly end the life of its target. It was a weapon meant for duelists who had been exiled from the colosseum, a place where only the fittest survived.

Item Description: A centipede-like creature discovered on successful hunts by League hunters. Vermin, found hidden within filth, are only seen by League confederates, and are the root of man's impurity. The League has assumed the task of finding and crushing all vermin. Perhaps there is some mercy in the madness. Those who wish to see vermin can, and those who choose to are provided with boundless purpose.
Story: The League has been hunting vermin for centuries, and they are always one step ahead. This centipede-like creature was found hiding within filth, and it is only seen by League confederates. It is the root of man's impurity, and the League has taken it upon themselves to find and crush all vermin. Some people may see this as a sign of mercy, while others may see it as madness.

Item Description: Ember required for weapon ascension. Huge ember of highest quality. Handled by the blacksmiths of Astora
Story: The blacksmiths of Astora were in need of an ember of the highest quality to help them with their weapon ascension. They searched high and low for an ember of the right quality, but they could not find anything that fit their needs. Finally, they came across a huge ember that was perfect for their needs. They took it home and handled it with care, making sure to keep it safe.

Item Description: Old armor that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol. Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.
Story: Niall was a general who fought in many wars, and his armor is testament to that. He was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. When he died, he decided to stay alive as a spirit, watching over his old home.

Item Description: Bladed prosthetic leg enwreathed with the power of lightning, instead attached to the fist. Commander Niall, veteran of Castle Sol, offered this prosthesis in exchange for the lives of defeated knights held prisoner. He went on to lead these men as an army of no nation.
Story: The commander had lost his leg in a battle against the knights, and was desperate to find a way to fight on even ground. He found the prosthetic leg in a destroyed castle, and used the power of lightning to attach it to his fist. He led the men as an army of one, using his prosthetic leg to devastating effect.

Item Description: Red-leather record of the Vilebloods loyal to the covenant of Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods, at Cainhurst Castle. A record of the Vilebloods, blood-lusting hunters who seek blood dregs of their prey, kept throughout the ages.
Story: The Red-leather record of the Vilebloods loyal to the covenant of Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods, at Cainhurst Castle is a record of the Vilebloods, blood-lusting hunters who seek blood dregs of their prey. The record is filled with drawings and notes of the Vilebloods' hunts, as well as descriptions of the blood dregs they've collected.

Item Description: Great Hammer wielded by Vordt, the outrider knight of the Boreal Valley. Weapon is inbued with frost, and causes frostbite. Frost accumulates in the body causing frostbite, which saps one's health, lowers absorption, and slows stamina recovery. Skill: Perseverance Anchor weapon in earth to temporarily boost poise. Damage reduced while activated.
Story: Vordt the outrider knight of the Boreal Valley wielded a great hammer imbued with frost. The frost caused frostbite, which saps one's health, lowers absorption, and slows stamina recovery. However, Vordt's skill with the hammer allowed him to anchor the weapon in earth to temporarily boost his poise. The frost also reduced damage while the hammer was activated.

Item Description: A hooked blade attached to a long handle. Wielded by the vulgar militia, its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard. The vulgar militia are the undecorated stewards of rancid, scorched battlefields that none dare approach, and forbidden domains better forgotten by the rest of the world
Story: The hook blade is a weapon that is used by the vulgar militia. It is a long, thin blade with a hook on the end. This hook is used to slip through an enemy's guard, allowing the militia to attack them from behind.

Item Description: War spear singed and blistered by fingers, used by Vyke, Knight of the Roundtable Hold. Like Vyke himself, it has been tormented by the yellow flame of frenzy from within.
Story: The War Spear singed and blistered by fingers, used by Vyke, Knight of the Roundtable Hold. It has been tormented by the yellow flame of frenzy from within.

Item Description: Short sword with a tempering pattern on the blade. A weapon unique to warriors of the Land of Reeds. Afflicts targets with blood loss. These swords are considered auxiliary weapons. Yet, one man is known to wield this weapon in his left hand while using a full-sized katana in his right. A demonic swordsman known only as Okina.
Story: Okina was a demonic swordsman who specialized in using short swords with a tempering pattern on the blade. This weapon was unique to warriors of the Land of Reeds, and it caused targets to experience blood loss. Okina was a feared figure in the Land of Reeds, and no one knew his true identity or whereabouts.

Item Description: Coat of an aimless traveler. Made from sturdy leather and quilting. Battle comes with the territory when one wanders the land, and this coat provides a certain degree of protection
Story: The coat of an aimless traveler was made from sturdy leather and quilting. It was meant to provide some degree of protection against the battles that come with wandering the land. The coat was also a reminder to never lose sight of what was truly important in life.

Item Description: Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.
Story: The gown is stained with the blood of those who have killed out of mercy. It is said that Varré, the only surgeon to survive the abduction, was able to tame the blood's curse. Now, the gown is worn by those who seek to bring peace and mercy to the world.

Item Description: Paired weapon wielded by the grave wardens of the Cathedral of the Deep. The grave wardens of the cathedral, who put down reincarnating corpses, wield weapons that cause profuse bleeding, for the loss of blood and bodily fluids is said to slow reanimation.
Story: The grave wardens of the Cathedral of the Deep are a group of warriors who use paired weapons to put down reincarnating corpses. The weapons cause profuse bleeding, which is said to slow reanimation.

Item Description: Talon-swords are affixed to the legs of the Stormveil's warhawks, but this one has been repurposed for human use. The blade is thin and lightweight so as not to obstruct the hawk's mobility.
Story: The talon-sword is a unique weapon that has been repurposed for human use. It is thin and lightweight so as not to obstruct the hawk's mobility. The blade is sharp and deadly, perfect for taking down enemies.

Item Description: Oversized double-headed axe with a bizarre, almost melted appearance. Brute strength is the only thing required to wield this weapon, which appears to have taken quite the beating itself.
Story: The Oversized Double-headed Axe is a fearsome weapon that appears to have taken quite a beating. Its brute strength is the only requirement to wield it, and it seems to be especially effective against enemies with a high resistance to damage.

Item Description: A curved sword forged from the soul of the Flexile Sentry. Once straight, but later twisted to reflect its warped owner. The sentry crammed inmates of the overflowing Bastille onto a rickety ship, and cast them out to the open sea. The majority of them drowned or starved but a few hardy survivors made land to the south, and imparted their knowledge of sorcery to the people there.
Story: The Flexile Sentry was a giant, metal sentry that stood watch over the Bastille. It was twisted and misshapen from the countless inmates that it had watched over, and eventually it fell to pieces. The few survivors that made it to the south told of the giant sentry and the horrors that it had inflicted on them. They also taught the people there about sorcery, and how to use it to defend themselves.

Item Description: Hammer with a large beak-shaped pommel. Originally a pickaxe; redesigned for battle. This simple but deadly weapon hits heavily with thrust damage such that it easily cracks metal armor.
Story: The hammer is a simple tool, but it is deadly in the hands of a skilled user. The large beak-shaped pommel makes it perfect for smashing through metal armor, and its thrust damage makes it easy to crack even the strongest defenses.

Item Description: Gauntlets of a nomadic warrior. Crafted from sturdy leather.
Story: The nomadic warrior wore these gauntlets to protect his hands while he roamed the land. They were sturdy and made from leather, and were perfect for his needs.

Item Description: Round wooden shield crafted in Lordran. Decorated with the ancient Labrys axe. The giant trees in Lordran are distant offspring of the great stone archtrees. This shield inherits their properties and the wood reduces magic damage
Story: The shield was crafted in Lordran, a land that is now long gone. The shield is decorated with the ancient Labrys axe, a weapon that is said to have been forged by the gods themselves. The giant trees that grow in Lordran are distant descendants of the great stone archtrees. This shield inherits their properties, reducing magic damage.

Item Description: Katana forged in an Eastern land. Very unusual specimen with a long blade. Has a different move set than the Uchigatana. The blade is extremely long, but as a result, quite easily broken.
Story: The Katana forged in an Eastern land is a very unusual specimen. It has a long blade that is different from the Uchigatana. The move set for the Katana is different as well, making it an interesting choice for combat. However, because the blade is so long, it is easily broken. This makes the Katana a risky investment, but it is still a powerful weapon.

Item Description: Stone greatsword wielded by Erdtree Burial Watchdogs. Though decorated with the watchman's eye, the pupil was taken by graverobbers and is now hollow, leaving this sword a mere lump of stone.
Story: The Erdtree Burial Watchdogs were a group of vigilantes who protected the graves of the Erdtree people. One day, they were attacked by graverobbers who stole their eye from the sword's pupil. Since then, the sword has been a mere lump of stone. However, the watchdogs never give up and continue to protect the graves of their people.

Item Description: Large stone staff embedded with glintstone. Wielded by Erdtree Burial Watchdogs who protect catacombs. The Watchdogs, battered and broken over their lengthy tenure, rule the catacombs and are even said to command the imps. Unique Skill: Sorcery of the Crozier Channel magic into the glintstone to activate an ancient sorcery, producing floating magic projectiles that chase enemies automatically.
Story: The Erdtree Burial Watchdogs have guarded the catacombs for centuries, using their magical staff to cast powerful spells. However, their long tenure has taken its toll, and the Watchdogs are now a broken and battered force. But their magic is still potent, and they can use their staff to cast an ancient sorcery that produces floating magic projectiles that chase enemies automatically.

Item Description: Greatsword wielded by the Throne Watcher. Unleash its true power to enwreath magic. The Watcher has stood by the throne for ages. Will his wait be worth the while?
Story: The greatsword known as the Throne Watcher was once wielded by a powerful warrior who served as the watcher of the throne. The sword's true power lies in its ability to enwreath magic, and the Watcher has waited centuries for the right moment to use it. However, his wait may be worth it, as a new ruler is about to be crowned and his reign may be marked by great magic and prosperity.

Item Description: Tool used to etch titanite into weapons for reinforcement. Rest at a bonfire to make weapon reinforcement possible
Story: The etching tool was a simple, but necessary tool used to etch titanite into weapons for reinforcement. It rested at a bonfire, allowing players to make weapon reinforcement possible.

Item Description: Tool used to etch titanite into weapons for reinforcement. Rest at a bonfire to make weapon reinforcement possible
Story: The etching tool was a simple, but necessary tool used to etch titanite into weapons for reinforcement. It rested at a bonfire, allowing players to make weapon reinforcement possible.

Item Description: Straight sword with a rather short but wide blade. Simple to wield, it was known as the sword of the people. Though the Erdtree styling is still visible, time has not been kind to this sword, now merely a shadow of its former self.
Story: The sword of the people is a simple straight sword with a wide blade. It is known for its easy to use design and is often used by commoners. However, over time the sword has become worn and damaged, with the Erdtree styling now barely visible. Despite this, the sword retains its power and is still able to fight on behalf of its owner.

Item Description: Martyr Logarius led a band of Executioners, and this badge was crafted at their dedicated workshop. The Wheel symbolizes righteous destiny. Their workshop was a secretive enclave of mystical beliefs and heady fanaticism which served as the backbone of the Executioners' unique brand of justice.
Story: The Wheel of Fate is a badge crafted by the Executioners, a band of vigilantes dedicated to carrying out justice with an iron fist. The badge is a symbol of their righteous destiny, and their workshop was a secretive enclave of mystical beliefs and heady fanaticism which served as the backbone of the Executioners' unique brand of justice. The Wheel of Fate was a source of great pride to the Executioners, and they would often display it prominently on their armor or weapons.

Item Description: Leather whip. Not intended for battle. Virtually ineffective against armor and tough scales, but quite formidable against enemies with exposed skin.
Story: The leather whip was not meant for battle. It was practically ineffective against armor and tough scales, but it was quite formidable against enemies with exposed skin. The whip was a symbol of power and dominance, and was often used to discipline or punish those who disobeyed the authorities.

Item Description: A trick weapon crafted by the workshop heretics, the Powder Kegs, and weapon of choice of the Old Hunter Valtr, the Beast Eater. This weapon pummels beasts in its mace form, but its true strength lies in its attached mechanical saws. These discs, lined with serrated teeth,spin rapidly, thrashing the flesh of beasts into fine shreds.
Story: The Powder Kegs are a weapon that was created by the workshop heretics. It is a mace that has attached saws that spin rapidly. The Powder Kegs are the weapon of choice for the Old Hunter Valtr, the Beast Eater.

Item Description: A short bow crafted with white birch. Endowed with light-manipulating magic. The bow is a relic from an ancient land of sorceries that was swallowed by the Abyss, most known for its folktale of the heroic Abysswalker. Skill: Unseen Arrow Arrows shot by large pulls of the bow are enchanted with a golden spell that turns them nearly invisible.
Story: The bow is a relic from an ancient land of sorceries that was swallowed by the Abyss. The Abysswalker was a hero who ventured into the dark depths to retrieve the bow. The bow is said to be endowed with light-manipulating magic, and its arrows are enchanted with a golden spell that turns them nearly invisible.

Item Description: Attire of special Church doctors. These doctors are superiors to the black preventative hunters, and specialists in experimentally-backed blood ministration and the scourge of the beast. They believe medicine is not a means of treatment but rather a method for research. and some knowledge can only be obtained by exposing oneself to sickness.
Story: The attire of the special Church doctors is a stark contrast to that of their black preventative hunters counterparts. These doctors are specialists in experimentally-backed blood ministration and the scourge of the beast. They believe that medicine is not a means of treatment but rather a method for research. This is why they often choose to work in hospitals and clinics, where they can expose themselves to sickness and learn what they need to know.

Item Description: Attire of special Church doctors. These doctors are superiors to the black preventative hunters, and specialists in experimentally-backed blood ministration and the scourge of the beast. They believe that medicine is not a means of treatment but rather a method for research. and that some knowledge can only be obtained by exposing oneself to sickness.
Story: The attire of the special Church doctors is a stark contrast to that of their black preventative hunters counterparts. Whereas the hunters wear heavy armor and carry large weapons, the doctors wear light, flowing robes and carry small, delicate instruments. They believe that medicine is not a means of treatment but rather a method for research. and that some knowledge can only be obtained by exposing oneself to sickness.

Item Description: Talisman made from a lock of white hair. This lock of hair belonged to a deformed member of the chaos witches, mothers of the art of pyromancy. Fashioned into a talisman, it enables the wielder to cast both miracles and pyromancies. Skill: Combustion Creates a powerful flame in the wielder's hand. One of the most basic pyromancies, and for this reason, the flame created is fierce. Works while equipped in either hand.
Story: The talisman was made from a lock of white hair belonging to a deformed member of the chaos witches, mothers of the art of pyromancy. The talisman enabled the wielder to cast both miracles and pyromancies. The skill combustion created a powerful flame in the wielder's hand.

Item Description: Mages wore different garb depending on their sex. What function this served, however, is unknown, as with many old practices.
Story: The mages of the kingdom wore all sorts of clothing, but it was always different for the different sexes. No one knew why this was, but it was an old tradition that had long since been forgotten. It was only recently that the king had decided to bring it back and make it a part of the mages' training.

Item Description: Bloodstained, faintly grinning mask. Worn by war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. The Lord of Blood's curse enlivens the wearer when bloodletting occurs. Slightly raises attack power when there is blood loss nearby.
Story: The Lord of Blood's curse enlivens the wearer when bloodletting occurs. Slightly raises attack power when there is blood loss nearby.

Item Description: Robe worn by a White Priest sorcerer. The man claims to have sealed himself away, but who's ever heard of sentient magic? It is no doubt difficult to judge the veracity of the man's words, but this hood certainly seems to possess an unusual power
Story: A white priest sorcerer wearing a robe with a hood claims to have sealed himself away from the world. He tells of a power that is beyond our understanding, a power that he has mastered.

Item Description: Armor of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina. The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat. To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.
Story: The armor of the White Reeds is a relic of a bygone age, when the Inaba were a band of swordsmen seeking death in honorable combat. Worn by the head disciples of Okina, the armor is a fitting symbol of their quest, and a reminder of their dedication to the art of swordsmanship.

Item Description: White Ring A precious ring which grants the protection of Quella, god of dreams. Makes its wearer appear as a white phantom, misleading invaders. He who sets the trap must be wary. For traps are known to spring upon their owners.
Story: The White Ring is a powerful ring that grants the wearer the protection of Quella, the god of dreams. The ring makes the wearer appear as a white phantom, confusing and deterring invaders. The trap must be careful to set it correctly, as the ring's wearer may be the one who falls victim to it.

Item Description: A divine ring entrusted to the head bishop of the Way of White and apostle to Allfather Lloyd, uncle to Lord Gwyn. It grants additional attunement slots. The head bishop of the Way of White is the guardian of law and caste, and one of the great royals of Thorolund.
Story: The Way of White is a monastic order devoted to the worship of the god Lloyd. The head bishop, uncle to Lord Gwyn, is one of the most powerful men in Thorolund. He wears a divine ring that grants him additional attunement slots. One day, the ring mysteriously disappeared. The head bishop is determined to find it and restore it to its rightful place.

Item Description: A wilted and faded stalk of dusk herb. Restores a great deal of spell uses. A dusk herb in bloom works wonders, but will wilt in the blink of an eye. Needless to say, finding such an herb is of the utmost difficulty.
Story: The dusk herb was once a proud and flourishing plant, but now it is wilted and faded. It is said that if you drink the sap of this herb, it will restore a great deal of spell uses. However, the herb will wilt in the blink of an eye, so finding it is a difficult task.

Item Description: Sword fashioned from a delicate wing, suffused with the magic of the stars. Strong attack unleashes a wave of enchanted light. Crafted from a relic of the Naturalborn of the Void who is said to have assailed the Eternal City.
Story: The sword is a relic from the Naturalborn of the Void, a creature said to have assailed the Eternal City. The sword's strong attack unleashes a wave of enchanted light, which can devastate enemies.

Item Description: Distinctive horn suffused with the power of ancestral spirits. This large, wing-shaped specimen is wielded as a weapon of spirit worship. In the ancestral spirit-worshipping faith, these are considered envoys' wings, made to reap the lives of beings which experience no sprouting.
Story: The large horn on the ground was suffused with the power of ancestral spirits. It was a sacred artifact, used by the faith as a weapon of spirit worship. The wing-shaped horn was wielded as a weapon of spirit worship by the descendants of the envoys who used it to reap the lives of beings who experienced no sprouting.

Item Description: Halberd wielded by the Winged Knights, who swore themselves to the Angels. The thick, heavy, bloodstained blade can only be swung by one with inhuman strength. Skill: Chain Spin Sweep foes in a large spinning motion and use strong attack to continue the motion until stamina is exhausted.
Story: The Halberd is a legendary weapon wielded by the Winged Knights, who swore themselves to the angels. The thick, heavy, bloodstained blade can only be swung by one with inhuman strength. The skill chain spin allows the wielder to sweep foes in a large spinning motion and use strong attack to continue the motion until stamina is exhausted.

Item Description: Armor of the Winged Knights, who swore themselves to the Angels. Worship of the divine messengers was viewed as heresy in Lothric and unrecognized by any of the Three Pillars of rule. This is believed to be why Gertrude, the Heavenly Daughter, was imprisoned in the lofty cell of the Grand Archives.
Story: The Armor of the Winged Knights is a sacred relic of the angels. It was created to honor the divine messengers and was viewed as heresy by the people of Lothric. Gertrude, the Heavenly Daughter, was imprisoned in the lofty cell of the Grand Archives because of her beliefs. She is now a revered figure in the religion and her armor is venerated as a holy relic.

Item Description: Paired beheading axes wielded by the Winged Knights, who swore themselves to the Angels. These axes, more befitting of an executioner than a knight, are indented to fit the human body.
Story: The Winged Knights were a group of knights who swore themselves to the angels. They were known for their beheading axes, which were indented to fit the human body. These axes were more suited for an executioner than a knight, and the knights themselves were known for their ruthless and brutal tactics.

Item Description: Sacred scythe resembling a pair of white wings. Deals holy damage. According to pagan belief, white-winged maidens are said to be Death's gentle envoys.
Story: The sacred scythe is a beautiful weapon that resembles a pair of white wings. It is said to deal holy damage, and according to pagan belief, white-winged maidens are said to be Death's gentle envoys.

Item Description: A long-hilted spear with a barbed point. Long reach and can be used with shield up. Effective against hard exteriors and hits for high damage at the right moment of an enemy's swing. But the hit radius is small and it is easily blocked by shields
Story: The long-hilted spear is a powerful weapon that can be used with shield up. It has a long reach and can deal high damage at the right moment of an enemy's swing. However, the hit radius is small, so it can be easily blocked by shields.

Item Description: A spear with winged lugs. Longer than standard spears, allowing for attacks from further away. Thrusting attacks are effective even against opponents with high defense, but they have a narrow point of contact and won't effectively break through a shielded defense.
Story: The spear has wings on the lugs, making it easier to hit distant targets. The wings also help to increase the weapon's effectiveness against opponents with high defense, as the point of contact is wider.

Item Description: A long-hilted spear with winged lugs. Long reach, and can be used with shield up. Spear attacks are centered on thrusting, but can inflict high damage when timed with the end of an enemy's swing.
Story: The long-hilted spear with winged lugs is a powerful weapon that can be used with shield up. The spear attacks are centered on thrusting, but can inflict high damage when timed with the end of an enemy's swing.

Item Description: Cloak of the rogue witch Beatrice. Almost all magic users that employ catalysts studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is one of the few exceptions. She braved the Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal
Story: Beatrice had always been a rogue witch, never following the rules of the other magic users. When she was just starting out, she decided to study at Dragon School, but she was one of the few students who didn't. She decided to brave the Abyss, but she never returned. Now, her cloak is a symbol of her bravery and her defiance of the rules.

Item Description: Hat of the Rogue Witch Beatrice. Almost all magic users that employ catalysts studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is one of the few exceptions. She braved the Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal
Story: Beatrice was a rogue witch who ventured into the Abyss to study magic. She never returned, and her hat is the only evidence that she ever existed.

Item Description: A whip fashioned from the black hair of a daughter of the Witch of Izalith, creator of the Flame of Chaos. The long, shining locks woven together to create this whip are imbued with the essence of fire, which can be channeled through the use of its skill.
Story: The Witch of Izalith created the Flame of Chaos, and her daughter's black hair was the perfect material to create a whip made from. The whip is able to channel the fire essence, making it a powerful weapon.

Item Description: The Witch of Izalith and her daughters, scorched by the flame of chaos, thaught humans the art of pyromancy and offered them this ring. Greatly boosts pyromancies. Every pyromancer is familiar with the parable that tells of the witches espousing the need to fear the flame, and teaching the art of pyromancy to men in hopes that they might learn to control it.
Story: The Witch of Izalith and her daughters, scorched by the flame of chaos, taught humans the art of pyromancy. They offered them this ring in hopes that it would greatly boost their pyromancy skills.

Item Description: A small clay urn filled with magic power. Explodes, inflicting magic damage. Created in Melfia, a land that flourishes with magic and pyromancy. Though the magic contained in the urn lacks potency, it is a boon to any inexperienced traveler.
Story: The small clay urn filled with magic power. Explodes, inflicting magic damage. Though the magic contained in the urn lacks potency, it is a boon to any inexperienced traveler.

Item Description: Witchtree bellvine that sprouts amongst old growth. A catalyst for miracles and hexes. Clerics who were ostracized devised this as an alternative catalyst for casting miracles. Most clerics who were stripped of their status are good-for-nothings, but among them are powerful spell casters who represented real threats to the establishment. Although not a proper catalyst, the bellvine is quite powerful.
Story: The Witchtree bellvine grows amongst the ancient oaks of a forgotten forest. It is said that this vine is the catalyst for miracles and hexes. For centuries, clerics who were ostracized by the rest of society devised this as an alternative means of casting miracles. Although not a proper catalyst, the bellvine is quite powerful.

Item Description: Branch of a forest-wandering witchtree. A catalyst for sorceries and hexes. Now it is used as a weapon, but this was originally a part of a witchtree.
Story: The witchtree was a sacred tree that was used by witches to perform their spells and hexes. However, over time, the witchtree became a weapon and was used to attack others. Now, the witchtree is a part of the forest and is used as a catalyst for sorceries and hexes.

Item Description: The branch of a large, well-tended witchtree, used as a sorcery catalyst. Witchtree staves are customary in the far north, and allow for faster casting than ordinary catalysts. Skill: Steady Chant Boost the strength of sorceries for a very short period. Works while equipped in either hand.
Story: The Witchtree Stave was a magical item used in the far north. It allowed for faster casting of spells than using an ordinary catalyst, and was especially beneficial to sorcerers. However, the Witchtree Stave was not without its drawbacks. While equipped in either hand, the Witchtree Stave boosted the strength of sorceries for a very short period of time.

Item Description: Well-made cloth vest, worn by official magicians
Story: The vest was made of fine cloth, and was decorated with intricate symbols and designs. It was clearly a piece of official magicians clothing, and was very well-made. The vest was comfortable to wear, and made the wearer look dignified and powerful.

Item Description: Helm of a knight tainted by the dark of the Abyss. The twilight blue tassel is damp, and will ever remain so. A vanquished knight left behind only wolf's blood, and legacy of duty. The Undead Legion of Farron was formed to bear his torch, and the armor of these Abyss Watchers suggests their own eventual end.
Story: The Helm of a Knight Tainted by the Dark of the Abyss is damp with the blood of the vanquished. It is said that this helm was worn by a knight who was consumed by the darkness of the Abyss. Now, the twilight blue tassel is permanently damp with the blood of the undead. This helm is a symbol of the Undead Legion of Farron, and suggests their own eventual end.

Item Description: Greatsword of a knight tainted by the dark of the Abyss, and master of the wolf's blood of Farron. The wolf knight was the first Abyss Watcher, and his sword is more punishing against creations of the abyss. Skill: Wolf Sword While in stance, use normal attack for a low spinning slash, or the strong attack to leap forward in a vertically-slashing somersault..
Story: The greatsword of the wolf knight is a fearsome weapon, forged from the blood of the Farron wolf. The wolf knight was the first Abyss Watcher, and his sword is more punishing against creations of the abyss. When in stance, the sword can be used for a low spinning slash, or the strong attack to leap forward in a vertically-slashing somersault.

Item Description: One of the special rings granted to the four knights of Gwyn. The Wolf Ring belongs to Artorias the Abysswalker. Artorias had an unbendable will of steel, and was unmatched with a greatsword.
Story: The Wolf Ring was a ring that was granted to the four knights of Gwyn. The ring was said to belong to Artorias the Abysswalker, who had an unbendable will of steel. Artorias was unmatched with a greatsword, and was known for his ferocity in battle.

Item Description: A holy sword eroded by the Abyss. When Wolnir fell to the Abyss, he was gripped by a fear of true darkness, and pleaded to the gods for the first time. This holy sword, together with three armlets stripped from the corpses of clerics, gave him some semblance of comfort. Skill: Wrath of the Gods Thrust weapon into earth to emit powerful shockwave. The wrath of those swallowed by the Abyss is a thing to be wary of indeed.
Story: When Wolnir fell to the Abyss, he was gripped by a fear of true darkness, and pleaded to the gods for the first time. In return, they granted him the power to create shockwaves with his holy sword. Now, whenever he feels the darkness creeping up on him, he can call upon the wrath of the gods to fight off the fear.

Item Description: Basic wood bolt. These bolts do not fly particularly far, nor do they inflict a terrible amount of damage, but their cheap cost makes them useful when volume is required.
Story: The first time I used a basic wood bolt was in my first ever game of D&D. I was a level 1 character and my party was fighting a group of goblins. I had just used my first bolt to take out one of the goblins when the rest of the goblins started to surround me. I was quickly running out of bolts and my party was running out of spells. I was about to be killed when one of my party members used a spell to create a wall of fire

Item Description: This special ring crafted in an Eastern land is made of metal, but with a wood grain crest on its surface. Slows equipment degradation. Wielders of swords originating in the same region follow a practice of inscribing special words on the blades of their swords, and are naturally drawn to this ring.
Story: The ring is said to have been crafted in an Eastern land and is made of metal, but with a wood grain crest on its surface. The crest is said to slow equipment degradation. The ring is said to be drawn to by those who originate from the same region as swords. The ring is said to be inscribed with special words that protect the wielder from harm.

Item Description: Standard arrow. These arrows do not fly particularly far, nor do they inflict a terrible amount of damage, but their cheap cost makes them useful when volume is required.
Story: The standard arrow is a common arrow that is not particularly powerful or accurate, but is affordable and can be used in large quantities. In the world of the story, these arrows are often used by peasants and commoners to shoot at targets or enemies from a distance.

Item Description: Vertically elongated wooden shield. Decorated with a white dragon. Wood shields are lighter than metal shields but with lower physical damage reduction and reduced shield stability
Story: The white dragon on the shield was a beautiful sight. It was carved into the wood with precision, and the scales were so bright they looked like they could glow in the light. The shield was much lighter than a metal shield, but it still provided excellent physical damage reduction.

Item Description: A hook that covers the hand. Clearly not intended as a weapon, but certainly sharp enough to shred an enemy's skin.
Story: The hook is a unique and unusual weapon. It is made from a metal that is both sharp and flexible, and it is covered in small, sharp hooks. The hooks are designed to shred the skin of an enemy, and they are perfect for catching and holding an opponent.

Item Description: (Piece Name) worn by inhabitants of the undead Settlement. Official attire for the dissection and burial of undead. Naturally the ceremonial significance of such work is long forgotten, Indeed, no one could continue to entertain such horrors.
Story: The Piece Name is a ceremonial robe worn by the inhabitants of the undead Settlement. It is made of ceremonial cloth and is meant to be worn during the dissection and burial of undead. The significance of this work is long forgotten, and no one could continue to entertain such horrors.

Item Description: A misplaced workshop tool from the Hunter's Dream. The hunter who retrieves this can extract Arcane Haze from ritual materials. But alas, spent materials are lost.
Story: The hunter who finds the misplaced workshop tool from the Hunter's Dream can use it to extract Arcane Haze from ritual materials. This allows the hunter to create powerful magic items, but the spent materials are lost forever.

Item Description: A misplaced workshop tool from the Hunter's Dream. The hunter who retrieves this can extract Arcane Haze from ritual materials. But alas, spent materials are lost.
Story: The hunter who retrieves this tool can extract Arcane Haze from ritual materials. Arcane Haze is a powerful magical substance that can be used to enhance spells or create powerful magical items. However, because spent materials are lost when extracting Arcane Haze, this tool is invaluable to any spellcaster.

Item Description: An armament forged from the soul of Elana,child of Dark. When the Abyss dissipated, the things that called it home were fragmented and scattered across the realm. Eventually these pieces regained form, in ways that hinted at humanity's true nature.
Story: The Dark Lord had always coveted the power of the Abyss, and when it dissipated, he was the first to seize upon its fragments. He used these to create an armament that would grant him ultimate dominion over all. The child of the Abyss, Elana, was the perfect candidate for this task. Her soul was infused with the darkness of the abyss, and so her weapon was unrivaled in power.

Item Description: A mysterious item once worn by the Xanthous King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one knows where it came from. The crown bears high-quality cloth which is quite soft to the touch, but its bright yellow color stings the eyes, and it is clearly far too big
Story: The crown was once worn by the Xanthous King Jeremiah. It is said that the crown was given to him by the gods themselves. The crown is made of high-quality cloth and is very soft to the touch. However, the bright yellow color of the crown stings the eyes. It is clearly too big for anyone to wear, and it is unknown where it came from.

Item Description: Crown made in imitation of a divine creature of Oolacile, land of ancient, golden sorceries. Xanthous clothing is the mark of a researcher of lost sorceries, and the oversized crown is emblematic of their work. Such a curious pursuit is surely nothing to be ashamed of. (Crown)
Story: A researcher of lost sorceries finds a crown made in imitation of a divine creature of Oolacile, land of ancient, golden sorceries. The crown is emblematic of their work, and they wear it with pride.

Item Description: A mysterious item once worn by the Xanthous King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one knows where it came from. It may be tattered, but its bright yellow color still stings the eyes
Story: The Xanthous King Jeremiah's legendary yellow item has been lost for centuries. Rumors say it was once worn by the exiled king himself. No one knows where it came from, but its bright color still stings the eyes. Some say it has magical properties, and that whoever possesses it will be able to rule the world.

Item Description: Yellowish overcoat covering a band of brass medallions. Xanthous clothing is the mark of a researcher of lost sorceries, and the number of medallions denotes their success. A point of pride for the researchers, even if its signficance is lost on others. (Overcoat)
Story: A researcher of lost sorceries wears a yellowish overcoat to show their dedication to their craft. The number of brass medallions on the coat denote their success. They are proud of their mark of distinction, even if others do not understand its significance.

Item Description: Thick black pullover worn by hunters of the Unseen Village. The hunters of Yahar'gul answer to the village's founders, the School of Mensis. Hunters in name only, these kidnappers blend into the night wearing this attire. Designed primarily to defend from physical attacks, the binding of thick rope serves both to protect its wearer, and restrain his foes.
Story: The hunters of Yahar'gul answer to the village's founders, the School of Mensis. They are kidnappers in name only, blending into the night to hunt the creatures of the Unseen Village. This thick black pullover was designed primarily to protect its wearer from physical attacks, with the binding of thick rope serving both to protect and restrain his foes.

Item Description: A standard hunter's hat, worn by Yamamura the Wanderer. This hat and staff were given to him when he became a hunter and confederate of the League.
Story: Yamamura the Wanderer was a wandering hunter who joined the League of Legends to find new and exciting prey. One day, he was given a standard hunter's hat and staff by the League. The hat and staff were a sign of respect and recognition from the League, and they helped Yamamura find new prey and become a better hunter.

Item Description: Special material used in a Holy Chalice rite. Special body parts collected by the Healing Church. What was this gruesome bait used to lure? The additional rite Rotted Offering beckons ungodly forces, normally terrifying things, but also worthy prey for a special hunt.
Story: The Healing Church uses a gruesome bait to lure ungodly forces, normally terrifying things, but also worthy prey for a special hunt. This bait is a special body part that is collected by the Healing Church. This body part is used in a Holy Chalice rite. The additional rite Rotted Offering beckons ungodly forces, normally terrifying things, but also worthy prey for a special hunt.

Item Description: A straight sword affixed with yellow quartz. This longsword was found in the Iron Keep. Breaks easily due to corrosion, but is light and still inflicts very significant damage. In the Old Iron King's great iron keep was a vast collection of weapons,erected as a display of strength to the world. But they were lost when the king's conceit doomed the castle to sink into a lake of fire.
Story: The straight sword was found in the Iron Keep. It was old and corroded, but it still inflicted significant damage. The sword was meant as a display of strength, but it was lost when the king's pride doomed the castle to sink into a lake of fire.

Item Description: Ludwig, the first hunter of the Healing Church, once recruited Yharnamites to serve as hunters. This hunter's attire was made for new recruits, and has excellent straightforward defense. But not nearly enough to allow an ordinary man to stand any real chance against the beasts.
Story: Ludwig is a hunter of the Healing Church, and his attire is specifically designed for new recruits. It is very sturdy, but not overly protective, which is why it is not very effective against the beasts of Yharnam. Ludwig is a brave and determined man, and he is always looking for new ways to defeat his enemies.

Item Description: Ludwig, the first hunter of the Healing Church, once recruited Yharnamites to serve as hunters. This hunter's attire was made for new recruits, and has excellent straightforward defense. But not nearly enough to allow an ordinary man to stand any real chance against the beasts.
Story: Ludwig is a hunter of the Healing Church, and his attire is specifically designed for new recruits. It is sturdy, but not overly protective, and is meant to be straightforward and easy to use. However, Ludwig is no ordinary man, and he is able to stand up to even the most ferocious beasts.

Item Description: A sacred heirloom left by Yharnam, Pthumerian Queen. The Queen lies dead, but her horrific consciousness is only asleep, and it stirs in unsettling motions.
Story: The Pthumerian Queen's heirloom is a cursed item that has the power to awaken the Queen's horrific consciousness. The item is currently in the possession of the player, who must use it to stop the Queen from awakening.

Item Description: Great machete wielded long ago by Yhorm the Giant. Yhorm once lumbered on the frontlines with a greatshield. But one day, in place of his shield, a left-hand notch was added to his machete, enabling the smashing technique that would become the legacy of his later years. Skill: Warcry Let out a spirited warcry that temporarily boosts attack, and enables a crushing strong attack.
Story: The machete once wielded by Yhorm the Giant is a relic from a time long ago. When Yhorm fought on the frontlines with a greatshield, one day he lost his shield and added a left-hand notch to his machete, becoming a master of the smashing technique. With this skill, he was able to smash through even the strongest of defenses. Now, with his warcry, he can temporarily boost his attack and enable a powerful crushing strong attack

Item Description: Ring of Sir Yorgh, who sought the blood of a dragon and invaded Shulva. Can deflect spells. When Sir Yorgh faced Sinh, the slumbering dragon, he drew blood with a flash of his steel, but Sinh responded by spewing forth the poison that had long brewed within him, blanketing the city in a miasmic cloud.
Story: The Ring of Sir Yorgh was a powerful artifact that sought the blood of a dragon. Sir Yorgh invaded Shulva and used the ring to deflect spells. When Sir Yorgh faced Sinh, the slumbering dragon, he drew blood with a flash of his steel, but Sinh responded by spewing forth the poison that had long brewed within him, blanketing the city in a miasmic cloud.

Item Description: Spear wielded by Sir Yorgh during his invasion of the Sanctum city. After his defeat of the Sunken King, Sir Yorgh pierced Sinh, the sleeping dragon, with this spear to claim its blood. But Sinh immediately awoke, spewing a poisonous fog that blanketed the city in death, and Sir Yorgh disappeared in to the Eternal Sanctum.
Story: Sir Yorgh's spear is said to have been used to defeat Sinh, the sleeping dragon. After his victory, Sir Yorgh claimed the dragon's blood with the spear. However, the dragon's poison immediately began to spread, killing many people in the city. Sir Yorgh disappeared into the Eternal Sanctum after this event.

Item Description: A sacred chime belonging to Yorshka. Her brother, the former knight captain, presented her with this medium together with another gift: her name. The ringing of the chime must have done much to soothe her loneliness.
Story: The chime was a gift from her brother, the former knight captain, in memory of their sisterhood. It was a sacred instrument that had been passed down through the family for generations. Whenever Yorshka felt lonely, she would take the chime and listen to its gentle ringing. It was a reminder of the bonds of sisterhood that she had lost.

Item Description: This treasure, gifted to the Yorshka Church, is enchanted with a soporific spell, and was surreptitiously worshiped by Irithyll slaves. As a weapon, it is part spear and part hammer, the former allowing thrusting, and the latter allowing strikes.
Story: The Yorshka Church gifted a treasure to the church of Irithyll that was enchanted with a soporific spell. The slaves of Irithyll secretly worshipped the treasure, using it as a weapon to strike and thrust.

Item Description: A small, transparent stone that once graced the green young grass crest. This semi-precious gem honors a Spear of Church after a battle well-fought, and is said to slightly enhance their blessing of protection.
Story: The small, transparent stone was once graced the green young grass crest. It was said that this semi-precious gem honors a Spear of Church after a battle well-fought. It was also said that this gem slightly enhances their blessing of protection.

Item Description: Branch of a young white birch received from a giant, apparently as a token of friendship. Become something that blends in to the surroundings. Consumed with use. Good friend, no hit.
Story: The young white birch was a gift from a giant, and it was clear that the giant was very friendly. The birch grew quickly, and soon it was indistinguishable from the other trees in the forest. But the birch didn't just blend in - it became consumed with use. It grew branches and leaves and twigs, until it was a tree of many shapes and sizes. The birch was happy to be a good friend to the forest, and it never hit anyone.

Item Description: Armor worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.
Story: The Zamor Armor is a relic from a time long ago when knights fought against the giants. The armor is said to have been worn by the bravest of warriors and was known for its ability to withstand the harshest of conditions.

Item Description: Mask worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.
Story: The Mask worn by knights of Zamor is said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial. The Mask is a symbol of bravery and honor, and is worn by knights who are willing to risk everything to protect their people.

Item Description: One of the gigantic straight Greatsword. As the name suggests the Zweihander is held with two hands but its wielder must still be inhumanly strong. It is this great weight that sends foes flying when hit solidly
Story: The Zweihander is a legendary greatsword that is said to be one of the most powerful weapons in existence. It is so heavy that only the strongest warriors can wield it with ease, and it is said that when it is used correctly, it can cleave through even the strongest of foes.

Item Description: An ultra greatsword, the heaviest of weapons. As the name suggests, the Zweihander is held with two hands, but its weight is such that even wielding it in this manner requires strength worthy of the blade.
Story: The Zweihander is a legendary ultra greatsword that is said to be the heaviest weapon in existence. Even wielding it with two hands requires immense strength, and it is said that only the strongest warriors are able to wield it with ease.
